items.title: Director, Digital Marketing - OPEN TO REMOTE
items.content: Our client, a dynamic digital consulting agency, is looking for a Digital Marketing Director to join their team in Boston (or remote). As a member of the consulting team, the ideal candidate would have hands on experience understanding consumer behavior across multiple digital channels, understand CRM and customer journey work and be familiar with leveraging loyalty within the digital space. The Director will be responsible for managing client intake, gathering objectives and requirements and presenting strategy directly to the client. (Note: this is not a sales or business development role.) This is a fast-passed digital role with emphasis on data and leveraging data to help solve business problems. Requirements: • 10+ years of experience in a digital marketing consulting role covering multiple disciplines (CRM, loyalty, digital marketing across multiple channels) • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field • Experience in a client facing role and presenting directly to clients • Demonstrated ability to present clear, concise reporting based on analytics to clients • Ability to work well autonomously • 5+ years of consulting experience Other information: • Salary is up to $140K and is commensurate with experience • Open to US Citizens or Green Card holders only • Open to Boston office or remote Keywords: website analytics, digital media, multi-touch attribution, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, measurement, statistics, mathematics, data extraction, data analysis, data interpretation, Tableau, social media monitoring

items.title: Communications and Campaigns Associate
items.content:
The role


If you like to move at pace on multiple tasks, take projects from design to execution and evaluation, have a flair for messaging and engaging audiences, this role in the area of might be perfect for you.


Apolitical’s aim of transforming government can only be achieved if we continue to grow and engage a diverse range of public servants across the world. That’s why we’re looking for someone with initiative, creativity and flair who can run their own projects with this aim in mind. This might include creating interactive content, organising online workshops, running competitions and working on search-engine-optimisation (amongst other ideas).


Prior experience is not necessary but concrete evidence of the desired skills is. This is likely to be a suitable role for someone of up to 3 years experience, but will vary by individual.


 


Your key activities will involve:




  • (30%) Design and execution of campaigns designed to achieve the companies growth and engagement goals.




  • (25%) Helping optimise our content for search, including making sure the journalists are formatting their pieces and headlines correctly, trying to get pieces on Apolitical republished, and trying to get external organisations to link to Apolitical




  • (10%) Researching policy challenges (the key issues, organisations, people) to support all your growth and engagement activity like generating ideas, writing messaging, finding speakers and participants, and liaising confidently with high profile public servants, academics, and practitioners.




  • (15%) Writing messaging to communicate the significance of a policy issue in a concise and engaging way, and setting up engaging email communications.




  • (15%) Ringleading distribution across the company to promote a campaigns - including reaching out to distribution partners, on social media, and engaging our community.




  • (5%) Tracking and evaluation of your interventions.




 


Who we are looking for -


You have these essential traits which you will further hone in the role:




  • Creative - You enjoy thinking of new ways to engage public servants.




  • Strategic - Your ideas match the reality of the resources available to you. You can see how others’ work can support your goals.




  • Organised and attentive executor and project manager - You enjoy zooming in and executing on multiple projects, as well as zooming out (being strategic).




  • Excellent communicator - Your communication is persuasive and compelling. You can credibly communicate with seniors. You are great at working with other teams.




  • Data and goal driven - You enjoy assessing the effectiveness of your effort by analysing data.




  • Passion -You are enthusiastic about i) building and engaging specific audiences through digital methods, and ii) learning about policy and the public service.




 


In addition you will develop skills in:




  • Using email software, like Hubspot




  • Basic coding




  • Running effective experiments and build a new function in a startup




  • Building online communities




  • Public speaking and moderation (through preparing the speakers and moderators, and possibly, in the future leading online events yourself)

items.title: Digital Marketing Intern
items.content:
A FINE HOUR brings a new dimension to the travel industry, offering gyms, spas, pools, meeting rooms and more from a selection of the finest hotels, bookable through our online platform.


We are now expanding our team to include a Digital Marketing Intern, to support with the increasingly broad and creative scope of marketing activities being undertaken.


As a new business, we are at an exciting stage of growth and are looking for an ambitious individual who wants to be part of an early-stage start-up.


Our Digital Marketing Intern will work across all marketing activities including social media, PR and A FINE HOUR website.


Key Tasks and Main Duties



  • Work with the Brand and Communications Manager to organise and deliver our social media activity in line with our brand and tone of voice

  • Implement individual campaign briefs (as part of a wider campaign strategy) using multiple channels and content

  • Execute email marketing campaigns to AFH subscriber base ensuring the copy, branding and look & feel is to the high standards of AFH

  • Assist with the timely development and continual improvement of AFH’s website in the realm of keywords, UX, hotel onboarding and regularly aiding the renewal of content and imagery

  • Work closely with the Co-Founder to respond to Press and PR requests

  • Create a library of imagery and video for marketing and social media

  • Help to provide regular reporting on performance metrics against KPIs for email marketing and social media

  • Conduct SEO Keyword and Social Media Hashtag research to help improve the reach of our campaigns

  • Identify trending topics and key themes in the luxury and hospitality space to help with the creation of new campaigns


Key Skills & Experience:



  • Excellent digital planning and implementation skills and ideas.

  • A keen eye for detail and the ability to be a brand guardian.

  • Experience in developing compelling digital and print content that inspires engagement

  • Ability to manage multiple projects while also being self-motivated

  • Experience of implementing a brief in collaboration with colleagues.

  • Full understanding of the growing trends of content and influencer marketing

  • Experience of being a brand guardian/ambassador

  • Excellent proofreader.

  • Knowledge of Google Analytics and Facebook Ads advantageous


More Information


This will initially be a 3 month, paid, part-time internship, with the possibility of full-time employment in the future


As a team, we often work remotely. You will be heavily supported during the internship, through regular meetings and contact, but you must be prepared to work independently on occasion.

items.title: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=2, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Product Designer at AVRA Talent

Remote | High-paying | International
  • Remote OK
  • Full-Time

Product Designer at Magic

*This is a fully remote role working with a dispersed team.

Location: Remote – California Bay Area preferred, open to North America or Asia timezones. You must have at least a 4-hour time zone overlap with PST (GMT -7) or the PHT (GMT +8).

Comp Range: $80,000 – $100,000

Benefits:

  • Employee equity: 0.02% to 0.04%
  • Magic will purchase the hardware setup of your choice
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Comprehensive health, dental, vision, 401k

Do you love creating moments of delight for users? Do you obsess over usability? Do you get that design is a living, moving experience that isn’t static? Then we may have just the role for you. At Magic, we love designers who make the complex, simple; and create experiences that resonate emotionally with users.

Our mission:

We want to provide excellent virtual assistance to as many people as possible. Our goal is to make people’s lives better by enabling them to offload tasks to high-quality personal assistants, so they can spend more time doing what they want and accomplish more. (https://getmagic.com/)

Why this role exists:

Reporting to the Head of Product, this role will initially be product design-focused, but we’re looking for a product designer who can also put on their user experience hat.

What’s in it for me?:

Join as the first dedicated designer and have an outsized role in the next chapter of our product, by understanding that design is a holistic craft – the alchemy of interactions, visuals, and brand. The details aren’t just the details, they are the product. The best interactions aren’t noticed by a user because the design gets out of their way.

Required Experience:

  • 4+ years experience working as a Product/UI Designer
  • Cross-platform design experiences (Android, iOS, web, email)
  • Advanced experience with image compositing and retouching in Photoshop
  • Solid knowledge of the creative process at high quality, and to specification
  • Lo-fi & hi-fi prototyping skills
  • Expert understanding of the formal elements of design, including typography, layout, balance, and proportion

Objective Outcomes:

  • You will design elegant UIs, animation, and graphics for Magic across platforms: web, iOS, Android
  • You will partner with Product Managers, Engineers, and Product Marketers to define problems & goals, map user flows, prototype interactions, and launch new products and services
  • You will design dynamic flows & interactions for a global audience across platforms
  • You will strategize and design for product marketing campaigns
  • You will define the product design strategy for a product area and work with Head of Product and cross-functional partners to drive consensus across teams
  • You will assist the Product team in implementing precise product design
  • You will create and manage asset libraries for reusable, systematic design
  • You will create, maintain and evolve product design guidelines for Magic

Core Competencies + Skills:

  • Basic level understanding of HTML & CSS
  • Ability to work with a design system; its curation, maintenance, and dissemination
  • Self-motivated, with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to execute in a fast-paced environment with ambiguity.
  • Expert knowledge of Adobe CC suite, Sketch, Figma, and other industry-standard creative tools
  • Prototyping experience with applications Principal, Flinto, Framer or Invision

Personal Attributes:

  • Highly detail-oriented, with a drive for perfection down to the last pixel
  • Excellent organization and presentation skills to structure your presentations and documents in a way that can be easily understood and modified by others
  • Problem solver that requires very little guidance on projects; thrives in a fast-paced environment

Magic is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for job

items.title: Social Media Manager
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Berlin, Dalia develops B2B/SaaS solutions to facilitate market and opinion research in >100 countries. We harness the app economy and advanced data science to distribute millions of micro-surveys worldwide to gather and analyze real-time data on consumer attitudes, public opinion, and market trends. Backed by some of Europe’s leading venture capital firms, Dalia is one of Germany’s fastest-growing tech startups with a team from 32 different countries driven by one mission: to generate information that helps us better understand the world around us.


Dalia is on the search for a Social Media Manager to invigorate our presence on all social media channels to better engage with our target communities.


The journey that awaits you



  • Despite a wealth of source material for spreading the word about Dalia to prospective clients, talent, and journalists, we aren’t consistently active in sharing them across channels, such as social media, where these audiences are looking. That’s where you come in.

  • As Dalia’s first dedicated Social Media Manager, you will act as our guru on all social media channels and content.

  • Working across multiple teams, you will craft and disseminate stories about our team, our research, and products that generate interest and engagement from our target audiences. An exciting opportunity to leave your mark and build buzz around one of Berlin’s most buzz-worthy organisations.


Your challenge



  • Significantly ramp up Dalia’s presence on key social media platforms including Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Glassdoor, Instagram, and others. You will revamp our pages to appeal to key audiences and set into motion a regular schedule of original, compelling content on these platforms. 

  • Work with stakeholders across research, design, talent acquisition, and engineering teams to craft stories that can be told via numerous mediums (video, graphics, articles, etc.) and spread through social media channels. You will also ensure consistency of style and tone across all content within each Dalia sub-brand.

  • Set up infrastructure and processes around social media at Dalia which can ultimately enable teams to publish content independently. 


Your profile includes...



  • Extensive experience managing the social media function for an up-and-coming organisation, with a knack for conceptualising and executing unique, compelling stories and campaigns which are tailored to these platforms. 

  • Native-level English writing skills, with the ability to write catchy copy for a variety of audiences. 

  • Some graphic design experience would be a plus. Experience with data-based storytelling would also be a bonus, but not required.

  • Are structured in an unstructured environment: you are highly organised and able to work autonomously without micro-management in a rapidly changing and often ambiguous environment.

  • Integrity and professionalism: you can make independent decisions on how to represent Dalia to the outside world as a trustworthy, values-driven organisation.

  • Growth-hacker mindset: You take a holistic approach to finding solutions through rapid experimentation. 


What else makes Dalia awesome?



  • No "ninja" culture - teamwork here is paramount, and that means others will help you when you need it. Mentorship is always available.

  • Occasional remote work is possible.

  • A well-stocked kitchen, where you can request grocery items.

  • A team boat that we built ourselves!

items.title: Skedda: Sales Success Expert
items.content:
Sales Success Expert

We’re an Australian-based SaaS business and it’s getting a little tricky for us to look after our growing worldwide fanbase! 

Our product Skedda, is an online booking and scheduling platform used by thousands of venues around the world. The platform is designed to streamline the management of ‘space’. Skedda is suitable for venues with meeting rooms, coworking spaces, community facilities, classrooms, studios, sport courts or any other bookable ‘space’ category.  

The opportunity:

We’re looking for a friendly, helpful, tech-savvy person with inbound sales experience; ideally from a SaaS background.

While the position is sales-focused, this role is for someone keen to become a product-expert and help our customers find the best solution to their space management problems. Our sales approach is geared around educating customers and demonstrating the value our product can bring their venue.

The position is full-time and fully remote but does require that live in a European timezone between UTC +0 - UTC +3

Your day-to-day will involve:

  • Knowing the product from back-to-front 
  • Performing product demonstrations for prospective customers
  • Communicating with prospective and current customers through our in-app tool
  • Managing customers leads to their success/conclusion
  • Developing and improving scaleable inbound and outbound sales processes 
  • Collating data and feedback to assist with product-development decisions  
  • Improving the onboarding experience 
  • Collaborating with senior management

Requirements include:

  • Inbound/outbound sales/success experience
  • Tech-minded: able to easily understand technology in order to effectively communicate with our customer base, general interest in technology 
  • Enjoy working in a high-volume sales environment, interacting with customers on calls, customer-facing experience in technology
  • High-level of English language proficiency (written and verbal)

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)

items.content:
A Senior Test Analyst specialising in Python, Ansible, Selenium or any other UI testing frameworks is now required by a global networking organisation to join their Automation Team on an initial 3-6 month contract.

.*This position is FULLY REMOTE, however the candidate must based in Stuttgart, Germany due to any meetings required on client site. The role requires strong German and English speaking skills*

The Senior Penetration Tester will be working as a key part of my clients Automation Networking team. Using Python, Ansible and Selenium you will be responsible for carrying out UI testing and validation/QA processes as part of a very important project.

The Senior Test Analyst requires the following experience:
  • Proficient in Python, Ansible, Selenium or other relevant UI testing framework
  • Strong German and English speaking skills
  • Experienced in validation/QA processes
  • Knowledge of test driven methodologies
  • Hands-on experience in writing test code.
  • Experience with Python coding for medium to complex solutions
  • Experience relational databases/data file formats and parsing libraries such as (YAML/JSON/XML)
  • Networking deployment/Rest API integrations experience is a bonus
  • Experience with SSH libraries such as Paramiko is a bonus
The Senior Test Analyst Contract is paying up to £500 per day for an initial 3-6 months with a high chance of extensions due to the nature of this project (which are looking to last all the way up until the end of 2020!).

PLEASE NOTE - You are required to be based in Germany for this role, however the position is FULLY REMOTE. The necessary travel requirements within the EU are required.

Interviews are taking place with immediate effect - If you are an experienced Senior Test Analyst with strong Python, Ansible and Selenium skills and this position applies to you, then we want to hear from you.

Please apply now.

  • Remote location in the Eastern Time Zone
  • Content Creator background in the Cyber sector
  • Background selling to small and mid-market clients

items.title: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Retrium

Senior Product Designer

verified
US-only
### Overview Retrium is a seed-funded startup that helps teams improve their Agile processes by facilitating effective and engaging retrospective meetings. With over 85,000 retrospectives run on our platform, we’re the trusted leader in our market, and we’ve been helping teams continuously improve since 2015. We’re also a small, cross-functional team of passionate and fun people. We have an outstanding leadership team and a dedication to company culture, so you’ll always feel connected to our mission, even though you can work from anywhere. We’re lucky enough to have an awesome product, great revenue growth, high customer satisfaction, low churn, and a recent round of seed investment. Now, we need someone to help us take our product to the next level! The right candidate for the Senior Product Designer position at Retrium is someone who has experience in a product-led organization, can translate complex customer problems into elegant solutions, understands best practices for user interface design, and likes to iterate based on research findings and customer feedback. If you’re a creative problem-solver and want to create a compelling experience for thousands of users, then come be a part of our growing team! ### Benefits We provide amazing benefits, and if you ask the team, they’ll tell you that the greatest benefits we offer employees are the ability to make a meaningful contribution to the company and the opportunities to “Listen. Learn. Teach”, another core value. Our other benefits include: - Competitive salary and equity in a fast-growing, funded startup - Health, dental, and vision insurance coverage for you and your family - Unlimited and minimum vacation policy (we encourage you to ask us about this!) - Flexible, sustainable work hours - Work from home or a co-working office - All the equipment you need to do your job - Continuing education and learning opportunities - Annual company retreats ### Additional Information Retrium is committed to creating a diverse environment where you can “Be Your Amazing Self”, yet another core value. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. # Responsibilities As the first dedicated product designer at Retrium, you’ll help us establish the design processes we’ll use going forward. This means you’ll need to understand the business context, customers, and technical constraints and their impact on design in addition to being a great designer. You’ll work closely with both the engineering and business teams to advocate for design in strategic product decisions and oversee the UI design implementation, so communication and collaboration will be key in this role. Because you’ll own everything related to design, you’ll need to be well versed in customer research, so that you can share your concepts and get feedback from our users. You’ll translate our product’s mission and these customer research insights into an engaging and simple interface for our retrospective platform. In this role, your goal will be to continuously improve the user experience of our application, so that customers can easily adopt, understand, and interact with our product. Day-to-day, you’ll be responsible for creating mockups, user flows, sketches, wireframes, diagrams, customer journey maps, and other design artifacts needed to guide the product development process. The ability to take ideas from low-fidelity outlines to high-fidelity designs using Sketch, Invision, Figma, Framer, or other relevant tooling, is a big part of this role. Because our core values include “Default to Autonomy”, “Bias for Action”, and “Level Up”, you’ll need to be a self-starter who can brainstorm possibilities, execute tasks, and lead the implementation of major features and changes to the product. If you want a job that’s integral to a company’s expansion and growth and where there’s opportunities to learn and make a real impact, then this role is for you! # Requirements More than anything else, we’re looking for a self-motivated person who is passionate about designing a great user experience within Retrium. We believe that the following collection of experiences and abilities would make someone successful in this position. However, we encourage anyone with 5 or more years of professional experience as a Product Designer, UX Designer, or Front-End Engineer to apply. - A portfolio of relevant design work that you’re proud to share that includes digital products, not just websites - A history of successfully shipping products and collaborating cross-functionally with both software engineers and business stakeholders - The passion and drive to learn about Retrium and our customers - A growth mindset with an openness to feedback, learning, and experimentation - Experience with Agile software development processes, from problem definition through to detailed UI and visual design - Experience designing a B2B SaaS product is strongly preferred - Experience in a distributed team and/or high-growth startup would be helpful #Salary 100000 - 140000 #Location - US-only

items.title: Xtensio: Technical SEO Lead (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=20, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Technical SEO Lead (Remote)

Xtensio is a an organically growing, bootstrapped SaaS platform with over 200K active users. We get 100K+ visitors on our pages every month and we are looking for a technical SEO wizard to lead us to the next level. This is a full time contract, remote position.


Job Description

You will be responsible for the research, analysis and execution of organic growth strategies. You will work closely with management, content and engineering teams and handle day-to-day responsibilities in organic SEO, technical website optimization and creative link-attracting strategies. You need to be knowledgeable in all aspects of search engine optimization disciplines, best up-to-date “white hat” practices and tactics.

A minimum of three years of SEO experience is required, including technical and hands on knowledge of HTML, CSS, PHP and Javascript.

We are looking to finish our interviews by this month and hire within 4 weeks or sooner.


Absolutely no agencies!



Job Requirements

Be an expert on Wordpress development and optimization
Lead on-page optimization tasks, such as coordination with content writing, web design and development teams, as well as off-page optimization tasks, such as coordination with outreach teams
Must be able to work and be trusted in an unsupervised manner as we do not believe in a micro-management type of work environment
Must be passionate about all things related to Growth Marketing, be a sponge for knowledge and advocate for fresh training


Required experience


Expertise of Google Analytics, MOZ, Yoast, Google Search Console, A/B testing, Setting up Tracking Funnels and ROI-Driven Strategies
Expertise in link building
Expertise in lead generation through SEO
Expertise in dealing with multiple B2B clients
Expertise in building an overall SEO Strategy


In addition:



Expertise and mastery of both on and off site SEO. Technical Development and Optimization, Site Speed Loads, URL Structure, 301 redirects, Link Building etc....

Strong technical aptitude including ability to understand web development technologies (mainly Wordpress)

Sound business acumen, analysis skills, and ability to think both strategically and tactically

Email marketing a plus

Bachelors Degree at a minimum

Deadline driven, organized self-starter with the ability to work effectively in a fast paced environment

Team player with a great work ethic

Smart, Fast, Logical and Precise


Main platforms and tools we use (Bring Your Own Tools)

Wordpress

MOZ
Yoast
Ahrefs
Google Analytics
Google Search Console

items.title: Social Media Sales Exec
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
Company name:


The Nature Boys


Tag line:


“Social and environmentally conscious organic audience builders”


Job Specifications


Title: Social Media Sales Exec


Location: Digitally nomadic (UK South East Preference)


Salary: £18,250 (Quick progression as tiny startup)


Benefits: 



  • Monthly cash bonus pot of £50 - £250, 

  • Audible and Meditation subscriptions included, 

  • Working for a company that’s environmentally and socially conscious,

  • All sorts of random free extras like festival tickets thanks to our super mixed client base! 


Mission for Role


To work alongside our head of sales, Kieran and founder Max, to find new individuals and businesses that need outside support in social media marketing and sell them in to the right support offered by our team. 


This would include our Instagram growth plugin, other Instagram related services like content & engagement powerups, Facebook and Instagram Paid Ads management, our Youtube growth plugin, Linkedin sales support and other services.


You’ll be joining a small but hard-working team - you will be reporting into Max Sinclair (Founder) and Kieran Gregory (Head of Sales) and working closely with the insta and youtube team of Kirstin and Chris and Facebook paid ads lead Vukasin.


We’re a young but fast-growing business having gone from 0 - 250 clients and 0 to 3m network in a year. We do things in a unique way - there’s no office, the first 40 minutes of your working day is a session of Audible listening to a book to develop your knowledge base and meditation to develop your capacity for mindfulness. While we have a huge mixture of clients from bars in London, to furniture designers or fitness influencers, our largest niche is focused on travel and natural world and veganism - so If you enjoy a bit of deer hunting on the weekends or think “meditation is for pussies”, then this position isn’t for you.


Overall you will grow faster as a person in all dimensions with The Nature Boys in comparison to 99% of any other jobs you’ve looked at today! And that’s a promise!! Growth is our number one focus for both the company and the people within it.


What you will be doing



  • Managing sales flow across multiple Linkedin profiles automated for outreach and bringing leads down the funnel all the way to sale.

  • Handling inbound sales opportunities in the same way.

  • Developing new opportunities to expand the business into whole new spaces! 


What we are looking for in you



  • You are naturally competitive against yourself always striving to grow and outdo your previous performance.

  • You’re highly driven with an execution focus, a strong sense of urgency and a belief in the mission and the way we do things here.

  • Maintain a positive mindset and have a ‘can-do’ attitude.

  • Have a long term vantage point thinking what’s the optimal approach to each message, email or follow up for the business in the long term instead of to achieve a short term result.

  • You have a curious and analytical mind to what does and doesn’t work and how to improve.


Essential hard skills and experience required



  • A basic understanding of social media, especially Instagram, Facebook and Youtube.

  • Experience in using Microsoft Excel, Word and Google Sheets.

  • High standard of written and spoken English.

  • Cultural understanding of the UK marketplace.


Bonus points



  • Experience with social media or any other sales.

  • Experience of CRM systems like Close.io

  • Experience of using Slack.

  • Worked with startups before.

  • Experience of Instagram marketing.


 


Read more about our company over on our site: www.wearethenatureboys.com 


"The greatest thing you'll ever learn


Is just to love and be loved in return"


Nat King Cole, Nature Boys

items.title: Senior Technical Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=8, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Technical Product Manager at Athletic Greens

Remote

Location: Remote

The Role

Athletic Greens is looking for a Technical Product Manager who will be the business owner for all customer facing and backend technical systems and architecture. This role is critical to the business and ensures our customer experience is seamless from the moment they land on our website, to selecting product, checking out and managing their subscriptions.

This role is also responsible for managing all internal technology and e-commerce systems including administration, on-boarding and development with the aim to drive efficiency through technology so we can work smarter and scale rapidly through systems.

What You’ll Do:

  • Gain a thorough understanding of our business and build out technical roadmaps to improve customer experience as well as internal business operations
  • Create backlogs, prioritize and build out requirements ahead of time for dev team to write technical scopes
  • Work with internal department stakeholders to prioritize and plan project execution and required resourcing requirements
  • Build out project milestones and tasks to ensure on time completion of technology roadmap initiatives
  • Validate current and future systems from a technical perspective to ensure capabilities are aligned with internal expectations
  • Oversee and manage our system architecture and system integrations
  • Develop and manage sprint plans for outsourced UI/UX and DevOps teams
  • Translate business requirements into user stories, use cases and build our acceptance criteria for UI/UX teams
  • Manage an external team of developers
  • Monitor and report on system uptime, page loading speeds and stability
  • Support product implementation and deploymentImplement and own the process for QA, UAT and code deployment
  • Participate, create, and utilize both quantitative and qualitative methods in understanding usage trends – including usability testing and analytics platforms
  • Support product roadmaps by conducting user research, project scoping and A/B test iteration ideas
  • Contribute to front-end testing and troubleshooting, helping maximize engineering capacity when possible
  • Work with Customer Happiness team to review and analyze trends and work with UX team on solutions
  • Manage A/B testing and ensure quick iterations are implemented
  • Communicate with stakeholders to ensure requirements are being met.
  • Be able to tell the story of why a project is important and rally team members around a common goal
  • Review backend code if necessary to ensure we re efficiently communicating between systems
  • Regularly communicate to the company on the status of major initiatives as well as reviews of recent deployments
  • Be the driver for continuously improving our technology stack
  • Conduct quarterly business reviews with all major technology partners to manage and monitor performance
  • Manage the technology budget
  • Translate high-level business ideas and requirements into technical documentation and manage the execution of such with internal and external partners
  • Move quickly. We strive for perfection, but love to release and iterate

Who You Are:

  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree, ideally in a technology related field
  • Minimum 5 years experience at a Senior Product Management level, within e-commerce
  • Subscription billing a huge plus
  • Experience managing a team of developers in a remote/distributed setting
  • Solid technical expertise; you understand development and engineering from a technical perspective and can create and vet technical documentation
  • You understand both backend and front end development thoroughly and can review and explain code to ensure efficient operations
  • Experience working with and a deep understanding of API integrations
  • Ability to write technical documentations and user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Solid understanding of data flows between e-commerce, payment, ERP and analytical systems
  • Experience working with data segmentation and analytical platforms
  • Experience across UI/UX as well as DevOps
  • An experienced and exceptional project manager with agile experience
  • Experience working with eCommerce platforms like Shopify, Magento or BigCommerce in combination with plugged in 3rd party apps (eg. subscription billing, analytics, website editing and more)
  • Experience in working with International eCommerce, ideally you ve been a part of an e-commerce business that has expanded internationally
  • A great communicator – you love giving and receiving feedback as well as keeping the right stakeholders up to date on what is happening in technology
  • You re decisive; you understand that we need to move quickly and that starts by making decisions, owning them and iterating when required
  • You are intrinsically motivated and strive in a WFH environment

What We Offer:

  • competitive salary
  • top medical, dental and vision plans covered 90% by the company
  • work from home environment
  • 401k plan with up to 4% match
  • unlimited vacation
  • quarterly team meet ups
  • yearly company trip
  • opportunity to work with a passionate group of people and really scale the business!

Additional Details

Athletic Greens is a fully remote company. Candidate must be located in a US timezone.

Apply for job

items.title: Lifecycle and Product Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Lifecycle and Product Marketing Manager at Scott's Cheap Flights

Remote
  • UNITED STATES
  • MARKETING
  • FULL-TIME

As Lifecycle and Product Marketing Manager you will be responsible for the member journey for our 1.6M+ members to drive activation, retention, and product and feature adoption. You will also be responsible for driving awareness and performance of the Scott’s Cheap Flights Scholarship Program and Swag Shop. You will take a data-driven approach to creating and optimizing automated and promotional campaigns, A/B tests, segmentation and continual data analysis and experimentation.

In the short term, you will:

  • Optimize strategy and execute campaigns and messages for the activation, upgrade, retention, referral, upsell/cross-sell, and win-back
  • Identify opportunities and develop strategies to increase Premium membership conversions through various channels (email, push, in-app messages, etc.)
  • Create, review, and edit copy to ensure it stays on brand, delights members, and contributes positively to our goals
  • Optimize existing marketing campaigns and create new campaigns with A/B tests on subject lines, content, audience segmentation, etc.
  • Analyze the data to identify key inflection points and drop-offs in the customer journey and identify opportunities to engage our members with targeted messaging
  • Run and monitor reports on the various lifecycle marketing initiatives

In the long term, you will:

  • Drive awareness of the Scott’s Cheap Flights Scholarship program
  • Optimize the ecommerce offering and increase sales performance that directly funds the program
  • Leverage personalization to deliver the right message to the right person at the right time based on their persona, geography, preferences, and other attributes
  • Collaborate with the Product team to support the launch of new products and features, and ensure the necessary tools are in place for analytics, testing, and automation

What you bring to the table:

  • 3+ years of experience in Lifecycle, Product Marketing, or a transferable background
  • A proven track record of managing various B2C lifecycle marketing campaigns including activation, retention, engagement, and win back
  • Experience working with CRM tools like Iterable or Braze
  • A data-driven and analytical approach to marketing decision making
  • Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States

Not required, but will set you apart:

  • Experience marketing e-commerce store performance
  • Experience working in a remote environment

Why you might love working here:

  • 100% remote work environment, so go ahead and bring your dog to work or wear your PJ’s to the office!
  • Open vacation policy, with a 3 week minimum!
  • Comprehensive health, vision, and dental insurance
  • 401(k) with a 5% match
  • Up to 12-weeks of paid family leave
  • Meetup meals when you cross paths with a co-worker
  • Continuing education & development reimbursement
  • Yearly team retreat (this year we went to Riviera Maya!)
  • Challenging problems to solve and an awesome team to collaborate with every single day
Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Overview

Retrium is a seed-funded startup that helps teams improve their Agile processes by facilitating effective and engaging retrospective meetings. With over 85,000 retrospectives run on our platform, we’re the trusted leader in our market, and we’ve been helping teams continuously improve since 2015.

We’re also a small, cross-functional team of passionate and fun people. We have an outstanding leadership team and a dedication to company culture, so you’ll always feel connected to our mission, even though you can work from anywhere. We’re lucky enough to have an awesome product, great revenue growth, high customer satisfaction, low churn, and a recent round of seed investment. Now, we need someone to help us take our product to the next level!

The right candidate for the Senior Product Designer position at Retrium is someone who has experience in a product-led organization, can translate complex customer problems into elegant solutions, understands best practices for user interface design, and likes to iterate based on research findings and customer feedback. If you’re a creative problem-solver and want to create a compelling experience for thousands of users, then come be a part of our growing team!

Responsibilities

As the first dedicated product designer at Retrium, you’ll help us establish the design processes we’ll use going forward. This means you’ll need to understand the business context, customers, and technical constraints and their impact on design in addition to being a great designer. You’ll work closely with both the engineering and business teams to advocate for design in strategic product decisions and oversee the UI design implementation, so communication and collaboration will be key in this role.

Because you’ll own everything related to design, you’ll need to be well versed in customer research, so that you can share your concepts and get feedback from our users. You’ll translate our product’s mission and these customer research insights into an engaging and simple interface for our retrospective platform. In this role, your goal will be to continuously improve the user experience of our application, so that customers can easily adopt, understand, and interact with our product.

Day-to-day, you’ll be responsible for creating mockups, user flows, sketches, wireframes, diagrams, customer journey maps, and other design artifacts needed to guide the product development process. The ability to take ideas from low-fidelity outlines to high-fidelity designs using Sketch, Invision, Figma, Framer, or other relevant tooling, is a big part of this role.

Because our core values include “Default to Autonomy”, “Bias for Action”, and “Level Up”, you’ll need to be a self-starter who can brainstorm possibilities, execute tasks, and lead the implementation of major features and changes to the product. If you want a job that’s integral to a company’s expansion and growth and where there’s opportunities to learn and make a real impact, then this role is for you!

Skillset

More than anything else, we’re looking for a self-motivated person who is passionate about designing a great user experience within Retrium.

We believe that the following collection of experiences and abilities would make someone successful in this position. However, we encourage anyone with 5 or more years of professional experience as a Product Designer, UX Designer, or Front-End Engineer to apply.

- A portfolio of relevant design work that you’re proud to share that includes digital products, not just websites
- A history of successfully shipping products and collaborating cross-functionally with both software engineers and business stakeholders
- The passion and drive to learn about Retrium and our customers
- A growth mindset with an openness to feedback, learning, and experimentation
- Experience with Agile software development processes, from problem definition through to detailed UI and visual design
- Experience designing a B2B SaaS product is strongly preferred
- Experience in a distributed team and/or high-growth startup would be helpful

Benefits

We provide amazing benefits, and if you ask the team, they’ll tell you that the greatest benefits we offer employees are the ability to make a meaningful contribution to the company and the opportunities to “Listen. Learn. Teach”, another core value.

Our other benefits include:

- Competitive salary and equity in a fast-growing, funded startup
- Health, dental, and vision insurance coverage for you and your family
- Unlimited and minimum vacation policy (we encourage you to ask us about this!)
- Flexible, sustainable work hours
- Work from home or a co-working office
- All the equipment you need to do your job
- Continuing education and learning opportunities
- Annual company retreats

Additional Information

Retrium is committed to creating a diverse environment where you can “Be Your Amazing Self”, yet another core value. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. items.title: Toggl: Product Designer
items.content:
Product Designer

Toggl is an easy to use and flexible time tracking tool that helps 3+ million users see where their work time goes, so they can focus on the projects that really matter. It also works on all your devices, and integrates with over a 100 tools.

Our team is looking for a Product Designer to level up the user experience for our time-tracking fans.

The role
You will be a part of our product team, working with product managers, developers and other designers to take our Toggl UX to the next level. You will be participating in all stages of the design process and will have a real impact on the product. Together with our team of enthusiastic designers, you will have ownership of developing and maintaining our design system.

About you
You will fit in well in the Toggl team if you are a web/mobile app designer skilled in user-centric design and believe that software should empower people not get in their way. Working experience with SaaS products and design systems is a must. Bonus points if you have knowledge about analyzing data and transforming it into impactful improvements. Experience with modern tools such as Sketch, Abstract, InVision, Zeplin and Adobe Creative Cloud will help you hit the ground running. You will be a perfect match with our team if you love collaborating with people from all disciplines, always try to look at the big picture and want to take ownership of your work.

About our team
Toggl is a distributed team of 80+ people working remotely from 30 countries. We take pride in our professional, learning-oriented and friendly working environment that values work-life balance and constantly doing our best in every aspect of our work. You can work from anywhere in the world, because we know great people do awesome work wherever they are. Every few months we travel to meet up somewhere in the world and spend some quality time together. Our business is profitable with a healthy margin and we’re built with no outside investments, so you can count on a stable working environment.

Some benefits
  • Freedom to choose when and where you work from.
  • 28 calendar days of paid time off a year, plus your local holidays.
  • 2 company retreats plus 2 team meetups a year (expenses covered) for team-building.
  • Laptop and a €2,000 budget to set up your home office.
  • Reimbursement for co-working space rent or internet service at home.
  • Opportunities to attend trainings, workshops or conferences.
  • Monthly reimbursement for gym membership, massage and other things to improve your health.
  • Support for buying a phone, eyeglasses or tools you need for doing your best work.

The salary for this position is EUR 48,000 annually.

Apply now!
All it takes to apply is answering a short skills test that assesses your expertise. Only candidates who take the test and submit a portfolio link will be considered.

Free Toggl t-shirt for those who do well on the test!

items.title: Manager, Food Partnerships
items.content:
Manager, Food Partnerships at Partnership for a Healthier America

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

(2-Year Contract Position, Remote or in-Person)

Background
Partnership for a Healthier America (PHA) was founded in 2010 alongside First Lady Michelle Obama’s Let’s Move Initiative. Our work is centered on crafting robust partnerships that deliver lasting, systemic changes that improve the food supply and increase physical activity so that all children, especially those disproportionately affected, grow up to be adults free from obesity, diabetes, heart disease, and other chronic conditions.

PHA has worked with over 300 partners that commit to making business practice changes in the interest of public health. We are looking to grow and deepen our work in emergency food assistance, which began in 2016. PHA currently partners with over 23 food banks and networked food pantries across the country to implement best practices that center operations around health promotion in order to uplift the well-being of individuals receiving food assistance. Additionally, PHA seeks broader food system partnerships that improve the nutritional profile of food reaching low-income Americans.

Position Description Reporting to the Chief of Staff this two-year contract position will be responsible for recruiting new food assistance partners, managing and seeking opportunities for the existing partnership cohort, and identifying opportunities to enhance PHA’s impact in food assistance.

Specifically, the position will:

  • Promote the PHA food assistance partnership program and cultivate a minimum of ten new partnerships annually with food banks and networked food pantries across the country.
  • Support the existing food assistance partner cohort by providing as-needed technical support, holding check-ins, and organizing quarterly learning conference calls and an annual in-person pre-meeting at the PHA Healthier Future Summit.
  • Build the evidence base to shift practices in food assistance settings by developing case studies or white papers from the information gathered from the PHA food assistance cohort.
  • Garner momentum for change by identifying opportunities to present PHA’s work in a variety of settings, including conferences and presentations.
  • Support the continued development and adoption of WellSCAN, software that enables instantaneous nutrition ranking using bar codes.
  • Monitor partner progress and trends to identify opportunities for program growth and strategies that support sector-level transformation.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree required.
  • At least two years’ experience in food assistance settings strongly desired.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with senior partner contacts, staff, and prospects.
  • Highly developed problem-solving skills, can identify and overcome challenges independently.
  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Passion for PHA’s work transforming food assistance and its mission.
Apply for job

items.content:
Welcome to one of the toughest and most fulfilling ways to help people, including yourself. We offer the latest tools, most intensive training program in the industry and nearly limitless opportunities for advancement. Join us and start doing your life's best work.

The Community & State Encounter Program Management team has oversight of complete, timely and accurate encounter submissions to state customers. This includes working with health plans and states on process improvements, implementing new requirements and analyzing current production results. A Medicaid Encounter Senior Business Process Analyst is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for one or more states, responsible for establishing a thorough understanding of state encounter requirements and meeting or exceeding those encounter requirements and internal goals by correcting encounters with issues in order to get them accepted by our state customers. This is a telecommuter opportunity, you can work from anywhere in Mississippi.

You'll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* in Mississippi from anywhere in the state as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Perform end - to - end encounter business process activities, which include gathering and understanding state requirements and translating these into business processes
  • Identifying opportunities to resolve encounter error root causes using an understanding of upstream and downstream impacts
  • Participating in the creation, control and improvement of business processes
  • Correct encounter bypasses and rejects; includes managing encounter corrections with the Information Technology (IT) team
  • Produce monthly reporting of status against goals
  • Develop collaborative relationships with internal partners impacting encounters
  • Develop relationships with state partners in order to research issues
  • Host or participate in regular meetings with health plans to share encounter status and address issues
You?ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:
  • High School Diploma / GED (or higher)
  • 2+ years of experience in business and / or finance analysis
  • 2+ years of experience in data analysis
  • 2+ years of experience working with and analyzing large quantities of data
  • Previous experience working with Microsoft Word (ability to create and edit documents) and Excel (ability to create and edit spreadsheets)
  • Must live in Mississippi
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's Degree (or higher)
  • Experience with Medicaid Encounters, Medicaid Claims or other related functions, such as Provider Data or Enrollment
  • Previous experience working with Microsoft Access (ability to create and edit databases)
  • Experience working with PL / SQL within an Oracle Data base
  • Experiencing working in a matrix - style organization
Soft Skills:
  • Ability to problem solve and research conflicting and / or inaccurate data
  • Ability to communicate analysis, including trends and opportunities, to partners and customers in writing and verbally
  • Ability to work on multiple priorities
Careers at UnitedHealthcare Community & State. Challenge brings out the best in us. It also attracts the best. That's why you'll find some of the most amazingly talented people in healthcare here. We serve the healthcare needs of low income adults and children with debilitating illnesses such as Cardiovascular Disease, Diabetes, HIV / AIDS and High - risk Pregnancy. Our holistic, outcomes - based approach considers social, behavioral, economic, physical and environmental factors. Join us. Work with proactive Healthcare, Community, and Government partners to heal healthcare and create positive change for those who need it most. This is the place to do your life?s best work.SM

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Keywords: UnitedHealth, UHG, Business, Process, Analyst, Senior, Jackson, MS - Biloxi, MS - Tupelo, MS - Ridgeland, MS - Gulfport, MS

As a Workday Principal Analyst II, you will work with a high-profile team and lead technical initiatives that guide and promote best practices within the team.

You will mentor team and oversee integrations with internal and external systems & applications while providing technical guidance for Workday HCM and Payroll.

Your responsibilities will include overseeing the overall technical implementation of Workday, making recommendations and providing input regarding integrating additional applications & services.

You will have a unique opportunity to work with business partners and educate about them about the many facets of the Workday platform.

Your deep knowledge and expertise of ancillary systems & HR system operations will play an important role.

In this role, you will independently address issues and design decisions of high complexity with no direct supervision while delivering clear communication and documentation of complex concepts and issues related to applications, integrations, interfaces, data structures, and workflows across the organization.

Qualifications

Our ideal candidate will possess a minimum of a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university.

Additionally, the successful candidate will possess twelve (12) or more years of progressively responsible and directly-related work experience.

Preferred qualifications include a Master's level degree along with six (6) plus years of Workday experience (preferably 2+ years at an architectural level).

Qualifications should also include specialty certification in relevant Business & Finance related applications/technologies.

Required Skills: Workday, Workday Architect Experience

Additional Skills: Workday, HR Payroll, Core HCM

items.title: Sales Cloud, Content Marketing, Product Marketing Manager – San Franci
items.content:
Sales Cloud, Content Marketing, Product Marketing Manager – San Franci

United States, California
Company: salesforce.com, inc

Overview

Job Category

Marketing

Job Details

Sales Cloud, Content Marketing, Product Marketing Manager

Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world’s #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!

Position Summary

We are looking for a creative, talented, passionate and well-rounded product marketer to plan, deliver, and measure the success of world-class product marketing content for Sales Cloud. The ideal candidate listens to the audience, digs for the story with a journalistic approach, lights up key messages with creative visuals, and thrives on exploring new and fun approaches to increase reader engagement.

Great candidates have a passion for products and working with teams that build them, as well as the sales teams that sell them. They search out the purpose behind the products and translate it into value, and find creative ways to illustrate this value. They have a knack for transforming the complex into simplicity. They love writing, communicating visually, and presenting. Lastly and most of all, great candidates must have a passion for customer success and telling stories from our customers’ perspective.

This PMM will work across teams, products, and functions, to help retain our portfolio market leadership position, globally grow the business, develop the market strategy associated with the product roadmap, and funnel market requirements to product management and the business unit. The PMM will also partner with the broader Sales Cloud GTM and Awareness team to respectfully deliver impactful sales plays and promote content.

Additionally, this role will partner with other teams to deliver our website and digital presence, through sales campaigns and enablement, customer campaigns, and our overall consideration funnel content strategy.

RESPONSIBILITIES & IMPACT

  • Collaborate with solution and product leaders to execute “re-imagined” content as part of a new and exciting corporate initiative evolving our brand and messaging to help customers “how to” change their business.

  • Create messaging in new media formats breaking “business as usual’ and inspiring new readership.

  • Ghost write creative thought leadership articles/blogs from white space that are fun to engage with and prompt action.

  • Author and execute “how to” low-res video reality snippets that cut through marketing jargon creating a connection and trust factor with prospects and customers.

  • Work with leadership to program manage the sales cloud content strategy ensuring it always reflects the latest information on funding, priorities, budget, and execution status.

  • Create and implement a new reporting dashboard for measuring content success across the Sales Cloud customer journey, working across departments and systems for a method that is easily updated and accessible by key stakeholders.

  • Create and maintain consistent messaging that unifies the Sales Cloud Portfolio, including the Sales Cloud first call decks, new solution content, website updates, and updated product messaging framework.

  • Team across product marketing and management owners to create and maintain a single quarterly customer view of the Sales Cloud Strategy and Roadmap.

  • Proactively work with product marketing leaders ensuring content across Sales Enablement Channels is up to date and aligned with our latest messaging framework.

  • Represent Partner Marketing initiatives for Sales Cloud working across functions and product leadership, ensuring proper positioning and presence in programs and functions e.g. Google.

    • LEADERSHIP QUALITIES

  • Focus on Customer Success — Builds and maintains relationships with key customers; helps shape solutions that have significant positive impact on their business.

  • Solves Complicated Problems, Simplifies – — Analyzes and synthesizes broad, cross-business or cross-discipline information that leads to breakthroughs or significant insight. Makes an impact.

  • Thinks Strategically — Knows what it takes to give your business the competitive advantage. Ability to see the forest through the trees in a dynamic environment. Can develop relevant, sustainable solutions. Aligns the right resources to the task at hand; foresees and plans around obstacles.

  • Drive Results — Attacks everything with drive and energy with an eye on both the bottom line and customer success. Detail oriented, but versatile. Self starter and can drive to outcomes with relentless focus.

  • Collaborate & Communicate — Works well within a team environment. Writes and presents effectively in 1:1 and group situations. Gives others a voice.

    • REQUIRED SKILLS / EXPERIENCE

  • 3-5 years experience in product marketing at a high tech company, or similar. MBA a plus, but not required.

  • Background in journalism and/or creative agency.

  • Experience in Partner Marketing and multi-product solution positioning.

  • Working Knowledge of the Adobe Creative Cloud Suite or similar.

  • Experienced in content marketing measurement and systems.

  • Creative thinker that can generate innovative marketing ideas and lead a cross-functional team of stakeholders to drive execution.

  • Experience working with direct distribution (sales) teams and channel partners.

  • Hands-on ability to create a range of marketing assets, including viral on-message product demo videos and succinct slide pitch-decks.

  • Dynamic, confident personality with ability to successfully define and drive project execution with minimal guidance amidst multiple priorities and goals.

  • Experience with business processes such as revenue recognition, finance, sales, ops, marketing, customer support, collaboration.

  • Strong skills in communication, writing and ability to work well cross-functionally.

  • Exceptional team player with proven ability to lead through influence.

  • Proven track record in performing well in a fast-paced environment and organizational skills to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines effectively.

  • Proven track record of speaking in front of internal, external, and global audiences.

    • Apply for job

items.title: Growth Hacker
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
We are looking for an experienced and creative Growth Hacker to join our team. You will be responsible for developing and implementing our Social Media strategy in order to increase our online presence and improve our marketing and sales efforts, within our developer communities, as well as supporting other growth initiatives such as marketing campaigns and our content management execution.


Responsibilities include:




  • Develop, implement and manage our social media strategy




  • Define important social media KPIs - measure our success




  • Implement acquisition programs via paid and organic marketing channels




  • Be up to date with the latest social media best practices and technologies / tools




  • Monitor SEO and user engagement and suggest content optimization




  • Communicate with industry professionals and influencers via social media to create a strong network




  • Support / drive marketing campaigns taking a data-driven approach 




  • Collaborate across Marketing, Sales and Product teams






Skills & Experience:




  • Solid experience in Performance/Growth Marketing roles in a tech company. 




  • Expertise in multiple social media platforms and best practices




  • In-depth knowledge of SEO, keyword research, Google Analytics, web traffic metrics / KPIs




  • Familiarity and experience engaging with developers and technical communities




  • Familiarity with web design and publishing




  • Bonus: 




    • You have an engineering background or working in an engineering business




    • You’ve worked at a marketing-led subscription business






What’s it like to work at Ably?


Ably is entering a new phase of growth led by an experienced senior team from the likes of E-consultancy and ThoughtWorks. You’ll be part of a successful, highly motivated, and extremely collaborative team.


To provide the infrastructure required for the next generation of the internet, to tell the world about it, and to support everyone inside Ably to do so we hire people who are ready and capable of taking on challenging problems in a high-growth environment.


We want to work in a company of inclusive people who treat each other well. We’re building a company with a diverse set of people who value:




  • Ownership and impact of work. You have real autonomy and ownership over your work with a visible impact inside Ably, and externally on products powered by Ably that you use in your daily life.




  • An environment to thrive. Modern, comfy office in the heart of Camden. Excellent transport links, Camden Food Market with over 100 food stalls and restaurants, and multiple work spaces to match your working style.




  • Work from home when you need. We offer the option to work from home when you need to be home, but the role is office-based.




  • Work is varied and challenging as we’re solving hard, complex problems that push the limits of what’s possible with today’s software and infrastructure.




Perks:




  • Health insurance




  • Gym membership




  • Regular company away days and social events




  • Weekly team breakfast or lunch




  • Free drinks and snacks in the office




  • Ongoing professional development (training, events, conferences)




  • 25 days of paid annual leave (33 days including bank holidays)




  • Company contributions towards your pension




  • Your choice of high quality tech kit to work on




Ably has a culture that values employee freedom and responsibility. Apply to talk to us to see if this role on an impactful and collaborative team is right for you.

items.title: Instana: Senior Product Designer (design for DevOps)
items.content:
Senior Product Designer (design for DevOps)

We’re seeking a Senior Product Designer who can empathize with technical users to define the future of performance management of modern technologies and businesses. As part of a small team at a quickly growing startup, the role requires involvement in all steps of the design process.

This role involves close collaboration with product management and engineering, from problem discovery through implementation. As one of the early members of the design team, there is the opportunity to define and establish the design practice and workflow.

Ideal Candidate
  • Technical background in software engineering and/or operations and experience in solving problems for software developers and/or operators
  • Facilitates and establishes user-centered, problem driven design with all disciplines
  • Works as part of a cross-functional delivery team
  • Develops and maintains understanding of customers, stakeholders, users, their pain points, and workflows
  • Builds wireframes, mockups, prototypes to communicate, develop, and challenge ideas
  • Produces user interfaces and visual assets for implementation
  • Understands and continuously influences product analytics from product capability
  • Works lightweight user testing and short iterations into day-to-day
  • Incorporates business constraints into design decisions and continually pushes to overcome these constraints
  • Fluent in written and spoken English

Location
We have a partially remote team, and are currently hiring from:
  • Austria
  • France
  • Germany
  • Netherlands
  • Serbia
  • Spain
  • UK

If you prefer to work out of an office, you're welcome to join us in one of our product hubs in Düsseldorf, Munich, or Novi Sad.

Please include a link to your portfolio, and we look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Senior Client Engagement Manager, Location Analytics (remote based)
items.content:
At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way.

As a Senior Client Engagement Manager for Pitney Bowes, you can too.

We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components: Client. Team. Win. Innovate.

We are actively looking for candidates who:
•Are passionate about client success
•Enjoy collaborating with others
•Strive to exceed expectations
•Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions

You are:
A trusted advisor and ongoing advocate for client and partner success. You are an expert in our clients' industries and businesses ensuring we are delivering the best client solutions while maximizing revenue opportunities.

You will:
•Manage a portfolio of strategic client and partner relationships for the mutual benefit of Pitney Bowes and our clients
•Engage early in the sales cycle to identify client needs, develop the set of expected and realistic business results, and work with the implementation teams to create solution proposals with cost estimates
•Define data driven, location intelligent solutions based on desired business outcomes and lead solution implementation teams to ensure engagement success
•Influence activities within Sales, Pre-Sales, and Product Development in order to maintain focus on client success; and to expand the use of our technologies to drive additional revenue streams in support of our clients
•Create Statement of Work (SOW) and work with sales through contracting
•Validate results against expected outcomes at project conclusion and/or key milestones

Your background:
As an experienced Client Engagement Manager, you will have:
•5+ years experience in business consulting or client services
•Proven background in data-driven solutions, geospatial data and analytics
•Geographic Information Systems (GIS) or Statistical/Predictive models background highly preferred.
•Industry expertise in retail, financial services, telecommunications, public sector, or insurance - particularly in channel strategy
•Project Management experience
•Ability to assess client needs/pain points and explain the value of PB solutions
•Strong solution selling and negotiation skills
•Ability to travel up to 25%

We will:
•Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your career
•Offer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspectives and ideas
•Deliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organization
•Offer comprehensive benefits globally (pbprojectliving.com)

Our Team
Our Software and Data Solutions team powers global commerce, processing billions of transactions every year. Our Software technology and solutions help businesses operate faster and more efficiently. How? By identifying trusted data and insights to create targeted, effective messaging, by providing accurate geographic data to make smarter business decisions, and by delivering relevant and engaging interactions across the customer lifecycle to drive increased satisfaction.

Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace.
