items.title: Market Manager
items.content:
Market Manager at Hipcamp

Remote
About Hipcamp

Please note we are only considering applicants for this role that can work remote in Colorado, Texas, or a region of the Mid-Atlantic United States. Hipcamp makes it easy to list, discover, and book campgrounds and accommodations on private and public land. Whether you’re looking for a scenic spot to pitch your tent or planning a nature-filled getaway, Hipcamp is your go-to guide to getting outside. One of our core beliefs is that people who are connected and aligned with nature are happier and healthier humans. Our mission is to get more people outside. We accomplish this by making nature more accessible, creating revenue to support the protection of land, and creating community across the urban-rural divide.

About the Role

Our Supply Team communicates Hipcamp’s mission to get more people outside by connecting private landowners with folks who are looking for new and unique places to stay, camp and recreate in the outdoors. We’re looking to add Market Managers to the team who are obsessed with building meaningful relationships and bringing the best possible Hosts onto the Hipcamp platform.

In this role, you will acquire, onboard, develop and maintain a high-quality portfolio of Hipcamp Hosts in our most established markets. You’ll be responsible for ensuring your markets have relevant, attractive and competitive listings for Hipcamp’s customers.  Every day, you’ll be responsible for designing, executing and adjusting the strategies need to grow and drive improvements within your markets.

About you

We’re looking for someone that is excited to work hands-on driving innovative initiatives for on-boarding and acquiring hosts to Hipcamp. You’ll build strong relationships and became a champion for Hipcamp and our hosts. You’re someone that has worked in Sales, Account Management or similar roles before, and you developed a foundation of competencies.

You excel at developing and maintaining relationships with different types of people. You’re a quick learner, and you’re fearless about doing whatever it takes to get the job done, even if it means making mistakes along the way. You’re results focused and are motivated by reaching aggressive goals. You’re a team player that leaves ego at the door and enjoys building collaborative cross-functional relationship centered around helping your team succeed together.

What you’ll get to do
  • Create and implement strategies to ensure your Host partners are successful and engaged in Hipcamp marketplace
  • Achieve booking, GMV and availability goals, owning the overall performance and success of your markets
  • Develop a meaningful understanding of your markets and market dynamics (seasonality,  demand patterns, pricing, Host personas, camping expectations, points of interest, etc)
  • Grow the number of Hosts in your region by introducing prospective partners to the Hipcamp marketplace and facilitating their on-boarding and activation
  • Ensure that Host listings (content, rates, and availability) are optimized maximize Hipcamp customer conversion and customer satisfaction
  • Secure additional inventory and availability over high demand and peak season periods
  • Partner with Marketing, Support, Product, BizOps and the greater supply team to create a healthy marketplace
What skills we ask for
  •  2+ years of Sales and/or Account Management experience: you’ve developed and honed sales strategies, learned from failure and have a track record of results
  • Ability to effectively communicate across diverse demographics and through a variety of communication channels including, email, phone, and text
  • Ability to analyze Hosts performance, identify opportunities and execute meaningful action plans based on the data
  • Strong aptitude to effectively prioritize work and focus on achieving clearly defined goals
Working at Hipcamp
  • We believe health is essential to happiness. That’s why teammates receive a monthly fitness stipend, an annual camping credit to get outside, as well as 50% off all Hipcamp listings (if you used up all of your annual credit).
  • We support and appreciate individual working styles and help each other’s productivity. Each Hipcamp team member completes a “how to work with me” document so we lay it all out from the get-go without having to guess.
  • We’re committed to striving toward and evolving our shared values in ourselves and in other team members.
  • We take team camping trips together, have a stocked gear library and access to pro deals at various outdoor brands.
  • Our sunny, plant-filled office is located at 2 Mint Plaza, between 5th & Mission Street, right next to the Powell BART station.
  • We hope you have a (well-behaved) dog to bring to our office.
  • We love sunlight, plants, the enneagram test, avocados, smoked salmon, bitchin’ sauce and hope you do too.

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote Looking for UX/Product Designers Hello everyone! I’m Noel. I saved ...
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote

Looking for UX/Product Designers

Hello everyone!

I’m Noel. I saved some money and now I want to invest it in some personal projects during my free time.

I need people for:

- Creating logos

- Creating web UI/UX designs (with no user-research. I’ll do the user-research and I’ll just send you the pages/features that needs to be created)

- Writing good product descriptions or product speech (you know, explaining how a feature works, and “why you should pay for this product”)

It’s not gonna be a full-time job.Every time I need to start a new project, I’ll send an email to a few of you, asking for how much time do you think it can take to finish the project (anyway, I’ll try to not work with fixed prices, but it will help to get a cost estimation).

If I choose you, I’ll send you a full detail of the pages/features that need to be created, and I’ll trust in your creativity and your UX experience, in order to create them. So, you are going to be responsible for defining the UX (more fun for you) with some input from my side.

So, if you can do some of those task mentioned above, send me an email to brodanoel@gmail.comPlease, the email should contain:

- Your portfolio or any kind of work that you already worked on (please, don’t bother you sending a PERFECT portfolio. Just send something)

- How much time have you taken creating each of your portfolio projects? (Will be helpful to get some cost estimations)

- Your rate (USD per hour) (consider that I’m not a company. It’s just a couple of side projects)

Important: I’m not in a hurry with none of the coming project. I WILL NOT request things to be done “yesterday”. We’ll have time. The job is going to be chill out.

I hope to see you there!

items.title: Digital Paid Media Marketing Manager
items.content:
Digital Paid Media Marketing Manager

United States, Washington
Company: Brooks Sports, Inc

Overview

Who We Are :

Brooks is a team of passionate people united by a desire to do meaningful work, lead healthy lives and make a difference. We share a focused mission: to inspire everyone to run and be active. That’s it. No distractions-it’s all about the run. Through science, creativity, service, authenticity and connection, we obsess over delivering the best running gear on the planet. We do it our way, with our unique spirit, with a goal of being more relevant to runners than any other brand, day after day and mile after mile. We are determined to innovate, challenging ourselves to lead thought at every turn. Inside these walls and on the roads, tracks and trails, we live and breathe Run Happy, celebrating the positive impact running has on our lives and others. We inject it into all we do because it makes everything better, smarter, more fun and more memorable. Our company culture defines us, bonds us together and creates the conditions for success. It is lived daily as a behavioral expression of our collective set of brand values: Connect with People, Innovate for our Customer, Compete as a Team, Build Trust, Have Fun & Bring Passion, and Be Active. If you’re on our team, it means you’re part of creating something extraordinary. You’re part of Brooks.

Your Job

The Digital Paid Media Marketing Manager will execute Brooks digital media strategy, and ensure our media agency is held accountable in meeting and exceeding weekly/monthly KPI targets. In partnership with the Sr Manager, Digital Marketing, you will plan, execute and deliver a full funnel media plan that drives Brooks strategic acquisition and retention goals across all channels efficiently. This role will manage Paid Media (E-commerce) and will oversee all lower funnel efforts, driving results for our eCommerce function within Marketing

Responsibilities:

Subject matter expert for all paid media channels within the media plan- including programmatic display/video, SEM, paid social, audio, and direct endemic partnerships.

Supports seasonal media plan and strategy development in partnership with Sr Manager, Digital Marketing

Budget management

  • Make budget allocation recommendations for each phase of marketing funnel by channel including forecasting and modeling.
  • Assist in developing quarterly budget plans and monthly targets, and approach agile budget planning process based on the business flows.

    • Own daily relationship with paid media agency

  • Partner closely with our media agency partners to deliver on our media performance plans and goals.
  • Identify and continuously optimize the best placement, audience and creative optimizations. Leverage the digital consumer journey to optimize audience targeting to deliver on KPIs on a weekly/monthly basis for all paid media channels.
  • Lead weekly status and working sessions with agency partners and ensure plans and KPIs are being delivered.
  • Develop test and learn opportunities on new/existing channels with aligned KPIs.
  • Own campaign taxonomy and setup to ensure accurate analytics and measurement are being captured.

    • Marketing campaigns planning

  • Work closely with creative agencies and/or internal content teams to develop content calendars by channel that support seasonal marketing stories
  • Help to provide strategy and media guidance to global regions

    • Own measurement and reporting on digital marketing campaigns

  • Monitor and report a detailed monthly dashboard of KPIs to all stakeholders (Broader marketing team including ecomm, social)
  • Assist in providing monthly, quarterly and campaign-based results for Integrated Marketing or other leadership teams

    • People Management

  • Manage, coach and develop at least one (1) direct report, including setting priorities and providing growth opportunities

    • Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communications or related field.
  • 4+years relevant experience in digital marketing or similar field
  • 1+ years management experience desired
  • Proven experience in executing digital campaigns; knowledge of all digital media is a must. Agency or in-house digital media is a plus.
  • Proven experience in developing and managing a media budget.
  • Proactive and highly motivated self-starter with a results-oriented and goal driven mindset.
  • Knowledge of Excel, and ability to manipulate raw data sets.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills that inspire and build trust resulting in effective working relationships across the company and agency partners
  • Analytical approach. Continuously asks, ‘yes ands..’ to dive deeper into problems and bring solutions to the table.
  • Keen attention to detail in planning, organization and execution of tasks, while simultaneously seeing the big picture and understanding how all of the pieces fit together and affect one another.
  • Ability to anticipate how a decision made can affect our customers, our partners, our products or other departments’ operations and/or morale; “connecting the dots.”
  • Embraces and lives the Brooks values!

    • At Brooks, we celebrate diversity & equity. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment, and encourage people of all backgrounds, perspectives, experiences, and skills to apply. Brooks is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, the presence of a sensory, physical or mental disability, medical condition, military status, marital status, pregnancy or child birth, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, political ideology, or any other non-merit based factors.

    Apply for job

items.content:
Social Media Manager at Spectraforce

Remote

Duration: 12 Months (Temp-hire/position will be becoming permanent)

Work Location: Virtual/Remote

Business: Brand new venture & concept, pet insurance business

We are looking for a talented Social Media Manager to administer our social media accounts. You will be responsible for creating original text and video content, managing posts and responding to followers. You will manage company’s image in a cohesive way to achieve our marketing goals.

As a Social media manager, we expect you to be up-to-date with the latest digital technologies and social media trends. You should have excellent communication skills and be able to express our company’s views creatively.

Ultimately, you should be able to handle our social media presence ensuring high levels of web traffic and customer engagement.

Social Media Manager Job Description

  • The Social Media Manager will administer company’s business social media marketing and advertising. Key oversight into setting and managing the following:
  • Deliberate planning, strategy and goal setting
  • Development of brand awareness and online reputation
  • Content management (including website)
  • SEO (search engine optimization) and generation of inbound traffic
  • Cultivation of leads and sales
  • Reputation management

The Social Media Manager is a highly motivated, creative individual with experience and a passion for connecting with current and future customers. That passion comes through as she/he engages with customers on a daily basis, with the ultimate goal of:

  • Turning fans into customers.
  • Turning customers into advocates.

Community participation.

  • Community leadership and participation (both online and offline) are integral to a Social Media Manager’s success.
  • An essential component is communicating company’s brand in a positive, authentic way what will attract today’s modern, hyper-connected buyers.

Content management duties include:

  • Administrate the creation and publishing of relevant, original, high-quality content (for all channels and ads)
  • Oversee creative agency’s content development and strategy to ensure alignment with company’s brand.
  • Oversee social media accounts’ design (e.g. Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and Instagram timeline cover, profile pictures and blog layout)
  • Identify and improve organizational development aspects that would improve content (ie: company’s recognition and rewards for participation in company’s marketing and online review building strategies).
  • Create a regular publishing schedule and promote content through social advertising.
  • Leverage the right tools and utilizing Salesforce Marketing Cloud’s Social Studio to manage content.
  • Implement a content editorial calendar to manage content and plan specific, timely marketing campaigns.
  • Integrate all channels of marketing (social media, SEO, content marketing, video, email, print and digital marketing)
  • Manage or oversee all social advertising campaigns for direct to consumer channels and partner channels (display and video).
  • Manage review website publications and referral partner partnerships.
  • Communicate with followers, respond to queries in a timely manner and monitor customer reviews.
  • Solid knowledge of SEO, keyword research and Google Analytics

Job Skills and Requirements

  • Writing: Social media manager will need to know how to write effective copy in a lot of different styles, for websites, twitter, Facebook, etc. Knowledge of writing for Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is also needed.
  • Research: Social media manager needs to know what is happening in the fast-changing world of social and digital media, what competitors are doing and what new measurement tools are being use.
  • Problem-Solving: Social media manager figures out how to best communicate company’s message on different platforms, and sometimes might need to convey sensitive issues or deal with angry customers.
  • Organization: There are many different platforms (Trust Pilot, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube and Instagram) and new ones are being developed all the time. How you communicate on each, determining audience, and measuring tactics all take organization.
  • Digital Tracking Tool: Social media manager must understand Salesforce Marketing Cloud’s Social Studio Tracking tool.
  • Interpersonal Skills: Even through writing, social media managers are a direct connection between company and the public. Being friendly and approachable online will help.
  • Technical Skills: Social media managers work almost exclusively through computers. Understanding computers, SEO, internet access and being tech savvy is necessary.
  • Collaborate with other teams, like marketing, sales and customer service to ensure brand consistency

Minimum Work Experience Required:

  • 3-5 years in social media marketing
  • Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Social Studio automation

Minimum Education Required:

  • Four-year Bachelor’s degree in relevant field or equivalent work experience
Apply for job

items.title: Junior Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
About Us


Planes is a young digital product studio, started by two friends who liked making great products together. As we grow that will always be our essence - to work on products we believe in with people we enjoy every day.


Our background is in startups, not agencies. We prefer shipping code, listening to users and iterating quickly rather than long lunches, ‘expert’ reports and death by powerpoint. This approach has lead us to work with all sorts of people, from international fin-tech providers to startups, building products that their users love.


A small and nimble team, we work collaboratively to produce work that we are proud of and our clients love. We are made up of designers, engineers and product lovers who are all entrepreneurs by nature.


The Role


We are looking for a Junior Product Manager to join our team full time. You will be responsible for managing a number of products at once, both new projects and retainers for existing products. Working in a multi-disciplinary team you will be the voice of the user, while also keeping sprints running on time and budget. Days will be varied and could involve any of the following:



  • Running user interviews to uncover insights

  • Testing prototypes with users to understand usability and solution fit

  • Digging into data to inform decisions and query hypothesis

  • Collaborating with a designer to convert ideas into a tangible product

  • Writing user stories and managing development pipelines to ensure delivery stays on track

  • Running product demos and sprint planning sessions with clients and the development team

  • Researching and making recommendations for solutions to product problems, or to help with product goals

  • Wireframing and mapping out user journeys


About you


For this role, you will have the right combination of experience and skills to manage multiple projects and priorities. You will need to be able to take the initiative and be organised as the rest of the team will rely on you to keep workflows moving in the right direction. Tonnes of experience is not required, but here is some idea of the kinds of experience that would suit:



  • Client facing; communicating directly with clients both written and in person

  • UX research/design; an appreciation of how users interact with products, how to map and measure these journeys and the ability to improve them. You might have some experience with wireframing too.

  • Project planning; aptitude at managing many moving parts and conflicting stakeholders requirements

  • Specification writing; translating designs or requirements to user stories for developers to build

  • Scrum/agile exposure; you will have exposure to the principles of agile development, and know how to adapt a development framework to suit various types of projects.

  • Exposure to deliverying digital projects; this doesn't have to be apps it could be micro sites or campaigns for an agency too for example


Working at Planes


We are a relatively relaxed bunch, and believe that if we hire adults and treat them like them we won't need any baby sitters. As such we leave it to you to decide where and when you will do your best work. If you need to stay at home and nut out a tough problem so be it, if you have to come in late because you are dancing at Morning Glory -power too you! That being said, we all tend to spend most of our time in the studio because we have more fun working together, so this is not a fully remote role.


We are also a social bunch and since we work with people we like we tend to hang out after work too. We don't really plan anything but tend to find ourselves doing at least one activity together a month be it mountain biking, rock climbing or just going out for beers. We also get that you have your own life too, so won't be upset if you can't join us every Friday night.


Holidays are the spice of life, so on top of your 28 days a year, we also let you take up to a month of leave without pay if you like to do even more adventuring.


Hiring process


If this sounds like a piece of you, please send through a short (no longer than one paragraph) intro on you along with your CV. If we like what we see we will start with a phone call. Following that we will send you across a small challenge for you to work on and come in to present back to us, at the same time we will introduce you to the team, show you our office and have a chat over a coffee.

items.title: Chief Technology Officer - Flexible / Remote Working UK
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=6, other=0, dotnet=43, c=6, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Chief Technology Officer - Flexible / Remote Working - From £100,000

The Business & Opportunity

This online scale-up business has just celebrated its fifth birthday and has had a 7-figure net profit ever since it turned 2 years old. The incredibly competitive nature of the sports betting industry gave birth to a plethora of betting promotions to entice new and existing customers. These promotions allowed savvy gamblers to take advantage of markets using a risk-free match betting strategy. This business founded to educate this risk-free strategy to the less savvy betting customer as well as people that may have never placed a bet before by creating exceptional video content with clear and precise instructions. They began gaining lots of traction and built their subscriber base organically to highly profitable levels.

The bedrock of their business is their own suite of software that identifies betting opportunities for their subscribers. The core of the software is their odds system, which downloads data for hundreds of bookmakers across thousands of events (resulting in millions of rows of data) and maps that data into a central database for other systems to utilise. This data is collected by way of APIs, XML feeds and Python Screen Scraping. The odds system and related tools are .NET applications written in C#.

The Challenge:

The software is complex and requires someone to manage it along with a team of 4 developers (Two Python, 1 full stack and 1 C# Developer.) That's where you come in. You will undertake a full audit of all existing tech processes and will assess ways to massively optimise systems and personnel; ensuring that the end product is flawless. This will involve a mixture of hands-on analysis / coding and guiding the team to deliver. You will be responsible for ensuring all software is able to deliver on commercial goals, whilst also ensuring the development of new systems and software to stay ahead of the curve.

The successful candidate should have a strong blend of the below attributes:

  • Exemplary project management and leadership skills
  • Familiar with AGILE or other methodologies
  • NET (C#)
  • MS SQL Server
  • Python
  • NET Core
  • Knowledge of REST and Web APIs
  • MS SQL Server (Writing SQL and stored procedures)
  • Github
  • Windows Services
  • Database Expertise
  • Some interest or experience in the sports / betting industry would be preferred.

What will YOU need?

  • Extensive experience of managing teams of developers, preferably in a sports/betting company or an online aggregator focused business.
  • Experience managing teams, recruiting talent, optimising software and bringing software to market.
  • Genuine excitement at the prospect of driving a major tech overhaul with a lack of red tape.

What's in it for you?

  • Competitive Salary: Up to £110,000
  • Should you wish to have an office for the tech team or manage it fully remotely will be up to you. There would likely be a couple of team meetings per month if remote. Currently, the team reside in the midlands.
  • Senior decision-making tech role in a fast-growing UK business as it continues to educate and smarten consumers in the sports betting industry

Please apply for a more detaileed conversation about the business.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=14, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=6, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Product Designer, Mobile at Skillshare

Remote | International

ANYWHERE

PRODUCT

FULL-TIME

At Skillshare, we’re building a global community of curious, lifelong learners. Our Mobile Team plays a key role in our ability to scale by building apps that make our classes and learning community available to anyone, anywhere. We design for users around the world, in various contexts—whether sitting on a train, or their couch in front of the TV—with the goal of making learning seamlessly accessible.

We’re excited to welcome a seasoned Senior Product Designer who will design our mobile efforts across iOS, Android, and TV. Working closely with Engineering, Product, and as a member of the Design Team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the mobile user experience with a highly collaborative team and by conducting/leading your own user research.

The Mobile Team is poised to grow significantly over the next year and you’ll help lead the charge. We’ll look to your expertise in designing consumer-facing mobile products and your ability to work seamlessly with teams across the company, champion the user, and drive real impact as we scale.

What you’ll do:

  • Work closely with Engineering, Product, and Design leaders to develop ongoing mobile strategy and roadmaps
  • Maintain and design new product features in our iOS and Android apps
  • Design and launch new TV apps experience (Apple TV, Android TV, Roku, etc.)
  • Own mobile design while working closely with web teams to unify the brand’s user experience, design system, and working towards feature parity between our web and mobile apps where applicable
  • Work with Product to interpret large bodies of qualitative and quantitative data on customer usage patterns to uncover new product insights and ideas

Why we’re excited about you:

  • 5+ years of experience designing web and mobile applications, ideally in a startup working in an Agile environment
  • Deep knowledge of app design and UI conventions across both iOS and Android (experience building TV apps a plus)
  • A digital portfolio showcasing your skills in UX, Visual & Motion design
  • Ability to own Design from a brainstorming session, user research, prototyping, usability testing, and working with Product & Engineering to build and ship successful products
  • You are continuously honing your craft as a Product Designer by learning new skills, adopting new tools, and sharing your efforts to the benefit of a stronger Design team
  • “Details are the design” is your mantra

Why you’re excited about us:

  • Impact: Mobile is a major company priority and you’ll have the chance to lead the charge.
  • Our team: We have a passionate, talented team that is a lot of fun to work with.
  • Our mission: We’re doing work that matters – connecting lifelong learners around the world and empowering them to pursue their creativity.
  • Flexibility: We believe that doing your best work means living a full life. That means different things for everyone, so we optimize for trust, invest to support remote teams, have an unlimited vacation policy (with a required minimum!), and encourage work-life balance.

About Skillshare:

Skillshare is an online learning community whose mission is to connect curious, lifelong learners everywhere – and, in so doing, build a more creative, more generous, and more prosperous world. Today, our community has grown to millions of members who come to Skillshare to learn creative and entrepreneurial skills, network with peers, and even teach a class themselves. We are backed by Union Square Ventures, Spark Capital, Amasia, Spero Ventures, and Burda Principal Investments.

Skillshare is committed to building a diverse team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We’re proud to be recognized as a top place to work by Crain’s, and one of the five best places to work for women by Bpeace. We work to ensure a consistent interview process, fair compensation, and inclusive work environment for all.

Apply for job

items.title: Growth Marketing Manager
items.content:
Growth Marketing Manager at Serverless

Remote | Freelance

GROWTH

CONTRACT

Who we are: Serverless is a Series A (Lightspeed Ventures, Trinity Ventures) startup that is changing the way cloud software is built and deployed. Our software is used by tens of thousands of developers from companies like EA, Coca-Cola, Nordstrom, and Nike, to get their cloud applications to market faster. We’re a small, distributed team that is obsessed with delivering value to developers.

As Growth Marketing Manager you will be responsible for strategizing, coordinating and implementing growth marketing efforts to drive users through our marketing funnel. You will be required to work cross functionally and manage efforts across marketing, product, data/analytics and sales. You’ll help identify and test the most impactful initiatives to drive acquisition, engagement, referral and monetization. The role is tasked with developing, measuring, testing and implementing initiatives that result in the acquisition and growth of customers using Serverless products.

Responsibilities
  • Prioritize and execute strategic growth marketing initiatives
  • Drive users and customers to understand the core value of our products
  • Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Sales to improve user experience, increase product engagement, and drive monetization
  • Develop, test and implement initiatives that increase product usage and lead generation
  • Own Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) for community growth and lead generation
Requirements
  • Good understanding of B2B growth tactics and channels
  • 2+ years experience in marketing, ideally in a developer facing org
  • Experienced with Free/Open Source to paid models and expertise in experimenting and optimizing all aspects of the conversion funnel
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work across functions
  • Strong analytical skills

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.

items.title: Chief Operating Officer for a SaaS company (Full-Time, 100% Remote)
items.content:
Time Doctor

 

Chief Operating Officer for a Saas Company (full-time, 100% )


Worldwide
This is a 100% remote position. You will be managing a company with over 80 people working from 28 different countries. You will need to have meetings with people in multiple time zones. This means that you may need to work several evenings or mornings each week. Otherwise, your work hours will be flexible. You should definitely have extensive management experience as well as experience in managing a technology/software company. # Responsibilities You will be responsible for: * Improving company revenue and profits. * Working with leaders to coach them and improve their results. * Implementing objectives and key results (OKRs). * Recruitment, HR, and retention. * Increasing the level of talent in the company. * Working hands-on in different areas when necessary. # Requirements You should have skills in as many of these areas as possible: * Managing a remote/distributed team * Taking a SaaS product from single-digit millions in revenue to double-digit millions in revenue * Recruiting a remote team * Achieving objectives and key results (OKRs) * Managing a software development team * SaaS product development * Sales management * Marketing #Location - Worldwide

items.title: Elevar: eCommerce Analyst
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
eCommerce Analyst

Do you love data and could spend your entire week sifting through Google Analytics and GTM accounts? Are you looking for an opportunity to thrive and flex both your analytical and technical skills at a fast growing start-up?

We are looking for an eCommerce Analyst to help implement strategies and solutions for our Elevar PRO customers that deliver exceptional results.

This is a high-growth role where you will be expected to learn on the fly with new solutions that Elevar delivers, adapt to changes in our business, and help maintain our lead in onsite tagging and optimization expertise. Your ideas and expertise will be critical in our growth! 


What you will do:

  • Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with our Pro customers by understanding their business goals and pain points in order to deliver solutions that help improve their business.
  • Execute Google Analytics & GTM audits and implement recommended changes across client accounts.
  • Collaborate with our customers to develop and implement Analytics and GTM solutions specific to their needs.
  • Ideate Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) strategies for our customers, including implementing a/b tests using Google Optimize.
  • Act as an expert liaison for our customer support team for Google Analytics and GTM questions specific to our Shopify GTM App.
  • Be an expert voice on delivering onsite and eCommerce solutions.

Your Qualifications:
  • 3+ years experience in digital commerce
  • Experience in eCommerce and Google Analytics required
  • Exceptional multi-tasking and context-switching capabilities
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills
  • Measurement, reporting, and other data analytics skills preferred
  • Experience in working in a startup environment
  • Experience in managing projects or client accounts

Benefits:
  • 100% Remote Company
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Company provided computer and equipment
  • Health insurance stipend (we are planning to offer company health insurance starting in 2020)
  • Working with a group of talented, passionate, and motivated team members across all disciplines

**** How to Apply ****

1. Please review the questions below.

2. Send your answers to ann@getelevar.com with the subject line "eCommerce Data Analyst." Please include your name, and a link to your Linkedin profile in your email.

The team will then review your answers and background, and if seems like we are a good fit for each other then we will reach out to schedule an interview.

**** Video Questions ****

Example Customer: Le Creuset
Website: https://www.lecreuset.com/

1. Propose an a/b test idea for Le Creuset, and tell us why you think it would be beneficial

2. Le Creuset tells you that they are looking for a way to increase their revenue. You see that their conversion rate and sessions have been consistent for the last year. What is another way they could increase revenue other than increasing sessions and conversion rate?

3. Le Creuset wants to know how many times the social buttons are being interacted with on this page (https://www.lecreuset.com/metallics-collection-heritage-rectangular-casserole). What could they do to track this?

items.content:
SkyVerge

Senior Product Manager

verified
Worldwide
Howdy We’re the folks at SkyVerge, and we build WordPress plugins that help over 100k+ eCommerce businesses grow and manage their WooCommerce stores. Our team is 100% remote, with 29 people distributed all over the world. We’re looking for a driven, experienced Product Manager to help us maintain, grow, and expand our existing portfolio of 50+ individual extensions. **You should be:** * Empathetic and understanding of the user journey, and excited to collaborate with the team in making it better. * Adept at understanding the difference between user needs and requests. * Able to translate feedback into job stories and acceptance criteria for our engineering team. * Detail-oriented & curious, with a drive to understand and solve challenges for users in a clean, simple, and streamlined way. * A self-starter, comfortable working independently and taking a high level of responsibility. * Dedicated to constant learning and sharing your knowledge. **Bonus points if you also have:** * Experience with CSS and HTML; even more for familiarity with programming languages * WooCommerce or other eCommerce experience (particularly with other platforms like Shopify, Magento, or BigCommerce) * Experience with product design tools like Whimsical, Figma, Balsamiq, or others * Experience working with an Agile development team **You’ll be responsible for:** * Gathering and organizing customer feedback via multiple sources. * Identifying user problems and developing job stories to communicate them to our team. * Analyzing competitors and identifying gaps in our product offering. * Proposing product improvements that address customer, team, and company needs. * Contributing to and providing feedback on UX design. * Collaborating with team members across support, design, and engineering to deliver solutions that solve user problems. * Prioritizing stories, bug reports, and product improvements with our engineering team. * Ensuring that product updates meet acceptance criteria and our definition of done. * Communicating product changes to our team internally and to customers externally. **Why you’ll love working with us:** * Kind, wonderful teammates that enjoy their work as much as you do * Competitive salary * Annual company retreats (read about [our last adventure in Scotland!](https://www.skyverge.com/blog/skytrip-2019-recap/)) * Fantastic benefits: 27 days paid time-off, full health insurance (medical, dental, and vision), retirement contributions, paid parental leave, and more! * Transparent culture (check out [our team wiki](https://hq.skyverge.com/)) Curious to learn more? Learn more about the position and [apply here.](https://skyverge.workable.com/jobs/1156501) Applications accepted through **Nov 1st**. We can’t wait to meet you! We support workplace diversity and do not discriminate on any protected class. We believe when we work together as a team of different views, experiences, and ideas, we can build amazing things. #Location - Worldwide

items.content:
HTC - A brief profile

Established in 1990, HTC Inc., a CMM Level 5 company with headquarters in Troy, Michigan, is a leading global Information Technology solution and BPO provider. HTC assists clients across multiple industry verticals, offering turnkey project lifecycle in, e-business, data warehousing, embedded systems, ECM, SCM, CRM, and ERP solutions. HTC Inc. offers ConnectIT, our Global Delivery Methodology that enables seamlessly delivery of outsourced IT services. HTC has global delivery centers across the globe.

About the Job

We are currently looking for Smart Communications / Thunderhead Developers. We will consider relocation for candidates with exceptional skills.

Requirements:

Details:

  • Looking for Thunderhead/ SmartComm developer with excellent verbal and written communication skill.
  • Should have good experience in application of standard software development principles.
  • Should be able to work as an independent team member, capable of applying judgment to plan and execute your tasks.
  • Should have in-depth knowledge of development technology/ programming language.
  • Should be able to respond to technical queries / requests from team members and customers.
  • Should be able to coach, guide and mentor junior members in the team.

Benefits:

HTC's competitive package includes besides compensation Health, Dental, Vision, Disability Cover, both Short and Long term, Life Insurance, Flexible Spending, 401k and Paid Vacation

Candidates should e-mail their resumes to

Be sure to reference the job number and title in the subject line. Relevant degree or its foreign equivalent is required. EEO/M/F/V/H

- provided by Dice

items.title: Director, Digital Marketing - OPEN TO REMOTE
items.content:
Our client, a dynamic digital consulting agency, is looking for a Digital Marketing Director to join their team in Boston (or remote). As a member of the consulting team, the ideal candidate would have hands on experience understanding consumer behavior across multiple digital channels, understand CRM and customer journey work and be familiar with leveraging loyalty within the digital space. The Director will be responsible for managing client intake, gathering objectives and requirements and presenting strategy directly to the client. (Note: this is not a sales or business development role.)

This is a fast-passed digital role with emphasis on data and leveraging data to help solve business problems.

Requirements: • 10+ years of experience in a digital marketing consulting role covering multiple disciplines (CRM, loyalty, digital marketing across multiple channels) • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field • Experience in a client facing role and presenting directly to clients • Demonstrated ability to present clear, concise reporting based on analytics to clients • Ability to work well autonomously • 5+ years of consulting experience
Other information: • Salary is up to $140K and is commensurate with experience • Open to US Citizens or Green Card holders only • Open to Boston office or remote
Keywords: website analytics, digital media, multi-touch attribution, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, measurement, statistics, mathematics, data extraction, data analysis, data interpretation, Tableau, social media monitoring

items.title: Product Marketing Manager
items.content:
Product Marketing Manager

United Kingdom, Northumberland
Company: Nigel Wright

Overview

The company

Nigel Wright are recruiting for a marketing manager with a product bias to join a global market leader within manufacturing. The company’s product portfolio is vast and diverse and spans industries such as chemical, oil and gas and pharmaceutical and they are a well known name within their respective markets.

With a large employer footprint in the region, they are looking for an experienced marketing manager to join a large team. Applications are sought from candidates with experience or exposure to product management within a marketing role, who have good commercial acumen.

The role is home based with frequent domestic travel and the requirement to be at head office occasionally in the North East.

Job description

  • Responsibility for the optimisation of the global product portfolio for domestic market and ensuring that the local market requirement are clearly communicated.
  • Responsibility for the local Price/Positioning of the Portfolio within the target markets. This includes the competitive positioning as well as the adaptation and development of the product differentiation message.
  • The Marketing Manager is responsible for the adaptation of global / regional marketing materials for the local market. Works in conjunction with the Communication team in the development of local materials and sales support information.
  • Act as a product expert, providing support to the sales teams for the achievement of their sales targets.
  • The Marketing Manager is responsible for the analysis of the market, definition of the portfolio and generation of the marketing plan.

Person specification

  • University degree or equivalent business experience
  • Experience with an industrial business highly desirable
  • Ability to organise and prioritise
  • Ability to lead and work as part of a team
  • Ability to influence and lead without authority
  • Customer orientation

Apply for job

items.content:
EMEA Marketing Manager- CyberSecurity

United Kingdom, Berkshire
Company: Eximius Group

Overview

Eximius Marketing have partnered with a US based Cybersecurity business to grow and develop their Marketing function across EMEA. This client is a fast expanding Software business with a strong client base and a unique proposition to the market. Based in Bracknell, they are keen to invest in their Marketing and brand.

The EMEA Marketing Manager role is targeted on growing sales pipeline and MQL/SQL’s through both Channel and Direct engagements. A brief summary of the duties and experience required is below:

  • Develop and expand a full Marketing Campaign plan to drive and deliver quality leads to the Sales pipeline
  • Manage and organise the Content library to ensure technical content is delivered to target accounts and relevant points of contact
  • Work with the Marketing team to develop and organise Events across EMEA to feed the pipeline with new target accounts
  • Plan and executive on Marketing campaigns that speak to relevant point of contact in target accounts
  • Measure and refine all campaigns and content to increase effectiveness

The EMEA Marketing Manager role will be a key stakeholder in the business as it expands, working closely with commercial leaders and corporate headquarters from the US.

  • A proven track record in Lead Generation focused Marketing (ideally within the Cybersecurity/SaaS space)
  • Experienced in working with and influencing Senior stakeholders
  • Any experience of budget management is desirable but not essential
  • Able to manage and develop the identify of the Marketing function in the business as it expands.
  • Ideally, Based a commutable distance from Bracknell
  • Open to travel around EMEA (Around once a quarter)

items.title: Communications and Press Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Communications and Press Manager at Wikimedia Foundation

Remote | International

Location: Remote

The Wikimedia Foundation seeks a remote Communications Manager with a deep understanding of media relations and digital content creation, as well as strong networking and editorial skills to elevate and amplify the voices and stories of the knowledge equity movement.

You will lead the development of proactive and reactive communications plans to strengthen Wikimedia’s worldwide narrative and amplify its brand, initiatives, and campaigns. The position requires an individual with an outgoing personality who can build relationships with journalists and actively pursue media opportunities. You will have proven experience in developing and executing successful communications initiatives and media campaigns that demonstrate tangible results.

This is a highly collaborative role, with regular opportunities to shape communications strategy, craft content, pursue strong relationships with media, manage the foundation’s reputation within the press, and extend the Foundation’s reach. You will lead and execute communications campaigns in close partnership with peers and colleagues in the department, and work jointly with branding and marketing to ensure content and storytelling are consistent with the foundation’s values, voice and tone.

Ideally, you are:

  • A self starter with excellent knowledge of the global media and social media landscape, as well as current events and news trends.
  • A strategic thinker with experience crafting engaging content, campaign development and creative execution, as well as a solid understanding of messages that resonate and engage.
  • An excellent verbal and written communicator with a keen knowledge of media and communications strategy, including the ability to write in a range of voices and styles for a variety of projects with diverse audiences.
  • An energetic networker who holds strong relationships with journalists around the world particularly with global development, technology, education and public policy media and can deepen media relationships, and secure engagement with influencers and journalists, bloggers, and other digital influencers.
  • A detail-oriented team player with the ability to manage projects and timelines and keep things on track, even under tight deadlines.
  • A results-driven achiever with the ability to gather key media insights, trends, and a strong understanding of media and social media metrics and tools.
  • A highly collaborative and vibrant team player committed to continuous learning, who can work closely with department colleagues, build support for shared visions, and integrate into a dynamic Communications department.

You will join a growing team of highly collaborative and adaptive media, creative strategists, marketers, writers and designers working to champion free information and knowledge around the world.

You are accountable for:

Shaping, implementing and executing communications and press plans, tactics and campaigns:

  • Shaping communications and developing media relations strategy to develop integrated campaigns that amplify the foundation’s voice, brand and the knowledge equity movement.
  • Guiding and drafting materials including press releases, blogs, pitch notes that highlight foundation goals, while underlining their connection to wider news trends and topics.
  • Communicating the Wikimedia story by keeping up with current news trends and generating media coverage for events, major milestones, and key announcements.
  • Managing and responding to daily press inquiries in a timely manner and in consideration of key opportunities for the foundation.
  • Acting as a media liaison and handling requests for information, interviews, statements, event participation, etc.
  • Handling rapid response and crisis communication to protect the perception and reputation of the foundation.
  • Creating target media lists and pitching print, broadcast, bloggers and online journalists at global media outlets.
  • Actively pursuing and fostering relationships with media and other reporters to ensure regular and in-depth coverage of Wikimedia work.
  • Using metrics, data and research to shape narratives and identify ways to strengthen media campaigns and strategies.

Monitoring Foundation social media platforms for media opportunities:

  • Crafting social media and digital content that resonates with media, influencers and key audiences, highlights coverage of the Foundation, and extends our following and reach in partnership with other communications colleagues.
  • Monitoring social media platforms to identify news trends and discussions related to foundation news, and advising on issues that might affect our brand and reputation.
  • Partnering with team members across departments and volunteers to create and distribute content.

Collaboratively supporting communications department work:

  • Working side-by-side with the marketing team to develop and advance strategies that amplify press campaigns, including paid social media campaigns.
  • Communicating clearly across the department on project objectives and deliverables, and connecting with internal teams to define and develop creative vision and strategy for media campaigns.
  • Analyzing content and media opportunities and recommending strategies, interactions or approaches.
  • Supporting the development of staff as thought leaders by advancing understanding of media and trending news and identifying key moments for staff to contribute.

Skills and experience:

  • Minimum of 2 years of communications and media relations experience.
  • Knowledge of and connections with global media and trends, behavior and products.
  • Excellent interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communications skills.
  • Experience and knowledge of media tools and digital communications platforms, audiences and engagement strategies.
  • Experience executing integrated communications strategies and a successful track record in shaping campaigns that reach or influence global audiences.
  • Experience cultivating diverse stakeholder relationships, including with media, advancing partnerships and stewarding collaboration.

Qualities that are important to us as a team:

  • Resilience we work on new and interesting problems in public and collaborative ways
  • Being open, curious, and inquiring in our work
  • Internal motivation and high standards
  • Working together for outcomes, and being willing to let go to scale or change course
  • Sharing a culture of constructive criticism and respect

Additionally:

  • Experience working with global nonprofit, media or technology service organizations is a plus.
  • Fluency or familiarity with languages in addition to English is a plus.

The Wikimedia Foundation is…

…the nonprofit organization that hosts and operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

U.S. Benefits & Perks*

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off – vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays – including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments – long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues – diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

*Eligible international workers’ benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

Apply for job

items.content:
Product Owner, Marketing Site at Fastly

Remote | International

Location: Remote

Fastly helps the world’s most popular digital businesses keep pace with their customer expectations by delivering fast, secure, and scalable online experiences. Businesses trust Fastly to accelerate the pace of technical innovation, mitigate evolving threats, and scale on demand. Founded in 2011, Fastly powers online destinations including Airbnb, GitHub, Alaska Airlines, Pinterest, Vimeo, The Guardian, and The New York Times.

The worldwide cloud services market is projected to grow rapidly to $236 billion in 2020, according to Forrester, Inc. As more and more businesses move operations to the cloud, Fastly is well positioned to continue increasing CDN, cloud networking and cloud security market share with edge cloud services that reach beyond content delivery.

We’re building a better Internet. Come join us.

Product Owner, Marketing Site

Fastly understands the importance of a marketing website in the era of buyer-led IT purchasing. Due to its importance, we’re looking for someone that can apply product management skills towards the ongoing development of the site. As a product owner, you will become deeply familiar with the site’s users and their preferences. You will also become proficient in what website improvements can make the most meaningful business impact so that you can prioritize web work effectively. And you will understand your extended team including your creative, technical, and analytical collaborators.

What You’ll Do

  • Manage the marketing site backlog including socialization, understanding capacity of internal teams, prioritization, and communicating customer insights to our web development team.
  • Manage prioritization of conversion rate optimization (CRO) experiments against the web backlog to continually learn what works best on our site.
  • Ensure web CRO experiments can be tracked all the way into our customer relationship management system. Optimize the site to financial improvements, not just clicks and form submits.
  • Conduct regular web analysis to surface opportunities for improvement.
  • Help our creative and front end development team members understand the impact of their work on the marketing site.
  • Evangelize the impact the marketing site has on our business.

What We’re Looking For

  • 7+ years of relevant experience (ideally in web management, web marketing, project management or product management).
  • Exceptional interpersonal and negotiation skills.
  • Outstanding organizational skills.
  • Strong experience in Google Analytics, CRO, search engine optimization (SEO), and agile project management.
  • Team-player; ability to establish trusted relationships.
  • Comfortable contributing strategically as well as leading day-to-day tactical execution.
  • Open, positive attitude towards change and personal development.
  • Proactive and driven to make an impact.
  • Clear, thoughtful communicator (verbal and written).

Why Fastly?

  • We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Not only do our customers have a tremendous user base, but we also support a growing number of open-source projects and initiatives. Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their heart with others so we can help lend a supportive hand.
  • We love distributed teams. Fastly’s home-base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. In fact, 50% of our employees work outside of SF! An international remote culture is in our DNA.
  • We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits like up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave, options for free medical/dental/vision plans, and an open vacation program that enables our folks to take the time they need to recharge (some benefits may vary by location).
  • We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful — every day.
  • We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we’re not one size fits all’. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they are passionate about.

We’re always looking for humble, sharp, and creative folks to join the Fastly team. If you think you might be a fit please apply!

Fastly is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity and to providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

Employment decisions at Fastly are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Fastly encourages applicants from all backgrounds.

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Apply for job

items.content:
We’re looking for a content marketing hero to showcase one of London’s top 100 start-ups


EduMe is excitedly on the search for a brilliant Content Marketing Manager. Are you someone with the biggest enthusiasm for marketing and content who wants to see their work making a significant difference?


You’ll want to excite people with your writing and be able to put yourself in the shoes of any number of existing and potential clients and industries. This is our second full time marketing hire alongside the Head of Marketing, and in a growing business it means this role will play a critical part in the success of EduMe.


About EduMe


EduMe is a Workforce Success platform used by modern companies across 6 continents to train, engage and communicate with their workforce. By having effective learning and relevant information in the palm of their hands, the workforce at companies like Uber, Airbnb, Deloitte and Vodafone are empowered with the knowledge they require to be successful in their job. This is the goal of Workforce Success.


We are a hyper-growth company that’s changing the way people get access to and absorb information. Founded in 2016, we have won numerous awards for innovation and excellence, and are listed by Seedtable as one of top 100 London startups to watch in 2019. We’re quickly growing, now with a team of 18 based in the idyllic and leafy Chiswick. Our office is in a modern Workspace building with café on site, all your high street favourites just over the road and a huge range of independent cafes, pubs and eateries.


What you’ll do



  • Be ultimately responsible for developing and delivering a content marketing plan

  • Come up with bold ideas

  • Write and edit blogs, guides, stories, social posts, webinars, product information, newsletters and anything else you want to get your hands on

  • Help to shape our category design marketing around Workforce Success

  • Become an expert in Workforce Success and a leading voice in the industry

  • Work with an in-house designer to bring your content to life

  • Carry out analysis of the performance of all new content and make recommendations

  • Run all our social media and manage performance 


What we’re looking for in our Content Marketing Manager



  • Someone with huge passion for building stories and taking pride in their work

  • A real creative soul - someone who’s always got ideas from both the inside and outside of the ‘box’

  • An eagerness to direct both content and social strategies and inform the overall growth marketing strategy

  • You’ll love exciting and educating people by creating a unique voice and personality for a brand

  • Experience in B2B content marketing for 3+ years is essential

  • Someone who’s had exposure to the full marketing mix

  • Experience with Hubspot will be a big benefit


Why EduMe


As one of London’s most exciting tech startups, there’s a wonderfully positive atmosphere in the office. Whether it’s the camaraderie and sharing of ideas, or the fact every opinion, suggestion and concept is totally valued. You will never feel out of place with us.


Work and play come hand in hand at EduMe with games nights, Friday afternoon pub sessions and the odd team party. We offer a pension, 25 days holiday, share options, personal health budget and personal learning and education budget.


This is a brilliant opportunity to be part of a business that’s growing, in an environment where you’ll have complete freedom to act on your instincts. You’ll see your ideas help build the path to bigger success, establish yourself as a critical part of the company and develop personally and professionally.


Please send us your CV with a short covering note.

items.title: G2i Inc.: Software Product Manager
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Software Product Manager

What is G2i?

G2i is a hiring platform for engineers by engineers. Our vision is for the hiring process to be simple, trustworthy and enjoyable for both companies and engineers. Our mission is to create a vetting process where:
  • Engineers will vet other engineers
  • Engineer vetting will be as close to on-the-job requirements as possible
  • The vetting process will be objective, repeatable and quantitatively scored
  • The process will be transparent. We will provide the engineer's code, our code review and technical interview notes in full to our clients.
G2i is short for "Good News to the Internet." In addition to being good news to engineers in the tech industry, we are on mission to help hundreds of street kids in Nairobi, Kenya obtain education, a safe home, parental care, and the love they need. We are also committed to supporting the open source community by finding ways to financially support those who build the OSS we rely on.

Feel free to watch this 6 minute video from our founder about the mission of G2i: http://bit.ly/2NtkIu1

What We're building

In order to fulfill our mission & vision, we are building a two-sided marketplace that will allow companies to find pre-vetted engineers that can augment their teams on demand. We're investing in features such as a quantitative manual review code process, individualized company match scores, and machine learning to automate more of these processes.

To learn more about this role you can watch this 3 min video from one of the members of our Product Team: http://bit.ly/327NXWD

Responsibilities

  • Understand our business strategy and deliver products with G2i's unique perspective in mind
  • Deeply understand the problems that you’re tackling through research and regular interaction with customers, and define and re-frame those problems for the team
  • Manage the roadmap—understand and prioritize potential projects from various inputs (user research, our wishlist, etc) so the team is always working on the most impactful projects
  • Facilitate our Weekly Stakeholder Meeting and ensure all G2i initiatives have a clear owner, priorities are clearly defined, and status is visible to all stakeholders.
  • Facilitate all Scrum Ceremonies (Sprint Planning, Daily Stand Up, Sprint Retrospectives, etc.) 
  • Define quantitative and qualitative success metrics and constantly evaluate if your solutions have solved the problem through these measures, both before and after it’s released
  • Deliver world-class software—maintain the quality of the product that your team is responsible for and
  • Motivate a group of committed, smart people to do the best work of their careers


Requirements

  • 3+ years experience in a Product Manager role
  • Be a clear communicator of product decisions and the rationale behind them. Be comfortable in making decisions without consensus. You can help others make decisions by being persuasive.
  • You’re entrepreneurial—you're self-driven and you don’t need direction.
  • You’re organized, not ad hoc.
  • Be able to easily switch between thinking creatively and analytically.
  • Have an understanding of the technical architecture of complex web and mobile applications.
  • You are interested in learning more about frontend development and might even like to learn how to code a bit (not required, but encouraged)
  • A leaning towards over communicating rather than under communicating which is paramount on remote teams
  • Urgency and ownership matter a lot to us. You can read about our CTO's perspective on it here.


This role is perfect for you if:

  • You are comfortable working remotely and/or managing a remote team — We are a 100% remote first company and you have the option of working remotely or moving to South Florida (near the beach)
  • You value work-life balance — you are not encouraged to work weekends. We value our 40 hours work weeks.
  • You aren't afraid of rolling up your sleeves and wearing many hats if that's what it takes to push a project forward. This is a dual Product and Project Manager role, with a lot of Project Management work involved at the beginning.
  • You are comfortable managing both software development projects and business process improvement projects.
  • You want to be a part of defining the product process — as our first Product Manager, you'll help build the design and development process and, as a startup, there's lots of room for new ideas and growth.


The other perks

  • We have a game night every 3 weeks which is a ton of fun!
  • 21 Days of PTO
  • Blue Cross Blue Shield Health Care (Gold Plan)


We are not a good fit for you if:

  • You are looking for a giant slow-moving company. ****We're constantly experimenting, iterating and changing things.
  • You are looking to specialize in some particular problem set. This role requires working in different contexts and problem sets. We need people that can adapt to the challenges thrown at them.
  • You don't want to take on any work outside of your job description/comfort zone. We're a small company and sometimes we need all hands on deck for certain problems.


Diversity

G2i is an equal opportunity employer. We’re dedicated to building a team where diversity in both ideas and identities is not only welcomed but encouraged. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you are part of an underrepresented group in tech that is considering applying, but you have any reservations about doing so, please email me (rhona@g2i.co) and let me know how we can be more welcoming to you.

items.title: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


Hubble is one of the UK’s leading PropTech scaleups and we’re changing the face of commercial property. We’ve raised over £6m in venture funding from the most respected investors in technology and real estate. Our vision is to create a world where everyone has the right workplace to succeed. The beginning of this journey is our online platform to help businesses rent, manage and share office space in London.


As a product designer at Hubble, you will have the opportunity to add your magic to every stage of the design process. Working closely with product managers and tech leads, you will have the autonomy to conjure up functional yet delightful solutions to genuine user problems. All the while working towards business goals.


Your role will of course include wire-framing, prototyping and spinning up high fidelity designs and assets but this is only a small part. Through user testing and internal feedback sessions, you will be responsible for continually testing ideas and assumptions and mixing your findings back into the designs. You will be able to use these findings to explain and defend your design rationale with the wider team and stakeholders. Excellent communication skills, explaining complex solutions in simple terms and the ability to challenge people in the wider team at all levels, backed with evidence, are all crucial.


Strong visual UI design is a given, but beyond that you will be instrumental in following and helping to build out the Hubble design system. You will work closely with our engineers and regularly pair with them to help set the rules and ingredients for new design assets and components. A keen eye for detail is important but you should understand the trade-offs between striving for pixel-perfection against good enough to ship fast.


You will possess a functional but creative mind and a no-fear attitude to your work. With a scientific approach to product design, don't be afraid to fail-fast and learn. You will feel empowered to push the needle, and suggest wildcard ideas that may make some colleagues squirm, but always be grounded in the possible. We build our products in an iterative, continuous deployment style, but as a designer you should always be thinking of where we want to be rather than just what's next.


Our vision to create a world where everyone has the right workplace to succeed starts from within. We're a friendly and diverse team. We go out for team lunches, monthly book, climbing, gaming and DnD clubs (among others) and are always looking for more ways to knowledge share and have fun as a group :). We host quarterly away days (organised by different team members) which are a great opportunity to chat with people who you rarely cross paths with and ensure that our business vision is always clear and transparent to the whole company. Although we're still only small, our team has a mix of different backgrounds, races, and genders and we want to continue this as we grow.


 




REQUIREMENTS



  • Have 3+ years experience in designing digital products.

  • Fully proficient in designing for various screen sizes with a mobile first approach to responsive design.

  • Solid understanding of UX design principles.

  • Good understanding of atomic design and front end architecture.

  • Expertise in the tools of the trade, sketch, invision etc. UI animations desirable but not required.

  • Have the confidence to explain and defend design decisions to colleagues at all levels.

  • Experience in mapping out user journeys and flows.

  • Have experience conducting user research and synthesising customer feedback.

  • An understanding of engineering processes and how stuff gets built.

  • Experience of working in a marketplace or SaaS company is a plus (but not necessary).

  • A self-aware, motivated and empathetic person.




 


BENEFITS


We make sure everyone in the team is comfortable and has the best environment for them. We offer flexible hours, remote working and have a relaxed attitude to taking holiday - focusing only on whether work gets done. Benefits can be tweaked on an individual basis depending on what makes you most productive. Here are some of the things we offer:



  • Remuneration competitive with industry and level of experience.

  • Macbook, peripherals and standing desk.

  • Expense budget & travel.

  • Subsidised Therapy

  • Noise-cancelling headphones.

  • Spotify Premium or Apple Music.

  • Kindle Unlimited + free professional books.

  • Health Insurance & Pension.

  • Cycle to Work scheme.


 


We truly value our people and company culture. Want to know more about why Hubble is a great place to work? Check out this recent blog post.


Hubble is an equal opportunities employer. We are a diverse bunch of people who are committed to maintaining a welcoming culture of inclusion and equality. We encourage applications from anyone that meets the requirements for the role.
