items.title: Senior Marketing Manager - Performance Marketing
items.content:
Technology has revolutionised the world we live in, yet somehow travel has stayed much the same as it was 30 years ago. Seatfrog is here to change that.


We’re on a mission to take every journey beyond the ordinary for millions of people all over the globe, empowering them to upgrade their seat and fill the 480M premium seats that travel empty every year with technology that’s a joy to use.


We’re building a stellar team to achieve our audacious goals. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work. Join us, and you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure. Ours is a culture with spirit and substance and our people are empowered to make the bold decisions others wouldn’t and haven't.


The opportunity


As a senior partnerships marketing manager you will be responsible for driving performance of user acquisition across partner channels, suggesting and planning effective digital marketing campaigns with partners.


We're looking for an enthusiastic self-starter who is keen on not only strategic planning and performance focussed marketing, but also nurturing client relationships and evolving Seatfrog use.


Tasks will include driving performance management of partner marketing; social media optimisation, content, remarketing campaigns and email.



  • Manage and maintain strong relationships with new and existing partnerships for an internal and external audience

  • Support partners with driving awareness & demand on their own digital & social channels activities such as email, social, online campaigns, events and direct marketing.

  • Support with creating relevant collateral including case studies & PR, advocating and building up the Seatfrog brand with each partner.

  • Deliver on a broad range of customer focused initiatives to support marketing with revenue targets in mind.

  • Working closely with the data & product team and sales team members to identify and create opportunities with partners

  • Evaluate partner needs and build productive long lasting relationships

  • Drive innovation in marketing across the Seatfrog channel mix

  • Educate partners on the value of Seatfrog on the best ways to support their customers with co-marketing activities


Requirements



  • Performance marketing focused experience, social & email primarily.

  • Relevant experience in B2B tech, B2C affiliates.

  • Excellent organisational skills and ability to meet deadlines to plan multiple concurrent marketing activities, content and campaigns in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

  • Excellent presentation skills to be able to present ideas and proposals in a clear and coherent way.

  • Strong influencing and negotiating skills.

  • Professional and upbeat attitude, with the ability to interact effectively with customers, sales, marketing and other internal teams.

  • Excellent problem solving skills, combined with strong commercial acumen.

  • Ability to deliver quality outputs in a fast-paced, exciting and dynamic environment with an ability to work to tight deadlines.

  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to liaise with all levels of management and to communicate cross-functionally in a structured and clear manner to influence outcome

  • Experience in a marketplace, high growth business is a plus


What's on offer



  • A fantastic opportunity to work in a high growth global software company and help shape the future of how travel should be

  • A team culture that is truly beyond the ordinary, where we solve problems together to drive the best possible results for our clients and users

  • Genuine autonomy to achieve your best and a personal development and growth plan to create a long-term career path for you at Seatfrog

  • Free Upgrades and budget for 1 week working anywhere in the world.

  • A competitive salary

  • Private healthcare plan via Vitality, with added gym discounts and incentives to encourage you to get out, get active and stay mentally and physically healthy

  • The latest gear and best tools to enable you to do your greatest work

  • Off-peak travel - so you can swap a public holiday with any day you like so you can get away without the crowds. 


At Seatfrog, we consider diversity a strength - inclusion fuels our ability to solve problems we never thought we could. Your application will be considered on its merits, without regard to your race, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability status or anything else. If there is anything we need to know to enable you to fully participate in our interview process, please just let us know in your application.

items.title: Junior Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Technology has revolutionised the world we live in, yet somehow travel has stayed much the same as it was 30 years ago. Seatfrog is here to change that.


We’re on a mission to take every journey beyond the ordinary for millions of people all over the globe, empowering them to upgrade their seat and fill the 480M premium seats that travel empty every year with technology that’s a joy to use.


We’re building a stellar team to achieve our audacious goals. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work. Join us, and you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure. Ours is a culture with spirit and substance and our people are empowered to make the bold decisions others wouldn’t and haven't.


We’re looking for a Junior Product Manager to come on the journey and join our London office. Fancy coming along for the ride? Apply below!


About the team you'll be joining


The product team at Seatfrog is focused on crafting great experiences that fundamentally change the way people are able to travel. You'll be part of a group of skilled and thoughtful individuals focused on solving big problems that deliver significant growth and build upon our ambitious vision.


About the role


In this role you’ll work closely with the Product Manager and the senior product team to drive decision-making and product delivery for our iOS and Android apps. You’ll create a strong connection to our customers along every stage of the process to listen, understand and empathise with their struggles and drive solutions to solve their problems.


Your key areas of focus will be: 



  • Checking in on app health metrics daily, and producing weekly and monthly reports of your findings. 

  • Working with the senior product team to build and maintain the product roadmap for customer experience.

  • Carrying out user and market research for new initiatives and features.

  • Managing new version releases. You’ll write app release notes and ensure that new versions are shipped on time. 

  • Communicating updates to the wider team.  

  • Being the go-to person for Customer Support and Customer Success teams.

    • Responding to customer feedback and bug reports, investigating the severity of issues in order to effectively prioritise a backlog.

    • Gathering insights that drive the Customer Experience roadmap.




What you'll need



  • A passion for delivering great products and great customer experience.

  • Ability to blend instinct, consultation, and objective analysis to make the right decisions in a timely manner.

  • A methodical approach and be able to proactively foresee issues. 

  • You’ll build the trust of colleagues to keep them informed and to deliver on expectations.

  • An energetic and motivational style, that stimulates pace and creativity from colleagues.


Nice to haves, or willing to learn



  • Introductory course to product management

  • Experience using Jira

  • Experience in an agile environment

  • Experience of travel sector 

  • Mobile app product development 

  • Exposure to a fast-paced start-up environment


What's on offer



  • A fantastic opportunity to work in a high growth global software company and help shape the future of how travel should be

  • A team culture that is truly beyond the ordinary, where we solve problems together to drive the best possible results for our clients and users

  • Genuine autonomy to achieve your best and a personal development and growth plan to create a long-term career path for you at Seatfrog

  • Free Upgrades and budget for 1 week working anywhere in the world.

  • A competitive salary

  • Private healthcare plan via Vitality, with added gym discounts and incentives to encourage you to get out, get active and stay mentally and physically healthy

  • The latest gear and best tools to enable you to do your greatest work

  • Off-peak travel - so you can swap a public holiday with any day you like so you can get away without the crowds. 


At Seatfrog, we consider diversity a strength - inclusion fuels our ability to solve problems we never thought we could. Your application will be considered on its merits, without regard to your race, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability status or anything else. If there is anything we need to know to enable you to fully participate in our interview process, please just let us know in your application.

items.title: Director, Digital Marketing - OPEN TO REMOTE
items.content:
Our client, a dynamic digital consulting agency, is looking for a Digital Marketing Director to join their team in Boston (or remote). As a member of the consulting team, the ideal candidate would have hands on experience understanding consumer behavior across multiple digital channels, understand CRM and customer journey work and be familiar with leveraging loyalty within the digital space. The Director will be responsible for managing client intake, gathering objectives and requirements and presenting strategy directly to the client. (Note: this is not a sales or business development role.)

This is a fast-passed digital role with emphasis on data and leveraging data to help solve business problems.

Requirements: • 10+ years of experience in a digital marketing consulting role covering multiple disciplines (CRM, loyalty, digital marketing across multiple channels) • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field • Experience in a client facing role and presenting directly to clients • Demonstrated ability to present clear, concise reporting based on analytics to clients • Ability to work well autonomously • 5+ years of consulting experience
Other information: • Salary is up to $140K and is commensurate with experience • Open to US Citizens or Green Card holders only • Open to Boston office or remote
Keywords: website analytics, digital media, multi-touch attribution, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, measurement, statistics, mathematics, data extraction, data analysis, data interpretation, Tableau, social media monitoring

items.title: Optimal Digital Marketing: Growth Marketer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Growth Marketer

Growth Marketers maintain relationships with their small set of clients, contribute to/communicate the value/oversee all work done for their clients, and work together with our talented team to develop quarterly digital marketing strategies that help our clients reach their goals.


Local and remote applicants are welcome to apply for this position.


We are accepting applications for this position until October 31st. We’ll let you know that we’ve received your application. After that, you probably shouldn’t expect to hear back from us until after the application deadline has passed. We want to give everyone a fair chance to apply and be evaluated.


We can’t wait to hear from you!



ABOUT THE ROLE:



CLIENT MANAGEMENT

Each Growth Marketer manages a handful of clients and is responsible for completing work, delegating and managing work, hitting their set quarterly goals, reporting, and maintaining client retention. Growth Marketers meet or do video calls with clients monthly, as well as provide ad hoc communication regarding project updates via email and phone calls.



STRATEGY

Growth Marketers diagnose and determine the levers that will most move a business forward and generate revenue. Growth Marketers work with our talented, cross-functional team for assistance in refining, improving, presenting, and carrying out quarterly goals.



TACTICS

Growth Marketers break down monthly goals/objectives into milestones and weekly tasks. Strong project management skills allow them to communicate, delegate, keep things on track, and ship work.



EXECUTION

Our Growth Marketers are experts in knowing their client's goals and work expectations. They work with the right individuals to get high-value work completed or, if they possess that unique ability, perform that work for their clients themselves. Our Growth Marketers have the autonomy of determining the best way of getting work done for their clients.



REPORTING

Growth marketers are radically transparent in their reporting - internally and with our clients. They seek to connect activity with tangible revenue growth. They set up and track all calls, form submissions, and page interactions for campaign initiatives, giving us insight through the buyer journey. This involves detective work and diligence to connect multiple systems together.



TEAM PLAYER

Our Growth Marketers are team players. They fill in where needed, assist the team, and collaborate as a group to be successful. Growth Marketers help the business grow through continuous improvement, candid feedback, quality control and process improvement.




REQUIREMENTS
  • 3-5 years client management experience
  • Wordpress and/or landing page builder experience
  • Experience with one or more of the following: 
    • Google Ads 
    • Facebook marketing 
    • Design (Graphics, web pages, email headers, social ads, etc.) 
    • Development (Wordpress, Divi, Instapage, Shopify, etc.) 
    • Conversion Rate Optimization 
    • Email Design/Development 
    • Marketing Automation 
    • Website or Ad Copy Creation 
    • Ecommerce Advertising 
    • Campaign Tracking, Analytics, Reporting 
  • Able to commute to our Appleton office
    • Fully remote employees fly in quarterly
  • You feel aligned with our mission, values, and company culture

items.title: MoveOn: Product Manager (Contract)
items.content:
Product Manager (Contract)

MOVEON REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS

Project: MoveOn Action Corps Organizing Tools

Proposals accepted on a rolling basis until: Monday, October 13, 2019
 
Project begins: Monday, October 21

Project overview: MoveOn seeks a contract product manager, based anywhere within the U.S., to evaluate and select a tool or suite of tools that can best meet our members’ and staff’s community-building needs. We are building out a digital community space for MoveOn members to see, know, inspire, and support each other, and recruit new leaders to join them. Since 2017, MoveOn has run several large-scale action programs that have developed the leadership of and built community among thousands of MoveOn members. These programs include Resistance Summer, Resist & Win, Nobody is Above the Law, Crisis Response Network, Text Team, Support Corps, and Training Corps. These members continue to actively organize their communities for positive change, and are active with MoveOn campaigns. However, MoveOn currently lacks the support structures to help these skilled, committed leaders stay in relationship with one another. You can be part of changing that! 

Scope of work: 
  • Run the discovery process with members of the Organizing Team, volunteer leaders, and other stakeholders to define the problems we are looking to solve
  • Familiarize yourself with MoveOn’s current digital community platforms (Facebook groups and Slack) 
  • Research community building and collaboration products that exist to solve the problems identified through the discovery process, facilitate demos for stakeholders, and coach stakeholders to evaluate the products. Products can include but are not limited to: ControlShift Groups and Events, Mobilize Groups, Slack, Facebook Groups, and Action Builder 
  • Lead a decision making process and decide which product or combination of products to use
  • Identify if any custom development or integration work is necessary for implementation
  • Create the project plan and project manage the implementation, including working with our organizing team, our in-house tech team and/or tech contractors if necessary
  • Create documentation for staff and volunteers

Criteria for selection: 
  • Demonstrated success as a product manager, particularly in organizing or progressive political contexts   
  • Able to communicate fluently in video meetings and in writing with both technical and nontechnical staff, and drive clarity in discussions with MoveOn staff, volunteers, stakeholders, and external vendors
  • Familiarity with agile software development methodologies
  • Excellent project management skills: ability to coordinate, plan, execute, and track implementation from beginning to end, and across technical and nontechnical teams
  • Experience successfully leading equitable decision-making processes with leadership from diverse stakeholders and attuned to historic inequities in who makes decisions about technology
  • Self-directed, efficient, determined, thorough, and a relentless finisher: able to determine the work to be done, prioritize, and get things done; ability to set and meet deadlines; able to reliably drive tasks and projects through to completion
  • Hands-on: detail-oriented and in the weeds with both the organizing team and the tech team
  • Demonstrated ability to learn new systems quickly and effectively
  • Ability to facilitate meetings and ensure alignment across stakeholder groups
  • Ability to be effective in an organization whose team members all work remotely

Proposal submissions:  To be considered for this role, please submit either a cover letter and resume, or a proposal which includes the following information below. No preference will be given to either form of submission. Please make sure to include the following information:

Background: Name, title and contact information.
Experience: Tell us about your relevant experience. A resume may be submitted in lieu of this section if your relevant experience appears within your resume.
Approach: Briefly explain how you would work with us to decide what digital tool or set of tools to use to build our online member community and how you would implement that decision
Cost and availability: Include an estimate for hourly rate in your proposal and any limitations on your availability. The project begins Monday, October 21. We anticipate this project will require 10-20 hours of work and should be completed by December 6, 2019, with the possibility of an additional phase after December 6 to evaluate and expand upon the first phase.
References: Past clients that MoveOn may reach out to as references, with contact info.

Submission: Submit to proposals@moveon.org and put "Organizing Tools Product Manager" in the subject line. Please submit by Monday, October 13, 2019.

Most-favorable terms:
  • MoveOn reserves the right to make an award without further discussion of the proposal submitted. Therefore, the proposal should be submitted initially on the most favorable terms that the vendor could propose. There will be no best-and-final-offer procedure. MoveOn does reserve the right to contact a vendor for clarification of its proposal.
  • The vendor should be prepared to accept this request for proposal for incorporation into a contract resulting from this request for proposal. Contract negotiations may incorporate some or the vendor’s entire proposal. It is understood that the proposal will become a part of the official procurement file on this matter without obligation to MoveOn.
 
No obligation to contract
This request for proposal does not obligate MoveOn to contract for services specified herein.
 
Rejection of proposals
MoveOn reserves the right at its sole discretion to reject any and all proposals received without penalty and not to issue a contract as a result of this request for proposal.
 
Nondiscrimination
The vendor will adopt and disseminate a policy that the vendor, in employment, recruitment, selection, compensation, benefits, promotion, demotion, layoff, termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, age, sex, national origin, ethnic identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, marital status, economic status, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected basis.

Data Analytics Course Mentor

People would have a path to a fulfilling future, instead of being buried under debt. Employers would benefit from a workforce trained for today. And education could finally offer students a return on their investment of both money and time.  We put in outlandish amounts of effort to create an education that offers our students a guaranteed return on their investment. we partner with employers to create a world-class curriculum built for today. We go to ends of the earth to find mentors who are the best of the best. We invest more in career services than any of our peers. We work hard to be on the ground in the cities our students are. Simply put, no other school works as hard for its students as we do.  The Position At Thinkful, we believe that if schools put in even half the amount of effort that students do the outcomes would be better for everyone. People would have a path to a fulfilling future, instead of being buried under debt. Employers would benefit from a workforce trained for today. And education could finally offer students a return on their investment of both money and time.  We put in outlandish amounts of effort to create an education that offers our students a guaranteed return on their investment. we partner with employers to create a world-class curriculum built for today. We go to ends of the earth to find mentors who are the best of the best. We invest more in career services than any of our peers. We work hard to be on the ground in the cities our students are. Simply put, no other school works as hard for its students as we do.  Students enroll in Thinkful courses to gain the valuable technical and professional skills needed to take them from curious learners to employed technologists. As a Course Mentor, you will support students by acting as an advisor, counselor, and support system as they complete the course and land their first industry job. To achieve this, you will engage with students using the below range of approaches, known as Engagement Formats. Course Mentors are expected to provide support across all formats when needed.  * Mentor Sessions: Meet with students 1-on-1 in online video sessions to provide technical and professional support as the student progresses through the curriculum. * Group Sessions: Host online video sessions on topics of your expertise (in alignment with curriculum offerings) for groups of student seeking live support between mentor sessions.  * Grading: Reviewing student checkpoints submissions and delivering written feedback, including analysis of projects and portfolios.  * Technical Coaching: Provide in-demand support to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team through text and video in a timely manner. This team also provides the TA support for immersive programs.  * Assessments & Mock Interviews: Conduct 1-on-1 mock interviews and assessments via video calls and provide written feedback to students based on assessment rubrics.  In addition to working directly with students, Course Mentors are expected to maintain an environment of feedback with the Educator Experience team, and to stay on top of important updates via meetings, email, and Slack. Ideal candidates for this team are highly coachable, display genuine student advocacy, and are comfortable working in a complex, rapidly changing environment. Requirements * 3+ years relevant professional work experience * Proficiency in SQL, Advanced Excel, Tableau, Python, Postgres, Strong Statistical Background, Experimental Design, A/B Testing  at an industry level * Demonstrates genuine student advocacy and empathy for beginners * Exceptional written and verbal communication skills * Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment * Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection and webcam * Teaching, mentoring and/or coaching experience a plus  Benefits * This is a part-time role (10-25 hours a week) * Fully remote position, with a flexible schedule   * Access to all of Thinkful Courses for your continued learning * Community of 500+ like-minded professionals looking to impact others and keep their skills sharp * Grow and develop as an educator with your managing Squad Lead and Squad Apply If you are interested in this position please provide your resume and a cover letter explaining your interest in the role. Thinkful can only hire candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. We stand against any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. Thinkful provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. If you're talented and driven, please apply. At this time, we are unable to consider applicants from the following states: Alaska, Delaware, Idaho, New Mexico, North Dakota, South Carolina, South Dakota, West Virginia, and Wyoming Apply here

items.title: Sierra Interactive: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Product Designer

TL;DR We’re looking to hire our first full-time product designer! As the product designer, you'll be responsible for designing new product features, improving the design of existing features and establishing the design culture at Sierra. #saas #remoteok

(This role can be 100% remote but you must be located in one of the four U.S. time zones.) 

About us...

Sierra Interactive is a small (and growing!) real estate technology company based out of Louisville with an expanding remote team. Our purpose is simple: to help real estate professionals close more deals. Our clients include more than 1,000 top agents, teams and brokers across the U.S. and Canada. We launched our first SaaS product a few years ago and were thrilled with the response -- we’ve more than doubled our user base in the past year and continue to experience strong growth. Our clients have helped us to crystallize an exciting roadmap for the next few years…and that’s where you come in. 

About this role...

You'll work closely with multiple members of our team to build innovative, engaging solutions that empower Realtors to grow their businesses. Our customers rely on our products as an essential part of their daily operations, and we're committed to providing them tools to help them succeed in an increasingly competitive landscape. Our entire product team is 100% remote and distributed across multiple time zones, so you’ll need to be comfortable designing in this environment.

Day-to-day you will…
  • Act as the design lead on the product team, managing all aspects of design for product enhancements.
  • Work with the product management team to design simple, easy to use solutions for our clients.
  • Manage multiple design projects at one time -- all in various stages, requiring differing levels of efforts.
  • Communicate, explain, persuade, explore and otherwise get a lot of the things done in writing. (Yes, we meet with each other regularly, but as a remote team across many time zones, a lot of our collaboration is asynchronous and written.) 

We’re looking for a designer with...
  • 5+ years of experience designing software products (preferably in a SaaS environment).
  • A portfolio showcasing your skills in interaction and visual design for software products.
    • Websites and graphic design is fine but we’re really looking for case studies of digital product experience (e.g., web apps, iOS apps, wordpress plugins, etc.), especially adding features to existing products.
    • Extra bonus points if you have examples of projects you designed we can actually use.
  • Advanced knowledge of UI design software (e.g., Sketch, Invision, Adobe CC/Xd, Figma, etc.).
  • A desire to be part of a product team iterating and improving on the product day-to-day.
  • A strong opinion on design but the humility to seek and incorporate feedback.
  • A highly collaborative nature and willingness for showing in-progress design work.
  • The ability to clearly communicate design rationale and conceptual ideas to a wide variety of people.
  • BA/BS degree in a related discipline (e.g., design, human-computer interaction, visual communication, etc.) or equivalent work experience. 

Extra bonus points if...
  • You have a good understanding of front-end web development (HTML/CSS) … you won’t be coding but we believe it’s good to know the intricacies and limitations of the medium you’re designing for.
  • You have experience working with a web-based CRM.
  • You have experience working with real estate technology.
  • You have experience working remotely.
  • You have experience working with a distributed development team.
  • You have experience working in an agile environment.
  • You have experience working in a startup. 

Benefits
  • 100% remote work (if you’re in Louisville, we’ll gladly set up a desk for you).
  • Competitive compensation (depends on experience, of course).
  • Health/vision/dental insurance.
  • Retirement plan with employer matching contributions.
  • Paid holidays and paid time off.
  • A respectful and open work environment. 
Something else that’s important to you? Talk to us. We’re flexible and committed to providing a healthy work environment where great people can thrive.

items.title: 51Blocks: SEO Strategist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
SEO Strategist

51Blocks is Denver's premier boutique Internet Marketing Agency. We provide SEO, PPC, Social Media, and other internet marketing tools and services for small businesses. We are looking for an excellent communicator that can help manage accounts. Our goal is to hire passionate individuals who want to work with a great team and wonderful clients in the comfort of their own home. 

Is this you or what you like?
  • Autonomy - We welcome people who are looking to drive their own success.  Someone who enjoys working without a boss looking over your shoulder.  Someone who likes to have their own time and space to do their best work.  Together we will set goals and define what success looks like together.
  • Purpose - At 51Blocks we are looking for someone who enjoys growing and developing business online - helping them understand their ROI and showing them how we grow their business.  We have people who love helping small business but at the same time are growing their passion in different areas.  For example, we have Reggie who loves music and creates his own.  Any time we run into anything in that field he loves working and helping those people.  What is your passion and how can we align that?
  • Always Learning - We welcome new ideas and always want you to be learning.  We hope that you would have a curiosity that pushes you to learn and grow consistently.
  • Who You Will Report To - You will work directly with the Founder and Owner of the company along with the Marketing Manager. 

Requirements:
  • 2-3+ years' experience with SEO & local SEO: (Google + Local)
  • 1-2 years Experience with Amazon a plus 
  • Be able to maintain normal office hours in a quiet working environment with a fast internet connection
  • Love being part of a virtual team atmosphere 
  • Experience working with law, dental, or auto clients a plus
  • Google Analytics certified (or plan to become within 30 days of hiring)
  • Experience with social media a plus 
  • Basic Understanding of Wordpress
  • Basic knowledge of Google Analytics & Google Search Console 
  • Comfortable conducting client calls one-on-one
  • Experience or ability to organize task work
  • Must be detail oriented and very thorough with your work
  • Need to be able to thrive in a fast pace environment
  • Must be a quick learner
  • Passion for marketing is a must!
  • Must have a positive outlook on life

Working Remotely
  • Hours - You must work US hours 
  • US Based - You must be based in the United States (non-negotiable)
  • Number of Hours - This will be an hourly position.  You will start with a few clients and then move up from there.  Every client has a certain number of hours you will work on them.  You will set the strategy and then execute against it. 
  • Moving Fast - We will be moving fast with this position so please have availability to start right away.
  • 1099 to W2 employment offered

If this position sounds like something you want to be a part of please apply.  We will reach back out in a few days if there is a good fix.  We hope that whoever applies enjoys having fun and working hard every day.

items.title: Business Analyst - Primat Recruitment - Aberdeen
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Worley is currently looking to recruit a Business Analyst to join our Oil and Gas project delivery operation based in Aberdeen on a permanent basis.

Job Purpose

Engage with business stakeholders and clients to convert their business requirements into user stories / functional specifications for use by developers; produce QAQC compliant test plans to enable acceptance of the developed solution against the user stories / specifications; instruct implementation on the correct use of the solution and estimate & schedule the complete process.

Key Responsibilities

  • Promote and support IT Services throughout the business community.
  • Works within the IT team structure, exhibiting a positive and proactive attitude.
  • Work with the development team to produce software in accordance with agile development methodologies and adhering to the IT team's practices and procedures.
  • Provides labour estimates and schedule input for assigned work.
  • Provides a weekly update of progress in the format determined by the delivery manager
  • Converts requirements into functional specifications / user stories, complete with recommended UI layout (wire frame), validations, business rules and logic.
  • Ensure all documents are prepared , issued and stored as per the Business Analysis Procedure
  • Develops test plans
  • Liaise with the development group to ensure efficiency and accuracy in the software development.
  • Reviews technical design specifications as required.
  • Perform functional testing in accordance to test plans as required.
  • Reviews completed and tested software and recommend the approval and acceptance to the product/portfolio manager.
  • Accountable for the execution of the User Acceptance Testing, performed in accordance with the QAQC standards and policy
  • Provide release notes and instructions as required for the release documentation
  • Provide Tier 3 support as required
  • Provide and/or update Help text
  • Provide training to implementation team as required
  • Comply with standard and procedures

Technical Skills

  • Excellent written and oral communications
  • Focussed on specific project delivery business knowledge (SME)
  • Extensive project delivery application knowledge
  • Analysis and development methodologies
  • Expert in conducting requirement gathering and facilitating workshops
  • Expert in the creation of functional specifications and test plans
  • Expert in evaluating 3rd party applications for integration
  • Able to Schedule and estimate
  • Team player
  • Familiar with working in an agile software development team and/or has an awareness of agile methodologies, practices and principals.
  • Familiar with Atlassian Software Suite: Atlassian Software Suite: JIRA, Confluence, Portfolio

Core Competencies

  • Commands attention when speaking. Identifies the needs of other parties, when influencing. Uses sound and persuasive arguments with groups and individuals.
  • Able to work in environment with limited day to day supervision while maintaining strong relationships with remote team.
  • Gathers needs, interacts effectively to develop plan and promptly actions plan with clear and succinct guidance to all. As issues arise, intervenes appropriately to get things back on track, and then withdraws. Creates practical and achievable plans. Clarifies and refocuses the whole team when direction becomes unclear
  • Thinks on feet to solve problems. Probes to discover the root of a problem or issue. Takes quick, but considered action. Is influenced by sound arguments, new data and cohesive solutions for the broader good of all stakeholders.
  • Goes out of way to develop trust in relationships. Builds productive relationships quickly. Demonstrates mutual interest and cooperation, even in difficult circumstances. Adapts own role in a team to meet their differing needs. Values individuals and respects differences.
  • Manages communication flow through the project team. Manages effective and worthwhile meetings. Expresses complex ideas simply and succinctly.
  • Proactively plans for all on-going work within the region and maintains formal project plan. Secures and allocates appropriate resources to deliver the work. Prepares contingency plans. Plans and prioritises workloads in accordance with business needs.
    Proactively engaging the project team to deliver projects; with quality, on budget, on schedule and aligned with collaboration strategies.
Aberdeen
Permanent

items.content:
Content Analyst at Animalz

Remote | Entry-level | International

Category: Marketing
Job Type: Full-Time
Job Desc:

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies particularly B2B SaaS businesses grow by making great content that their audience loves.

A subset of the work we do involves helping entrepreneurs and CEOs at rapidly scaling startups and venture capital firms spread their ideas through writing. Our goal is to establish these executives as thought leaders in their field, and that’s where you come in.

An ideal Content Analyst at Animalz:

  • has a track record of writing that distills complex problems into simple frameworks clearly and succinctly.
  • is interested in turning the thoughts and ideas of leaders in tech into compelling content
  • has a demonstrated interest in tech/SaaS/startups/business, and wants to learn more
  • is a rigorous researcher and uses books not just articles to understand a topic
  • has the capacity to learn rapidly across topics and industries.
  • has spent time honing their craft
  • is interested in learning about content marketing

About Animalz:

We’re a remote team with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world. We have an eclectic team of scientists, journalists, operations folks, and more.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the Position:

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote position. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to clarify that this is NOT a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional endeavors

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere you like, as long as you have regular overlap with Eastern Time business hours and can schedule overlap with Pacific Time business hours when needed for customer calls.
  • Health insurance for both US and international team members, covering 80% of the premium for health and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Parental leave for both primary (up to 12 weeks) and secondary (up to 6 weeks) care providers
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and attending conferences

What’s it like to work at Animalz?

Join us for an hour-long webinar where we discuss careers, growth, and culture at Animalz. We’ll make sure to leave time to answer all your questions.

Grab a seat here. We’d love to have you on a call!

Apply for job

items.title: marketing, social media, online growth role
items.content:
Stretch inc., a new retail experience is looking for a fun, witty, and creative marketing and social media professional. You will own social activity and social management for the company, creating, scheduling and distributing engaging and interesting content across channels. We will be looking to you to help us grow with exciting ideas and marketing campaigns that drive revenue, cultivate our brand, highlight our product and embody stretch inc. values and objectives.


Not only will you own social media management for the business, you'll also help with design content creation in the lead up to our launch. Stretch inc. is an innovative and fresh retail experience and we need a strategy that captures that vibe. 


The role will grow and develop as the company grows and develops with the potential to become a full-time member and / or manager of the marketing team.


You will gain invaluable experience in marketing, partnerships, and promotion of events but as a rough guide here is what we expect:



  • Design a campaign that drives online booking

  • Managing the company's social media calendar and accounts, including LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and any other relevant platforms.

  • Plan and create content to effectively deliver stretch inc’s message and increase online following

  • Report activity and performance data against the campaigns you run and the copy you create

  • Be a key stakeholder in event marketing and planning and promote our events through social media engagement

  • Develop partnerships for marketing promotion

  • Develop and maintain contacts and a distribution network

  • Creation and management of marketing materials including text content, images, blogs, and more

  • Creation of artwork for emails, digital newsletters, brochures, event signage, social media, and other marketing tools

  • Generate prospective attendee and press leads through intelligent & in-depth research


Experience is great, but not essential. Personality, work ethic, and organisation skills are paramount. We’re looking for a hardworking and ambitious team-player who is excited to grow with the company. You will bring:



  • A great eye for design, attention to detail and composition

  • Knowledge and experience of Adobe InDesign and Photoshop

  • A keen user of social media

  • An enthusiastic and positive outlook, energy, passion and “let’s do this” attitude

  • Initiative to share and implement ideas

  • Ability to communicate confidently within the team and externally

  • Excellent organization skills, and ability to remain calm under pressure

  • Ability to adapt to and work effectively in a fast-paced environment

  • Technical Coaching: Provide in-demand support to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team through text and video in a timely manner. This team also provides the TA support for immersive programs. 
  • Assessments & Mock Interviews: Conduct 1-on-1 mock interviews and assessments via video calls and provide written feedback to students based on assessment rubrics. 
In addition to working directly with students, Course Mentors are expected to maintain an environment of feedback with the Educator Experience team, and to stay on top of important updates via meetings, email, and Slack. Ideal candidates for this team are highly coachable, display genuine student advocacy, and are comfortable working in a complex, rapidly changing environment.Requirements
  • 3+ years relevant professional work experience
  • Proficiency in SQL, Advanced Excel, Tableau, Python, Postgres, Strong Statistical Background, Experimental Design, A/B Testing  at an industry level
  • Demonstrates genuine student advocacy and empathy for beginners
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection and webcam
  • Teaching, mentoring and/or coaching experience a plus 
Benefits
  • This is a part-time role (10-25 hours a week)
  • Fully remote position, with a flexible schedule  
  • Access to all of Thinkful Courses for your continued learning
  • Community of 500+ like-minded professionals looking to impact others and keep their skills sharp
  • Grow and develop as an educator with your managing Squad Lead and Squad
Apply
If you are interested in this position please provide your resume and a cover letter explaining your interest in the role.Thinkful can only hire candidates who are eligible to work in the United States.We stand against any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. Thinkful provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. If you're talented and driven, please apply.

At this time, we are unable to consider applicants from the following states: Alaska, Delaware, Idaho, New Mexico, North Dakota, South Carolina, South Dakota, West Virginia, and WyomingApply here
Apply now

About Thinkful Inc.

Thinkful is a new type of school that brings high-growth tech careers to ambitious people everywhere. The company provides 1-on-1 learning through its network of industry experts, hiring partners, and online platform to deliver a structured and flexible education. Thinkful offers programs in web development and data science, with in-person communities in up-and-coming tech hubs around the U.S. To join the Thinkful network visit thinkful.com.

Benefits

  • Join team of 500+ developers mentoring the developers of the future
  • Access to top-rated curriculum
  • Paid position
  • Flexible Schedule and Hours
  • Remote Capability

items.title: Senior Marketing Manager - Performance Marketing
items.content:
Technology has revolutionised the world we live in, yet somehow travel has stayed much the same as it was 30 years ago. Seatfrog is here to change that.


We’re on a mission to take every journey beyond the ordinary for millions of people all over the globe, empowering them to upgrade their seat and fill the 480M premium seats that travel empty every year with technology that’s a joy to use.


We’re building a stellar team to achieve our audacious goals. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work. Join us, and you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure. Ours is a culture with spirit and substance and our people are empowered to make the bold decisions others wouldn’t and haven't.


The opportunity


As a senior partnerships marketing manager you will be responsible for driving performance of user acquisition across partner channels, suggesting and planning effective digital marketing campaigns with partners.


We're looking for an enthusiastic self-starter who is keen on not only strategic planning and performance focussed marketing, but also nurturing client relationships and evolving Seatfrog use.


Tasks will include driving performance management of partner marketing; social media optimisation, content, remarketing campaigns and email.



  • Manage and maintain strong relationships with new and existing partnerships for an internal and external audience

  • Support partners with driving awareness & demand on their own digital & social channels activities such as email, social, online campaigns, events and direct marketing.

  • Support with creating relevant collateral including case studies & PR, advocating and building up the Seatfrog brand with each partner.

  • Deliver on a broad range of customer focused initiatives to support marketing with revenue targets in mind.

  • Working closely with the data & product team and sales team members to identify and create opportunities with partners

  • Evaluate partner needs and build productive long lasting relationships

  • Drive innovation in marketing across the Seatfrog channel mix

  • Educate partners on the value of Seatfrog on the best ways to support their customers with co-marketing activities


Requirements



  • Performance marketing focused experience, social & email primarily.

  • Relevant experience in B2B tech, B2C affiliates.

  • Excellent organisational skills and ability to meet deadlines to plan multiple concurrent marketing activities, content and campaigns in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

  • Excellent presentation skills to be able to present ideas and proposals in a clear and coherent way.

  • Strong influencing and negotiating skills.

  • Professional and upbeat attitude, with the ability to interact effectively with customers, sales, marketing and other internal teams.

  • Excellent problem solving skills, combined with strong commercial acumen.

  • Ability to deliver quality outputs in a fast-paced, exciting and dynamic environment with an ability to work to tight deadlines.

  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to liaise with all levels of management and to communicate cross-functionally in a structured and clear manner to influence outcome

  • Experience in a marketplace, high growth business is a plus


What's on offer



  • A fantastic opportunity to work in a high growth global software company and help shape the future of how travel should be

  • A team culture that is truly beyond the ordinary, where we solve problems together to drive the best possible results for our clients and users

  • Genuine autonomy to achieve your best and a personal development and growth plan to create a long-term career path for you at Seatfrog

  • Free Upgrades and budget for 1 week working anywhere in the world.

  • A competitive salary

  • Private healthcare plan via Vitality, with added gym discounts and incentives to encourage you to get out, get active and stay mentally and physically healthy

  • The latest gear and best tools to enable you to do your greatest work

  • Off-peak travel - so you can swap a public holiday with any day you like so you can get away without the crowds. 


At Seatfrog, we consider diversity a strength - inclusion fuels our ability to solve problems we never thought we could. Your application will be considered on its merits, without regard to your race, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability status or anything else. If there is anything we need to know to enable you to fully participate in our interview process, please just let us know in your application.

items.content:
Technology has revolutionised the world we live in, yet somehow travel has stayed much the same as it was 30 years ago. Seatfrog is here to change that.


We’re on a mission to take every journey beyond the ordinary for millions of people all over the globe, empowering them to upgrade their seat and fill the 480M premium seats that travel empty every year with technology that’s a joy to use.


We’re building a stellar team to achieve our audacious goals. We strive to create an environment where you can do your best work. Join us, and you’ll be challenged and supported in equal measure. Ours is a culture with spirit and substance and our people are empowered to make the bold decisions others wouldn’t and haven't.


We’re looking for a Junior Product Manager to come on the journey and join our London office. Fancy coming along for the ride? Apply below!


About the team you'll be joining


The product team at Seatfrog is focused on crafting great experiences that fundamentally change the way people are able to travel. You'll be part of a group of skilled and thoughtful individuals focused on solving big problems that deliver significant growth and build upon our ambitious vision.


About the role


In this role you’ll work closely with the Product Manager and the senior product team to drive decision-making and product delivery for our iOS and Android apps. You’ll create a strong connection to our customers along every stage of the process to listen, understand and empathise with their struggles and drive solutions to solve their problems.


Your key areas of focus will be: 



  • Checking in on app health metrics daily, and producing weekly and monthly reports of your findings. 

  • Working with the senior product team to build and maintain the product roadmap for customer experience.

  • Carrying out user and market research for new initiatives and features.

  • Managing new version releases. You’ll write app release notes and ensure that new versions are shipped on time. 

  • Communicating updates to the wider team.  

  • Being the go-to person for Customer Support and Customer Success teams.

    • Responding to customer feedback and bug reports, investigating the severity of issues in order to effectively prioritise a backlog.

    • Gathering insights that drive the Customer Experience roadmap.




What you'll need



  • A passion for delivering great products and great customer experience.

  • Ability to blend instinct, consultation, and objective analysis to make the right decisions in a timely manner.

  • A methodical approach and be able to proactively foresee issues. 

  • You’ll build the trust of colleagues to keep them informed and to deliver on expectations.

  • An energetic and motivational style, that stimulates pace and creativity from colleagues.


Nice to haves, or willing to learn



  • Introductory course to product management

  • Experience using Jira

  • Experience in an agile environment

  • Experience of travel sector 

  • Mobile app product development 

  • Exposure to a fast-paced start-up environment


What's on offer



  • A fantastic opportunity to work in a high growth global software company and help shape the future of how travel should be

  • A team culture that is truly beyond the ordinary, where we solve problems together to drive the best possible results for our clients and users

  • Genuine autonomy to achieve your best and a personal development and growth plan to create a long-term career path for you at Seatfrog

  • Free Upgrades and budget for 1 week working anywhere in the world.

  • A competitive salary

  • Private healthcare plan via Vitality, with added gym discounts and incentives to encourage you to get out, get active and stay mentally and physically healthy

  • The latest gear and best tools to enable you to do your greatest work

  • Off-peak travel - so you can swap a public holiday with any day you like so you can get away without the crowds. 


At Seatfrog, we consider diversity a strength - inclusion fuels our ability to solve problems we never thought we could. Your application will be considered on its merits, without regard to your race, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability status or anything else. If there is anything we need to know to enable you to fully participate in our interview process, please just let us know in your application.

items.title: Growth Assistant
items.content:
Do you want to be a part of a wellbeing revolution? Are you looking to gain experience in a femtech startup, funded by one of Europe’s most well-known VC firms?


Yoppie is on a mission to name and shame the industry’s dirty little secrets in the form of unwanted and unknown toxic ingredients. We keep it 100% real and 100% au natural by combining the best of product design with synthetic-free, biodegradable, cruelty-free and 100% organic cotton period products. We make tampons, pads and liners for girls with periods, yes we said it, the forbidden P-word. We think it's about time we started talking about them.


We’re growing our team and have an exciting opportunity to bright & intelligent people to help in driving user acquisition and scaling the systems that lead to that. This is a great opportunity to develop a broad, lateral skill-set and will let you interact with the entire marketing funnel.
This role reports directly to Head of Growth.


Responsibilities:



  • Your role will take you from working on our website to our conversion rates to growth experiments to email campaigns

  • Setting up paid acquisition campaigns: Facebook Ads,  Google Ads, Pinterest Ads and a few more

  • Managing email campaigns

  • Weekly reporting on the growth KPIs together with the Head of Growth

  • Working with the creative team to produce content


What we’re looking for:



  • Relentlessly curious people

  • Organised self-starter

  • Inclination towards tech & data analytics

  • Experience or knowledge of Facebook Ads & Google Ads

  • Design experience

items.content:
SEO Content Manager

Ellipsis Marketing is a small and fast-growing marketing agency for WordPress businesses. We sit at the intersection of digital marketing and the WordPress ecosystem, serving agencies who sell websites to the biggest companies in the world, and product businesses who sell addons to WordPress users. 

Between us, we have the skills “in house” to do marketing strategy and implementation in the most effective areas for WordPress businesses.

As a 100% remote team, we carefully balance collaboration with an environment that lets everyone do their very best work. We’re based in the UK but regularly travel for work, WordCamps, and pleasure!

As our new SEO Content Manager, you'll work closely with our Head of Content and freelance writers to deliver amazing content to clients. 


This position can be broken down as follows: 

50% SEO analysis & client reporting
25% content and copy & project management
25% copywriting & editorial

Your main responsibilities include:
  • You’ll research SEO keywords which accurately address our clients’ content needs
  • You’ll oversee SEO content production from start to finish. This includes writing content outlines for freelance writers, proactively ensuring writers have everything they need to deliver timely work, editing, proofreading and ensuring smooth final delivery to our clients
  • You'll oversee website conversion-focused copy production from start to finish. This includes discovery, collecting resources from the client, delivering briefs to writers and providing everything they need to deliver timely work, editing, proofreading and ensuring smooth final delivery to our clients
  • You’ll feel comfortable creating brilliant SEO website copy and content 
  • Your strong organisational skills enable you to keep ahead of timeframes and deadlines for multiple clients simultaneously, as well as help to improve processes wherever possible
  • You’ll be highly detail-oriented, and feel comfortable handling large amounts of data, distilling the essentials into easily digestible reports for both internal and client use
  • You’ll help us to develop and implement content strategies for multiple clients
  • Your background in Marketing (agency a bonus) helps you to intuit what clients need
Requirements: hard skills 
  • Existing experience in SEO Content Marketing
  • Existing experience working remotely full time
  • Native English speaker
  • Availability to work on European time (GMT/CET)
  • WordPress user (advanced usage desirable but not essential), Ahrefs, Google Analytics, GSuite
  • Expert understanding of SEO, CRO and Marketing methodology
  • Experience in proofreading and editing
Requirements: soft skills
  • Great communication skills: Remote work relies on a team being able to fully trust each other, so frequent and clear written communication is a must
  • Proven organisational skills: You must be obsessive with deadlines, managing and updating tasks, and totally reliable
  • A “people person”: You’ll be dealing with writers and clients on a daily basis, so this is an integral part of the role
  • Self-driven work ethic: You need to be self-motivated and comfortable taking initiative and seeing things through to completion
  • Curiosity and the desire to learn: As our business grows, we’re constantly adapting and evolving with it. Who knows what the skills of tomorrow will be? Flexibility is essential
 
Bonus points if you have:
  • Familiarity with project management and remote-work tools, e.g. Basecamp
  • Experience managing and dealing with external contractors and internal teams
  • Experience managing content costs
  • Marketing agency experience, including client-facing 
  • Knowledge of B Corp business principles


Compensation and Benefits: 
  • This is a full-time, 100% remote role. Work from home, or the beach! 
  • Competitive salary
  • 28 days of paid holiday
  • Monthly remote-working allowance
  • Yearly team retreat (in fun places!) 
  • Attendance to conferences in Europe (1-3 per year)
  • The role has plenty of scope for personal development, and to grow and add more responsibilities as the business grows
  • Maternity and paternity leave, and sick pay
  • Ellipsis is aiming to become a B Corp by the end of 2020

The application process: 


It’s important we find the best candidate for this position, and our selection process will reflect this. You’ll be required to attend at least two interviews (by video call) and carry out a (paid) project with us before we make an employment offer.

We’re fortunate to receive a large volume of applications, so make your application stand out. We’re interested in what you can do, what experience you have, and why you want to work with us!

We do great work for clients, are building an ethical business that lets everyone do their best work. If you think you could be the next person to join our team, please apply :) 


How to apply:

Please apply through the form linked below. We will decide who progresses to the next stage based on the form you submit, and your CV. Please give us a good reason to select you! Your cover letter is where you have the space to do this.

We'll be looking at applications anonymously initially in order to reduce bias. Please do not include any personal information in your cover letter, or contact us through other channels. 

The deadline for submission is the end of the day on Monday, 21st October. We will then interview some candidates and will notify everyone, whether we're proceeding or not.

items.title: Director, Digital Marketing - OPEN TO REMOTE
items.content:
Our client, a dynamic digital consulting agency, is looking for a Digital Marketing Director to join their team in Boston (or remote). As a member of the consulting team, the ideal candidate would have hands on experience understanding consumer behavior across multiple digital channels, understand CRM and customer journey work and be familiar with leveraging loyalty within the digital space. The Director will be responsible for managing client intake, gathering objectives and requirements and presenting strategy directly to the client. (Note: this is not a sales or business development role.)

This is a fast-passed digital role with emphasis on data and leveraging data to help solve business problems.

Requirements: • 10+ years of experience in a digital marketing consulting role covering multiple disciplines (CRM, loyalty, digital marketing across multiple channels) • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field • Experience in a client facing role and presenting directly to clients • Demonstrated ability to present clear, concise reporting based on analytics to clients • Ability to work well autonomously • 5+ years of consulting experience
Other information: • Salary is up to $140K and is commensurate with experience • Open to US Citizens or Green Card holders only • Open to Boston office or remote
Keywords: website analytics, digital media, multi-touch attribution, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, measurement, statistics, mathematics, data extraction, data analysis, data interpretation, Tableau, social media monitoring

items.content:
About MyTutor:


One-to-one tuition is proven to significantly improve pupils’ grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. MyTutor’s mission is to bring life-changing tuition to all. Our handpicked network of tutors work online with pupils from all walks of life, and we’ve given half a million lessons so far – raising results on average by one whole grade. We’re proud of the fact that over 400 schools have also chosen to work with us. And that we’ve earned a Trustpilot rating of 4.8/5


We understand the hectic lives of families with teenagers, and our flexible lesson times mean parents can juggle schedules more easily. On our website, it’s simple to find a tutor your child gets on with – and every lesson is tailored to their needs. Also, by having lessons via live video, pupils can access the best tutors no matter where they live or when they need help. No travelling for Mum and Dad, no waiting around, no strangers in your home. Pupils can have their lessons anywhere – at Grandma’s, at a friend’s house or on holiday, so there’s no disruption in the run-up to exams.


Tuition is now more affordable and accessible, making life less stressful for those who care about seeing the next generation succeed. 




REQUIREMENTS


About the Role:


You’ll be joining our passionate, ambitious team in an exciting, fast-paced & high-growth environment. With tutoring being a well searched term, SEO is key to our growth, ensuring that we are well ranked for the appropriate keywords and converting this organic traffic into paying customers.


Working closely with the CMO, you'll be responsible for creating, managing and implementing the MyTutor SEO strategy with support from external consultants. The SEO champion across the business, You’ll coordinate all efforts across product, tech and marketing to drive growth in this channel including onsite and offsite optimisation and keyword expansion research.


What you'll do:



  • Produce and publish content in line with SEO standards (articles, blogs, web copy)

  • Write compelling content for landing pages to drive organic traffic

  • Conduct keyword research to drive organic visibility and authority

  • Monitor and evaluate search results and search performance across the major search channels in order to improve search engine positioning

  • Oversee the implementation and management of the website SEO particularly onsite and offsite content requirements

  • Deliver content auditing and content gap analysis and SEO forecasts

  • Proactively research and implement SEO recommendations to drive organic traffic and revenue

  • Coordinate and report on link building activities


 


Requirements



  • At least 1 year experience of either producing content or optimisation

  • Understanding of on-page SEO and copywriting

  • Passion for writing great SEO content

  • Strong knowledge of newest SEO best practices

  • A strong understanding of SEO metrics and KPIs

  • Experience using Google Analytics and Google Search Console

  • Experience using SEO tools (SEOMonitor, Screaming Frog, Majestic or similar)

  • Link building experience

  • Experience with CMS platforms (e.g. Wordpress)

  • Comfortable dealing with large site structures

  • Ability to work independently and effectively as part of a team



Nice to have:



  • Understanding of HTML & CSS

  • Experience with SQL

  • Experience in performing competitor analysis


Interested in applying but don't tick all the boxes on the list? Please apply, we'd still love to hear from you.




BENEFITS


 



  • Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people

  • A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support

  • Training and investment in your learning

  • Competitive salary and share option package

  • Tuesday Breakfasts, Friday drinks and regular team events & outings

  • 24 days holiday (plus public holidays)



MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with an EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

items.title: Senior Performance Marketing Manager (m/f/d) // flowkey GmbH
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
Senior Performance Marketing Manager (m/f/d) // flowkey

Company: flowkey

Tags:
  • SEM
  • Paid Search
  • Facebook ads
  • ASO
  • Paid Ads

    • Who we are

    We develop products and new technologies that help people fulfill themselves. Our first product is flowkey – a revolutionary app for learning to play the piano. flowkey was launched in 2015 and quickly became a global success with millions of users.

    Why join us

    We‘re among a small number of startups that quickly became profitable. One important reason for this success is our team culture. We trust each other. We listen to each other. We strive to do outstanding work that has a positive impact on the world. You will work with a team of people who value and respect your personal opinion and your freedom.

    In addition to that, we offer the following special perks company-wide:

    • Flexible working hours and the possibility for remote work
    • Annual profit sharing with the whole team
    • Generous budgets for personal and professional development
    • Beautiful and spacious office for calm and focused work

    Your role

    As our goal was to quickly become profitable we had to find extremely capital efficient growth channels. We ended up partnering with popular YouTubers and the biggest music instrument manufacturer Yamaha. We also focused on inbound channels, such as SEO and ASO. This strategy worked exceptionally well, which allowed us to start investing more in paid advertisement. Adding paid ads has fueled our growth and we believe it will play a very important role in the future of our company.

    Your role will be to scale our mobile user acquisition strategy internationally and find new growth opportunities. You will work with a high degree of independence in a small team that manages ad campaigns across our existing channels (Facebook, Instagram, Apple Search Ads) and optimizes the user funnel within the App Stores. You will also closely work together with our Creative Team and our Data Insights Team to continually test and iterate new creatives, audiences or platforms.

    Requirements

    • At least 3 years of hands-on experience with two of the following platforms: Search Ads, Facebook Ads, UAC and preferably also one of these: LinkedIn Ads, Pinterest Ads, Podcasts, Native Ads (Outbrain/Taboola), Twitter Ads
    • Experienced with ASO and also A/B Testing, e.g. for CR optimization in the App Stores
    • Understand campaign effectiveness and funnels using first-party tools (e.g. FB ads manager, search ads advanced platform) and third-party MMPs (e.g. Adjust)
    • Strong analytical skills and expertise with customer data via BI platforms (e.g. Tableau, SuperSet), spreadsheets (Excel, Google Sheets) and SQL is a plus
    • Fluent in English and / or German

    How to apply

    If we’ve captured your interest and you want to help millions of people achieve their dream of learning piano, apply now and let us know why you’re the perfect fit for the job!

    Apply for this position

items.title: Senior Performance Marketer
items.content:
Senior Performance Marketer at Enhancv

Remote | International

Full-time

Remote / Sofia

At Enhancv, we build the world’s best resume-editing platform. Each month we help thousands of customers worldwide get the job they love. We are a small 10-person team spread across Europe , Asia and North America whose goal is to put an Enhancv resume on every recruiter’s desk!

We are looking for a data-driven performance marketer to build and grow our paid channels. The market is huge and the question is — are you up for the challenge and ready to roll-up your sleeves?

Well, here’s what you’ll be doing

  • You’ll dive deep into our data, content and other sources to find opportunities for profitable ad campaigns. Design experiments and test.
  • You’ll own the entire paid funnel — setup campaigns with clear goals and return-on-investment in mind (plus take care of everything from eCPM to CAC), craft landing pages and other collateral (or lead creation of), do CRO and iterate.

Ideally, you’re no stranger to these

  • You’ve ran $500,000+ in annual ad spend across Facebook or Google Ads.
  • You’ve done it all with your own hands , constantly challenging yourself and reading between the lines (put your fav ice-cream flavor in first line of the application).
  • You look beyond vanity metrics and overall performance. You take 100% accountability of your goals and work independently.

Where you’ll work

Enhancv started in 2014 and today it’s a profitable B2C startup. Most of us are working from Bulgaria and we have two remote members from India and Canada. They fly and work from Bulgaria a few times a year, plus we organize a team-wide retreat once a year. We have ambitious growth plans and that’s why we are expanding. Join us in our office in Sofia, or work remotely.

You will have the freedom to experiment and build things your way — we believe that’s how we’ll win. And while the sky’s the limit, remember you’ll also positively change people’s lives! Check out the story of Sam from Spotify.

Over the years Enhancv has been featured on Business Insider, Glassdoor, BuzzFeed and other media. Most recently Mark Cuban spotted us.

Salary, Benefits & Perks

  • Work remotely.
  • Market salary based on location and results you produce.
  • 22 days of paid leave.
  • Healthcare: Company-wide insurance policy or a budget for remote team members.
  • Sports allowance.
  • Equipment: Get a MacBook and other equipment to do your best work.
  • Transport allowance.
  • Travel: We cover work-related travel and retreats.
  • Courses and learning: We invest in your professional growth.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for job
