It is also important for the Digital Designer to beteam players and able to implement suggestions to improve designs.

The Company

The Admin Center wasfounded by an innovative entrepreneur with a vision of creating customizablesolutions to meet the complexities of growing businesses on an essential level.Today, The Admin Center is known for the great care we take with our clientsand employees alike. We are a growing virtual company based in Boise, Idahothat is continuing to put its mark on how companies delegate theiradministrative and marketing needs. We offer both full and part time schedules,with a 100% work from home position, a supportive team environment and theability to gain experience by interacting with multiple clientele. We are thepremier front and back office outsourcing solution for small businesses. Webelieve in empowering our clients with the tools to be successful. Our team iscommitted to being approachable, understandable, and a knowledgeable resource,to help businesses satisfy demanding and complex administrative challenges.

Job Responsibilities

  • Must have extensive experience in the Adobe Suite
  • Passionate about design with a desire to communicate visually.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Highly organized and the ability to work under pressure from deadlines.
  • Display a high level of critical thinking and a desire to create solutions to problems.
  • Well organized, self-motivated, proficient in time management
  • Producing materials that are consistent with the client’s visual identity. Establish the overall look, graphic elements, and content of specific materials in order to meet project needs.
  • Determining the medium best suited to produce the desired effect and the most appropriate vehicle for communication.
  • Developing concepts and graphic elements to meet project objectives and prepares layouts to be rendered using professional design software.
  • Estimating time to complete project work.
  • Using existing photo and illustration libraries and typography guides to produce solutions that meet internal client’s communication needs.
  • Ensuring all files are checked for quality prior to release to clients.
  • Designing web-based and interactive applications in conjunction with other marketing resources.
  • Comprehending, communicating and addressing client goals, budgets and revisions throughout the design management process and meets all deadlines.Plan, design, create, edit and assist with any video production.
  • Create outlines and be able to individually produce scripts in collaboration with Leads and Writers.
  • Follow processes and procedures to create videos from concept to completion.
  • Take initiative and ownership of projects to enhance client expectations.
  • Be able to work independently while keeping an open and clear communication with team members and clients.
  • Assisting with the day-to-day operations of the brand function.
  • Other duties as assigned

Job Requirements

  • 1 – 3 years of experience designing for clients.
  • Passionate about design with a desire to communicate visually.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Specialized in Digital Print
  • Highly organized and the ability to work under pressure from deadlines.
  • Display a high level of critical thinking and a desire to create solutions to problems.
  • Bachelor‘s degree from an accredited institution is a plus.

MUST INCLUDE COVERLETTER AND RESUME TO BE CONSIDERED

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $16.00 to $19.00 /hour

Experience:

  • relevant: 5 years (Preferred)
Apply for job

items.title: Animalz: Content Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Content Marketing Manager

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies—particularly B2B SaaS businesses—grow by making great content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (Executives, Managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the SaaS/tech field.

This is a writing-focused role that also requires direct contact with customers. In addition to high-quality writing, successful candidates should be able to demonstrate strong skills and/or interest in managing customer accounts and content workflows.

An ideal content manager at Animalz:

  • is deeply passionate about writing and approach all forms of content with a creatively curious mindset
  • writes clearly, concisely, and in an organized way
  • has a marketing sense of storytelling
  • understands the business side of writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves working directly with customers
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future.
Requirements:

For our current openings, we're particularly interested in subject matter experts in the following areas:

  • sales/CRM
  • accounting/bookkeeping
  • digital marketing
  • thought leadership in the fields of startups and SaaS
(Tip: When applying, mention your field of expertise, and choose the 3 articles that best demonstrate your expertise in that specific field.)

You should also have experience with at least some of the following, though we'll train the right subject matter expert in these as needed (which also means desire to learn and grow in these areas is paramount):

  • You are able to articulate a basic B2B content strategy
  • You can clearly explain why a piece of content needs to be written
  • You know how to do on-page SEO for any piece you write
  • You have a strong writing ability
  • You've worked directly with customers and understand the basics for handling that relationship
  • You have a good basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social marketing function (on a theoretical level, at least) and how they can work together to get results.
About Animalz

We’re a remote team with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world. We have an eclectic team of scientists, journalists, operations folks, and more.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the Position:

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote position. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is NOT a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional or academic endeavors.


Benefits

  • Work from anywhere you like, as long as you have regular overlap with Eastern Time business hours and can schedule overlap with Pacific Time business hours when needed for customer calls.
  • Health insurance, covering 80% of the premium for health and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Parental leave for both primary (up to 12 weeks) and secondary (up to 6 weeks) care providers
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and attending conferences
What's it like to work at Animalz?

Join us for an hour-long webinar where we discuss careers, growth, and culture at Animalz. We'll make sure to leave time to answer all your questions.

Grab a seat here. We'd love to have you on a call!

items.content:
Medical Coder – Claims Analyst at UnitedHealth Group

Remote

Location: United States
Division:O360 Hsptl Srvcs Middle Ops
Contest Number: 848413
Family: Medical and Clinical Operations
Function: Medical Coding
BusinessSegment: OptumInsight
Region: North America
Country: United States
City:
State:
Other States:
Other Cities:
EmployeeStatus:Regular
Schedule:Full-time
JobLevel:Individual Contributor
Shift:Day Job
Travel:No
Overtime Status:Non-exempt
TelecommuterPosition: Yes

Position Description

Health care isn’t just changing. It’s growing more complex every day. Because of this hospitals and health care organizations continue to adapt, and we are a vital part of their evolution. If you’re looking for a better place to use your passion, your ideas and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It’s an opportunity to do your life’s best work.(sm)

Delivering quality care starts with ensuring our processes and documentation standards are being met and kept at the highest level possible. This means working behind the scenes ensuring a member-centric approach to care. As an Inpatient Medical Coder you will determine and record the correct medical codes for all treatments and health services. Ensuring proper records is just one way your work will impact the health and wellness of our members on a huge scale.

Who are we? We’re Optum360. We’re a dynamic new partnership formed by Dignity Health and Optum to combine our unique expertise. As part of the growing family of UnitedHealth Group, we’ll leverage our compassion, our talent, our resources and experience to bring financial clarity and a full suite of revenue management services to health care providers nationwide.

As a Medical Coder/Claims Analyst you will work remotely to correct CCI, MUE, and Medical Necessity Edits on accounts of all patient types in addition to periodic coding. You will ensure that all coding assignments are accurate according to coding policies and based on the documentation provided in the medical record. Using a thorough knowledge of coding policies and procedures as well as medical terminology and technology, you will be responsible for providing documentation feedback to physicians under the direction of the Coding Operations Manager or Quality Management personnel.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Apply coding knowledge to analyze/correct CCI Edits and Medical Necessity accounts
  • Identify appropriate assignment of ICD-10-CM and for services provided in a hospital setting and understand their impact, while adhering to the official coding guidelines and established client coding guidelines of the assigned facility
  • Identify appropriate assignment of CPT and ICD-10 Codes for outpatient surgery, observation, emergency, and ancillary services while adhering to the official coding guidelines and established client coding guidelines of the assigned facility
  • Understand the Medicare Ambulatory Payment Classification (APC) codes
  • Abstract additional data elements during the Chart Review process when coding, as needed
  • Adhere to the ethical standards of coding as established by AAPC and/or AHIMA
  • Adhere to and maintain required levels of performance in both coding quality and productivity as established by Optum360
  • Provide documentation feedback to providers and query physicians when appropriate
  • Maintain up-to-date Coding knowledge by reviewing materials disseminated/recommended by the QM Manager, Coding Operations Managers, and Director of Coding/Quality Management, etc.
  • Participate in coding department meetings and educational events
  • Review and maintain a record of charts coded, held, and/or missing
  • Additional responsibilities as identified by manager

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Required Qualifications:

  • Professional coder certification with credentialing from AHIMA and/or AAPC (CCS, RHIA, RHIT, CIC, ROCC, CPC, COC, CPC-P) to be maintained annually
  • HS Diploma or GED
  • 2+ years of Outpatient Facility Surgery coding experience
  • Intermediate knowledge of OCE, MUE and NCCI classification and reimbursement structures.
  • Experience working in a level I trauma center and/or teaching hospital with a mastery of complex procedures, major trauma ER encounters, cardiac catheterization, interventional radiology, orthopedic and neurology cases, and observation coding.
  • Must have ICD-10 and CPT coding experience
  • Ability to use a PC in a Windows environment, including MS Excel and EMR systems

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 1+ years of Inpatient medical coding experience (hospital, facility, etc.)
  • DRG coding experience
  • Experience with OSHPD reporting
  • Experience with various encoder systems (eCAC,3M, EPIC)
  • Intermediate level of experience with Microsoft Excel
Apply for job

items.content:
At Chattermill we use cutting-edge AI technology to give leading companies the key to improving their customer experience.  We work with many of the most exciting companies in the world (Uber, HelloFresh, Transferwise, Skyscanner, and Deliveroo to name a handful!) and are passionate about helping them put their customers’ at the heart of their decision making.


In four short years, we’ve grown from two co-founders to a team of 40 (and counting) bright and diverse individuals.  We have big plans and are now looking for a Growth Associate to join our highly functioning Growth team and work to amplify our demand generation.  


As a Growth Associate, you will:



  • Strategically identify new leads and plan demand generation cadences to generate interest in Chattermill

  • Take ownership of our go-to-market tactics across varying sectors and geographies 

  • Make an impact in revenue growth by assisting the Sales Development and Growth teams to prepare and tailor effective approaches for new prospects 

  • Work with the team to create impactful content for outbound marketing 


What we’re looking for:



  • A creative thinker who loves coming up with new approaches and solutions 

  • A self-starter who is eager to learn in a hands on and autonomous environment

  • An entrepreneurial spirit with a knack for spotting opportunities

  • A clear and effective communicator

  • You’re resourceful and able to find information and tools 

  • You’re ambitious, goal oriented and have a strong aversion to failing

  • You have a great work ethic and are driven to achieve extraordinary results early on in your career


Nice to have:



  • Degree level education

  • 1+ years of experience in a competitive professional environment

  • Prior experience working in a SaaS or startup environment

  • A good understanding of Customer Experience and a passion for helping businesses improve in this area


Why join us?



  • A competitive salary 

  • Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us!

  • 25 days holiday (in addition to bank holidays)

  • Company pension plan 

  • A big focus on personal development including a £500 development budget and biweekly Breakfast and Learns

  • Perks including discounts on cinema tickets, utilities and more

  • Flexible working conditions and the opportunity to work from home

  • Lovely office (with great coffee, events, and a rooftop terrace) 

  • Office wellness events like Monday Mindfulness and yoga

  • Quarterly Company Socials planned by our great colleagues!

items.title: Sendible: Product Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Product Marketing Manager

  The Opportunity

Are you passionate about Social Media, B2B SaaS and conversion optimisation?

If that’s the case, this is a fantastic opportunity for you to join a fast-growing company in an exciting space (social media) and be a part of Sendible’s marketing team!

As Product Marketing Manager, you’ll be responsible for maximising adoption of the Sendible platform from our trialists. This means improving each user interaction with our product during the trial period, and continuously optimising it, to provide the best user experience and to maximise our conversion rate.

Your focus is to drill down on user experiences and to understand what makes different personas convert and then improve the trial experience based on these findings.

We are committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.

About You 
  • 2+ years working in Product Marketing in SaaS
  • Advanced experience with Google Analytics
  • Experience with Hubspot, Intercom, Appcues a plus
  • Analytical skills with a CRO mindset: test, learn, improve, repeat.
  • Copywriting skills: ability to write to a high standard is crucial. You will frequently have to write engaging copy, telling the ‘story’ of products, for various marketing channels.
  • Problem-solving skills: ability to handle difficult or unexpected situations and complex business challenges.
  • Autonomous and not afraid of being the CEO of your own domain.  
  • Strong passion for serving and understanding users.
We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. 

Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company.

✅ Things You’ll Be Doing
  • Increasing product adoption during a user’s first 60 days.
  • Analysing product usage, behavioural data and drilling down on our target personas’ experience within our product. 
  • Optimising our onboarding flow and messages within our webapp or through marketing automation. 
  • Working with our Customer teams to provide educational content through the web app or through marketing automation to help onboard new customers and help them make the most out of our platform.
  • Providing the Sales team with product collaterals needed to close deals.
  • Supporting the Product team during the discovery and launch phases of new features and products.
  • Helping the Marketing and Sales teams meet business objectives by driving initiatives to  improve product adoption.
  • Creating and implementing new creative projects that help improve users’ experience during their first 60 days.
  • Communicating with all departments involved during the free trial period: Product, Sales, Customer Success, Support.

Why work with us
  • Work remotely or from our HQ and create your own schedule (we believe in trust and autonomy).
  • 25 days paid holiday per year, plus one bonus day for your birthday.
  • Profit-sharing bonuses (if the company does well and you played a big part, you'll be rewarded).
  • Paid sabbatical after 5 years.
  • We love learning! Take part in our book club and receive free books quarterly or use your £1000 learning allowance to develop your skills.
  • Gain incredible experience building a truly successful, global SaaS company with a dedicated, small team where you can have a huge impact! 

We have a low staff turnover rate — a large portion of the team has been at Sendible for 5+ years. But, your voice matters to us. 

We like hearing fresh perspectives and appreciate new viewpoints, so you should feel comfortable speaking up and not be afraid to drive change and challenge the status quo. If something sucks and can be done better, we want to hear!

How we work

Sendible is a UK corporation and our head office is based in London but we are building a distributed team, and you can work from anywhere in the world for this role.

Of course, if you're based in London, you are welcome to work from our HQ  which is fully equipped with free fruit and snacks, excellent coffee, standing desks and table tennis, but we also allow team members to work from wherever they are most productive

⚡ How to get our attention when you apply

Introduce yourself to us as a colleague. Show us what your future could look like here! We value authenticity, so be yourself, be creative, and take your time with the application. 

Tell us why you want this particular job. Tell us about:
  • Why you want to work in Marketing.
  • Why you want to work at Sendible and not somewhere else.
  • A description of a great product onboarding experience you have had recently and why it was awesome.
  • A time you taught yourself a new skill to complete a job or project. 
So, if you want to join Nico, Veronika, Katey, Ellie in our Marketing team along with a talented team of Product people, please submit your application!

items.title: Marketing and social media rep
items.content:
Who are we?


At Volatile Technologies (https://volatile.ai) we are unlocking the world of digital scent sensing. Our passion is to organise the chaotic ways we perceive scents and bring certainty for aroma based decision making. After all, smell is the last of human senses to remain largely off limits from being fully understood and measured digitally.


Having launched the company in June 2019, we have received investment from two of the top early stage investment funds: leading deep tech fund Entrepreneur First in London and world's top hardware investor Hax from Silicon Valley with offices in China. We are now looking to grow the team and accelerate our growth.


Our offering


We are a young startup with only 2 employees at this stage. If you are excited about joining a company which aims to fundamentally change the way things are done, and grow together with it - this is the right opportunity. We are looking for someone who thrives at the face of uncertainty, is super proactive and will tell us what needs to be done in the areas of marketing and social media. This is an opportunity for you to set your own KPIs and deliver them, shaping your own role. As we grow, we expect you to grow with the company, with a possibility to set up your own team eventually.


We are open to both full and part time, with qualification level ranging from junior to mid level, and open to the person working from home.


Why are we recruiting?


One of our first markets is tracking the quality of beer during and after brewing as well as wine and whiskey production tracking.


We need someone to be our representative on social media and the online world to reach our potential clients and raise awareness about us. Someone who can run linkedin and facebook campaigns with our partners, quantify gathered feedback and feed into the sales planning. This will also involve market research and conversations with market participants.


You:



  • are passionate about visibility, social media broadcasting and always-on approach;

  • understand and use all sorts of social media platforms, ranging from old school facebook to linkedin to tiktok etc.

  • are a beer fan and want to understand in more depth how it is actually made and what makes a good beer;

  • are independent in information gathering and synthesising - and along the lines of this we would expect someone on the more quantitative side, being able to measure any social media campaigns and drive numbers based decisions;

  • are geeky and excited about technology and IoT devices;

  • based anywhere for a remote position;


Interested?

items.title: Content Marketing Manager
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


Mews is looking to add an experienced B2B Content Marketing Managerto our growing Marketing team.


As the Content Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for designing and delivering unique and compelling product marketing content, customer success stories and other thought provoking material. You will be proficient in producing a wide range of high quality, creative content including video / blogs / webinars & podcasts that really captures the Mews tone of voice.


You will thrive in a dynamic, fast paced environment and work collaboratively with various stakeholders. Highly organised with a creative flare and great sense of humour, this role will offer incredible opportunity and freedom to create exceptional content to drive our brand forward.


 


The Role:



  • Design a Content Strategy that will drive Sales Leads

  • Engage freelancers when required

  • Day-to-day creating and publishing of content

  • Work collaboratively with both Creative, Digital and Product teams

  • Maintain clear and consistent tone of voice

  • Increase brand awareness

  • Monitor and work to improve engagement

  • Work to a world-class model that elevates Mews above other B2B companies and uniquely reflect our brand ethos and value proposition


 




REQUIREMENTS



  • 4 to 7 years of experience in a content manager, editorial or project management position

  • Extraordinary organization skills and ability to work across concurrent workstreams

  • Comfortable working collaboratively

  • Detail-oriented and committed to editing accuracy

  • Proficiency with content management systems, production and publishing

  • Writing and editing skills: excellence with English language and grammar

  • General photo-editing skills preferred

  • Project management: some experience coordinating longer-term development projects

  • Able to think ahead and be proactive on next steps

  • Familiarity and interest in both Tech and Hospitality

  • Interested in process improvement, technology and content management

  • Excellent communication skills; present ideas in clear and logical way

  • Ability to work in fast-paced environment




BENEFITS


We believe that excellence can be achieved through a dynamic culture driven by collaboration and teamwork.


At Mews we promote an environment of trust, respect and flexibility which allows us to not only support and learn from one another but motivate our team to push the boundaries in our own specialisms.


Our Values



  • Ambitious

  • Agile

  • Grit

  • Playful

  • Kind


You will be working some of the most innovative minds in our industry along with the following benefits:



  • Discounted travel (25-50%) at Mews hotels in 35+ countries

  • Flexible working

  • Excellent holiday allowance

  • Diverse and multicultural working environment

  • Regular team outings (2+ annual company trips)

  • Stocked fridge with soft drinks / snacks

  • Mews Library

items.title: Social Media Marketing Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


We're currently hiring for a Social Media Executive to join our Marketing team in London. You'll be charged with management of our social media accounts which will also include content creation, scheduling and distribution as well as analysis and reporting of social media performance and activity. 


 


About us


 


Since launching in 2014 we have been on a mission to fight financial crime on a global scale. In that time, we have raised over $35m in funding, opened offices in New York, Singapore and Romania, and have grown to over 200 employees, and we're not stopping there!


 


We aim to grow to over 500 employees in the next 18 months, as we continue to fight the good fight against financial crime and help make compliance less painful for our client base of over 450 customers across 45 different countries. We're leveraging game-changing tech to help us on our mission, building our platform around AI, Machine Learning and Big Data, meaning that our platform is unrivaled in it’s capabilities.


 


No fight against crime is complete without the right values, and we take ours very seriously!


 


Focus on the Team- We're Collaborative, Human, and Humble


Kaizen- We're Curious, Proactive and Agile


Deliver Results- We're Tenacious, Accountable and Focused


 


We can only defeat financial crime if we have the right people with the right values in place to do so, and we're committed to investing in passionate people who are experts in their field. Our culture and working environment is second to none- Don't believe us? See what our employees have to say on Glassdoor


 


 


The Role


As part of our growth an exciting position has opened up on our UK marketing team. ComplyAdvantage is seeking a Social Media Executive as we scale our marketing function. You will own social activity and management for the company, creating, scheduling and distributing engaging, snappy, and interesting content to our customers, prospects and followers.



Not only will you own social media management for the business, you'll also help with design and content creation so worlking knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite would be very helpful, including Illustrator and Photoshop. You will work alongside our in-house Graphic Designer to help create engaging content for our social channels. 


If you know how to communicate with content, have experience managing social media, want to continue to innovate and learn and are self-motivated, you’ll fit in well and have fun!




REQUIREMENTS


What You Will Do



  • Your time will be split between short-form content creation and content planning for social media, creating assets with a designer and writing fantastic short-form copy.

  • You will be responsible for managing the company social media calendar and accounts, including LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and any other relevant platforms.

  • Plan and create content to effectively deliver ComplyAdvantage’s message globally, primarily industry-focused - e.g. Banking, Insurance, Gaming

  • Work with all other areas of marketing to understand and effectively support their in-country campaigns and activity with appropriate content.

  • You'll also be responsible for reporting activity and performance against the campaigns you run and the copy you post, to ensure we are performing as we should be in the future.


Who You Are


 



  • Ideally minimum 1 years experience with B2B multi-channel content creation

  • Experience managing social media accounts for your company (Including LinkedIn, Twitter, etc)

  • A B2B technology marketing background - with the ability to imagine the possibilities for customers using new technology.

  • Previous experience generating marketing content focusing on Fintech sectors is a plus.




BENEFITS



  • 25 days holiday

  • Share Options

  • Flexible working

  • Company Health Insurance

  • Company pension scheme

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=10, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Product Manager - Transactions Americas

Company: Jobandtalent
Location:
Salary: 35.000 - 50.000 €
Requires Work Permit
Level: Senior
Language: English Language: Spanish
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Agile Methodologies
  • AWS Redshift
  • Communication Skills
  • Product Management
  • SQL Server

    • Intro

    We are a workforce on-demand company that heavily rely on tech. We integrate the complete process of selecting, hiring and managing employees, being the first in digitizing all the steps, introducing Artificial Intelligence solutions in multiple phases, obtaining faster and higher-quality service for our clients and great satisfaction and loyalty for our workers.

    Our vision is to create a long-term job security condition for our workers while providing flexible solutions to our clients. We can do this by concatenating different short-term contracts and minimizing–or completely removing–their unemployed time. We want to remove the need for finding a job ever again. 

    We have an annual growth of 170%, available in multiple countries: the UK, Spain, Germany, Sweden, Mexico, Colombia, France, and more are coming. HQ in Madrid with a second big presence in Barcelona and some remote workers in the UK, The Netherlands, and the USA. Some of our great clients are Amazon, XPOLogistics, Cabify, Santander, Just Eat, etc. 

    To make all of this possible we need a motivated Product Manager wanting to join us and willing to deliver top quality products at the end of the line. Join us in one of the hottest startups in Spain, breaking into a new market worldwide, learning and contributing with your expertise in innovating the entire job market! 

    As a Product Manager you will: 

    • Work with a team of talented engineers, general managers of each country and key operational stakeholders to build custom solutions with very unique use cases... This role will work very closely with our talented Design team, Data Science team, but also with 4 other Product Managers to make sure the Jobandtalent product as evolves as a single entity
    • Work closely with all the countries we operate in Americas to automate and optimize the process of putting job seekers to work, paying them correctly & on time
    • Master complex operational processes & legal systems, to define short term and long term solutions to challenges impacting the core of the company, the transaction
    • Travel to our operating countries in the Americas to gather and create specifications with the local teams
    • Coordinate a team of talented engineers
    • Report directly to our VP of Product
    • Unify evolution of our product

    Main requirements

    • A track record of working with engineering teams
    • Experience working with operational problems (staffing, logistics, ...)
    • A strong entrepreneurial spirit, understanding problems and looking for solutions outside the box
    • Know how to manage stakeholders and rationalize backlog prioritization
    • A thirst for analyzing key business metrics & qualitative feedback
    • Knowledge of Agile methodologies (inc. Scrum, Kanban, …)
    • Being a great communicator both in Spanish & English

    Nice to have

    • Basic SQL & Redshift querying knowledge
    • Experience in developing third party integrations 

    Perks

    • Enjoy partial remote work & flexible hours
    • Ticket restaurants (transport & kindergarden)
    • Discount on private health insurance
    • Work in an international & motivated environment, with English, French, Italian, German, Spanish colleagues and more
    • Ship complex & innovative products
    • Teams lunches & drinks, free lunch on Fridays!
    • Have your office in the middle of one of the most fun cities in Europe, Madrid
    • Free coffee, fruits, drinks in the office

items.content:
Footstock | Chief Marketing Officer | remote only

We are a Germany based start-up and run a gambling/ fantasy football app. Our users can collect, trade and earn virtual trading cards of real football players and use them to gamble and win money.Our crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo raised more than 5,000% of our funding target and over €250,000 in total before our launch on April 12th this year. We have a ton of great ideas for product development and our concept can be rolled out internationally.

We work remotely in Central Europe and operate in the UK only at the moment. You should be independent, highly motivated and self-organized. We are looking for someone experienced in online marketing, preferably in the UK (gambling/sportsbetting/fantasy football) market.You will be responsible for all marketing and sales activities. Your job is to make our company grow massively. In addition to your salary you will receive a share in the company!

oliver@footstock.com

items.title: Full Stack Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Full Stack Product Designer at Localize

Remote

As a Full Stack Product Designer, you’ll be involved in every aspect of our product development process, from early concept, to wireframe, to prototype/mockup, to pixel perfect design, build, and launch.  You’ll own and shape the user experience and ensure product goals align with customer needs.

Responsibilities:
  • Map a plan for new products and features based on company vision, customer feedback, and business objectives.
  • Design, prototype, and iterate on new features and refresh UI/UX of existing features.
  • Communicate design solutions through wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes.
  • Translate wireframes into highly-polished visual composites while following (and developing) a UI style guide.
  • Work independently and across multiple teams. Collaborate with product team and software engineers to find elegant but practical solutions to design challenges.
  • Work closely with engineering to oversee execution and build of a new product/features; be “go to” person when designs specs require clarification or change.
  • Iterate and improve on product/features over time based on data from user feedback and lessons learned.
  • Develop launch strategies including: designing email campaigns to announce new functionality; updating marketing / features pages to reflect new functionality / products; etc.
  • Follow up post-launch to measure product effectiveness and user experience, and to verify / validate the original hypothesis on which the new product/feature built.
  • Test new product ideas / features with customers to validate assumptions before dedicating resources to building something.
Experience and Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 6+ years as an experience designing UI / UX for B2B SaaS products (design portfolio a must)
  • Solid skillset around user flows, wire frames, mockups, and generating assets and specifications for integration into digital products
  • Strong facilitation and project management skills. Ability to lead collaborative design sessions.
  • Strong verbal and written interpersonal skills. Ability to articulate your product design vision and defend your design decisions.
  • An understanding of marketing techniques and aptitude a plus
  • Strong ability to solicit user feedback, both directly with customers and indirectly through tracking customer usage and impact on sales through analytical tools like Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Salesforce/Freshsales
  • A team player who can work autonomously and easily adapt in a rapidly changing environment
About Localize:

Our Localize TMS platform is used by 500+ companies to translate websites and applications into other languages. We help companies like Trello to translate their help center (https://help.trello.com/), Tinder to translate their blog (https://blog.gotinder.com/), and RocketMiles to translate their web app (https://www.rocketmiles.com/) – to see our product in action, click any of those links and use the website’s language switcher to switch from English to another language.

Localize works by providing a code snippet (similar to the Google Analytics snippet) that our customers add to their website / web app. The Localize snippet pulls in content from the page into the Localize dashboard where our customers login to add translations and manage their content. Localize automatically deploys those translations to the customer’s production site.

We are a team of 8 working fully remote. We offer competitive pay, a full benefits package, and a culture with emphasis on work + life balance.

To apply:

Along with your resume, send us a cover letter that showcases your personality and tells us why we should hire you.

https://hire.withgoogle.com/public/jobs/localizejscom

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.title: Growth Marketer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR( australia, japan, newzealand)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=24, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Growth Marketer at Red Guava

Remote | International
  • REMOTE
  • MARKETING

Who we are

Red Guava is a small bootstrapped and profitable software company based in Melbourne, Australia. Our team works remotely from all over the world.

Our sole focus is building an application called Cliniko. Cliniko makes life easy for Allied Health professionals by handling appointment scheduling, storing treatment notes, and a bunch of other things. It’s quite a neat system and is used globally by tens of thousands of people every day.

Things we love to do:

  • Provide great software and service.
  • Work with talented people.
  • Delight our customers.
  • Make the world a little bit better.

How we work

We work smarter, not harder. We think work/life balance is important and we work a 30-hour week as standard (you still get full-time pay; it’s a full-time position).

Even though we’re based out of Melbourne, Australia, our team is spread around the world. We want to hire the best person available, not just the best person within a 10km radius. You can see our team’s locations on the Red Guava website (admittedly that site is a bit neglected, so it’s kind of how our team looked a couple of years ago).

If you want to know more about how we work (which really is quite different), our founder Joel gave a talk about it.

The job

We are looking for a Growth Marketer to join our team. We’d love someone that can be up and running very quickly, but that doesn’t mean you need 5 years’ experience in the industry. What we really care about is skill, passion, and integrity. That’s much more important than what’s on your CV.

Who you are

You understand how to reach people and let them know about a product that could be useful for them. You’re able to do so in a helpful friendly way, not a hard sales approach. You’re very familiar with the options for marketing in the digital world. Not only do you stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies available, but you’re also creative with your approach.

You either have a very strong knowledge of SEM, or at the very least, a keen interest and the aptitude to learn it very quickly.

You’re passionate about helping people find solutions to their problems, and strive to do so at scale with your work. You much rather sustainable long term growth, than a fleeting quick win.

You’re prepared to roll up your sleeves and get it done. You don’t need a team to bring your vision to life, you’re very capable with your hands on the tools.

What you’ll work on

You will spend your time helping people find out about Cliniko. This includes:

  • Improve our measuring and reporting for both growth and churn.
  • Public relations.
  • Identifying partnership opportunities.
  • Investigate and reduce our churn.
  • Paid search ads (SEM).
  • Improving our on-boarding.
  • Helping develop our content strategy (and producing content).
  • Optimising for organic search (SEO).
  • Anything else you think needs doing.

There are many businesses that could benefit greatly from using Cliniko, you’ll help them do that.

Great work environment

We want people doing their best work with us. We know that needs a great work environment, and we don’t just mean a flashy office. Some things we do a little differently to enable people to do their best work and live a happy life:

  • 30-hour work week.
  • Complete autonomy.
  • Work from anywhere.
  • Unlimited annual leave (minimum 4 weeks per year).
  • Supplied computer equipment.
  • Ergonomic furniture.
  • Fresh organic fruit weekly to your home.
  • Overseas trips for full team meet-ups (family invited and paid for too).
  • No managers.
  • No meetings.

In summary

Let’s be clear, you do need to be seriously amazing. We don’t hire often and when we do, we get hundreds of applicants. We will offer you the best job you have ever had with plenty of perks, but we expect you to be super-talented.

You should be absolutely passionate about digital marketing. You should believe you can make a significant difference in our growth and churn rates.

Apply for job

items.title: Development Officer, Foundations Relations
items.content:
Development Officer, Foundations Relations at Earthjustice

Remote

San Francisco, CA or Remote

Earthjustice is the premier nonprofit environmental law organization. We take on the biggest, most precedent-setting cases across the country. We wield the power of law and the strength of partnership to protect people’s health, to preserve magnificent places and wildlife, to advance clean energy, and to combat climate change. We partner with thousands of groups, supporters, individuals, and communities to engage the critical environmental issues of our time, and bring about positive change. We are here because the earth needs a good lawyer.

Founded in 1971, Earthjustice has a distinguished track record of achieving significant, lasting environmental protections. We achieve this by hiring people who share a passion for justice and a healthy environment. Our headquarters are in San Francisco with offices in Anchorage, Juneau, Los Angeles, Miami, Tallahassee, Honolulu, New York, Philadelphia, Denver, Seattle, Bozeman, Chicago, and Washington, D.C.

The Foundation Relations Development Officer is an integral part of an eleven-person foundation relations team, which raises approximately one-quarter of Earthjustice’s contributed revenue. The Foundation Relations Development Officer, who will primarily work on our Climate and Energy portfolio, raises grant support for their designated program areas, managing a portfolio of foundation donors and prospects. The person in this position works closely with the president, vice presidents of litigation, program managers, attorneys, communications staff, board members, and the entire development team to develop and implement effective strategies for meeting revenue goals.

This position can be based in our Headquarters in San Francisco, CA or remote for qualified candidates.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Foundation Solicitation and Relationship Development: 50% (writing 30%; research/prospecting 10%; foundation relationship building/stewardship 10%)

  • Achieve foundation revenue goals as specified in the annual work plan.
  • Ensure growth of donor base by identifying, researching, and cultivating potential sources of foundation support.
  • Research foundation guidelines, giving histories, and talk to informed allies to determine best approach for Earthjustice solicitation, when possible. Monitor program developments at relevant foundations.
  • Stay abreast of foundation trends through philanthropic journals and other sources.
  • Engage in personal contact with foundation staff to cultivate, solicit, and steward foundation donors; coordinate appropriate program staff involvement at each stage.
  • Serve as a resource to foundations seeking information about Earthjustice, about the environmental community, or about environmental issues more broadly.
  • Work with program staff to define and articulate broad program vision, goals, objectives, and specific strategies to attain them.
  • Work with program staff to develop and submit the highest quality letters of inquiry, grant proposals, and reports to foundations.
  • Engage foundations and other informed allies in discussions about program direction and gap analysis.
  • Write and submit timely gift acknowledgement letters.
  • Monitor and meet foundation proposal and reporting deadlines in coordination with attorneys’ schedules.
  • Monitor and track foundation commitments or deliverables and communicate these expectations with program staff. Maintain regular communication with program staff on grant management.
  • Identify and develop opportunities for personal communication between foundation contacts and Earthjustice staff and trustees, such as personal meetings, invitations to events, and program update briefings.
  • Write briefings memos and prepare the president, senior leadership, and attorneys for foundation meetings; and participate in such meetings as appropriate.
  • Manage travel and other logistics for funder meetings, in collaboration with foundations associate.

Program Knowledge and Communication 25% (15% research; 10% staff interactions)

  • Follow issues related to Earthjustice litigation and remain conversant in the work of assigned Earthjustice programs, with a focus on climate and energy issues. This includes reading all relevant New Matter Forms, news & communications generated by Earthjustice, and news from external sources such as E&E Publishing and Greenwire.
  • Develop a working knowledge of Earthjustice’s past accomplishments and current programs and budget.
  • Track the status of relevant legal cases and programs through ongoing conversations with program staff, and use of our legal database.
  • Work with the communications team to track media hits and press coverage relevant to foundation relations.

Budget Creation and Financial Reporting: 15%

  • Develop budgets and financial reports in coordination with program and finance staff and occasionally with subcontractors or external partners.
  • Synthesize and analyze program work using database searches and queries to inform budgets.
  • Create and maintain case lists to inform budget construction and financial reporting.
  • Create and maintain list of revenue restricted to particular program areas through use of our database, as well as regular communication with the Finance Department and other teams within the Development Department.
  • Ensure appropriate tracking of cases and grant priorities in our legal database.
  • Define new bodies of work by researching and aggregating cases, creating vision budgets when necessary.
  • Keep program staff abreast of grant-related budget commitments.

General Responsibilities: 10%

  • Participate in the preparation of foundation revenue estimates for the annual budget.
  • Develop and implement an individual work plan to meet revenue goals.
  • Periodically provide revenue re-projections based on actual year-to-date performance.
  • Collaborate with development staff on donor cultivation activities, site visits, solicitations, and special events.
  • Regularly edit mailing lists for events and publications.
  • Support the senior development officer and the foundations team members working on climate and energy as needed.
  • Serve as a resource for program writing for the Development Department.
  • Maintain current and accurate hardcopy and computer database records to track foundation relations. Document interactions with foundations in our relational database.
  • Attend departmental and organizational retreats for shared planning, team building, and professional development.
  • Represent Development Department in legal practice groups.
  • Additional duties as assigned.
  • This position requires occasional travel.
  • Occasional evening and weekend work may be required.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree required.
  • Five years of successful experience in foundation fundraising. Knowledge of foundations that emphasize environmental giving preferred.
  • Background in law, policy, and/or the environment preferred.
  • Excellent creative writing skills, including the ability to develop successful grant proposals, reports, and other materials. Ability to synthesize complex material, to translate it into readable and engaging prose, and to communicate it clearly and succinctly.
  • Ability to build and interpret a program budget and financial reports.
  • Outstanding verbal and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Extraordinary attention to detail.
  • High level of intellectual curiosity.
  • Outstanding commitment to producing high quality work products.
  • Ability to prioritize and to manage work independently; ability to perform effectively and with minimal supervision under pressure of multiple deadlines.
  • Keen ability to troubleshoot complicated projects to their completion.
  • Ability to take initiative in identifying and skillfully solving problems.
  • Ability to work and communicate effectively with a wide range of people, including the public, foundation staff, and in-house staff.
  • Ability to work constructively as a member of a team.
  • Interest in environmental protection and public health issues.
  • Knowledge of climate and energy issues strongly preferred.
  • Legal and/or environmental background preferred.
  • Ability to use relational database systems.
  • An awareness and sensitivity to the needs and concerns of individuals from diverse cultures, backgrounds, and orientations.
  • Contribution to the creation of a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work culture that encourages and celebrates differences.

We offer a mission- and employee-focused work environment and a competitive compensation package, including excellent benefits. Earthjustice is an equal opportunity employer and highly values diversity.

Earthjustice is driven by a passion for justice, partnership, and excellence. Our core values lead us to seek a broad range of perspectives and backgrounds to achieve our mission and to maintain an inclusive environment where all staff are valued and respected. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to employment practices that ensure that employees and applicants for employment are provided with equal opportunities without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other factor that is not related to the position.

For positions located within the City and County of San Francisco: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment-qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

For positions located within the City of Los Angeles: We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring.

Apply for job

items.title: College Loops Outreach Coordinator
items.content:
College Loops Outreach Coordinator at Girls Who Code

Remote | Part-time
  • REMOTE
  • PROGRAMS
  • PART-TIME, TEMPORARY

Girls Who Code (GWC) is an international non-profit organization working to close the gender gap in technology. Through our College Loops program, we are leading the movement to support and equip college-aged women with the skills to pursue careers in technology fields. Girls Who Code is searching for dynamic, results-oriented College Loops Outreach Coordinator to execute recruitment strategies to generate leads for the expansion of the College Loops program. The ideal candidate has experience cultivating, building and maintaining leads, creating email campaigns, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. They bring experience working with collegiate student organizations.

This is a part-time (10 hours/week), temporary (through early December), remote position.

  • Work closely with the Manager of Alumni Programs to ensure that the outreach strategy being implemented is effective and meeting outreach targets
  • Submit weekly status updates and meet monthly lead targets
  • Convert interested College Loops applicants through phone banking and additional individualized follow up on select campuses

Qualifications

  • Previously participation in GWC programs (Campus, Clubs, College Loops, and/or SIP)
  • Excellent communication skills with an ability to balance priorities
  • Able to work independently and comfortable working remotely
  • Proactive and self-motivated; you follow-through with projects from start to finish
  • Detail-oriented, with superb organizational skills and Google Sheet experience
  • Commitment to Girls Who Code’s strategy and mission
  • Knowledge of and/or interest in computer science, and understanding of the college landscape and student organizations

Girls Who Code is committed to building a truly diverse and inclusive organization with a focus on valuing, serving, and understanding our target constituents, while challenging all stakeholders to think inclusively for the betterment of our programs.

Girls Who Code is an equal opportunity employer committed to a policy of equal treatment and opportunity in every aspect of its hiring and promotion process without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sexual orientation, partnership status, gender and/or gender identity or expression, marital, parental or familial status, national origin, ethnicity, veteran or military status, age, disability, or any other legally protected basis. Racial and ethnic minorities and men are encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels. GWC is not able to sponsor employment visas.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Client Engagement Manager, Location Analytics (remote based)
items.content:
At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way.

As a Senior Client Engagement Manager for Pitney Bowes, you can too.

We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components: Client. Team. Win. Innovate.

We are actively looking for candidates who:
•Are passionate about client success
•Enjoy collaborating with others
•Strive to exceed expectations
•Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions

You are:
A trusted advisor and ongoing advocate for client and partner success. You are an expert in our clients' industries and businesses ensuring we are delivering the best client solutions while maximizing revenue opportunities.

You will:
•Manage a portfolio of strategic client and partner relationships for the mutual benefit of Pitney Bowes and our clients
•Engage early in the sales cycle to identify client needs, develop the set of expected and realistic business results, and work with the implementation teams to create solution proposals with cost estimates
•Define data driven, location intelligent solutions based on desired business outcomes and lead solution implementation teams to ensure engagement success
•Influence activities within Sales, Pre-Sales, and Product Development in order to maintain focus on client success; and to expand the use of our technologies to drive additional revenue streams in support of our clients
•Create Statement of Work (SOW) and work with sales through contracting
•Validate results against expected outcomes at project conclusion and/or key milestones

Your background:
As an experienced Client Engagement Manager, you will have:
•5+ years experience in business consulting or client services
•Proven background in data-driven solutions, geospatial data and analytics
•Geographic Information Systems (GIS) or Statistical/Predictive models background highly preferred.
•Industry expertise in retail, financial services, telecommunications, public sector, or insurance - particularly in channel strategy
•Project Management experience
•Ability to assess client needs/pain points and explain the value of PB solutions
•Strong solution selling and negotiation skills
•Ability to travel up to 25%

We will:
•Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your career
•Offer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspectives and ideas
•Deliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organization
•Offer comprehensive benefits globally (pbprojectliving.com)

Our Team
Our Software and Data Solutions team powers global commerce, processing billions of transactions every year. Our Software technology and solutions help businesses operate faster and more efficiently. How? By identifying trusted data and insights to create targeted, effective messaging, by providing accurate geographic data to make smarter business decisions, and by delivering relevant and engaging interactions across the customer lifecycle to drive increased satisfaction.

Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace.

W/M/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/LGBT are encouraged to apply.

All interested individuals must apply online. Individuals with disabilities who cannot apply via our online application should refer to the alternate application options via our Individuals with Disabilities link.
- provided by Dice

items.title: Shogun: Partnerships Manager (Technology)
items.content:
Partnerships Manager (Technology)

We are: Shogun, a powerful page builder and AB testing platform for eCommerce stores. We were in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, and we have over 10,000 active paying clients!

We are looking for: A Partnerships Manager to build out our eCommerce technology channel partnerships. This includes developing deep relationships with other eCommerce software companies, identifying areas where we can leverage these relationships for growth, and executing those campaigns with the help of marketing and sales. It also includes attending meetings and industry events, conducting product demos, and maintaining contacts in our CRM.

We need someone that has a strong understanding of software, integrations, and frontend development, and can leverage that knowledge for a business focused role.

This role will make a huge impact on the business, and there will be an opportunity to grow with our business development team.


You must:

-Be comfortable owning measurable Key Results as personal monthly or quarterly goals.
-Be incredibly detail and process oriented.
-Have 1-3 years of web development/ software development experience.
-Have at least 1-3 years of experience with sales development or business development.
-Be comfortable running software demos, meetings, and networking at conferences.
-Have experience with maintaining contacts in a CRM platform like Hubspot.
-Have meticulous note taking abilities. Ability to create clear action items, and execute follow up.
-Have the ability to learn how software works, and memorize key facts about the software.
-Be a self starter that defaults to action.
-Have a few references we can say hi to.

We offer:

-Competitive compensation
-Equity
-A skilled team that is fun to work with
-The ability to work from wherever you want in the world.
-The opportunity to help build the business development side of a company from the ground up

Sounds interesting?
Apply via Angel.co via the link/button provided.


Please note:
-Our team is fully distributed and global (check out our team page!). We have no office. You should be comfortable with remote work.
-We hire on a full time contractor basis to begin with. Team members enjoy the same opportunities for great compensation, full time positions, equity, and consideration, regardless of location.

items.title: Red Guava: Growth Marketer - Join a very unique company
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR( australia, japan, newzealand)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=24, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Growth Marketer - Join a very unique company

Full-time
Anywhere
Remote job
Small business
Posted Today – Accepting applications
Who we are
Red Guava is a small bootstrapped and profitable software company based in Melbourne, Australia. Our team works remotely from all over the world.
 
Our sole focus is building an application called Cliniko. Cliniko makes life easy for Allied Health professionals by handling appointment scheduling, storing treatment notes, and a bunch of other things. It’s quite a neat system and is used globally by tens of thousands of people every day.
 
Things we love to do:
  • Provide great software and service.
  • Work with talented people.
  • Delight our customers.
  • Make the world a little bit better.
 
How we work
We work smarter, not harder. We think work/life balance is important and we work a 30-hour week as standard (you still get a full-time pay; it’s a full-time position).
 
Even though we’re based out of Melbourne, Australia, our team is spread around the world. We want to hire the best person available, not just the best person within a 10km radius. You can see our team’s locations on the Red Guava website (admittedly that site is a bit neglected, so it’s kind of how our team looked a couple of years ago).
 
If you want to know more about how we work (which really is quite different), our founder Joel gave a talk about it.
 
The job
We are looking for a Growth Marketer to join our team. We’d love someone that can be up and running very quickly, but that doesn’t mean you need 5 years experience in the industry. What we really care about is skill, passion, and integrity. That’s much more important than what’s on your CV.
 
Who you are
You understand how to reach people and let them know about a product that could be useful for them. You’re able to do so in a helpful friendly way, not a hard sales approach. You’re very familiar with the options for marketing in the digital world. Not only do you stay up to date with latest trends and technologies available, you’re also creative with your approach.
 
You either have a very strong knowledge of SEM, or at the very least, a keen interest and the aptitude to learn it very quickly.
 
You’re passionate about helping people find solutions to their problems, and strive to do so at scale with your work. You much rather sustainable long term growth, than a fleeting quick win.
 
You’re prepared to roll up your sleeves and get it done. You don’t need a team to bring your vision to life, you’re very capable with your hands on the tools.
 
What you’ll work on
You will spend your time helping people find out about Cliniko. This includes:
  • Improve our measuring and reporting for both growth and churn.
  • Public relations.
  • Identifying partnership opportunities.
  • Investigate and reduce our churn.
  • Paid search ads (SEM).
  • Improving our on-boarding.
  • Helping develop our content strategy (and producing content).
  • Optimising for organic search (SEO).
  • Anything else you think needs doing.
 
There are many businesses that could benefit greatly from using Cliniko, you’ll help them do that.
 
Great work environment
We want people doing their best work with us. We know that needs a great work environment, and we don’t just mean a flashy office. Some things we do a little differently to enable people to do their best work and live a happy life:
  • 30-hour work week.
  • Complete autonomy.
  • Work from anywhere.
  • Unlimited annual leave (minimum 4 weeks per year).
  • Supplied computer equipment.
  • Ergonomic furniture.
  • Fresh organic fruit weekly to your home.
  • Overseas trips for full team meet-ups (family invited and paid for too).
  • No managers.
  • No meetings.
 
In summary
Let’s be clear, you do need to be seriously amazing. We don’t hire often and when we do, we get hundreds of applicants. We will offer you the best job you have ever had with plenty of perks, but we expect you to be super-talented.
 
You should be absolutely passionate about digital marketing. You should believe you can make a significant difference in our growth and churn rates.

 
Job applications close 16th of October, 2019.

items.title: Dofollow.io: Outreach Specialist [100% Remote | Part-Time 20h/Week]
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Outreach Specialist [100% Remote | Part-Time 20h/Week]

You’ll be in charge of link building tasks on SEO client projects. This includes hands on work, managing multiple projects with time constraints at the same time and adjusting strategy as necessary.


Your main task will be to communicate with various website owners to promote our clients’ content.


We intend to enter into a long term, project based collaboration. You will receive your assignments from the founders directly but we aim to give you as much autonomy as possible. We hate micromanagement as much as anyone :)


Responsibilities:
  • Promote content and articles through concerted email outreach to get authoritative websites and publications to link back.
  • Familiarise yourself with multiple online niches, identify key influencers and start conversations with them. Maintain these relationships to produce positive results for both parties.
  • Discover link building opportunities through industry specific searches
  • Ability to track your link building efforts and report results on a monthly basis.

Requirements:
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work within a team and independently
  • Assiduity in performing long-term tasks of the same type.
  • Ability to handle large volumes of projects quickly across various industries
  • Expert level attention to detail is essential

Nice to Haves:
  • Basic understanding of SEO and function principles of search engines;
  • Basic understanding of internet marketing;
  • Experience in customer support or customer facing communication
  • Tech savvy and willing to learn new tools

We offer:
  • Create your desired lifestyle
  • Travel and work from wherever you want
  • Possibility to move your residence in a country of your choice
  • Flexible schedule to allow for an optimum work-life balance
  • Create space for personal plans
  • Opportunity to be with dofollow.io team for a long time. We are focused on long term collaboration more than on one time freelance projects
  • Opportunity to go up to 40h/week in a few months
  • Grow with the company
  • Access to very experienced team members in various Digital Marketing areas.
  • Every 30, 60 or 90 days propose 1 or more projects you would like to develop for the company. We appreciate and support initiative.
This is an entry-level position which can be a good start for building a career in online marketing.


Job Type: Part-time contractor - Everyone in our team is a freelance contractor which means you will be responsible for paying your own taxes etc.

items.title: ClickFunnels: Manager, Product Design (UX)
items.content:
Manager, Product Design (UX)

ClickFunnels is a company focused on changing the world by helping individuals and businesses get their message, products and services out to those they want to serve. We created an amazing software platform to make this process as simple and friendly as possible. We work hard to serve our customers at the highest possible level by providing the tools and knowledge they need to be successful. We believe that what we do matters and we are looking for people to help us in our cause. 

With over 95,000 users, a growing internal team, and a passion for being the best we can be, we are looking for our next Manager of Product Design to help support our focus on supporting our customers and growing our business. 

The Manager of Product Design is responsible for building a team of Product Designers that champion the customer, represent the business needs and build and evolve the product. The Manager continuously works to elevate the discipline and output of the product design practice within ClickFunnels.



In this role you’ll make an impact by….
  • Being responsible for the process of product design. This includes building product design teams, balancing staff assignments, standardizing the process of product design, fostering cross-functional cooperation, setting product-level strategy and resource allocation
  • Setting goals for the Product Design team and working collaboratively with the Product Designers to set individual goals then meeting with each Product Designer frequently to assess progress towards those goals and help remove roadblocks
  • Refining the process of Product Design, as needed, and ensuring that each of the product designers are following the process within their teams
  • Mentoring and guiding all of the Product Designers 
  • Working collaboratively with the other Practice Managers to ensure the entire product delivery process runs smoothly
  • Making sure problems are dealt with promptly by working with individual contributors, other Practice Managers or the leader of the ClickFunnels product organization
  • Removing roadblocks for Product Designers\Coordinating cross-team efforts to ensure business needs and deadlines are met
  • Fostering cross-functional communication and collaboration
  • Adjusting assignments to meet business needs
  • Communicating the roadmap to other functional areas
  • Championing the customer and business needs and ensuring all Product Designers are doing the same
We are looking for individuals with….
  • 8+ years of experience as a creative professional
  • 3+ years of people management experience
  • Tech savviness and passion about building products
  • Proficiency in Adobe CC, Sketch and Figma
  • Track record of using qualitative and quantitative data to prioritize and drive decision-making
  • Demonstrated leadership, collaboration, communication and problem-solving skills
  • Patience and humility
  • Metrics-driven mindset: Strong analytical and synthesis skills, including the ability to absorb and process large amounts of data into actionable information
  • Experience with agile scrum development and lean startup principles
  • Curiosity and comfort holding professional conversations with customers
  • Internet access and connection download speeds of at least 30 Mbps if working remotely 
We’ll see it a bonus if you also have….
  • 5+ years of formal digital product design experience

Position can be remote, however hiring is limited to the following states in the United States. 
  • Arizona
  • California
  • Colorado
  • Connecticut
  • Florida
  • Georgia
  • Idaho
  • Indiana
  • Kansas

  • Michigan

ClickFunnels is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

items.content:
Growth Marketer

Red Guava

Who we are
Red Guava is a small bootstrapped and profitable software company based in Melbourne, Australia. Our team works remotely from all over the world.

Our sole focus is building an application called Cliniko. Cliniko makes life easy for Allied Health professionals by handling appointment scheduling, storing treatment notes, and a bunch of other things. It's quite a neat system and is used globally by tens of thousands of people every day.

Things we love to do:
  • Provide great software and service.
  • Work with talented people.
  • Delight our customers.
  • Make the world a little bit better.

How we work
We work smarter, not harder. We think work/life balance is important and we work a 30-hour week as standard (you still get a full-time pay; it’s a full-time position).

Even though we're based out of Melbourne, Australia, our team is spread around the world. We want to hire the best person available, not just the best person within a 10km radius. You can see our team's locations on the Red Guava website (admittedly that site is a bit neglected, so it's kind of how our team looked a couple of years ago).

If you want to know more about how we work (which really is quite different), our founder Joel gave a talk about it.

The Job

We are looking for a Growth Marketer to join our team. We'd love someone that can be up and running very quickly, but that doesn't mean you need 5 years experience in the industry. What we really care about is skill, passion, and integrity. That's much more important than what’s on your CV.

Who you are
You understand how to reach people and let them know about a product that could be useful for them. You're able to do so in a helpful friendly way, not a hard sales approach. You're very familiar with the options for marketing in the digital world. Not only do you stay up to date with latest trends and technologies available, you're also creative with your approach.

You either have a very strong knowledge of SEM, or at the very least, a keen interest and the aptitude to learn it very quickly.

You're passionate about helping people find solutions to their problems, and strive to do so at scale with your work. You much rather sustainable long term growth, than a fleeting quick win.

You're prepared to roll up your sleeves and get it done. You don't need a team to bring your vision to life, you're very capable with your hands on the tools.

What you'll work on
You will spend your time helping people find out about Cliniko. This includes:
  • Improve our measuring and reporting for both growth and churn.
  • Public relations.
  • Identifying partnership opportunities.
  • Investigate and reduce our churn.
  • Paid search ads (SEM).
  • Improving our on-boarding.
  • Helping develop our content strategy (and producing content).
  • Optimising for organic search (SEO).
  • Anything else you think needs doing.
There are many businesses that could benefit greatly from using Cliniko, you'll help them do that.

Great work environment
We want people doing their best work with us. We know that needs a great work environment, and we don't just mean a flashy office. Some things we do a little differently to enable people to do their best work and live a happy life:
  • 30-hour work week.
  • Complete autonomy.
  • Work from anywhere.
  • Unlimited annual leave (minimum 4 weeks per year).
  • Supplied computer equipment.
  • Ergonomic furniture.
  • Fresh organic fruit weekly to your home.
  • Overseas trips for full team meet-ups (family invited and paid for too).
  • No managers.
  • No meetings.

In summary
Let’s be clear, you do need to be seriously amazing. We don't hire often and when we do, we get hundreds of applicants. We will offer you the best job you have ever had with plenty of perks, but we expect you to be super-talented.

You should be absolutely passionate about digital marketing. You should believe you can make a significant difference in our growth and churn rates.



Job applications close 16th of October, 2019.
