items.content:
DESCRIPTION


ABOUT MARSHMALLOW:


We're a VC-backed digital insurer of the future. We use machine learning, automation, our own technology stack and comprehensive data integrations to be quicker, cheaper and fairer to customers, and need product managers to plot a course through the chaos to take advantage of countless opportunities.


We're a team of 35 with experience at the likes of Intercom, Monzo, Transferwise, Depop, HP backed by investors who have backed Spotify, Monzo, Adyen and others. Over the next 2 years we will grow the team to 150, as we expand our revenue product offering and geography - pushing further in to the multi-trillion $ insurance market.


WHAT'S THE ROLE? 


You will be working in the pricing and growth team; working alongside data scientists, pricing experts and engineers to ensure rapid growth whilst delivering a good return on capital for our insurers and re-insurers. This means defining roadmaps, prioritising model builds, querying new data sources, negotiating with partners, managing integrations and motivating a high-performance, cross-functional team


THE CURRENT PRODUCT TEAM


We are a team of *one* currently, please see here: https://www.linkedin.com/in/williamnialloconnor/


YOU'LL BE...



  • Defining problems for the team

  • Working on high-level product strategy to deliver huge growth



  • Managing the roadmap: capture work from a wide range of inputs, understand and prioritise this work so your teams is always working on the most impactful projects

  • Deeply ingrained in the problems that you’re tackling research and regular interaction with customers; defining and framing those problems for the teams

  • Scoping solutions in the smallest possible state to ship to customers as early as you can.


YOU SHOULD APPLY IF...



  • You have at least 3 years as a product manager used to delivering customer centric, meaningful products

  • Have a maths, economics or similarly numeracy based degree

  • Have worked in a data-focused team, before

  • Have an interest in financial services


WE WILL GET BONUS POINTS IF YOU...



  • You have experience moving and living in a foreign country

  • Have worked in a fintech company before


OUR CULTURE


https://www.notion.so/getmarshmallow/Company-Values-e798b5c1fce54e8789274cf83c978831


BENEFITS 



  • Competitive salary 

  • Stock options 

  • Health Insurance 

  • Working from home 

  • Monthly Socials 

  • 32 day holiday allowance (inc bank holidays) 

  • Pension 

  • Cycle to work scheme 

  • Unlimited books 

  • Equipment you need to get the job done 

  • Weekly knowledge sharing presentations 

  • Friday all-hands with snacks 

  • Learning and training supported 

  • Fruit, snacks and soft drinks in the office 


LOGISTICS



  • Our process consists of a phone interview, an onsite and a final round to make sure we're both sure interview. We will endeavour to be communicative and transparent throughout :)

items.title: Senior Product Manager // Idagio
items.content:
Senior Product Manager // Idagio

Company: Idagio

Tags:
  • Product
  • music streaming
  • Classical music
  • product management

    • WHERE YOU’LL CONTRIBUTE

    We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Manager to join our marvelous product team: a group of people with a shared interest in great user experience, robust software, fast delivery, and clear communication.

    Help us build an outstanding Music Discovery experience, giving our listeners easy access to the most comprehensive catalogue of classical music in streaming and letting them explore and find what is most relevant for them.

    As part of a cross-functional team, you will be actively driving the product development process throughout the product life cycle, collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and other teams.

    Come build the best classical music streaming service with us!

    • Own the 6-12 months roadmap for the Music Discovery Unit and collaborate with other product Units on joint initiatives
    • Develop goals and priorities that align with company goals and strive for product excellence
    • Research & evaluate opportunities & spec product requirements
    • You will execute on product features with the unit
    • You will analyse and document product research, findings, decisions, success etc.
    • Communicate and align with stakeholders
    • Develop effective narrative to provide context for product vision
    • You don’t believe in or practice “by the book” implementation of processes or working methods, you believe in understanding the principles and making use of them where needed

    EXPERIENCE AND PERSONALITY TRAITS WE FIND RELEVANT FOR THIS POSITION

    • Proven track record of at least 5 years in developing user-facing products along the product life cycle
    • A proven ability to partner with product designers, engineers, business analysts, and other stakeholders to create the best products for the users we serve
    • Proven ability to define a successful business strategy and product roadmap
    • A calm and structured communicator that keeps the big picture in mind and is able to deep dive into a subject
    • Proven ability to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously
    • Interest in classical music is a plus

    WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

    • Join an exceptional multinational team of almost 100 and shape the future of classical music
    • Enjoy a positive and purpose-driven working atmosphere in our office in Berlin Kreuzberg
    • Invest your time and energy into a meaningful and beautiful product that improves the lives of people
    • Make use of a generous education budget + extra days off to be spent on your professional and self-development
    • Enjoy flexible working hours, occasional remote work, and use the tools and hardware of your choice

    ABOUT US

    “This startup is set to revolutionize classical music” – Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung

    Classical music connects people all over the world, transcending culture, race, and generation to inspire and evoke thoughts and emotions in a powerful way. Our vision is to enrich people’s lives through classical music. That’s why we are building a streaming service that caters to the unique depth and complexity of the genre –  with the goal of making classical music as accessible as never before.

    We work with all major and specialized record labels around the globe and maintain close relationships with the world’s leading artists and musical institutions. Among them great orchestras such as the Vienna Philharmonic or iconic artists like Thomas Hampson.

    IDAGIO is available to music lovers across the globe. Physically we are rooted in Berlin and we consider the German-speaking countries our home base, in the same as the world perceives them as the cradle of classical music.

    Apply for this position

items.title: Graduate Marketing Coordinator (Edinburgh)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Location


Edinburgh


Description


We’re on a mission: to change how the world works. 


We want to give people the freedom to access the world’s best work spaces, anywhere, any time, at the touch of a button. Communicating to the world is at the heart of delivering that. 


We’re a growing startup so we’re looking for a well rounded Marketing graduate capable of growing with us from the ground up.


About Desana


Desana gives our customers access to a network of great work space when they want it, where they want it, through a single monthly subscription. We do that by supporting coworking spaces, taking their spare inventory and giving our customers fluid access to it.


We’re a growing startup based between London, Edinburgh, and Stockholm but we aim to become a globally relevant company by disrupting the way people think about, and access, the places they work. We're looking for the best people to join us on our journey.


With prior experience in startups ourselves, we’re keen to do things the right way from the very start. That’s why we believe in openness and transparency in everything we do, from salary to communications, to processes.


Why Join Us?


We’re at the forefront of a new wave of innovation in the office space sector which is already undergoing tremendous change and significant growth. Join us to not only grow our brand which is changing the ways people work, but by living and breathing the innovation as you work flexibly, autonomously, and (as much as the job demands) remotely yourself. We pride ourselves in radical open-ness and strive to create a company that fulfils its users, partners, and employees. 


The Role


Marketing done well isn’t always marketing done by the book. It’s out-of-the-box, inherently unique thinking that makes the biggest impact.


We’re giving you the chance to flex your creativity. We want to build a brand that’s memorable and impactful to both our customers and the workspaces that we’re partnered with. To do that, we need someone that’s motivated to:



  • Work with the founders and get to know the business really well.

  • Work with our consumer groups, and workspace partners and will learn how to speak with them directly through email and LinkedIn, and indirectly through our social media channels.

  • Work as a member of the team to produce a marketing strategy plan - you’ll be in charge of delivering it.

  • Work together to generate creative ideas and to identify new, high impact ways (and channels) to grow the business and engage potential customers.

  • Run our social media platforms. 

  • Work with photographers and videographers to create high-quality, engaging media. 

  • Create and manage a content calendar for analytically focussed, multi-channel marketing campaigns.

  • Reach out directly to potential customers and create a pipeline for the team to meet with them.

  • Participate daily in a 10 minute whole team “stand up” call, wherever you are. Our team are regularly in London so it will be up to you to touch-base with us and take charge of your days.


About You



  • You have a solid understanding of marketing: you have a relevant degree and, ideally, can already demonstrate experience in delivering marketing campaigns.

  • You know what’s effective: you have experience with marketing automation platforms, CDPs, and attribution tools and it would be advantageous if you are able to make good recommendations on different platforms.

  • You get the importance of data: you understand growth metrics, A/B testing, and statistics and you’ve delivered effective data-driven strategies and marketing campaigns across multiple media channels for for the companies you’ve worked with.

  • You can design: not essential for the role but it would be extremely advantageous if you have design experience that can be applied directly to content creation.

  • You have CRM experience / awareness: not essential but would be really useful.

  • You’re personable: a fun, enthusiastic people-person.

  • You’re self-starting & self-motivated: you’re confident in your abilities, willing to take on responsibilities, and manage your own agendas and work scopes. Actively seek and respond to feedback.

  • You can communicate diligently: you’re able to understand the importance of maintaining regular communication with our team, our partners, affiliates, and our customers. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

  • You’re never complacent: you strive to recognise that things can always be better than they currently are and have the confidence to present solutions to any weaknesses or inefficiencies that you see.

  • You have a growth mindset: a desire to grow both personally and professionally.


Desana benefits



  • Share options in the business if the role were to become full time.

  • Flexible and remote work hours with a strong focus on work-life balance.

  • We’re establishing complete salary transparency across the company with clear progression paths.

  • Team drinks, events and trips.

  • Free access to the app and our network of workspaces.

items.content:
Product Owner - Driver Tools

Company: FREE NOW
Location:
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • A/B testing
  • Agile Methodologies
  • Product Management
  • Scrum
  • Team Leadership
  • UX Design

    • Intro

    Do you want to proactively contribute to designing the future of mobility? Are you interested in optimising and developing a key component of the FREE NOW business in a challenging role with a lot of responsibility?

    If the answer is yes, then we have the right role for you based in the heart of Barcelona.

    As Product Owner of the FREE NOW Driver Tools, you are responsible for the optimization of our operation processes and driver self-service via our Driver Tool Products. They are the backbone to operate the business of mobility without limits via our services. Your work will contribute directly to the ongoing success and growth of FREE NOW in one of the most dynamic markets of our times.

    FREE NOW encourages a strong team spirit and simple company culture. Our teams organise themselves in established agile working environments. People at FREE NOW work flexibly and independently. Every single employee is a part of our success story and so, open communication and a fair feedback culture come naturally to us.

    We are passionate problem-solvers who listen and understand before we act. By working together – with each other, customers, drivers and cities - we make things better. Besides a lot of fun and potential to make a real difference, you will have the opportunity to work with the best team in the world (we know, everybody says so, but at FREE NOW it’s true)!

    As Product Owner at FREE NOW you will:

    • Be part of the Driver Tools tribe - the backbone of the operations - in order to push it to its next level
    • Work closely with the product department in Hamburg/Barcelona and stakeholders across Europe
    • Understand the users of the tools through working with Business Intelligence, executing tests and overseeing UX/UI research, in order to find out and work on the main problems
    • Define and communicate product requirements and specifications by thinking creatively about how to solve problems that have never been solved before at this scale
    • Collaborate with key stakeholders, engineers and designers to define a winning strategy
    • Shape the product roadmap together with our developers, the Prioritization Committee and stakeholders
    • Maintain a prioritized product backlog in partnership with the technical team
    • Fail fast, learn fast and move fast to deliver real customer and business value
    • Adapt and understand different cultures and market environments. Traveling to our offices around Europe is key
    • Work closely with our teams to improve the development process across our European markets

    Main requirements

    • At least 2 years of product experience in a fast-moving environment
    • Leadership—you can motivate your teammates to build amazing products. You’re great at making tough decisions in a sea of ambiguity and keeping everyone on track
    • Superb communication—you have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You make complex ideas understandable and craft specs that are easy for multiple audiences to consume
    • Technical know-how—you have a solid understanding of how software is made and how it works.
    • Art of Ambiguity- A smooth sea never made skilled sailors. You have to be able to make decisions with imperfect information in a fast-moving environment
    • UX fluency—you know the latest user experience trends and can empathise with users to create new, novel and simple solutions.
    • Languages - You have written and spoken proficiency in English and Spanish. German is a plus 

    Perks

    • Flexible working hours and intensive Fridays
    • Gym membership
    • Quarterly team-building activities (karting, bowling, laser tag, escape rooms, barbecues/calçotades,etc.)
    • Yearly off-site hacking weeks
    • Hacking days and occasional trips to our HQ in Hamburg
    • Weekly free buffet breakfasts in the office
    • Health insurance with basic dental coverage
    • 25 days annual leave plus your birthday off
    • A monthly mobility allowance for free taxi rides
    • The opportunity to use the latest technologies and implement your own ideas
    • Working with agile methodologies following Spotify's engineering culture
    • Flexible learning and development opportunities through internal and external workshops, events and conferences
    • Be part of a motivated and innovative team with flat hierarchies
    • Free language lessons
    • Beautiful office at the heart of Barcelona
    • All the usual start-up goodies like free fruit, unlimited drinks, after-work beers and many more!

items.title: Moment: SEO/SEM Analyst
items.content:
SEO/SEM Analyst

The Role
Run organic and paid search for the Moment Shop, the largest online store for photography, filmmaking, and travel. The role is bigger than Moment the gear maker. It extends to the gear, apps, and photography trips we sell in the Moment Shop. This means supporting over 30 different brands and making our store the place you shop before your next trip.

On one side you’ll be following the traditional role for search in making sure every article, trip, and product page is authoritative. This means managing both our organic and paid efforts to rank for the searches that matter. This also extends to multiple search boxes with Google, Amazon, Youtube, and iTunes to name a few. If people are searching for photography, filmmaking, and travel we want to win these searches.

On the other side, you get to work creatively with our content and commerce teams as they explore what content to publish and what products to sell. You will be collaborating with them from the beginning, using data to help them make better decisions. We expect search boxes to be an integral part of the new campaigns we launch, therefore search will have a seat at the table during inception.

We’re looking for an analyst with a methodical approach who appreciates creative collaboration.

What you’ll be working on
+ Collaborating with our content, commerce, and travel teams to provide insights on what content they should be publishing, gear to be carrying, and trips to be running.
+ Supporting new campaigns with all of the SEO and SEM.
+ Analyzing a lot of search data to find cheaper opportunities.
+ Creating, managing, and optimizing our SEM campaigns.
+ Working with fellow analysts on the team to forecast traffic from search, by platform.
+ Using and managing our SEO tracking tools.
+ Working with designers and engineers to make changes that improve our SEO results.
+ Building and maintaining dashboards in Looker (our BI tool).
+ Customer service, because everyone on the team does a few hours per week. And we mean everyone in the company.

You need these qualifications
+ Passionate about photography and travel.
+ Organized, detailed, and a simple communicator. Your analysis should be easy to follow.
+ 2+ years managing SEO and SEM campaigns.
+ Deep experience with either excel or SQL for data analysis.
+ Experience forecasting search traffic.
+ Experience building dashboards for others to understand our results.
+ Experience with Google’s platform.
+ Experience with Amazon, YouTube, and iTunes a very big plus.
+ Experience at e-commerce, media, or creative agency a big plus.
+Experience in a remote culture is helpful.

Compensation And Benefits
The Moment culture is about ownership so the more you take on the more you make. Otherwise, we keep compensation simple...

+ Equity in the company.
+ A salary.
+ Medical insurance or $550 per month to do what you want.
+ A free Moment Trip every year.
+ Moment gear.
+ A $500 stipend per year to spend on your own equipment.
+ Three company offsites per year.
+ Unlimited vacation.

Are you in?
Apply here on Angel List.

items.title: Hubstaff: Growth Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Growth Marketing Manager

As the Growth Marketing Manager, you’ll be responsible for leading and assisting marketing initiatives meant to increase traffic and trials. You will use your broad skillset to present new ideas and opportunities to help grow Hubstaff through new and existing channels and retargeting efforts. Thrilling, right? You will also help build and monitor automations, and report back with suggestions on next steps. 

Hubstaff is a fully remote company with team members all around the globe. For this position, though, only candidates in time zones within 2 hours of EST will be considered.

Responsibilities


Growth

  • Develop/promote new channels and drive traffic to Hubstaff website to get more trials for our products.
  • Manage our outreach team
  • Influencer outreach & collaboration (blogs, videos, podcasts, etc.)
  • Including cold email outreach campaigns
  • Modify/design the process of reaching out to influencers/content owners for content/brand
  • Own the reporting/results of outreach
  • Design and implement A/B tests for our site, emails, ads, and popups
  • Video search optimization
  • Analyze listicle blog posts and suggest reformatting top converters to video
  • Manage youtube rankings
  • Paid (google ads, facebook, twitter)
  • Advertising optimization
  • Facebook
  • Google
  • Getapp / capterra 
  • Content promotion via paid
  • App store advertising
  • Podcast advertising
  • Retargeting
  • Retargeting trials
  • Retargeting failed trials
  • Retargeting visitors
  • Content retargeting
  • Working with the Content team for ad text and look


Automation

  • Scaling and automating the growth processes
    • Manage ActiveCampaign marketing automation platform and marketing email communication
    • Segment lists based on behaviors like past email engagement and website and blog interactions (content downloads, site page visits, etc.).
    • Measure results and optimize the lead nurturing workflows for these segments to convert leads into customers.
  • Make sure pixels are on all of our pages and that we have a way to remarket to everyone that sees specific pages 

Requirements

  • Experience with email marketing, lead nurturing, marketing automation, and web analytics
  • Experience with deploying and testing ads
  • Understanding and experience in CRO methodology
  • Deep understanding of analytics
  • Ability to work autonomously
  • Comfortable only meeting with your co-workers on a screen versus in real life. (We do have fun retreats, though, so you can actually meet them.)
  • Good suggestions for new shows to watch, music to listen to, or new travel destinations to visit. 

Bonus points - tell us about them!

  • Experience with ActiveCampaign, VWO, Woopra, Hubstaff, and/or Hubstaff Tasks
  • Ability to build landing pages
  • What we love about Hubstaff is being able to have a real-life and do work you genuinely enjoy. So, it’s a plus if you have any hobbies or interests outside of the work grind. 

Work breakdown

60% direct work to Increase traffic and trials
30% completion of marketing projects
10% advertising


Hubstaff is a 100% distributed team that values:

- Freedom
- Flexibility
- Hard work
- Data-driven decisions
- Having a great time
- Building a product that is doing well 

Sound good? We think so! Apply and let us know how you'd be a good fit for the Hubstaff team. Who knows, you could be our next Hubstaff-ian! (Hubstaff-er? Hubstaff-ist? We’re working on that one.) 

We look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Inbound Marketing Strategist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Inbound Marketing Strategist at SmartBug Media

Remote
  • New York, NY
  • Full Time
  • Consulting
  • Experienced

Company Overview

SmartBug Media is a fast-growing and nationally recognized inbound marketing agency. We’ve built our name and client base by delivering game-changing marketing campaigns that increase traffic, leads, customers, and brand value. That’s why we are recommended by some of the biggest names in inbound marketing and maintain a client roster that’s growing by the day. We are a 56-person remote company that believes you shouldn’t have to compromise work/life balance in order to deliver great work, and we believe that you can do this from anywhere.

Job Summary

This is a roll-up-your sleeves and get it done senior marketing consulting position.

Marketing Strategists at SmartBug Media have an important role serving as the liaison between your Client and SmartBug Media, as well as overseeing all activities required to help those Clients meet their goals and objectives. This means you’ll play a lead role in executing inbound and content marketing activities that include blogging, social media, marketing, SEO and marketing automation while leading Client communication and education. You’ll also be responsible for analyzing each Client’s marketing analytics, creating reports and recommending future strategies and tactics.

We know your leadership is what generates renewal business and increased trust and responsibility with our clients. That’s why our Marketing Strategists are compensated for account growth and incremental revenue brought in. That doesn’t make this a sales position. It’s not. It means that you get to participate in the financial growth of your accounts.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Create the vision and marketing strategy for your clients, then work with your team of consultants, copywriters, designers and developers to deliver on that strategy and vision.
  • Create new clients’ Inbound Marketing Playbook and Gap Analysis based on client and customer interviews, research and collaboration with our team.
  • Serve as the primary liaison and representative of SmartBug Media for your clients you are the extension of their team and will be expected to know their business as well as they do.
  • Assist and empower clients with the results, knowledge, content and tools to not only get their buy-in, but to evangelize their success through their organization.
  • Become an expert at inbound marketing tactics including blogging, social media marketing, search engine optimization, eBook/white paper/video content creation, website updates, email marketing, and others.
  • Become a HubSpot and SmartBug process ninja and keep up with software updates and best practices, educating your teammates as required.
  • Execute your clients’ inbound marketing plans proactively in order to meet schedules, performance, and budget goals.
  • Take the lead in creating monthly performance reports to highlight wins, areas of improvement and recommendations for future programs.
  • Stay informed about inbound marketing industry developments and be able to utilize these developments to your clients’ benefit.
  • Become the resident expert on your clients industry and marketing.
  • Contribute to client and internal content development.
  • Practice your craft by contributing to SmartBug Media’s blog and social media presence.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned
  • Have fun and make some great friends!

Qualifications and Skills

  • Authorization to work in the U.S. without employer sponsorship
  • 5+ years experience building comprehensive marketing campaigns
  • 2-5 years experience with online marketing and social media
  • B.A. or B.S. degree
  • Hands-on experience with HubSpot required – you are a power use that uses it in your day-to-day
  • Track record of building multi-channel campaigns that yield substantial results
  • Demonstrated ability to think creatively and create campaigns based on customer requirements
  • Passion for the Internet and marketing with a strong understanding of inbound marketing
  • Demonstrate strategic thinking and independent management skills
  • Able to find and assimilate market and customer data into marketing strategies
  • Proven relationship building skills and client communication experience
  • Strong work ethic with a positive and enthusiastic attitude
  • Strong understanding of all social media platforms
  • Working knowledge of search engine optimization
  • Working knowledge of email marketing best practices and CAN-SPAM compliance
  • Desire to learn on your own and keep up with inbound marketing and Internet marketing developments and best practices
  • Great writing skills and strong understanding of how to write SEO-friendly content
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • Proficiency in blogging platforms such as a WordPress
  • Experience working remotely in similar roles strongly preferred

Interview Process:

  • Phone Screen
  • Video call with hiring team
  • Semifinal video interview with VP of Client Services
  • Sample campaign assessment
  • Reference checking
  • Final video interview with SmartBug’s CEO

Benefits and Perks

  • Generous compensation package with performance incentives
  • Health insurance with company contribution
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Paid time off
  • 401(k) with employer matching
  • Flexible spend plan
  • Company-funded short-term disability and life insurance
  • Long-term disability
  • Annual leadership conference, SmartBugapalooza’
  • Training budget
  • Flexibility of working remote

About SmartBug Media
SmartBug Media is a globally recognized Intelligent Inbound marketing agency that assists businesses in growing revenue through content marketing, sales enablement, web development, marketing automation, and PR. For over 10 years, SmartBug has helped businesses increase qualified leads, close customers, and enhance the reach and loyalty of their brands. We are a 60+ person remote company that believes you shouldn’t have to compromise work/life balance to deliver great work, and we think that you can do this from anywhere.

Apply for job

items.title: Marketing Intern
items.content:
The Intro is the most efficient way to find someone for a date: wave goodbye to swiping, we're making it easier and faster to meet someone in person for a truly human connection.


We are looking for marketing interns to help drive users to the beta version of The Intro’s mobile app. You can work remotely but will interact regularly with our experienced CEO, helping to raise awareness and drive new users to the app, using a combination of digital marketing and partnerships.


If you're looking to learn more about marketing this would be a great opportunity and we are happy to be flexible around your other commitments.

items.title: Product Manager
items.content:
We are an international team of lawyers and technologists, working to reinvent the startup law experience from the ground up. Clara graduated from Techstars Dubai’s class of 2019 and closed a USD 2,000,000 seed round before expanding into London. We move fast (but thoughtfully), and are looking for a talented and impact-oriented Product Manager to join us.


The Role:


You will be the product owner for your area, initially managing a defined roadmap which will ultimately become yours to own and shape through the use of data, internal feedback and market assessment. 



  • Collaborate with internal teams to shape, scope and prioritise new product opportunities within the broader product roadmap.

  • Develop written user requirements and define success metrics for new product features, moving quickly with Design and Engineering teams to execute, test and validate your ideas and address any blockers through problem solving and coordination with your stakeholders.

  • Research, troubleshoot, diagnose and recommend solutions to increasingly complex business problems.

  • Ensure user acceptance testing is performed prior to go-live launch of new features.

  • Assist in prioritising enhancements and triaging bug fixes.

  • Monitor key conversion metrics and A/B tests to support in the continued optimisation of your product area. continual optimization of the product and business plan.


We are looking for the following:



  • At least three years of demonstrable experience of managing features and/or products throughout the full development lifecycle in a B2B or SaaS environment.

  • Excited about the idea of taking a broad product vision and leading the ideation, technical development, and launch of products that are making a dent in the future of the internet

  • Experience integrating usability studies, research, market analysis and customer development into product requirements

  • Obsessive over continuous product improvement and the ability to optimise for shipping a portfolio of small, medium and large releases

  • Data driven: using both quantitative and qualitative data to inform decisions and priorities.

  • Growth mindset: demonstrable experience of delivering products, features and/or optimisations with the results to back it up.

  • Naturally curious: someone who wants to truly understand their product – how it works, who uses it and hypothesising on how it can be improved

  • Hands-on experience working with agile methodologies, but isn’t dogmatic about a single approach.

  • A basic understanding of key startup legal concepts such as equity and intellectual property is a plus.

  • Experience working with remote development teams preferred.

items.title: Social Media and Content Creation Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)

items.content:
About Flora & Curl Haircare


Hello, we’re Flora & Curl! We are a UK based haircare start up formulating products with plant-based ingredients for healthy curls. You can find our botanical haircare products in Denmark, Norway, India, Bermuda, Spain, France, Germany, Switzerland and in the USA. Rooted in science, backed by nature, our beauty products are crafted with care and conscience. We are looking for a creative Social Media Content Design Executive to join our team.


About You


You are a creative thinker who is able to generate engaging and creative content in alignment with a beauty brand. You pride yourself in delivering the high quality and professional work, no matter how big or small the job.


Your Role and Key Responsibilities
Deliver Print and Web ready artwork and content for our social media channels and email campaigns.



  • Deliver creative assets for Flora & Curl Social Media accounts (Instagram stories, posts, Twitter and Facebook) in line with brand and platform guidelines (including still and animated/gifs)

  • Deliver email designs for weekly newsletter campaigns in Mailchimp(ability to code them is a plus)

  • Process and edit photography and videography files to make them fit-for-use for digital marketing

  • Manage our Asset files, keeping them up-to-date and well-organised at all times

  • Working closely with brand director to maintain marketing schedule and social media content calendar


We would love to hear from you if you have the following skills:
Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator or InDesign, HTML/CSS
Photography, animation or video editting experience is a plus
Proficiency with Mailchimp and its analytics


Our top candidates would also have:



  • University degree or equivalent, and/or transferable work experience in previous role

  • Experience in writing, developing engaging content and/or copy for a beauty brand or beauty related media.

  • Experience in social media management and managing a marketting calendar - Ability to analyse, measure and react to social media KPI’s to guide decisions and recommendations and able to think strategically about social media growth


Location: UK (Birmingham or London) or Remote: work from anywhere.
Commission: Paid 

Application: Provide links to your porfolio or past body of work (blog, emails, videos, graphics, social media). Please include a Cover Letter in your application.

items.title: Epic Beaker Analyst (relocation available)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Bring your Blood Bank System expertise to Tower Health, a growing system. Be a key player in implementing, developing, and maintaining the Epic system along with third-party systems. Some flexibility to work from home exists.

Your contributions will include:

  • Analysis - Investigating processes to understand operations. Researching, analyzing, and understanding workflows of end users.
  • Building & Testing - Developing, testing, deploying, and evaluating appropriate interface solutions and ongoing maintenance needs for sustainable processes. Appropriately configuring systems to improve processes, add efficiencies, and promote patient safety.
  • Troubleshooting - Resolving integration/mapping issues. Methodically approaching problems or processes to troubleshoot and resolve. Developing application and integrated test scripts. Participating in thoroughly testing builds. Providing on-call support based on upon application needs.
  • Independently Interacting - Establishing credibility at all levels and build partnerships with customers and colleagues. Working closely with Senior Analysts and technical IT staff to implement, upgrade and support software systems. Comfortably presenting information to colleagues and end users and tailoring communication to the audience. Communicating, collaborating, and sharing knowledge with team.
  • Developing Knowledge/Skills - Obtaining an in-depth knowledge of the Epic platform for the supported application and a general knowledge of other applications supported along with a detailed understanding of the integration of modules within the Epic Enterprise.



Qualifications

  • Blood bank system experience is strongly preferred. Certification in and experience with Epic Beaker build or relevant experience with build with another EHR vendor will be considered.
  • Excellent communication skills and customer-service oriented. Collaboration with IT staff and end users is key for this position.
  • A basic understanding of the Windows environment and an eagerness to learn, support, and tenaciously troubleshoot supporting technologies.
  • Bachelor s degree is preferred. Combination of relevant education and experience may be considered in lieu of degree.
  • Proven critical thinking skills, follow through, and attention to detail.

items.title: RADIANT/IMAGING ANALYST
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
RADIANT/IMAGING ANALYST

United States

New





Healthcare IT



2 days agoPost Date



19208602Requisition #



Apply for JobShare this JobSign Up for Job Alerts

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

CTG is seeking experienced Epic Radiant Analyst for a short term opportunity in the South region to provide remote activation support for a large multi-hospital Epic implementation. Target start date is mid-October. This is approximately 4 weeks. Estimated 40 hours/week during the orientation period and approximately 60 hours/week during activation support weeks. May require some on-call as well.



Job Title- Epic - Radiant Analyst

Job Description-



? Must have strong leadership and communication skills.

? Must be able to trouble shoot, prioritize and remediate go live issues with a new activation.



Duration- 1 months

REQUIRED SKILLS:

Must be current with NVTs for Radiant

Must have experience with a multi-hospital organization implementation



? Minimum of five years' progressive clinical/healthcare experience with demonstrated experience with Radiant and other imaging services.

? Strong problem-solving & troubleshooting skills

? Self-starter with demonstrated teamwork & communication skills

? Excellent communication and collaboration skills



Preference - radiology and cardiology imaging and pacs experience







If interested, please apply online, or email resumes to:...@ctg.com

CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.

CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).

CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.

CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.

* Education Level: High School Diploma/GED (?11 years)

items.title: Marketing Intern
items.content:
The Intro is the most efficient way to find someone for a date: wave goodbye to swiping, we're making it easier and faster to meet someone in person for a truly human connection.


We are looking for a marketing intern to help drive users to the beta version of The Intro’s mobile app. You can work remotely but will interact regularly with our experienced CEO, helping to raise awareness and drive new users to the app, using a combination of digital marketing and partnerships.


If you're looking to learn more about marketing this would be a great opportunity and we are happy to be flexible should you have other commitments.

items.title: eCommerce Analyst - Remote
items.content:
Do you love data and could spend your entire week sifting through Google Analytics and GTM accounts? Are you looking for an opportunity to thrive and flex both your analytical and technical skills at a fast growing start-up?
We are looking for an eCommerce Analyst to help implement strategies and solutions for our Elevar PRO customers that deliver exceptional results.
This is a high-growth role where you will be expected to learn on the fly with new solutions that Elevar delivers, adapt to changes in our business, and help maintain our lead in onsite tagging and optimization expertise. Your ideas and expertise will be critical in our growth!

What you will do:
Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with our Pro customers by understanding their business goals and pain points in order to deliver solutions that help improve their business.Execute Google Analytics & GTM audits and implement recommended changes across client accounts.Collaborate with our customers to develop and implement Analytics and GTM solutions specific to their needs.Ideate Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) strategies for our customers, including implementing a/b tests using Google Optimize.Act as an expert liaison for our customer support team for Google Analytics and GTM questions specific to our Shopify GTM App.Be an expert voice on delivering onsite and eCommerce solutions.
Your Qualifications:3+ years experience in digital commerceExperience in eCommerce and Google Analytics requiredExceptional multi-tasking and context-switching capabilitiesStrong collaboration and communication skillsMeasurement, reporting, and other data analytics skills preferredExperience in working in a startup environmentExperience in managing projects or client accounts

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) QM -Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP

We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP QM specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong QM experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to.

What You Will Be Doing

- The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Quality Management (QM) modul
- SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the QM modules in the SAP functional area
- Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution
- Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support,
- Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices,
- Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas,
- Supports multiple projects and BAU activities,
- Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration
- Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles

What You Need for this Position

- 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment, several S/4 HANA implementations under your belt.
- Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success,
- Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite,
- Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls,
- Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation,
- Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles
- Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape,
- Experience in designing SAP software components,
- Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools,
- Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies,
- Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment,
- College or University (IT /Business) Degree,
- Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of QM and experience with S4/HANA
- Expert SAP technical knowledge,
- Expert Integration understanding,
- Strong spoken and written English,
- Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP QM specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

items.content:
Language Drops

Mobile UA Expert (specialized in ASO and SEO)

verified
EU-only
**Remote, permanent, full-time (40h/week) position** If you have a soft spot for bootstrapped, profitable companies with a meaningful product, and you would like to hone your cutting edge ASO and SEO expertise in a refreshing work environment, you might quite like this rare new position at Drops. **About us:** Drops’ goal is to turn language learning into a delightful game while ensuring effective learning. Drops is one of the top10 most innovative education companies according to FastCompany. Our app is in the Appstore for 3+ years, teaches 32 languages, was featured by both the App Store and Play Store multiple times - App of the Year in 2018 on the Play Store - and the company is still run by the founders. We are a small, super-capable remote team mainly spread across Europe (we have a small marketing crew in California) . We’re working synchronously, so time zones matter for us. We communicate via Slack, Github and Monday. We want to be the no.1 app for vocabulary learning and we are getting there quickly with our current user base of 15 million, a monthly active of >1,500,000 and an average store rating of 4.7. You can find us here: http://drops.app.link/ # Responsibilities  **Here’s what we’re currently after:** * You are capable of bringing the bar even higher and bring new ideas, pushing a well-oiled machine even further. Keeping in mind, that we’re ranking top 5 for most relevant kws and kw combination in key markets already, awarded App of the Year on Google Play and App of the Day multiple times on PlayStore - you’re capable of getting us to the next level! * You don’t just understand and use the best practices ASO but know every single tiny factor that moves the discovery and conversion needle. You are up to date, see and leverage new opportunities before others get there. * You want to own and manage SEO projects and tests. Our web presence and traffic is not as established - and we’ll rely on your skills and ideas succeeding on the web. * You provide a constant stream of fresh, potentially high impact ideas both for ASO and SEO discovery and conversion. * We value clear and honest communication and transparency, it’s the linchpin of our culture and current success and independency. * You will be involved in both high and low level decision making and will be available during European working hours (9AM - 6PM GMT). * We are looking for a missionary rather than a mercenary. # Requirements ♀️ ♂️ **Skills and experience You have:** * ASO - App Store Optimization (both Apple Appstore and Google Play) * SEO * Mobile Paid User Acquisition - Adsense, Facebook, Instagram, any newer platform * Web Paid User Acquisition - Adsense * Strong analytical skills - AB testing, SEO tools, appstore asset testing, variety of ASO tools, etc. * Experience with Chinese Android appstores (Oppo, Huawei, Tencent, etc) is a big plus! * Email marketing experience is a plus - sales funnels, drip campaigns, using email as content marketing channel, etc.  **You will:** * Keep your eyes on the bleeding edge of ASO and find new opportunities arising due to the ever-changing appstore environment and algorithms * Keep yourself updated with the latest SEO moves affecting us, scanning for opportunities. * Plan, prioritize and help execute the next level ASO game for Drops, and help guide team members with execution. * Plan, prioritize and help execute our SEO projects and work closely with our content marketer to build strong high-ranking keyword portfolio. * Help us get our main programmatic SEO project (the Drops Visual Dictionary) to improve and reach its potential. * Experiment with paid UA channels and manage campaigns while optimizing for positive ROI * Potentially work hand-in-hand with our newsletter marketer/content marketer to optimize our email funnels and come up with new ideas to maximize open rates, user retention and revenue from e-mail sales. **PERKS** * All the perks of remote working * An awesomely compact 19 person team * Yearly educational allowance * Fitness allowance * High-end Apple hardware and ergonomic accessories * 30 days of holiday per year (including Christmas and other holidays) * ✈️ Quarterly team gathering somewhere in the world (Amsterdam, Iceland, Lisbon and Budapest were previous locations) #Location - EU-only

items.title: Constructor.io: Technical Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=18, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Technical Product Manager

The job

Constructor.io's mission is to empower our customers to build great search that drives growth by anticipating users’ needs. Our product managers are charged with empathizing with our customers in order to help to shape the future of Constructor.io.

We are seeking an exceptional Product Manager who can represent the voice of customer with empathy and passion while they dive deep with engineering to understand technical challenges and constraints; work with sales to shape new feature go-to-market; and coordinate ideal messaging with marketing.

This person will be as talented at communication as they are at analysis and user discovery. The ideal candidate should be just as comfortable discussing search internally as they are with external partners and current or prospective customers.

Day-to-day you will
  • Work with engineering to define the product roadmap and execute backlog while balancing efficient delivery with high-quality work.
  • Orchestrate go-to-market activities with sales and marketing.
  • Conduct customer and user interviews to inform product priorities.
  • Ensure coordination between teams (front-end, back-end, devops, data science) to deliver customer value.
  • Work to support major new customer onboarding where necessary.
  • Research market trends, and make sure we're planning for where the market will be in a few years, not just today
You would be a good fit if:
  • You have exceptional technical understanding - bonus points if you have previous experience with search solutions.
  • You seek an entrepreneurial environment and have a track-record of delivering results in a high-growth environment.
  • You have excellent analytical abilities and can effectively use data to drive decisions.
  • You have demonstrated success working with teams including a significant number of remote members, particularly in engineering roles.
  • You are motivated to deliver value in production and aren't satisfied with works-in-theory solutions.
  • You are collaborative, value learning and want to accomplish great things.
About us

Constructor.io is a search-as-a-service company that differentiates itself by taking on the hard problem of ranking and behavioral optimization of search results on our customers' behalf. We believe that search is -- at its core -- a data science problem and are using machine learning to provide our customers with the best possible experience. Customers of note include Safeway/Albertsons, Build.com, Expensify and Jet.com.

Promoting a diverse and inclusive culture of learning is core to Constructor.io's values. Constructor.io is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

Benefits
  • Unlimited vacation time
  • A competitive compensation package including stock options
  • Company sponsored health coverage
  • Stocked snacks
  • A pet friendly workplace
  • Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact
  • Monthly company contribution into your commuter benefits for local SF employees
  • Remote friendly to individuals within a few time zones of US PST

items.title: DreamSpring: Product Manager
items.content:
Product Manager

We are looking for a Product Manager to join our team either at our Albuquerque headquarters or remotely within one of the states in our region: Arizona, Colorado, Nevada, New Mexico, and Texas. DreamSpring is in the midst of a three-year project to overhaul our technology infrastructure and implement a state-of-the-art lending platform. It will be the only end-to-end lending platform in our industry, and is fully owned and operated by DreamSpring, allowing it to be customized to meet our (and our customers’) needs. This will have a transformational effect on DreamSpring, our clients, and the sector of lenders supporting underserved entrepreneurs.  


As our Product Manager, you will play a critical role in managing the evolution of our core customer and lending technology platforms. You will work to understand the vision of DreamSpring and execute our strategy, working with our team of engineers in Bangalore, India. You’ll use your passion for technology to help us carry out our mission of creating lasting social and economic change in the United States through entrepreneurship.



What you’ll be doing:


  • You will manage and coordinate product development projects.
  • You will lead product strategy, vision, roadmaping, and requirement gathering to help us scale our loan products, servicing, and client offerings.
  • You will evaluate and resolve technical feasibility, design optimization, user adoption and production issues.
  • You will research and monitor existing client base and industry developments and identify potential new product opportunities.
  • You will plan and prioritize product features and manage product backlogs.

Skills and Experience:


  • You have a passion for DreamSpring’s mission and are motivated by the ability to make a difference in underserved communities through financial technology.
  • You have at least three years’ experience in product management and end user interface.
  • You have the ability to translate business needs into a technology roadmap, working across teams and with senior leadership to develop and execute on a product vision.
  • You are inspired by technology and can inspire others.
  • Experience in financial technology or financial services is a plus.

DreamSpring offers an excellent total compensation package, including competitive base salary, the opportunity for exciting incentive pay, health and dental coverage, retirement benefits, and generous paid time off.

items.title: Digital Campaigner
items.content:
Digital Campaigner at National Domestic Workers Alliance - NDWA

Remote | High-paying
  • Employment Type
  • Compensation

The National Domestic Workers Alliance (NDWA) is the nation’s leading voice for respect, recognition and labor standards for nannies, housecleaners and home care workers. Through leadership development, strategic campaigns and alliance building, we are raising employment standards for the domestic workforce while building a powerful movement for social and global justice. The Alliance formed in 2007 at the US Social Forum. For the first several years of its existence, NDWA was solely a network of affiliate organizations, independent local domestic worker organizations. In 2016, NDWA launched a membership association to allow domestic workers around the country–including in locations where there is no local organization–to join NDWA, helping the domestic worker movement build the power necessary to successfully advance an ambitious agenda. NDWA is currently made up of 60 affiliate organizations, 4 chapters, 3 organizing projects, and a network of thousands of individual workers throughout the U.S.

NDWA seeks a Digital Campaigner to use social media platforms and online advocacy tools to build, grow and activate online communities to connect domestic workers to the organization and our campaigns, and to each other. The Digital Campaigner’s main focus will be developing online domestic worker leadership, and online and online-offline mobilization of domestic workers in NDWA’s campaigns.

Responsibilities:

  • Utilize online technologies, specifically social media communities or other digital tools, to build a broad base of domestic workers, including telegraphing opportunities for workers to be active and involved in local and federal policy and industry campaigns and supporting workers using online tools to take those actions.
  • Monitor NDWA’s worker-facing online presence; respond to worker inquiries; identify, assess and act on trends in how workers relate to NDWA in online spaces.
  • Maintain private member social conversations, including community moderation and content generation.
  • Execute digital strategies for worker recruitment and conversion to active membership.
  • Understand and apply data-informed decision making, including analysis, reporting, and targeting.
  • Identify potential domestic worker digital leaders. Train a core group of leaders on digital organizing, advocacy and networking skills, and support these leaders in carrying out online leadership roles
  • Track worker engagement across digital channels and utilize analysis for audience understanding, targeting and refinement.
  • Support the development, delivery and facilitation of online programming and digital learning and connection.
  • Create and maintain weekly reporting, including data analysis and metrics.
  • Write as needed for online ads, video scripts, websites, SMS, and email.

General qualifications:

  • Minimum 3 years digital experience, ideally with online organizing or managing online communities.
  • A native or fluent and culturally competent Spanish speaker; excellent writing, translation and interpretation skills in both Spanish and English.
  • Excellent time management skills, including ability to meet deadlines, work successfully in a team, handle supervision, and attention to detail
  • Strong research and communication skills.
  • Willingness to be coached, experiment, apply lessons and iterate on the work continuously.

Data and tech qualifications:

  • Proficiency in strategic use of Facebook and other social media platforms, as well as social media management systems and online tools. Direct experience with Facebook Messenger and WhatsApp a plus.
  • Familiarity with digital organizing strategies and online to offline organizing.
  • Familiarity with data informed online organizing, including multi-channel digital engagement tracking, list segmentation and CRMs. Direct experience with Action Network, Relay, Mobile Commons, Quickbase and/or other advocacy platforms a plus.
  • Comfortable working with online campaign tools: including basic coding in HTML, the ability to use queries to segment emails to include and exclude key constituencies, and set up A/B experiments.
  • Familiarity with digital strategies for engaging communities with limited access to technology.

Organizing qualifications:

  • Experience as a digital or field organizer for a social justice organization.
  • Ability to relate to and work with diverse groups of people as well as an understanding of the daily challenges faced by low-income communities of color; previous experience working with marginalized communities or domestic workers.
  • Experience with leadership development, popular education methodology, and strong facilitation/training skills.

FLSA Status: Exempt
Location: Remote
Start Date: November 1, 2019
Reports to: Senior Field Director

Women, People of Color, People with Disabilities and LGBTQ people strongly urged to apply. Applications will only be accepted electronically. Please submit a cover letter, resume, and one professional writing sample in English AND in Spanish to this page. This position will remain open until filled.

Apply for job

items.content:
Technical Outreach Editor at Wolfram Research

Remote

Location: Remote

Wolfram, creator of Mathematica, Wolfram|Alpha and the Wolfram Language, is looking for a Technical Outreach Editor who has a solid understanding of the current technology space to create and edit technical content for its US corporate and industry communications efforts.

This position requires proactive and reactive content creation and editing. The ideal candidate will have a solid grasp of the Wolfram Language, Mathematica and Wolfram|Alpha. Strong organization, communication, project management and copywriting skills are essential. Candidates must thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, distributed-team environment.

Responsibilities

  • Managing, editing and creating content for web articles, prioritizing specific requests and remaining active in subject areas
  • Providing support for additional online efforts, including Wolfram-specific content creation
  • Using gained editing knowledge to positively impact other collaborative virtual media, such as Reddit, Quora and other online forums as appropriate
  • Providing team support for blog-content dissemination through additional outlets
  • Supporting upper management through research projects and side assignments

Requirements

  • Working knowledge of the current technology space
  • Exceptional technical or scientific writing, editing and proofreading skills
  • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with distributed teams
  • Attention to detail and quality
  • Ability to distill complex technical information for distribution to a less technical audience

Location: Remote

Wolfram is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at its company. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, individuals with disabilities and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply.

Apply for job

items.title: FeedOtter: Part-Time SaaS Digital Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Part-Time SaaS Digital Marketing Manager

 
FeedOtter is an email marketing software company used by Facebook, Adobe, and top brands to automate and streamline email creation and delivery.

We are hiring a part-time digital marketing professional to be responsible for our online marketing operations 20-30 hours per week.   I envision a regular Monday marketing meeting where you and I discuss objectives, ideas, priorities for the week and then you could take and run.

Currently we use a patchwork of consultants to get things done but I wish to improve marketing across the board with some consistent effort and less reliance on myself. 

*This is a part-time remote position based in the US only. 


Responsibilities Include:
  • Consistent customer communication; product update, new feature, and regular emailing
  • Consistent social strategy, we have none
  • Management of paid ad spend; we run retargeting ads right now but there are some aspects that could be improved. We have a solid consultant in this area so you can manage her or takeover
  • Kickstart partner marketing; seek out and come up with initiates to do blog-post-exchanges, or other co-marketing projects with synergistic companies.
  • Content Marketing; right now we do the best we can producing content BUT I would really like to overhaul this area as well and really focus on creating content that draws in our ideal customer base both from an interest and an SEO perspective.
 
There is budget to use freelancers for design assets and content production.  I am looking for someone that can provide consistent ownership of this area so steady progress is happening at all times.

Requirements:
  • 3+ years experience in SaaS marketing
  • Knowledge of current marketing technologies and trends
  • Basic competence in all areas of digital marketing; SEO, Content, Email, Product, Paid etc..
  • Knowledge of Marketo, Pardot, or similar marketing automation tools
  • Excellent written skills with demonstrable content, blog posts, media available for review
  • Experience managing contractors and other remote create assets

We'll work 100% remote, use Zoom, Skype, Slack etc...  The position is super-flexible although I would like to keep our weekly meeting semi-sacred.

Benefits
  • $30-40K Annually Based on Experience

items.title: Help Scout: Product Marketer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Product Marketer

The Help Scout platform helps more than 10,000 small and midsize businesses in 140+ countries deliver great customer service. We’re building a product marketing team to help us earn the next 10,000 customers through close collaboration with our product, engineering, design, support, leadership, and(of course) marketing teams. 

Watch this 2-minute video from Justine (the hiring manager) to hear more about what you can expect.

As a Product Marketer on our team, you will:

  • Make it easy for businesses to understand the value of Help Scout. It goes without saying that the ability to foster a deep understanding of our products, customers, and target audience is critical to this role. You’ll be a product expert: filling the gaps between what features we have, what customers are aware of, and use cases for growth.
  • Create messaging that communicates value. Great stories enable us to differentiate from competitors, communicate the value of our products, and share our impact with the world. You’ll use market, customer, and competitive research to create effective messaging frameworks, content, collateral, and sales tools to drive adoption and growth. 
  • Design, develop, and execute cross-functional product launches. You’ll be the point person for product launches, and are responsible for knowing what we’re releasing; who it will benefit; how impactful it will be; and how to best get the word out. That includes creating audience segmentation plans; developing messaging around the value of the new feature; writing copy and content along the customer journey for our self-service and sales-assisted funnels; pulling together the launch plan; coordinating marketing activities; identifying opportunities for iteration and experimentation; and measuring the impact of your campaigns. 
  • Support demand generation, content marketing, and acquisition efforts. From crafting website copy to running a custom video shoot and everything in between, you’ll collaborate with internal teams, freelancers, and agencies to create and maintain an up-to-date product presence across all marketing channels. This will include (but is not limited to) our website, email programs, blog, print materials, digital assets, events, and more. Everything you write sets and reinforces the voice and tone of our brand.
  • Enable our customer-facing teams. You’ll educate our internal customer-facing teams to ensure they’re informed of what we’re releasing, how it will benefit our customers, and how to talk about it. You’ll participate in gathering competitive intelligence; ensuring consistency of our messaging across teams and channels; and producing internal and external product materials including case studies, sales collateral, and internal training sessions. 

About You

  • You’ll need to be skilled in understanding, articulating, and communicating the value of our products to our target audience through creative marketing tactics and programs. 
  • You have superhuman organizational skills, an entrepreneurial spirit, and the capability to bring different teams together to achieve a common goal. You have a track record of getting things done—managing multiple projects and timelines simultaneously.
  • You are empathetic and thoughtful, always putting yourself in the customer’s shoes. You know that the most relevant messages start with understanding how people feel, which includes internal and external partners and stakeholders. 
  • You have a high bar of excellence and leave no stone unturned when it comes to the details. Shipping a campaign with a broken link will temporarily ruin your day (but you’ll quickly recover and learn from the mistake, as will we!).
  • You are an outstanding writer, with a knack for summing up a customer benefit in 10 words or less. You can connect what something does with why the reader should care in a clear, articulate way.
  • You have a thorough, practical understanding of the product marketing process and understand how to balance competing demands and needs while always delivering content and communications that are valuable for your customers.
  • You are excited about being part of a remote-first company! No experience is required—we’re happy to set you up for success.
  • You have worked in B2B SaaS and enjoy the challenges of attracting people and getting them to consider our product. Bonus points for experience with SMB markets or in companies with a hybrid self-service/sales assisted business model. 

Who you’ll work with:

  • Head of Product Marketing – To be hired. You’ll report to this person, while also working closely with Justine Jordan, our CMO, on go-to-market strategy and campaigns. 
  • Ben Henderson — Director of Product, along with our product leads
  • Product Specialists in the Support Team - Product specialists represent the voice of the customer, track and report on customer insights, and take the lead on creating documentation.
  • The Sales Team—The Help Scout sales team inverts the way sales is typically done. They’re passionate about their craft, which entails putting the customer ahead of the sale.
  • …plus teammates in Design, Marketing, Finance, and more!
