items.title: Social Media and Content Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Freelance Social Media & Content Manager (£100 p/w - 10h p/w) 


Who we are


Pretty Bee Fresh is a fast growing eco-startup producing bees wax wraps as a sustainable alternative to plastic and cling film thus helping people to live a more zero-waste lifestyle. Our wraps are sustainable, reusable, antibacterial and bio- degradable. They’re all unique, handcrafted using only the highest quality natural ingredients.


We at Pretty Bee Fresh believe in the importance of giving back to our planet. As a business, we try to reduce our own carbon footprint as much as we can and reuse/recycle materials instead of ditching them after first use.


The fight against plastic is one we can't win alone, hence why we have partnered up with charities like Plastic Oceans UK to promote sustainability and positive change.  We also work with Trees for Cities UK, and plant a tree for every purchase over £50. We’ve had an incredible journey so far and are ready for the next stage.


 


The role


We’re looking for a highly enthusiastic freelance social media and content manager for about 10h per week who can help us boost our social media channels and increase our overall online exposure.


You’d be in charge of managing all things social. From creating engaging social media posts, to writing a monthly newsletter, out of the box social campaigns and driving traffic to our website and online shop. We need someone who can think on their feet, has experience working in the field and shares our passion for sustainability and the environment.


The perfect candidate is forward thinking, creative with a track record of delivering strong marketing activities, can help us define online strategies and is great copywriter.


Our production unit is in Peckham, however given the nature of this job, you can work from the comfort of your own home with occasional meetings at Google Campus near Old Street as well as Skype calls.


 


How to apply


This is a really exciting time to join a fast growing eco-startup and a great opportunity for any creative freelance marketeer looking to take on a few extra hours of work per week.


If this sounds like you then please send us your CV and a quick cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you want to join us. 


We look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Product designer
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=4, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
About us


We are on a journey to make pet healthcare more accessible, and we want you to help us! Did you know that only 8% of health issues are seen by a veterinary professional? In real numbers: pets experience 24 issues per year, but only 2 of them make it to the vet. This isn’t because people are bad at being pet owners — going to the vet can be expensive, and takes a lot of effort, and sometimes it’s even embarrassing. We want to remove all these barriers that stop pet parents from seeking expert care so that our pets can live the long and healthy lives they deserve.


 


Our mission is to empower vets to advocate for their patients wherever and whenever suits them. Our current product provides an app-based approach that allows vets to interact with their patients through a combination of chat and video consultations. The future holds lots of exciting opportunities to expand this into the go-to app for all things pet care related. Gula recently raised a pre-seed round of funding, and off the back of that, we are looking to build the beginnings of our product team, which is where you come in. With a goal like allowing pets to live healthier lives, a fantastic experience across all our user facing products is going to be key to overcoming challenges in changing the way pet owners think about how they interact with their care providers.


 


Our customer facing products right now are in the form of iOS & Android apps written in React Native, with a web-app soon to follow. We envisage most pet owners interacting with their vets through digital means via their mobile devices. To date, most UX work has been done in Sketch, but we are open to any tooling that can do the job well!


Who we’re looking for


You would be the first Product Designer working at Gula, which gives you the opportunity to help architect the ways of working in the product team and put in place what we would consider to be best practices. Your primary responsibility will be to deliver fantastic user experiences across our range of user-facing products, both to pet owners and vets. Here are some projects you might work on in the next six months:



  • Building the base of a design system for Gula.

  • Designing innovative ways for pet owners to communicate with their vet.

  • Redesigning our website to speak to our target customers better.

  • Crafting the language we use to speak to our users.

  • Testing new propositions with our users.

  • Building a library of assets to be used in marketing material.


You might be perfect for this role if most of these apply to you:



  • You have extensive experience designing for iOS and Android

  • You have extensive experience designing for the responsive web

  • You consider a close relationship with the engineering team mandatory for building great products

  • You have worked in a start-up

  • You have experience with user research

  • You have experience with user testing

  • You would describe yourself as an animal lover

  • You are happy working autonomously

  • You love learning new things


Application process


Once we have reviewed your CV and have decided that we could be a great mutual match, we’d start with a short phone call or coffee to tell you more about what we’re trying to achieve at Gula long-term and also to give you some more details about the role. Then if successful there would be a final stage where we’d spend some more time talking about your design thinking, look at some problems together, and you would meet Gula’s CEO Thom to find out more about our values and to see if you’d fit in.


The benefits



  • Pay £55,000-65,000

  • Stock options

  • Flexible hours

  • Working from home when you want

  • 25 days holiday

  • Pick your own hardware up to £2000

  • Training budget

  • Central London office

items.title: Wallaroo Media: Paid Social Media Advertising Manager
items.content:
Paid Social Media Advertising Manager

We are looking for a paid social media advertising manager, to start ASAP. This role is remote. It can be contract or full time. We are looking for someone available for 15-30 hours per week to start. A long term working relationship is the goal. The role is managing ad campaigns, primarily on Facebook and Instagram. Mostly for ecommerce clients. Experience is a must. Case studies/examples of work and results will be required. Apply at the link below.

items.title: Content Marketing Editor
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Content Marketing Editor at Animalz

Remote | International

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (executives, managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the B2B SaaS/tech field.

We are looking for an editor who specializes in online content and who can help our writers improve over time and across clients in structure, tone, style, and on-page SEO. As much teacher as teammate, this person will review every piece of content at least twice — from the outlining phase to the nearly final draft — and use each review as an opportunity to encourage the writer and drive their continued growth in the craft.

“A real editor isn’t just someone you work with; they are your guide. They see your brain doing its thing and learn its weaknesses and abilities, and if they’re really good, they figure out what you need to hear to compensate for the former and accentuate the latter.” – Ariel Levy

An ideal B2B tech/SaaS content editor at Animalz:
  • has a proven track record of successful writing and editing for the web, particularly in B2B/tech/SaaS
  • can communicate why changes should be made, not simply fix errors or improve writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves coaching writers
  • understands the business side of writing & editing
  • is deeply passionate about good content and approaches editing with a creatively curious mindset
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future
Requirements:
  • Proven writing and editing ability
  • Mastery of on-page SEO and how to apply it to each piece of content to provide guidance for writers
  • Ability to understand content strategy and edit content to align with it
  • Desire to help writers improve their craft and elevate their content to the highest quality
  • Experience successfully working with writing/editing customers
  • Basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social media function, how they can work together to get results, and the different writing/stylistic requirements of each
  • Strong interest in the tech/SaaS field and a thorough knowledge of the top content and thought leadership in the field
  • Work in North America’s Eastern time zone to support our writers there and in Europe
Responsibilities:
  • Edit ~15 B2B articles and outlines per week (~1,500 words each), ensuring they comply with the customer strategy and optimizing them for performance
  • Educate our writers around good content in both form/structure and technical aspects (like SEO)
  • Provide support and constructive feedback to writers to help them improve their craft
About Animalz

We’re a remote, eclectic team of current and former scientists, journalists, operations folks with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the position

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote job. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is not a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional endeavors.

Benefits
  • Work from anywhere you like (during EST business hours)
  • Company-sponsored health insurance covering 80% of premium for medical and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year (including holidays)
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Parental leave for both primary (up to 12 weeks) and secondary (up to 6 weeks) care providers
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy a lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and conferences
What’s it like to work at Animalz?

Join us for an hour-long webinar where we discuss careers, growth, and culture at Animalz. We’ll make sure to leave time to answer all your questions.

Grab a seat here. We’d love to have you on a call!

Location: Anywhere in the world

Apply for job

items.title: Teamweek: Digital Marketing Manager (Remote)
items.content:
Digital Marketing Manager (Remote)

If you love to nerd over digital marketing (paid and organic), proactively find new ways to grow, and work on a variety of projects, then we want you!

Teamweek is a SaaS tool for task scheduling, project planning, and team management. We’re looking for a Digital Marketing Manager to improve the profitability of our paid advertising as well as build and grow our organic online presence. Ideally, you’d be happy to find and test new platforms that may work out for us and eventually help us get started with email marketing. If that sounds like you, read on...

What you’ll be doing as a digital marketing manager
  • Plan and manage effective paid search and display strategies
  • Optimize our paid efforts to gain better ROAS
  • Build awareness and manage our social media presence
  • Find and test new platforms and solutions
  • Write engaging copy for our adverts and social media posts
  • Identify the latest trends and technologies affecting our industry
  • Cooperate with the rest of the team on strategy, analysis and ways to grow
  • Create an email marketing system

What we imagine you’re like
  • Experienced in managing paid ads across Google Ads and Facebook Ads (other platforms are a plus)
  • Experienced as a brand manager on social media
  • You understand how to measure the success of campaigns
  • You’re organized, detail-oriented and self-driven. You can get things done without being micro-managed and are happy to take responsibility.
  • You have a habit of showing initiative (i.e. you’re happy to take the lead to manage projects)
  • You’re curious to keep up to date with the latest industry trends and can’t wait to test new solutions
  • You’re creative and enjoy coming up with engaging copy for ads and social media posts
  • You have great spoken and written English skills

What we offer
  • Annual salary of 42 000 EUR
  • Stipends for internet and coworking space rental
  • Allowance for home office set-up
  • 28 annual vacation days
  • Travel for conferences, trainings and team meet-ups
  • You can work from anywhere in the universe with good internet connection as long as you can overlap for a few hours between 0700 - 1400h UTC.

Interested?
We don’t do CVs or motivational letters. Take our 20-minute test instead to see if you have the skills to take on the role. If you pass the quiz, we will plant a tree in your honor!

items.content:
Social Media Editor at Bakpax

Remote

What is Bakpax?

Bakpax uses artificial intelligence to “auto-grade” schoolwork in seconds. We save teachers the time and trouble of grading. We give them free standards-aligned content. And we give students instant feedback to increase their engagement and understanding.

Background on the Role:

Bakpax was built for teachers. We have been working directly with teachers for the past two years to create the product they want and need. We continue to bring this feedback into the product every day.

We are looking for a social media-savvy writer and editor, to help us connect with teachers and create a Bakpax community where teachers can share best practices and content creations. We’re looking for someone who is an excellent writer of short and snappy posts, who has a fun and friendly sense of humor, and who gets their energy from communicating and helping others.

We think the background traits that would make someone the most successful in this role are:

  • Writer/Editor – You have a short, snappy, and friendly writing style that engages, delights, empathizes, and makes people laugh. You likely majored in journalism or English in college and maybe do improv or stand-up comedy for fun.
  • Teacher in another life – You have been a teacher or you come from a family of teachers. You have a deep understanding of the challenges and rewards of being a teacher.
  • Image editing – You have experience editing images for the internet. You understand the different specifications needed for images to perform well on each social media platform.

The Role:

Editorial Calendar

Bakpax helps teachers save time grading, delivers instant feedback to students, and provides standards aligned material to be used in their classroom. You will be responsible for creating and managing an editorial calendar of relevant issues, such as: grading for completion vs accuracy, managing paperwork in the classroom, student handwriting, how well publisher content aligns to the Common Core State Standards, how to manage parental expectations.

Community Building

You will be responsible for crafting creative ways to engage teachers in conversation using engaging content, polls, and contests. You’ll let them know when we post new free content, or new features that might interest them. You’ll facilitate conversations about best practices. You’ll be a friendly voice to celebrate their successes, commiserate with their frustrations, and cheer them onward.

You will also be responsible for identifying and connecting with influential educators on social media who can help to bring our message to a wider audience of teachers.

Channel Management

The top four social platforms where teachers spend the most time are Facebook, Pinterest, Instagram, and Twitter. You will be responsible for content development, publishing, and community management on each of these social networks, as well as others you see as critical to our social strategy. You will need a deep understanding of each platform and how it can be leveraged to connect to teachers

Responsibilities:

  • Manage day-to-day messaging, monitoring and moderation across social channels: Facebook, Pinterest, Instagram, and Twitter, among others
  • Write warm, funny, engaging content for social media channels daily
  • Create and manage our social media editorial calendar
  • Identify and engage with influential educators.
  • Provide support to our customers via social media channels
  • Turn frequently asked questions into clearly written help articles and video tutorials

Qualifications:

  • Exceptional short-form writing skill
  • Short, snappy, and funny writing style
  • Fun and friendly sense of humor
  • 2+ years of social media experience
  • Demonstrated ability to create / edit images for the internet
  • 4 year college degree with a major that involves a lot of writing (English, journalism, etc.)
  • Strong sense of ownership and urgency
  • Strong organizational and project management skills

Nice to Have:

  • You were in the drama club or do improv and/or stand-up comedy for fun
  • You have worked for a very early stage technology startup.

More about the job:

  • Remote – We work remotely. This is nice, and, like anything, has its drawbacks. We’re committed to helping each other work remotely while building a strong culture. We’ll get together in person from time to time to have fun together, hone our communication skills and plan.
  • Healthcare – our government does not provide it, so we will.
  • Equity – You will receive options in the company as part of your compensation package.
Apply for job

items.content:
You could join us join at an exciting time for the business. We are active across 16 countries, with the USA our largest single market closely followed by the UK. The success of new launch titles in the past 12 months – particularly Where Are You and our new Bedtime storybook- mean that the Board and team are hungry for data-driven insight to guide their next moves.


This role comes with a wide remit to lead;


- Analytics strategy & development : Lead the development of Customer analytics, working with internal Data specialists to define a roadmap for more sophisticated analysis, predictive modelling and data


- Delivery of key customer Insight – to the Senior management team, Product leads and Marketing Group


- Continuing to develop our Attribution & LTV models


- Looker BI : You will lead & manage our Looker BI reporting tool. There has been a significant investment in training across the team and in development of a series of dashboards & reports, which help all members of the team self-serve daily and hourly insight. You are the go-to person for support on Looker, to Quality check outputs and to help create new reports as needed.


- Marketing & CRM Performance measurement & team meetings: Jointly lead [along with the Head of CRM ] a bi-monthly Marketing and CRM activity review, presenting to all the commercial and marketing group. This covers major initiatives, launches, CRM campaigns etc. Every 6 months, this extends to a full Review for the MD , FD and team.


- Data & Analytics stack : Oversee the management of a full data analytics & technology toolkit. You’ll lead best in class solutions to help us gather, store, process, analyse and share through the business.


- Team leader & collaborator, particularly with CRM & Marketing heads : You’ll work in close collaboration with our VP of Marketing, CFO, Search and Digital marketing specialists to develop customer-centric strategies that deliver against sales and profitability targets. You’ll heavily support in setting strategies for pricing/promotions, product and marketing.


- Make the business case to build the Data & Analytics function


As value to the business and ROI is proven, we are open to expanding the analytics team


Hopefully you will have some or all of the following:


· Skilled Analyst with hands on experience of BI & Reporting tools - ideally within digital product, marketing and/or trade (more than one not essential, but desirable) with 5+ years experience


· Highly numerate, ideally with a bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in Maths, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or similar


· Regular & strong user of SQL, Python; Understanding of, and practical use of, Python, R , SQL and/or similar programming language


· Advanced Excel and/or Google Sheets skills are essential, for the manipulation of and sharing of insights/data to the team. Wonderbly operates on the Google sheets/slides/Docs /Gmail environment


· Experience with managing data in a data warehouse, including identification of data quality issues and data structure improvements.


· Fast learner or expertise of using BI tools - particularly Looker [Tableau and other similar ‘drag & drop’ tools are also a positive]


· Campaign measurement experience : track record of measuring large seasonal marketing campaigns a plus; understanding the importance of seasonal bias and time periods will be key to this role


· Experience with the Google & Amazon tech stack a major positive - especially Google Analytics , Google BigQuery and Amazon AWS


· Experience of machine learning and modelling techniques a plus


Your Personality


As we move out of early start-up phase, we are looking for big personalities that will be the future leaders of the business, as we grow in scale, launch in new areas [grown-ups books etc] and across markets. To thrive at Wonderbly, we are seeking candidates who can demonstrate some or all of the following;


· Proactive self starter who readily takes ownership of key projects


· Great at prioritising & managing requests : show track record of handling multiple requests on your time, managing via Trello or other work management tools


· Naturally inquisitive about Wonderbly products & customers ; seen as the ‘customer expert’ in the business within a few months


· Strong communicator to deliver insights and recommendations to stakeholders


· Able to work within a creative, lively environment : managing and building relationships with people who maybe less comfortable with numbers than you


· Confident enough to Identify opportunities for the business, through analysis and modelling - whether in product, marketing, or trade (pricing & promotions)


· Helpful & a patient trainer: Provide know how and help for others to use data in their decision making


Why join Wonderbly?


Asi , David and the Founders of Wonderbly believe strongly in the culture that drove the success of the business since 2016. It’s that energy & belief to tackle big opportunities that attract people to join and stay.


· Each year you'll accrue a generous 28 days holiday, plus 8 bank holidays


· We support being active ; with numerous running groups, gym lunches and yoga in the office. We have some sparkling new showers on site , secure bike parking facilities and are part of the Cycle To Work scheme


· Childcare vouchers, health insurance are also available


· Matched pension contribution


· You’ll get a sweet training budget to enable you to do your best work and develop as a professional, combined with weekly Lunch and Learns


· We have heaps of snacks, drinks, and comforts in our fully-stocked kitchen


· PLUS team lunches and breakfasts. Every Thursday, our Studio Manager orders some super delish food and we gorge ourselves.


· We love having dogs in the office [well behaved ones anyway]!


Equal opportunities employer


Our team are committed to providing equal opportunities for employment regardless of of race, religion or belief, ethnic origin, disability, family structure, socio-economic status, age, nationality or citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis (it's the law, but it's also just the right thing to do).


If you have a disability, caring duties, or any other additional need that require consideration, please do let us know.


And to see more on our business and products, please do visit


www.Wonderbly.com


Summary of position



  • Reporting into the VP Marketing, you will play a central role in supporting data-driven Strategy , marketing & commercial decisions at Board level and with the team

  • Competitive + benefits

  • 28 days paid holiday per year + 8 bank holidays

  • Start date : June 2019 [although Contract support mean later dates considered]

  • Would consider Temp to Perm candidates

  • Fantastic office and open kitchen; weekly free lunch & team events


Who are Wonderbly?


Wonderbly is a unique, award winning start-up that lives on the intersection of storytelling, engineering, digital and print. We are building a global personal-publishing business that brings millions of people into our products - as co-creators and audiences We are best known for our first title, Lost My Name, which is read by over 4 million children and their families globally. We are releasing a new title every few months and now have 18 books in our range.


Our focus in the near future is with the children’s book market - creating stunning, uncompromisingly high quality and technically ambitious personalised books for kids.


We’re in the business of sparking kids’ imaginations; inspiring them to read & to learn as well as build confidence and self-belief. May 2019 sees a relaunch of our website and material to back up that positioning

CTG Health Solutions is in need of an Epic Inpatient Willow Analyst resource to assist in the activation support of the implementation of Epic for our client in the Southeastern United States. The opportunity is an approximately 1 month REMOTE position.

CTG is looking for an outstanding consultant with Epic Inpatient Willow experience. The consultant will be responsible for Implementation support of the Epic Willow application.

Candidate will need to show a willingness to be a team player and apply application activation best practices.

.Required:

Current Epic Certification in Willow Inpatient.

Previous experience with rolling out exisitng build to additional clients.

At least 3 years of Willow Inpatient experience

Understands Epic methodology along with potential risks and implications.

Strong communication skilla

Highly Preferred:

Registered Pharmacist or Pharmacy Tech

Strong pharmacy operational pharmacy experience.

CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) provides industry-specific IT services and solutions that address the business needs and challenges of clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.

CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011).

CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.

CTG is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran.

Additional Information

  • Job Function: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

  • Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (?16 years)

  • Work Remote: Yes

  • Travel: No

items.content:
PR Associate (or recovering journalist) to drive mindshare and placements for up and coming financial content website

 
STOP:
If you think this job mostly involves writing Press Releases and sending emails blindly in the hopes that someone will pick up what you’ve sent them, this is not the right job for you.






PR is hard. Cutting through the noise and getting journalists to pay attention to you and what you have to say is never easy.

Guess what? In personal finance and small business, it’s even harder.

Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to build the PR machine around our flagship website in the small business to business and personal finance space. I can tell you already, this will not be easy.

You’ll be competing against well oiled PR Machines run by public companies and well funded private companies who have been doing this for years.

Your job will be to cut through the noise with newsworthy insights, content, and information that helps journalists do their job even better.

You will take the lead on:
  1. Brainstorming and developing newsworthy content like surveys, studies, tools, in conjunction with our content team.
  2. Contacting  online publishers, bloggers, editors, journalists, government agencies  directly and pitching them on #1
  3. Developing relationships with journalists so that we become their go to source for the topics we cover.
  4. Responding to and covering interview requests for local outlets as needed
  5. Managing the Editorial Calendar in relation to PR






Things we’re looking for in a candidate
  1. English needs to be your mother tongue. No exceptions.
  2. You need to be able to communicate well both in written and spoken mediums.
  3. You need to live somewhere in North America with a reliable internet and phone connection and be available during normal business hours.
  4. You cannot be phone shy. You’ll need to be able to cold call journalists as needed to pitch them.
  5. If you were a journalist in a past life, then you’ll love this job.
  6. You need to be able to work  independently with little to no direct supervision.
  7. Excellent interpersonal skills
  8. 1+ years' relevant experience; agency experience or experience as a journalist is preferred.
  9. Attention to detail with excellent proofreading, fact checking, editing skills and grammar.
  10. Experience writing press releases and pitches

Tools for the job:

You won’t be starting from scratch - we have a successful track record of doing similar things in other verticals and now need someone to do it in a more nuanced, direct fashion. We use tools like Cision to make finding and contacting journalists a lot easier, and will help you with other tools for the job (not mentioned here for competitive reasons).

Ideally, you’ve worked in PR or as a journalist. You need to be curious, you need to be able to think outside of the box and come up with all sorts of weird ideas, and you need to be able to write and speak well. You need to be tenacious, you need to be somewhat aggressive and you need to do research. There's a lot of room to grow in this role over time, and a very clear track to growth for the right person.

items.title: Network Growth Manager (Coworking Space)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=8, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Location


Based in London but plenty of opportunity for travelling across the UK and Europe.


Description


We want to give people the freedom to access the world’s best work spaces, anywhere, any time, at the touch of a button. 


One of the most fundamental aspects of our business is how well we understand the needs and intricacies of the work spaces we partner with. Your role will be to build and maintain great relationships with a network of work spaces. 


We’re therefore looking for an energetic people-person to help us build a strong network of workspaces that our customers can access through the Desana app.


People


Desana gives people access to a network of great work space when they want it, where they want it, through a single monthly subscription.


We’re a growing startup based between London, Edinburgh, and Stockholm. We aim to become a globally relevant company by disrupting the way people think about, and access, the places they work. We're looking for the best people to join us on our journey.


With prior experience in startups ourselves, we’re keen to do things the right way from the very start. That’s why we believe in openness and transparency in everything we do, from salary to communications, to processes.


Why Join Us


We’re at the forefront of a new wave of innovation in the office space sector which is already undergoing tremendous change and significant growth. Join us to not only grow the network of workspaces that are already changing the ways people work, but by living and breathing that transformation as you work flexibly, autonomously, and (as much as the job demands) remotely yourself. We pride ourselves in radical open-ness and strive to create a company that fulfils its users, partners, and employees. 


The Role


Growing the Network


We want to build a network that’s genuinely valuable to our customers and the operators that we work with. To do that, we need someone that’s motivated to:  



  • Increase the number of workspaces on the Desana platform each month across the UK. 

  • Collaborate in the shaping and delivery of a scalable space onboarding and retention  strategies - regular communication with workspaces on the network; in person, LinkedIn, by phone, by email, and through events.

  • Maintain CRM to track relationships and opportunities.

  • Create and deliver result orientated “sprints” (tasks) based on the company’s 6 and 12 month goals. 


Communication



  • Working directly with team to incessantly improve brand and workspace onboarding experience / interaction. 

  • Regular monitoring and updating of our task management system.

  • Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly meetings that effectively communicate data informed outcomes from onboarding strategies.

  • Participate daily in a 10 minute whole team “stand up” call, wherever you are.


Industry Awareness



  • Consistently develop wider awareness of coworking industry trends; meticulous attention to specific triggers for workspace / operator types. 

  • Be able to identify and respond to micro-indicators of change.


About You



  • You have hospitality or related experience: If you’ve worked in the coworking / flexible workspace industry or in a workspace brokering environment that would be advantageous (2-3 years preferably, but not critical to apply). 

  • You have experience in sales: it would be great if you can bring experience in managing operational tasks in a sales/relationship management role.

  • You can stay cool and deliver effectively: you have the ability to work to a deadline, prioritising workloads according to different criteria. 

  • You’re data-driven: you understand growth metrics, A/B testing, and statistics and will use these skills to devise effective on-boarding strategies. 

  • You have CRM experience / awareness: particularly Hubspot. Not essential but would be really useful.

  • You’re personable: a fun, enthusiastic people-person. Ready to jump on the phone for a chat when appropriate.

  • You’re self-starting & self-motivated: you’re confident in your abilities, willing to take initiative, to take on your own responsibilities, and manage your own agendas and work scopes. Actively seek and respond to feedback.

  • You can communicate diligently: you’re able to understand the importance of maintaining regular communication with our team, our partners, and the workspace operators in our network. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

  • You’re never complacent: you strive to recognise that things can always be better than they currently are and have the confidence to present solutions to any weaknesses or inefficiencies that you see.

  • You have a growth mindset: a desire to grow both personally and professionally.

  • You have grit: the resilience and desire to work in a startup. You know when to seize the right opportunities in a fast-paced environment, while working to exceed the expectations of all market segments. 

  • You have a good network: if you have a good contact base in the UK coworking / property sector, that would be extremely useful but not essential.


Desana Benefits



  • Share options in the business.

  • Flexible and remote work hours with a strong focus on work-life balance.

  • We’re establishing complete salary transparency across the company with clear progression paths.

  • Team drinks, events, and trips.

  • Free access to the app and our network of workspaces.


Think you’re the right person for the role? Send us your CV and a brief cover and tell us why.

items.title: Senior Product Owner - Contract - Minneapolis or Telecommute
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Health care leaders turn to Optum Advisory Services (OAS) for guidance, insights and practical strategies to help assert control over their organization's future. We are more than just consultants. We are also operators with real-world health care experience, which helps clients hardwire and sustain more meaningful results that would otherwise not be achievable. As integrators across Optum, we deliver unique client-focused strategies and impact. Our proven track record driving success across the entire health care continuum empowers clients to grow, thrive and disrupt.

The Product Owner (PO) of IT serves as the liaison between the Development Team and its primary business stakeholder(s). The Product Owner is accountable for understanding the strategy and vision of their customer base and ensuring their product backlog of features is prioritized to best support this vision.

The PO plays a significant role in delivering high quality product capability to the business stakeholders. The relationship between the Product Owner and their customer is paramount for product success. Product Owners must be able to clearly communicate, receive feedback, and when necessary challenge appropriately.

In collaboration with the Scrum Master, the PO is responsible for ensuring quality deliverables at the end of each sprint. As the liaison for the customer, the Product Owner is accountable for determining whether sprint deliverables have met the definition of done or requires additional work. Successful candidates will work closely communicate with a variety of IT Teams and must have in-depth and hands-on experience.

You'll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.


Primary Responsibilities:

Explains competitive landscape for how product fits into it; anticipates what is happening in the market and plans and executes on insights learned; translates data into a compelling business case and customer
Works with matrix partners to translate required capabilities into concrete operational processes and measurement plans; Interprets vision and translates into requirements for engineering teams; Validates requirements with marketplace via pilots and beta groups; Pro-actively identifies needs/priorities of audience and provides relevant information when sharing insights, including facts and explanation of decision-making criteria
Tells the story of the product both internally and externally; Provides subject matter expertise; Joins sales team on calls to offer expertise
Prioritizes roadmap and articulates a logical, iterative approach to delivering the customer solution; May serve as lead product manager in an Agile environment
Pro-actively analyzes internal and external networks; Builds strategic relationships based on current and future business needs. Identifies potential issues and pro-actively develops mitigation plans; Assists in removing obstacles, resolves conflicts and ensures alignment Uses an understanding of the complex relationships among organization's leaders to facilitate successful outcomes; Uses an awareness and understanding of the organization's environment and culture when recommending strategies and seeking buy-in/support
Uses an understanding of the organization's processes, systems and policies to facilitate successful outcomes; Influences direction setting, facilitates decision making and resolves conflicts; Motivates stakeholders to support product vision and goals; Identifies success criteria and achieves consensus on strategies, requirements and roadmap
Clearly articulates vision and roadmaps; Leverages credibility--offering insights, guiding discussions, challenging the status quo and providing alternative solutions; Relates tasks/activities to overall product vision and strategy; Gathers multiple viewpoints, listens for understanding, seeks clarification and provides alternatives to achieve objectives
Scans external resources for data relevant to the organization; Identifies decision points that can be informed by data and evidence
Seeks feedback and identifies opportunities to modify processes; Assesses impacts of change and develops inclusive response
Leverages relevant data points and internal partners to frame an approach or proposed solution; Provides leadership to others to move forward
You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.


Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in related field
5+ years experience as a Product Owner
1+ year of experience working in a heath care or payer environment
Experience with requirements in an agile software development environment
Knowledge of Agile and Lean values/concepts and scaling with SAFe framework


Preferred Qualifications:

Ability to work independently and drive the scrum teams
Clinical and UM experience
CA Agile Rally experience
Proven ability to understand complex ideas, break them down into smaller, sequential plan, while understanding interdependencies to deliver solutions
Uses solutions based thinking in problem solving, asking probing questions and looking for underlying issues
Has systems subject matter expert technical knowledge to partner with technical leads as it relates to stories and the Agile Release Train
Strong influencing skills to guide a team to understand Program Features and the impact to the story and iteration deliverables
Strong influencing skills with customers and Product Managers to understand the system and iteration capabilities for deliverables
Strong verbal and written communication skills necessary to develop stories and to inform team and stakeholders
Software skills, including use of Microsoft Office and web-based applications
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

*All telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group's Telecommuter Policy.

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Job Keywords: Agile, Scrum, Hartford, Minneapolis, Payer, Optum, Provider, Risk, SQL

items.title: Expert tech writers needed
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=4, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=1, gamedev=0, php=15, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Expert tech writers needed

Company: AddictiveTips
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Freelance
Description

Are you a talented writer with a genuine interest in technology? We are looking to grow our exciting team at AddictiveTips.com, an established consumer advice site providing information and reviews around all things tech.

We are currently seeking new team members to write in-depth features and how-to guides/tutorials covering:

  • Security, privacy (VPNs, streaming) - main topic
  • OS specialists: Windows, Linux, Mac, Android / iOS (development, too)
  • Consumer electronics: buying guides / reviews
  • WordPress related stories.

We would prefer a specialist in each of these industries rather than writers with only surface-deep knowledge in multiple areas. And we would prefer someone who's not afraid of writing, as these stories would probably go 1,000 to 3,000+ words.

Requirements:

  • Previous online blogging or writing experience
  • Proposing your own content ideas in addition to editorial assignments
  • Produce well-researched content which covers topics comprehensively and engages our audience
  • Think simple when explaining complex and technical information. The average person needs to understand
  • A genuine interest and good level of knowledge in your chosen topic(s)
  • Not being bothered to answer readers in the comments
  • Excellent command of the English language.

Additional skills (optional):

  • WordPress knowledge - what plugins are, what themes are, how WordPress works, etc.
  • Being able to source images for your content (ideally you'd use your screenshots, create your own imagery; photo editing skills an added bonus)
  • Active on social networks and not having a problem with sharing your content.

Remuneration:

We're looking for writers with a genuine interest in crafting high quality material. Remuneration will be negotiated with the right individuals.

To apply:

Please send links to three samples of your published work and why you would be a good fit for this role. If you don’t have any published work but still feel you are particularly well-suited, please link to a Google Doc with an example of your writing. When applying, please include your desired rate per word/article.

items.title: Animalz: Content Marketing Editor
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Content Marketing Editor

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies grow by producing high-quality, strategic content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (executives, managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the B2B SaaS/tech field.

We are looking for an editor who specializes in online content and who can help our writers improve over time and across clients in structure, tone, style, and on-page SEO. As much teacher as teammate, this person will review every piece of content at least twice — from the outlining phase to the nearly final draft — and use each review as an opportunity to encourage the writer and drive their continued growth in the craft.

"A real editor isn’t just someone you work with; they are your guide. They see your brain doing its thing and learn its weaknesses and abilities, and if they're really good, they figure out what you need to hear to compensate for the former and accentuate the latter.” - Ariel Levy

An ideal B2B tech/SaaS content editor at Animalz:

  • has a proven track record of successful writing and editing for the web, particularly in B2B/tech/SaaS
  • can communicate why changes should be made, not simply fix errors or improve writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves coaching writers
  • understands the business side of writing & editing
  • is deeply passionate about good content and approaches editing with a creatively curious mindset
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future
Requirements:

  • Proven writing and editing ability
  • Mastery of on-page SEO and how to apply it to each piece of content to provide guidance for writers
  • Ability to understand content strategy and edit content to align with it
  • Desire to help writers improve their craft and elevate their content to the highest quality
  • Experience successfully working with writing/editing customers
  • Basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social media function, how they can work together to get results, and the different writing/stylistic requirements of each
  • Strong interest in the tech/SaaS field and a thorough knowledge of the top content and thought leadership in the field
  • Work in North America’s Eastern time zone to support our writers there and in Europe
Responsibilities:

  • Edit ~15 B2B articles and outlines per week (~1,500 words each), ensuring they comply with the customer strategy and optimizing them for performance
  • Educate our writers around good content in both form/structure and technical aspects (like SEO)
  • Provide support and constructive feedback to writers to help them improve their craft
About Animalz

We’re a remote, eclectic team of current and former scientists, journalists, operations folks with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the position

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote job. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is not a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional endeavors.

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere you like (during EST business hours)
  • Company-sponsored health insurance covering 80% of premium for medical and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year (including holidays)
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Parental leave for both primary (up to 12 weeks) and secondary (up to 6 weeks) care providers
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy a lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and conferences
What's it like to work at Animalz?

Join us for an hour-long webinar where we discuss careers, growth, and culture at Animalz. We'll make sure to leave time to answer all your questions.

Grab a seat here. We'd love to have you on a call!

items.title: Marketing Coordinator
items.content:
Marketing Coordinator at Dollar Flight Club

Remote | Entry-level | International | Part-time

Location:

Category: Marketing
Job Type: Part-Time
Job Desc:

The Opportunity-

This role will help manage existing marketing channels and develop new channels that are aligned with our growth goals. Projects include: email marketing, sweepstakes management, and analytics management. You’ll wear multiple hats and manage a variety of marketing strategies and tactics to help us grow our Free and Premium user base. The ideal candidate is creative, analytical, and extremely determined.

Job Duties-

Email Marketing:

  • Help plan, design, and write email automation flows and newsletters.
  • Find creative ways to increase open rates and click through rates across our Premium and Free Member user-base.

Sweepstakes:

  • Organize, plan, and execute giveaways with like-minded brands for new email acquisition.
  • Research & get in touch with like minded companies to partner with on sweepstakes.

Analytics:

  • Track KPI metrics for channels and specific campaigns to gauge ROI and scalability
  • Learn a data-driven approach to marketing by coming up with new ideas, testing, analyzing data, and improving.

Internal Tools We Use To Get It Done –

  • Slack
  • Asana
  • Active Campaign
  • Google Analytics
  • Hubspot
  • Referral Hero

Skills –

  • Preferably Marketing or Communication major/minor, or experience in advertising, digital marketing, or sales.
  • Knowledge of email and/or marketing best practices.
  • Passionate about travel and cheap flights.
  • Problem solver, detailed-oriented and hyper-organized.
  • Self-starter, scrappy, get-it-done attitude.
  • Should be genuinely interested in the latest marketing trends.

Big Plus if You Have –

  • Work experience in B2C or lifestyle consumer brand.
  • Work experience in the travel industry.
  • Experience growing & managing email subscribers.
  • Working knowledge of Google Analytics.
  • Working knowledge of Active Campaign.
  • Working knowledge of Hubspot.
  • Design skills (Canva.com).

Why You’ll Just Love Working With Us –

  • Competitive Pay.
  • No vacation policy – take the time you need.
  • Annual company retreat.
  • Work remotely! How about from Bali or Thailand? That’s cool with us.
Apply for job

items.title: Content, Social Media, and Community Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Who are we?

We are a team of entrepreneurs, designers, engineers, and creators on a mission to change the way brands think about recruitment in the hospitality sector. We’re inploi, the talent engagement platform built for the industry.

Why we do it?

The candidate has changed. The way they expect to interact with brands and access information has shifted. If companies want to remain relevant to the next generation of the workforce they must change the way they think about recruitment.

In a rapidly changing candidate climate, we empower employers by providing them with the tools they need to stay ahead of the curve.

How we do it?

We enable brands to connect with the new generation of talent through a unique blend of technology and storytelling.

inploi Connect is our software: a unique talent engagement suite built to provide hospitality businesses with a platform on which to showcase their brand, communicate with talent and manage candidates to the point of hire. For jobseekers inploi provides an online professional presence for the first time, making it easy to access career-related information, apply for job opportunities, and connect and communicate with employers, and with each other.

inploi Stories is a content creation, production and distribution service. We work with our clients to showcase their talent brand, corporate culture, and the people behind it, telling a story that highlights why a candidate should work with them.

The dual approach of Connect & Stories establishes a dialogue between brands and new talent pools with relevant messaging on channels they are familiar with.

We’re a team of seven, based in Fitzrovia, working alongside a much bigger community of hospitality’s leading lights. With their help, we have built the most comprehensive, easy to use recruitment marketing software on the market. We’re partnered with Jobs on Facebook, Deliveroo, The Grosvenor Group, and many others, and are working with leading hospitality brands including Annabel’s, Sexy Fish, Island Poke, and many others.

After an extensive period of learning and product development, we’re now ready for growth and are looking for a Content, Social, and Community Manager to join us! The role is wide in scope with ample opportunity to shape the future of inploi, working alongside the founders, the product team, and the sales team across digital marketing, communications, and design - growing our community and strengthening our brand.

What will my responsibilities include?

  • Creating brand and design assets
  • Managing inploi’s social media channels and executing our social media strategy.
  • Directing inploi’s content strategy - from inception through to design, copywriting, SEO optimisation, distribution and analysis.
  • Conceptualising and running events to engage inploi’s community
  • Copywriting for a wide range of brands with varying styles and tone of voice
  • Managing freelancers
  • Acting as a brand ambassador for inploi by attending industry events and engaging with industry leaders
  • Designing, copy editing and building marketing emails to users, including weekly job roundups, product updates, and monthly newsletters.
  • Maintain consistency of brand design/language across the platform and internal and external communications.
  • Develop and maintain strategic partnerships with industry partners, including training providers and social enterprises and charities.
  • Drive brand presence and customer acquisition through community marketing via digital channels (social media, paid media, B2B and B2C comms), and event attendance.
  • Provide support to the jobseeker community.
  • Working with the CEO on PR and external communications.
  • Manage relationships and budgets with external agencies.
  • Stay abreast of industry competitions and grant opportunities, authoring entries where applicable.
  • Develop, document and share inploi’s DLS (design language system) and component library.

Attributes of the Ideal Candidate:

  • An affinity with inploi’s mission and values and be excited about the opportunity to work with a young, motivated team.
  • Experience in the world of brand content and strategy.
  • Strong design ability.
  • Understanding of user experience, design principles and product development.
  • The ability to work independently and creatively in a fast-paced, agile environment.
  • Be an excellent writer, able to transition between different tones, styles, and forms.
  • Experience with social media - be a ‘digital native’ with strong knowledge of (facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and … ). 
  • Experience with their ad platforms is a bonus.
  • Be able to see the big picture, but obsess about the details on the way there.

Required technical knowledge:

  • Product design software e.g. Sketch and Abstract (or similar).
  • Prototyping software e.g. InVision.
  • Email marketing software e.g. Sendgrid (or similar).
  • Social media scheduling tools e.g. Buffer (or similar).
  • Customer support software e.g. Intercom.
  • Knowledge of HTML/CSS and SQL is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Adobe Suite (Photoshop/InDesign) is a plus.

How do I apply?

In the first instance, please apply to the role via inploi with a complete profile! Adding a profile video introducing yourself is advisable, plus a short introductory bio.

From there we’ll send you a few questions to answer, and we’ll ask for a writing sample. Then it’s an interview with the founders, and on to a decision.

We look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: You Need A Budget (YNAB): Humbly Confident Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=12, go=9, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Humbly Confident Product Designer

YNAB is growing, and so is our product design team. We’re a software ecosystem that includes personal finance apps for web, iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, and Android phones. If you’re the one we’re looking for, you have experience in designing great interfaces and experiences for most of those platforms. More important, you’re a designer who views your job as that of problem solver. You come to the table not only with a knack for interaction design and love of logical UI patterns, but also with a deep empathy for people. We design our software to fit our users more than our fancy, and you love nothing more than digging through (or conducting!) research that leads the way in the design process. You’ve been around the block a few times and know what it means to design a mature, evolving product. 


Requirements (these are real, actual requirements): 
  • You must have at least 3 years of experience working in product design at a software company. Complex or data-rich applications are a plus.
  • Experience in designing applications for both web and mobile (in your cover letter, please include the platforms for which you have designed and your level of experience with them). 
  • We are looking for a designer who has a strong background in UX and usability but who also can design UI independently. This is a truly mixed position where you will be responsible for activities traditionally held in the “UX” and “UI” wheelhouses. And a user-testing/research wheelhouse, too. (Can you have three wheelhouses? Are they still wheelhouses? Yes, sometimes we do philosophical tangents, too.)
That’s a super-brief intro of what you’ll be working on. But first, you need to know if you’ll even like working with us. We think you will. 


A Bit About Us

We build YNAB (or “You Need a Budget” if you have a lot of extra time on your hands), the best budgeting software around. For more than a decade, people have been buying YNAB and then telling their friends what a difference it has made in their lives. (Google us, or read some of our reviews on the app store, and you’ll see what we mean.) We love building something that has a huge positive impact on people’s lives.


We’re profitable, bootstrapped, and growing. YNAB started in 2004 and we haven’t taken any outside funding—we’re in it for the long haul. 


We have one overarching requirement when it comes to joining our team: our Cultural Manifesto has to really click with you. If you’re nodding emphatically while reading it, you’ll probably fit right in, in which case, we can’t wait to hear from you! 


First, let’s talk about life at YNAB and then we’ll go into detail about what we’re looking for. 



Who you’d be working with:


Todd, our Chief Product Officer, obsesses about continuously improving our products and the experiences they enable—and knows that begins with design. He’ll have any conversation where he has the chance to learn something, loves greyscale to an irrational extent, and enjoys ideas for their own sake. He likes long gaps of silence and very loud music, running ultramarathons, and wants to disappear someday to make hand-crafted furniture.


And our product designers:


Alan can be seen wearing many hats—and loving every second of it. He could be interviewing users one day and programming a prototype in Framer the next. He loves exploring ideas with teammates and lives for that rush when the team discovers a novel solution to a difficult problem. When he’s not busy designing, he’s probably either at Crossfit or working to improve his culinary skills... or contemplating the conflicts that occasionally arise between the two.


Andrea has spent a lengthy career knee-deep in interactive design. Today she finds great satisfaction in her dream job at YNAB where design and helping others converge—the perfect environment for empathic-driven design. After work, this compulsive doodler cherishes her time with her husband and kids. Soaking up live music, art, and setting sail on the occasional cruise are among her favorite to-dos.


Cindy sweats the small details when it comes to crafting simple, intuitive experiences. She loves having conversations with our users, and digs deep to find the root of their needs before exploring a solution. On most weekends (and some weekdays, depending on the daylight saving time), you can probably find her outdoors chasing sunrise and sunset with a camera in hand. 


Dylan loves organizing design systems, obsessing over typographic details, and everything in between. Above his desk (ahem, kitchen table, it's a small apartment after all) sits an inconspicuous letterpressed card with Dieter Rams' 10 principles of good design on it. In his spare time he's probably taking photos or running—sometimes at the same time. 


Emily is a design generalist, through and through. What she loves most about being a designer—besides the obvious draw of working with a team to build things people love—is how much there is to learn. Right now she's focused on honing her coding skills enough to be able to put up the occasional pull request as well as practicing the art of writing great microcopy. She enjoys reading books, cooking, biking, lifting weights, and spending time outdoors. 


Kathryn loves to dig into problems and learn where things aren’t working, what people need, and how we can empower them to be even more amazing.  And once she truly understands a problem, figuring out how to solve it is pretty fun. When she’s not at work, she can usually be found reading, conquering escape rooms, or hanging out with her family.


How You’ll Work at YNAB

We work really hard to make working at YNAB an amazing experience. In fact, we were recently recognized as Fortune's #2 best small company to work for in the United States! We have a team full of truly exceptional people—the kind you’ll be excited to work with. Here’s how we operate:

Live Where You Want


We’re a distributed team, so you can live and work wherever you want. Proximity doesn’t influence productivity. Taylor, our CTO, was traveling who-knows-where for a couple of years before he bought a farm. Up and move to France for a year? Sure, Todd did that. Don’t like France? How about London, where Janelle trotted off to. Tulsa Remote? Can do. Or if you just love LA or Baltimore or Buenos Aires, we’ve got people there, too.  Not all of us move around, but the fact that these folks have is totally okay because we’re all adults. Just make sure you have a reliable internet connection.

No Crazy Hours


We rarely work more than 40 hours per week. There have been a few occasions where things got a little crazy and people had to log some extra hours. But then they took some extra time off, so it all balances out. We work hard and smart but we’re in this for the long haul, no need to go crazy on the hours.

Take Vacation (Seriously)


We want you to take vacation. In fact, we have a minimum vacation policy of three weeks per year. Five weeks feels about right (plus two extra weeks for Christmas break). It’s important to get out and do something. We’ll look forward to seeing pictures of your vacation in our Slack channel, creatively named #office_wall

The YNAB Meetup


We get the teams together once a year to catch up on spreadsheets and powerpoints in a Best Western conference room. Just kidding. So far, we’ve done Costa Rica, a gigantic cabin in the mountains, a beach house in the Outer Banks, a ranch in Montana, and we most recently took over an entire hotel in Laguna Beach. We do really fun things, but the highlight always seems to be just hanging out together and having a blast.

Up Your Game


We’re serious about helping you improve your craft. We budget for it (hey-o!). Think conferences, Lynda subscriptions, dedicated time away from work to learn something new… it’s really up to you and your manager. But we love to see our people growing.  

International is Absolutely Okay


If you are Stateside, we’ll set you up as a W2 employee. If you’re international, you’ll be set up as a contractor. Employee or contractor, it’s all the same to us. You’re part of the team. (We are spread all over the world: Switzerland, Scotland, Mexico, Brazil, Argentina, Germany, Canada, and all over the United States.)

If You’re Stateside…


YNAB offers fantastic health, dental, and vision insurance, where we cover 100% of the premium for you and your family. (No need to check your vision, you read that right, 100%. Although if you did need to check your vision, NBD, we’ve got you covered!)


We also have a Traditional and Roth 401k option. YNAB contributes three percent whether you choose to throw any money in there or not. It vests immediately. (Are you a personal finance junkie like our founder Jesse? He set up YNAB’s 401k to have the lowest fee structure possible, where all plan costs are paid by YNAB, not your retirementnest egg. The investment funds available are fantastic, passively-managed, ultra low-cost index funds. You’re not a PF junkie? Trust us, it’s awesome.)



Other Tidbits
  • Once you start, we DEMAND (in a friendly, ALL CAPS IS YELLING way) that you fill out your “Bucket List” spreadsheet with 50 items. (That’s harder than it sounds!) 
  • The bucket list really helps in deciding what we should give you for your birthday and Christmas.
  • We have a bonus plan based on profitability. You’ll be in on that from day one. YNAB wins, you win. That kind of thing.
  • We’re all adults. There’s no need to punch a clock, or ask for permission to take off early one afternoon to go see the doctor (health insurance premium 100% covered!). We look at what you accomplish, not how long you sit (have you tried standing?) in front of a computer.
  • We want you firing on all cylinders so we’ll set you up with a shiny new computer and replace it every three years.
  • Did I mention we make a huge, positive difference in people’s lives? You may not think that matters much, but then a few months down the road you’ll realize it’s made your job really, really enjoyable. Don’t underestimate this one!
If this sounds like your ideal environment, read on because now I want to talk about you. You will play a big, big part in helping YNAB customers achieve success. You will change lives. I’ll only say that six more times.


Now, back to you, our new Product Designer...

What Success Looks Like:


At YNAB, our goal is for our users to achieve life changing financial control. No small thing, right? You’ll join our six product designers, working on both our web and mobile platforms. Throughout 2020, we’ll focus intensely on making YNAB effortless and helping new budgeters get started effectively, from their very first experience. You will also help us develop systems and processes to more efficiently deliver top-notch, dare we say life-changing, experiences to our users.


You’ll need to: 
  • Understand the journey our users take, not just as they use our apps, but in the real world as they seek to take control of their financial lives.
  • Learn the design system, UI patterns, and financial logic of our apps like the back of your hand. You have no problem designing a cross-platform feature for the web and mobile apps. You can clearly discern and navigate the relationship between the UI and the available data behind the scenes. 
  • Solve design problems in a user-centric feedback loop. Research plays a big part in our design process so you’ll need to break down analytics and user feedback to make informed design decisions. You’ll also follow up on the data gathered after the feature is released and continue to iterate and improve your designs until the data confirms success. 
  • Shepherd your work from ideation to release. You will document your work for review with fellow designers, developers, and stakeholders, make agreed-upon refinements, and will work with the developers on the upcoming feature. Design reviews during the development process examine form and function and you will see the feature through to the end. 
  • Be comfortable iterating with low-fidelity designs and prototypes while working in cross-functional teams made up of developers, marketers, and customer-facing team members (waterfalls are for rivers!), while continuing to pursue a meticulous and thorough design.
  • Communicate and document the styling, user flows, and the impact of your designs on other parts of the system. You’ll update this documentation as feedback comes in and the apps evolve. On the flip side, you’ll provide feedback in design reviews that is clear and helpful in moving our products forward.
  • Communicate, explain, persuade, explore and otherwise get all the things done in writing. Yes, we like talking to each other, but as a remote team, much of our collaboration is asynchronous and written.
  • Be comfortable writing a first pass at UI copy which is then refined with the help of your team in design reviews. There’s no lorem ipsum here. 
  • You are comfortable speaking the language of software development. If you’re also comfortable diving into HTML and CSS (or even one of the programming languages in our development stack!) to help implement your design work, that’s a plus, but it’s not a requirement.
  • We use Figma for the vast majority of design work and maintaining our design system. You will aid in the expansion and maintenance of the design system and feel comfortable contributing new UI for our applications and website. If you have experience developing and maintaining design systems and can help us strike a balance between fighting for consistency and pushing the design system forward, that’s another plus.
  • Be comfortable talking to customers in user interviews and usability testing. You have a knack for summarizing research in a concise way to share with teammates. 
Finally, the success of a designer at YNAB hinges upon the ability to approach design as holistic problem solving for both user and business goals. We work collaboratively here and you’ll listen to ideas, questions, and critiques from teammates with grace and patience. That said, you know your stuff and can eloquently and logically explain design decisions. You see this type of exchange as critical to the success of yourself and our product: it is through sharing ideas and being open to the brilliance of others that we arrive at the best solutions. 


And, since our job descriptions are already so long, what’s another sentence or two…


YNAB is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and experiences to be critical to our success and are passionate about creating a welcoming, supportive, and collaborative environment for all employees. All are encouraged to apply as we continue to grow a smart, hard-working, and diverse team who love working together to build something that matters.

How to Apply

  • Apply below by 11:59PM on Oct 3rd, 2019. Firm. It’s a real deadline. Like, after it is too late.
  • Attach a pdf of your cover letter. In your cover letter:
    • Introduce yourself and explain why this position is of interest to you, and why you would be a great fit. 
    • We love a designer with a perspective. What’s yours? Feel free to touch on your beliefs on how design should be done, what it’s used for, or why it’s important. 
  • Please include a portfolio that contains the following: 
    • Design work across web and mobile 
    • Your design process (wireframes, interviews, architecture documentation)
    • Links to any live work. 
    • Please state the role you played on each project.
  • If you have a prepared resume, attach it in PDF form. If you don’t have a resume because you aren’t even sure you’re looking to change jobs, that’s fine! An informal list of your work and education history are all we’re looking for.
P.S.  If you’re not interested in or available for this position, but know someone who might be, we would really appreciate it if you passed this along!
