items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) QM -Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills: Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP QM specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong QM experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to. What You Will Be Doing - The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Quality Management (QM) modul - SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the QM modules in the SAP functional area - Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution - Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support, - Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices, - Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas, - Supports multiple projects and BAU activities, - Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration - Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles What You Need for this Position - 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment, several S/4 HANA implementations under your belt. - Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success, - Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite, - Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls, - Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation, - Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles - Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape, - Experience in designing SAP software components, - Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools, - Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies, - Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment, - College or University (IT /Business) Degree, - Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of QM and experience with S4/HANA - Expert SAP technical knowledge, - Expert Integration understanding, - Strong spoken and written English, - Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP QM specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume! Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you. - Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions. Looking forward to receiving your resume! CyberCoders CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Product Marketing Manager at Astreya

Remote
  • Remote, Remote, United States
  • Full-time

Astreya is the leading IT solutions provider to deliver technology-enabled services and fuel digital transformation to some of the most exciting companies on the planet. We are at the cusp of a new way of working with our delivery model that helps our clients be positively productive by matching exceptional people to on-site teams delivering world-class IT service. With engineers in over 30 countries and 70 cities around the world, we are a global company working with the world’s most recognizable and innovative organizations.

Job Description

As the Leader of Marketing, you will work across the organization to identify opportunities and help us take new and existing offerings to market both with new and existing clients. Reporting to the VP of Marketing, you will be expected to communicate the value of our offerings both internally and externally. You will have an understanding of the IT managed service/professional services landscape. In addition, you will leverage qualitative and quantitative data to support product positioning. You are detail oriented and will roll up your sleeves to ensure that our offerings are successful for both Astreya and our customers. You possess a background in IT/professional services marketing, and the ability to coordinate with and influence a range of stakeholders including sales, delivery, and the Astreya Center of Excellence (COE). You will have a solid track record of bringing successful solutions to market within the IT services ecosystem.

Your Role and Responsibilities:

  • Own the marketing plan for both existing and prospective clients
  • Identify growth opportunities for both existing and prospective clients
  • Facilitate the cross-functional team will evaluate and implement new offerings
  • Define core positioning and messaging for the solutions externally
  • Partner with the Demand Gen Lead to launch for new offerings and develop the demand generation strategy
  • Develop quantitative & qualitative market insights – customer needs, industry trends, and competitive intelligence

Qualifications

Your experience and qualifications:

  • 5+ years of marketing experience in the IT service industry
  • Exceptional communication, presentation and negotiation skills with the ability to drive vision and influence cross-functional teams
  • Solid track record of marketing experience in the IT service industry and demonstrated success in bringing to market commercially successful initiatives and offerings
  • Strong collaboration & negotiation skills, showing ability to influence without ownership, gaining support and trust across the organization to achieve agreed upon business outcomes

Preferred experience and qualifications:

  • BA/BS Degree
  • Ability to define a compelling story, a path to market, and evangelize that vision within the organization and across the company
  • Experience with business case modeling, development and scenario planning

What can Astreya offer you?

  • Working with some of the biggest firms in the world as part of the Astreya delivery network
  • Employment in the fast growing IT space providing you with brilliant career options for years to come
  • Introduction to the new ways of working and awesome technologies
  • Career paths to help you establish where you want to go
  • A company-wide mentoring program to advise you along the way
  • Online training courses through CBT-nuggets to upskill you
  • Performance management system to provide you with meaningful, actionable feedback
  • Dedicated management to provide you with a point of leadership and care
  • Internal promotion focus. We love to build people from within.
  • Numerous on-the-job perks
  • Peer Recognition
  • Market competitive rates and benefits

Astreya Partners is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. We evaluate qualified applicants on merit and business needs and not on race, color, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status or any other factor protected by law.

Apply for job

items.title: Product Manager
items.content:
Product Manager at Superformula

Remote

(US Only)

  • Engineering
  • Remote job
  • Job openings

Job description

About Superformula

We are a global team with plenty of enterprise and startup experience. Mix of analysts, creatives, strategists, technologists, and engineers. Currently situated in NYC, PDX, SEA, LAX, ATX, and Poland to name a few! Our company is entirely remote and we are focused, enthusiastic, and engaged.

Executing products in all digital touch-points and ecosystems, we’re working primarily in the hospitality and automotive industries and have both growing and greenfield products with aggressive and challenging roadmaps.

We support and encourage remote working environments as we support asynchronous communication and collaboration.

Job Specifics

We are seeking an energetic, full-time, and senior Technical Product Manger. The role will be remote (ideally in the East Coast and must be US based) and requires vast knowledge of the full development life cycle for both back-end and front-end products. While we have many products happening in parallel, your focus will be both on current the upcoming products.

The right person for this role will be someone who is data driven, has excellent customer experience judgement, and will be able to work cross-functionally across the organization.

The ideal candidate would exhibit the following qualities:

  • Honest, mature, committed, and ensuring a high level of communication.
  • Ability to work early hours to communicate to our developments teams in the US and Poland.
  • Proactively take ownership of tasks needing attention.
  • Be a self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset.
  • Move and adapt to change at a rapid pace.
  • Enjoy working with creative, business, and engineers alike.

Important to understand:

  • We are willing to be very competitive in pay to attract our perfect match and expect a lot from every member on the team.
  • Everyone works together to solve problems when needed, we are a small and skillful team.

Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years experience working in a similar role.
  • Proven ability to plan and execute responsibilities with minimal direction.
  • Passionate about the latest technological trends and their use in product development and workflows.
  • Proven experience in various types of user/customer research, user testing and analysis, insights generation, touch-point/ journey mapping, workshop design and management, developing sketches/low-fidelity wireframes for digital prototypes, products, and or services.
  • Expert at synthesizing and translating high quantities of information into cohesive and concise thoughts and plans.
  • Collaborative team player with experience working cross-functionally (i.e. with Creative, User Experience, Account and Analytics teams).
  • Ability to manage a scrum team day-to-day.
  • Ability to solve complex technical issues/bugs during Sprints.
  • Ability to perform code reviews and make modifications to pull requests (as needed).
  • Proven track record of excellence in collaborating effectively across multiple teams and locations (including programming/development).
  • Expertise in Web technologies, both front-end and back-end, is a plus.
  • Must be a strong leader and teammate.
  • Must be punctual, reliable, flexible, and excellent at balancing multiple detail-oriented projects.
  • Hospitality or automotive industry experience is a plus.
Apply for job

items.title: SEO Consultant - Remote / Home based
items.content:
Do you have a few years experience in digital marketing and looking to take the next step in your career?


ABOUT US


BoostLabs.co.uk is a fast-growing SEO agency, made up of a small team of experts who over-deliver on client campaigns every time. Our values are based on transparency, value, and expertise. We have big growth plans and are looking for a proactive SEO Consultant to help deliver outstanding results for client campaigns. The role is both exciting and challenging: you will be given account responsibility, whilst being fully supported by the agency Founder from day one. 


We believe in a work-life balance and hiring only the best talent, so we work remotely within the UK.


ABOUT THE ROLE


We are looking for a passionate, dedicated and highly professional SEO Consultant to join our team. This would suit an experienced SEO Executive or SEO Manager looking to take the next step in their career, who is hungry to succeed and be the best.


You will work with the founder from day 1 - with 10 years of SEO experience working on enterprise-level sites, you will gain unique experience. You will be responsible for managing and delivering SEO campaigns for brands - brands that you have definitely heard of.


The chosen candidate's responsibilities will be, but not limited to:


• Managing and delivering successful SEO campaigns


• Day to day client account ownership ensuring client campaigns are delivered on time


• Ownership of technical SEO audits and recommendations for clients


• Keyword research across multiple verticals with detailed gap analysis


• Backlink analysis and strategy


• On-page optimisation


• Carrying out monthly/campaign reporting internally and to clients.


Essential skills & experience required:


• Experienced in SEO website optimisation techniques, preferably across high traffic websites


• Proficient in the use of SEO research and insight tools such as Ahrefs, SEMrush, Searchmetrics, Sitebulb, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics, Search Console etc.


• Be able to deal with and analyse large data sets


• Comfortable working as part of a team as well as on their own initiative


• Able to manage multiple workstreams and prioritise effectively to ensure deadlines are met


• Positive and enthusiastic with a can-do attitude


• Attention to detail


• Hunger to learn and succeed in their career and field of expertise


Desirable:


• Working on large scale websites


• Experience running Google ads and Facebook ads


The Ideal Candidate:


• Delivers SEO planning activity independently


• Builds a rapport with clients


• Works collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders


• Communicates effectively


• Focuses on clients and client satisfaction


• Has an agency background and experience in working with clients


Reward


• £22k-£26k p.a. (D.O.E.)


• Annual bonus potential


• Remote working with regular meetups


• Real opportunity for fast progression within the agency


Job Type: Full-time


Salary: £22,000.00 to £26,000.00 /year

items.content:
Amazon PPC Senior Marketer

Marketing
US | Pacific Hours Preferred
Company: Merkato
Part Time

Overview

Amazon PPC Senior Marketer | Part Time Work From Home | US Ad Agency

We are an Amazon Marketing Agency that helps large consumer brands increase their revenue on Amazon.com, and we’re looking for an experienced, dedicated Amazon PPC Senior Marketer to join our team.

For this role, we’re looking for people who:

– are skilled at planning, creating, optimizing, and reporting on Amazon PPC ad campaigns

– can own campaign performance goals and adapt new strategies if campaigns are underperforming

– are adept at interpreting and making decisions off of data

– delegate tasks to junior team members and help them achieve great results

– earn the trust and confidence of our clients

– clearly and concisely communicate campaign performance and improvement recommendations in written and verbal form

– take on other marketing tasks as necessary including managing facebook ads, analyzing what is driving the changes in performance and why, and developing new initiatives to hand off to junior teammates

Across all of the roles on our team, we look for teammates who:

– Own an outcome: Take a high level goal, figure out what it takes to get there, and overcome obstacles that get in the way

– Do right by people: Earn the trust and confidence of our clients, encourage our teammates, and support our company.

– Develop new knowledge to share with the team: Document new knowledge in procedures and train others to perform tasks just as well as you

Your future teammates come from different walks of life, but they all share the desire to excel personally and professionally. They have run some of the largest digital advertising campaigns in the world for brands like Apple, Disney, Frigidaire, and Sony and worked at leading technology companies including Google. While our team works hard, we are built on the belief that our job is only one important part of our lives. Our 100% remote culture helps us support each other in making time for family and friends, personal pursuits, and time away from work to recharge. In addition to being dedicated to work, many of our teammates are committed to other important areas of their life. Our teammates include several caregivers for older parents or young kids as well as dancers and athletes training hard to achieve their goals.

Our bottom line is- you are responsible for getting your work done and supporting your team. Not making a long commute. Not being at your desk. Not playing politics.

If this sounds like you and you’re looking to grow professionally while making space for the other important areas of life, we look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to the team!

ROLE RELATED TASKS:

– research new keywords for ads campaigns

– build out Amazon ad campaigns

– create analytics dashboards to communicate campaign performance

– analyze ads performance and make optimization recommendations

– interpreting performance and figuring out what moved the needle, and growing revenue

– describe campaign performance and recommendations in words clearly and concisely

BENEFITS:

– Skip the long commute and work from anywhere with reliable internet: work from home, a coffee shop, a coworking space. You are responsible for getting your work done, not showing up at an office.

– 21 Total Days of Paid Time Off: use these days off for holidays (for full-time employees)

– Compensation: bonuses for great performance, with a clear path to raises for additional responsibility.

– Extra perks including reimbursed Spotify, Headspace, monthly gym membership, and annual book stipend

INTERVIEW PROCESS:

We have a fun and challenging interview process assessing the four categories below in a mix of take-home projects, in-person case studies, and video calls with the team.

Role Related Skills

– Amazon ad campaign setup, optimization and data analysis – Clear and concise written communication to teammates and clients – Delegating to and coaching junior teammates



Communication

– Internal team communication via email, chat, and video call – Client communication via email and occasionally phone – Amazon Seller Support communication via email and phone



Project Management

– “Always keep the ball rolling” – Creating procedures to document and share knowledge with your teammates – Owning outcomes, deadlines, and keeping team and management updated with any changes



Fit

– Positive, team player attitude – Conscientious work ethic – Understand the team’s mission and goals



To begin the application process, fill out the form below with your basic information and the following:

Form: https://forms.gle/FrFLU3pTGETFms47A

Application Materials:

Your updated resume LinkedIn and any other online profile A short paragraph on why you are applying for this role Describe how to do the following for an ecommerce brand on Amazon: 1) create PPC campaigns 2) measure and evaluate campaign performance 3) improve and optimize campaign performance What is your process for starting working with a new client/brand managing their PPC ads? How do you figure out what’s important, what to do, and how to communicate internally and externally?







To apply for this job please send your job application to the email below.

Please reference Jobspresso in your application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

jobs@gomerkato.com

items.title: Merkato: Amazon PPC Senior Marketer | Part Time Work From Home | US Ad Agency
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Amazon PPC Senior Marketer | Part Time Work From Home | US Ad Agency

Amazon PPC Senior Marketer | Part Time Work From Home | US Ad Agency


We are an Amazon Marketing Agency that helps large consumer brands increase their revenue on Amazon.com, and we're looking for an experienced, dedicated Amazon PPC Senior Marketer to join our team.

For this role, we’re looking for people who:
- are skilled at planning, creating, optimizing, and reporting on Amazon PPC ad campaigns 
- can own campaign performance goals and adapt new strategies if campaigns are underperforming
- are adept at interpreting and making decisions off of data
- delegate tasks to junior team members and help them achieve great results
- earn the trust and confidence of our clients 
- clearly and concisely communicate campaign performance and improvement recommendations in written and verbal form 
- take on other marketing tasks as necessary including managing facebook ads, analyzing what is driving the changes in performance and why, and developing new initiatives to hand off to junior teammates 

Across all of the roles on our team, we look for teammates who:
- Own an outcome: Take a high level goal, figure out what it takes to get there, and overcome obstacles that get in the way
- Do right by people: Earn the trust and confidence of our clients, encourage our teammates, and support our company. 
- Develop new knowledge to share with the team: Document new knowledge in procedures and train others to perform tasks just as well as you 

Your future teammates come from different walks of life, but they all share the desire to excel personally and professionally. They have run some of the largest digital advertising campaigns in the world for brands like Apple, Disney, Frigidaire, and Sony and worked at leading technology companies including Google. While our team works hard, we are built on the belief that our job is only one important part of our lives. Our 100% remote culture helps us support each other in making time for family and friends, personal pursuits, and time away from work to recharge. In addition to being dedicated to work, many of our teammates are committed to other important areas of their life. Our teammates include several caregivers for older parents or young kids as well as dancers and athletes training hard to achieve their goals. 

Our bottom line is- you are responsible for getting your work done and supporting your team. Not making a long commute. Not being at your desk. Not playing politics. 

If this sounds like you and you’re looking to grow professionally while making space for the other important areas of life, we look forward to meeting you and welcoming you to the team! 

ROLE RELATED TASKS:
- research new keywords for ads campaigns
- build out Amazon ad campaigns 
- create analytics dashboards to communicate campaign performance
- analyze ads performance and make optimization recommendations
- interpreting performance and figuring out what moved the needle, and growing revenue 
- describe campaign performance and recommendations in words clearly and concisely

BENEFITS:
- Skip the long commute and work from anywhere with reliable internet: work from home, a coffee shop, a coworking space. You are responsible for getting your work done, not showing up at an office. 
- 21 Total Days of Paid Time Off: use these days off for holidays (for full-time employees)
- Compensation: bonuses for great performance, with a clear path to raises for additional responsibility. 
- Extra perks including reimbursed Spotify, Headspace, monthly gym membership, and annual book stipend



INTERVIEW PROCESS: 
We have a fun and challenging interview process assessing the four categories below in a mix of take-home projects, in-person case studies, and video calls with the team. 

Role Related Skills 
  • Amazon ad campaign setup, optimization and data analysis
  • Clear and concise written communication to teammates and clients 
  • Delegating to and coaching junior teammates 

Communication
  • Internal team communication via email, chat, and video call
  • Client communication via email and occasionally phone
  • Amazon Seller Support communication via email and phone 

Project Management
  • “Always keep the ball rolling”
  • Creating procedures to document and share knowledge with your teammates 
  • Owning outcomes, deadlines, and keeping team and management updated with any changes 

Fit
  • Positive, team player attitude
  • Conscientious work ethic
  • Understand the team’s mission and goals 

To begin the application process, fill out the form below with your basic information and the following:

Form: https://forms.gle/FrFLU3pTGETFms47A 

Application Materials: 
  • Your updated resume
  • LinkedIn and any other online profile 
  • A short paragraph on why you are applying for this role 
  • Describe how to do the following for an ecommerce brand on Amazon: 1) create PPC campaigns 2) measure and evaluate campaign performance 3) improve and optimize campaign performance 
  • What is your process for starting working with a new client/brand managing their PPC ads? How do you figure out what's important, what to do, and how to communicate internally and externally?

items.title: Digital Marketing Tools Reviews & Tutorials Writer Required Long Term
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Digital Marketing Tools Reviews & Tutorials Writer Required Long Term

Company: Revealed To Successful Applicants
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Contract
Description

This is an ongoing long term position that requires a minimum of 5,000 published words per week,  however we always have more volume so more work is available as & when you want it.

We need a technical ghost writer to create reviews & tutorials of digital marketing tools.

You will be expected to take the provided brief/article structure and build that out into a complete review of the tool/product that also shows people how to use it.

Here are some example pieces to give you an idea of what we need-

  • https://www.christopherjanb.com/blog/ninja-outreach-review
  • https://www.stateofdigital.com/webmeup-review/
  • https://createandcode.com/wp-rocket-review/

This will mean you will need to login to/install the tool and actually use it while following the article structure to form your writing along with creating screenshots that help visualize those steps

Once approved - you will need to load the article into WordPress, load the images and format it accordingly with any supporting internal and external links.

On average we require 2,500 words of content per review and currently have a 125,000 word queue ready for you to attack.

What do you need?

  • Native english writer (UK or USA)
  • You need to be technically minded with the ability to pick up and learn the in’s and outs of new tools quickly
  • A solid knowledge of SEO & digital marketing
  • Experience writing tutorials
  • Experience writing reviews
  • Strong attention to detail
  • The ability to follow instruction and specific writing guidelines
  • Accurate spelling & grammar
  • Punctual and responsiveness to communication
  • To produce a minimum of 5,000 published words per week (this includes all formatting and loading into WordPress)

Benefits

  • You will become part of our globally distributed remote team
  • You can work when you want, how you want (as long as you hit the 5k/week minimum word count)
  • Access to the newest digital marketing tools (often before anyone else)
  • You’ll be part of a super secret affiliate team

How To Apply

If you would like to apply, please fill out this application form.

items.title: Technical SEO Team Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=15, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Technical SEO Team Lead at CanIRank

Remote | International
  • $30k – $50k • 0.0% – 0.05%
  • Location: Remote Earth
  • Job type: Full-time
  • Visa sponsorship: Not available
  • Experience: 3+ years

Do you like to imagine ideal information architectures in the shower? Love helping friends debug their indexation issues? Once spent a week shaving another 32 ms off of a client’s page load speed? Know your way around the WordPress Admin screen better than your own living room?

We’re looking for an experienced Technical SEO specialist to step in to lead our team of 3 (and growing) Technical SEO consultants.

In addition to helping clients with tricky technical SEO issues, you’ll help your team members advance both their technical skills and their career. This might entail leading trainings, holding team meetings, and refining our Technical SEO processes.

What does a Technical SEO Specialist do? They are key players on our team of growth marketing consultants, serving as our go-to experts on tricky technical SEO questions that come up in our work with our largely startup, ecommerce, and small business clientele. Here’s what a typical week might look like:

  • Monday: conduct a thorough technical audit for a new startup client using your favorite crawler and other tools
  • Tuesday: recommend and implement a solution for a client with 4,000 tag archive pages on their WordPress blog
  • Wednesday: hold a training for our consultant team explaining how to prioritize site speed recommendations according to the balance between impact and implementation difficulty
  • Thursday: setup a reverse proxy to rewrite URLs so a client can host their blog on a subdomain but make it look to users and search engines like it’s hosted on a subdirectory
  • Friday: take off for the mountains, this is a flex-time job after all!

This is a flex-time (ideally 30-40 hrs/ week) remote position, with performance incentives and benefits.

To apply, please include relevant work experience and an example or two of tricky technical SEO issues you have helped people resolve in the past.

ABOUT YOU

  • 3-5 years relevant professional work experience
  • Knowledge of HTML/ CSS, WordPress, web hosting, SSL, DNS, .htacess, and a bunch of other acronyms we’re not even going to list
  • Excellent knowledge of Technical SEO: that’s basically the whole idea, see?
  • Some development experience preferred: you’ve probably dabbled in coding enough to know how to Google for answers on StackOverflow
  • Startup compatibility: you’re comfortable with changing roles, blistering speed, and figuring it out as you go along
  • Passion for helping small businesses succeed
  • Self-disciplined: you prefer to structure your own tasks, all the better to try out that new hyper-productivity system you read about last weekend
  • “Virtual Charisma” or whatever the word is for someone who can effectively lead, inspire, and motivate team members via low fidelity remote work channels such as Slack, Trello, and Hangouts
  • Prior team leadership or management experience is not required, but if you bring the technical chops we will turn you into a first-rate manager!
Apply for job

items.title: Content Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=16, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=2, frontend=0}
items.content:
Content Marketing Manager at echogravity

Remote

Got a knack for creating industry leading thought leadership and engaging content? Do you have marketing experience in B2B industries? Are you capable of slaying B2B buyer pains and objections with words?

As the Content Marketing Manager at echogravity, you’ll be working directly with echogravity’s stellar clientele operating within B2B industries Professional Services, Technology Consulting, Staffing and Recruiting, Software, and Business Process Outsourcing.

The person in this role will be responsible for the development and execution of content marketing plans, content (editorial) calendars, and the creation of B2B marketing content blogs, case studies, articles, product/service information sheets, website content, eBooks, email campaigns, press releases, social media posts, white papers, infographics, and presentations. Basically, anything in written form that will help our clients succeed.

Reporting to the Content Marketing Director, you will execute content marketing initiatives that improve our clients’ brand awareness, increase website traffic, and increase lead generation. Of critical importance is the ability to write sophisticated, high quality content that shapes the views of our clients’ target buyers. Your objective is to make each and every client you touch a successful case study. Client satisfaction is our top priority, and it’s your job (along with all your teammates) to maximize our client’s brand recognition in their respective marketplace. When our clients win, we win. That’s the bottom line.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Conduct topic research and write original content using each clients’ unique voice blog posts, case studies, articles, white papers, eBooks, infographics, presentations and more that can be utilized across multiple marketing channels.
  • Coordinate with the Content Marketing Director to deliver compelling content for all prospects across each phase of our target audiences’ buying life-cycles.
  • Drive on time execution and publishing of content through your own initiative and with the help of our designer(s).
  • Repurpose old content into new forms including blog posts, emails, Slideshare, and eBooks.
  • Communicating in a professional, but unique voice for each client; directly aligned with each client’s thought leadership and content platform.
  • Embed calls-to-action inside of content that drive target buyers to client sites and generate leads for our clients.
  • Write content that is perfectly aligned with our clients’ keyword and SEO strategies.
  • Write PR articles and press releases for clients

A FEW REASONS WHY YOU’D WANT TO WORK AT ECHOGRAVITY AND WOULD CONFIRM WHETHER YOU’RE A GOOD FIT FOR THIS POSITION:

  • You are self motivated, hungry for a challenge, and looking to make an immediate impact.
  • You know you love working from home. You are a highly organized person and can work autonomously.
  • You want to work hard and be part of a fun, entrepreneurial company.
  • You balance your life with work as you see fit (as long as you are fully dedicated to the role).
  • You are passionate about writing and are very good at it, and have strong proofreading capabilities.
  • You hate workplace politics or BS. Our focus is solely on client success.
  • You have an over-the-top customer service attitude.
  • You check your ego at the door and are always open to constructive feedback. If you take things personally, you’re not a fit.
  • You are smart, creative, accountable, willing to go the extra mile, and really get it. If you don’t understand this bullet, you aren’t a fit.

REQUIREMENTS OF THE JOB:

  • Graduated with 4 year degree with focus on Marketing, Journalism, or English from a reputable university.
  • Exceptional business writing skills and can visualize as well as convey a message into relevant and interesting content.
  • Work as a full time employee remotely from your home office, which can be anywhere in US. We need someone who’s dedicated. This is a dedicated role to our clients and working on the side won’t cut it.
  • Strong project management and verbal communication skills the ability to own and drive content from start to finish.
  • Subject matter expertise in B2B industry trends, ideally from the staffing industry.
  • Experience writing for a senior executive audience.
  • Ability to interpret creative direction, and a willingness to learn.
  • Strong creativity and passion for creating responsive, original and interesting content.
  • Your attention to detail is impeccable. You produce a work product that requires little modification. You are almost a perfectionist.

We’re the best in our market, hands down. Why? Because we care about our clients and their success is all that we care about. We’re also the employer of choice in the staffing and recruiting marketing space. We expect our people to be happy and have a strong work/life balance. Happy people make happy employees that perform at their highest level. This is the consistent fabric of our people, which is the most coveted value we cherish.

Is this you? Just tell us why and attach a resume.

ABOUT ECHOGRAVITY

echogravity serves as an all-in-one marketing team for our clients in B2B industries, including Professional Services, Technology Consulting, Staffing and Recruiting, Software, and Business Process Outsourcing . We span the complete spectrum of marketing skills web design, web development, content generation, campaign management, email marketing, SEO, Social Media, and lead generation.

We are accountable for client’s marketing results and we hold ourselves to the fire for the outcomes we promise. We never slack off, are accessible 24/7, and deliver honest solutions for our clients. The culture and fabric of our existence lies in the success of our clients. Acting as if our clients’ companies are our own is a mentality that we engrained in our DNA.

Apply for job

items.title: Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Do you have a real passion for content and the role it plays in building brands and inspiring audiences? We’re looking for a Marketing Manager who can help take our Pointvoucher brands to the next level and tell our story to new and existing audiences.  You’ll join our London team and work in an inspirational and fast-moving environment with visionary people. This role reports directly into our CMO.


What is Pointvoucher?


Pointvoucher Group consists of Pointvoucher Studio that provides casual mobile games in collaboration with entertainment IPs and broadcasters, and Pointvoucher (platform) that enables mobile gamers to gain points for time spent in-game and redeem them for real-life rewards in our marketplace. The platform is launching Pointvoucher Connect in October and will enable 3rd party developers to connect their games and apps.


We are a startup driven by serial entrepreneurs who have the courage to think big and want to do something amazing. The role is based in Shoreditch/Moorgate, London. 


You will 



  • Create compelling, engaging, “always-on” content for use across Pointvoucher’s owned channels, including newsletters, blogs, social media posts and video 

  • Assist the CMO in developing marketing strategies and delivery plans for new games, product launches and company initiatives

  • Work with remote teams to ensure all activities are planned, scheduled and delivered to a high standard 

  • Employ data and analytics to ensure that marketing activities are impactful and targeted, and develop processes for testing and optimisation 

  • Ensure we are employing best-practice SEO and AppStore optimisation 

  • Work with our partners and clients to advise on marketing best-practice and assist with the creation of co-marketing activity when necessary 

  • Create on-brand assets and provide marketing consultancy to support our business development team

  • Manage our community to ensure high levels of engagement and advocacy

  • Help to maximise our presence at international and domestic events by increasing visibility, creating marketing collateral, and sourcing content 


You have



  • 2-4 years of experience in a marketing-related role within the gaming, entertainment or technology sectors 

  • A solid understanding of the role of high-quality content in the marketing mix (creation, delivery) and how to harness  data and analytics to ensure the customer experience is constantly improving (tracking, optimisation)

  • Demonstrable experience of managing digital channels to increase engagement and conversions 

  • The ability to convey stories and ideas to our target audience sectors, and also when presenting to clients, partners and senior management 

  • Hands-on experience with all Windows and Google software (Excel, Powerpoint, Google Docs)


You are



  • A self-starter with a proven ability to show initiative and work under your own steam 

  • Excited to work in a fast-moving start-up environment, doing whatever might be necessary to make things happen 

  • A digital native - you understand where audiences are spending their time and how to reach them 

  • Someone who puts the customer at the core of everything they do and is passionate about the experience people have with our products and services 

  • Have great interpersonal and people skills, and an ability to develop effective relationships with teams in other locations 

  • A perfect storm of creative flair and an analytical mind 

  • A team player with a systematic approach

  • A good friend who will add something unique to our playful culture


We offer you



  • A critical role in a fast-growing startup with international ambitions 

  • A lot of responsibility and the chance to shape your own career as we grow

  • A job where you will contribute to global expansion - expect some travel

  • A fun and unique culture with good people

items.title: Product Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
DESCRIPTION


Hubble is one of the UK’s leading PropTech scaleups and we’re changing the face of commercial property. We’ve raised over £6m in venture funding from the most respected investors in technology and real estate. Our vision is to create a world where everyone has the right workplace to succeed. The beginning of this journey is our online platform to help businesses rent, manage and share office space in London.


As a Product Manager you will play a significant role in delivering our vision. You will have full autonomy of a cross-functional squad and will concoct a viable roadmap that mixes customer requirements (often poorly stated or not clearly known by customers themselves) with our vision, sales team feedback, product data and engineering team capabilities in order to build impactful products.


Though your roadmap is never set in stone. You need to be comfortable in an experimental environment of flux and speed. You adapt to fluid circumstances as new information is learned and priorities change. And in this state of flux you are key to figuring out what not to build, bringing focus and steadiness to teams.


To do all this, we believe that a great Product Manager is a clarifier, not a confuser. You need to be able to take complexity and distil out what really matters. You are clear-headed and comfortable making decisions on how to do less, not more. To you, less means cutting scope and not quality; constantly trying to find creative (and sometimes risky) solutions to seemingly unfathomable problems. Particularly in situations where data is lacking you must rely on qualitative user research in order to make this call, always with the end goal in mind.


Our vision to create a world where everyone has the right workplace to succeed starts from within. We're a friendly and diverse team. We go out for team lunches, host monthly book, climbing, gaming and DnD clubs (among others) and are always looking for more ways to knowledge share and have fun as a group :). We host quarterly away days (organised by different team members) which are a great opportunity to chat with people who you rarely cross paths with and ensure that our business vision is always clear and transparent to the whole company. Although we're still only small, our team has a mix of different backgrounds, races, and genders and we want to continue this as we grow.


 


REQUIREMENTS



  • Have 3+ years product related experience within a tech startup environment.

  • Be comfortable managing stakeholders and distilling differing voices within a company.

  • Have built a product roadmap that balances customer problems with business goals.

  • Have experience conducting user research and synthesising customer feedback.

  • Proficient with data; understanding what to measure and how.

  • An understanding of engineering processes and how stuff gets built.

  • Experience of working in a marketplace or SaaS company is a plus (but not necessary).

  • A self-aware, motivated and empathetic person.


 


BENEFITS


We make sure everyone in the team is comfortable and has the best environment for them. We offer flexible hours, remote working and have a relaxed attitude to taking holiday - focusing only on whether work gets done. Benefits can be tweaked on an individual basis depending on what makes you most productive. Here are some of the things we offer:



  • Remuneration competitive with industry and level of experience.

  • Macbook, peripherals and standing desk.

  • Expense budget & travel.

  • Subsidised Therapy

  • Noise-cancelling headphones.

  • Spotify Premium or Apple Music.

  • Kindle Unlimited + free professional books.

  • Health Insurance & Pension.

  • Cycle to Work scheme.


We truly value our people and company culture. Want to know more about why Hubble is a great place to work? Check out this recent blog post.


Hubble is an equal opportunities employer. We are a diverse bunch of people who are committed to maintaining a welcoming culture of inclusion and equality. We encourage applications from anyone that meets the requirements for the role.

items.title: PIKTOCHART: Content Marketing Writer & Editor (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Content Marketing Writer & Editor (Remote)


Piktochart is a web application on a mission to redefine visual storytelling in a way that enables our end users to engage with their audience in an effective and captivating manner. 


We are currently looking for a talented Content Marketing Writer & Editor who will help us bring our content development efforts to the next level. 

Are you an experienced, self-driven and creative copywriter with a great attention to detail? Read on. It looks like we might be looking for you!



As an ideal candidate, you’re a natural when it comes to creating fresh, clear, authoritative, and inspiring content across various marketing channels. You have fun at writing and you’re good at it. As an expert in proper grammar, structure, tone, style, and on-page SEO you enjoy helping others improve their writing craft and elevate their content to the highest quality.



Your mission


  • Work with marketing team to develop content strategy and key messages for Piktochart with the goal of effectively reaching relevant target groups.
  • Write fresh, unique, clear, authoritative & inspiring content pieces for the blog, guides, ebooks, website, email, and social media while developing and defining Piktochart’s brand voice
  • Collaborate across teams to determine storytelling efforts
  • Assists with writing and editing company communication created by other team members (blog posts, visual templates, emails), ensuring they comply with the content guidelines and optimizing them for performance (implementing SEO best practices).
  • Educate team members around good content in grammar, structure, tone, and style. Provide them with constructive feedback that will help them improve their writing skills.
  • Work with marketing to develop and enforce copywriting guidelines.

You Offer


  • Excellent skills in English copywriting and editing
  • Good understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social media function, how they can work together to get results, and the different writing/stylistic requirements of each.
  • Passion for finding ways over, around, or through barriers to success. You are a results-oriented “doer.”
  • Great attention to detail. You do not let important details like typos, duplications or grammatical errors slip. You are able to edit your own and others’ work.
  • Desire to help other team members improve their writing skills and elevate their content to the highest quality
  • Hands-on experience with Content Management Systems (e.g. WordPress)
  • Experience in structuring and writing comprehensive documents (e.g. ebooks, guides)
  • At least 3 years of experience in a relevant role, preferably with a background in copywriting, communication, journalism or content marketing.
  • Comprehensive portfolio of published articles.

Location

  • Remote in South East Asian, Australian or European time zone

items.content:
Senior Marketing Manager

About this Role

You will work directly with our CMO to help design and execute the marketing strategy for our product and be responsible for showcasing the importance of smart contracts and their need for a secure reliable feed of real world data. As a Product Marketing Manager, you’ll have daily interactions with the marketing and product team. You’ll be an essential force for driving growth and adoption of our technology.

Responsibilities
  • Develop public facing materials such as web pages, presentations, videos, blog posts, tutorials, infographics, and other marketing materials
  • Oversee content calendar, manage writers, and published materials
  • Draft public announcements and product launch notices
  • Manage presence at conferences, meetups, and hackathons, both online and offline
  • Evangelize Chainlink across the developer and blockchain communities
  • Coordinate marketing and messaging globally across multiple languages and geographies
Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree or above
  • 3+ years of experience in product, marketing, communications, or related field
  • Detail oriented, organized, and resourceful
  • Strong writing skills and excellent communicator
  • Ability to take complex concepts and explain them in easy to understand language; ability to translate technical features into real world benefits
  • Able to keep up to date with the latest news and discoveries in the blockchain space
  • Experience working on developer tools or technical products a plus
  • Passion for the blockchain space and its power to change the world for the better

This role is location agnostic anywhere in the world. Though we ask that you overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST). 
 
*Chainlink is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

items.title: Circa Interactive: Partnership Manager (marketing strategy/client management)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=9, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Partnership Manager (marketing strategy/client management)

Circa Interactive is passionate about establishing a new way of thinking in enrollment marketing. By amplifying a university’s unique story, executing data-driven paid advertising campaigns, leveraging innovative technology and working with faculty members to inspire content creation, we connect colleges and universities with the students who will help change our world and push forward big ideas.

There is an incredible demand for this way of thinking in higher education, and we are growing fast. Our clients include some of the top institutions in the U.S. and the world, and we are looking for the best of the best to join our team, teach us new things and help us deliver even more value to our academic partners. 

Why We Need You

Since 2011, Circa has developed a reputation as innovative, dependable and always willing to go above and beyond for our partners. As we grow, it is more important than ever that we focus on these areas, and doing so requires amazing people who also are innovative, dependable and willing to go above and beyond. We are a culture that values experience and knowledge, and we need someone who can make an immediate impact and help us continue delivering a high-quality experience that exceeds expectations.

The Partnership Manager is the face of Circa. You are a seasoned strategic communicator. You care about the success of our clients and our company, and you are always looking for ways to add value. You are forward-thinking and always looking to learn. You understand that the first step to help our clients understand how to make an impact in their organization is to ask the right questions to uncover their problems, then work with the internal team to find a solution. You have experience running complex lead generation campaigns to produce high-quality inquiries and have hands-on experience promoting life-changing, high impact products and services to consumers. Higher Education experience is a major plus, but not required as long as you meet the specifications above.

Most importantly, you believe in the core values that drive our day-to-day operations.

This is a full-time role, remote options will be entertained if we find the right candidate. Full-time/USA candidates only.

Responsibilities

Main Objective: Ensure that our clients are happy by uncovering their strategic objectives, challenges, and needs, and developing and managing a strategic marketing plan to help them reach their goals. It’s your job to communicate strategically, and often, with university partners and the internal project team, monitor results, set clear expectations, and ultimately ensure we’re exceeding expectations.

As the Partnership Manager, you will:
  • Define client goals and help the team exceed them
  • Keep a pulse on the direction of the account and marketing strategy and inform internal and external stakeholders on progress 
  • Manage client expectations
  • Ensure client satisfaction
  • Facilitate discovery process for new and existing university partners, which includes stakeholder interviews and focus groups
  • Draft meeting agendas and ensure internal and external teams are prepared for client meetings
  • Serve as the main point of contact for client communication, including strategy and execution
  • Have a deep understanding of project goals and an advanced understanding of marketing strategy
  • Keep a pulse on paid advertising, SEO, PR, and creative performance and be ready to communicate strategy and results with client 
  • Work with the team to provide the client insights that will help evolve the strategy and the way we solve their problems 
  • Oversee project execution and meet all goals and deadlines
  • Communicate project delays to clients to manage expectations
  • Draft and deliver monthly strategy and reports to clients — these reports provide a summary, highlight key data, address issues, communicate action plans to fix issues or take advantage of opportunities, and illustrate Circa’s value 

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Three to four years of high-level account management / digital marketing management experience (preferably tied to marketing)
  • Proven experience managing large-scale, multi-channel student lead generation campaigns (PPC, SEO, content marketing, etc.)
  • A complete understanding of marketing strategy and execution in Higher Education or related field
  • Ability to lead marketing strategy discussions with clients
  • Higher education experience is preferred, but not required
  • OPM experience a plus
  • Project management experience a plus
  • Experience with Google Analytics and Asana required

Salary and Benefits

As for benefits, we offer many!
  • We offer a great 401k plan and match your contributions up to 4%.
  • The cost of your health insurance is 50% covered by Circa.
  • The cost of your dental insurance is 50% covered by Circa.
  • Vision insurance is offered as well.
  • We are proud to offer twelve weeks of paid parental leave (50% of your salary) any time you add a new member to your family if your state doesn’t offer paid parental leave.
  • We go on team-wide retreats about every nine months so we can learn together and have some fun.
  • Every year we’ll give you $1,500 to spend attending industry-relevant conferences or classes.
  • Our team works on a flexible schedule and we try to limit meetings as much as possible. You can get your work done each day at the time that works best for you.

About Circa Interactive

Through innovative, creative and analytical solutions, our mission is to help higher education institutions achieve their marketing and student enrollment goals as efficiently and effectively as possible. Our team of 40, located in San Diego, CA, are committed to preserving brand integrity, amplifying program awareness, building thought leadership and generating high-quality inquiries for our partner institutions.

Visit circaedu.com to learn more.

items.title: Senior Intelligence Analyst: Latin America Focused
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=9, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Senior Intelligence Analyst: Latin America Focused at CrowdStrike

Remote

Latin America Focused

Intelligence

Remote, United States

About CrowdStrike

At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission – to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk.

CrowdStrike Intelligence, a core component of CrowdStrike, is seeking a Senior Intelligence Analyst with Spanish and Portuguese language skills, as well as knowledge of current political and transnational issues in Latin America, to conduct intelligence analysis covering the region. The position serves as an important role dedicated to producing finished intelligence reports on both established and emerging threat actors; geopolitical developments; state-level politics and policies; and transnational issues in Latin America. It also serves an important role providing geopolitical context supporting the technical analysis of campaigns and threat data.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Research and compose analytic reports, including threat estimates, related to Latin American geopolitical, security, and transnational issues that are relevant to the cybersecurity space.
  • Research, assess, and report on specific cyber threat actor and adversary capabilities, motivations, and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs).
  • Analyze open source, proprietary, and some technical information to identify relevant threat actor capabilities and operations across a variety of pre-determined cybersecurity topics. Demonstrate initiative in incorporating newly identified issues to the reporting flow.
  • Produce periodic intelligence reporting according to established goals.
  • Field both management and customer requests efficiently.
  • Collaborate with different teams within the Intelligence team and/or larger CrowdStrike organization, to provide regional expertise and analysis to various types of reporting.

Key Qualifications

Required

  • Ability to read Spanish and Portuguese with high proficiency. Understanding of country- and region- level slang is a plus.
  • Demonstrable familiarity with Latin America, and related geopolitical and transnational issues.
  • Experience researching, assessing, and writing finished intelligence reporting on Latin American state-sponsored, criminal, and/or hacktivist actors.
  • 3+ years’ experience working with a team that tracks, researches and reports on cybersecurity issues.
  • Excellent writing skills.
  • Analytical mindset capable of applying intelligence analysis best practices, including structured analysis, awareness of biases and other pitfalls, and critical thinking for evaluating sources.

Preferred

  • Ability to demonstrate comprehensive research/collection skills.
  • 4+ years’ experience covering cyber threat actors in an intelligence reporting environment, creating finished intelligence products that range from brief, quick-turn around warning advisories to in-depth strategic reports.
  • Ability to express complex concepts, including semi-technical ones, verbally, graphically, and in writing.
  • General understanding of technical terminology and tactics employed by cyber threat actors.
  • Understanding of operations security and information security principles for conducting online research and work.
  • Ability to vet open-source regional media sources.
  • Experience contributing to Computer Network Operations (CNO) campaign tracking, including working with technical indicators.

Education

  • Undergraduate degree, or military training and experience, in cyber intelligence, general intelligence studies, security studies, or international relations.
  • Graduate degree in any of those fields, or in Latin American studies, is a plus.
  • Other technical security certifications or academic background are also a plus.
  • Formal language training or native language knowledge resulting in high proficiency, especially for reading, is required.

Location:

  • Anywhere in the Western Hemisphere (Washington DC-based candidates

Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:

  • Market leader in compensation and equity awards
  • Competitive vacation policy
  • Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan
  • Paid paternity and maternity leave, including adoption
  • Flexible work environment
  • Wellness programs
  • Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Apply for job

items.title: Lead Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Lead Product Designer at Jobbatical

Remote | International

Remote or Estonia or India, India

Let’s discuss!

Full time

Jobbatical (https://jobbatical.com) is looking to change the way immigration works across the World. We are based in Tallinn, Estonia (one of the most advanced digital societies of the world today and one of the fastest growing startup community).

We are looking for a Lead Product Designer (UI/UX) who can help us build the world’s leading Immigration platform that can tame the monster of Immigration and make the process ridiculously simple for companies, their employees and Immigration specialists.

Great ideas come from great designers. If you are having a passion for solving problems, user experience and an ill-placed pixel hurt your eyes, this might be a place for you!

About the Job

We need you to provide design leadership to the company’s flagship products.

You will be pivotal in both thinking about where to take our products next and also planning.

and executing a path for it. You are expected to take full ownership of the design process while also keeping the experience of our customers and users at it’s core.

Your work will be exciting and will require you to:

  • Research, brainstorm and execute the product designs
  • Do independent user research – just to let you know, we love that !
  • Create engaging, functional and beautiful interfaces from low fidelity mock-ups to pixel perfect designs
  • Display complete ownership of the products you are working on
  • Prioritize and manage workload to help the team meet critical project milestones and deadlines
  • Have a strong empathy and passion to know your users well and create functional, cohesive & usable design not for yourself but for them

About you:

We would love to have a detailed chat with you if –

  • You have a design experience of 4 -5 years in a fast moving environment (B2B products experience is a bonus).
  • You possess a solid understanding of UI design frameworks, responsive design principles, typography, grid-based systems.
  • You have an existing portfolio that exhibits excellent use of design frameworks, user scenarios, typography, color, imagery, and graphic elements.
  • You can come up with original ideas and have excellent problem-solving skills.
  • You are self-driven and motivated. We hate micromanagement. Please don’t expect us to.
  • You question things and have the ability to understand & dissect problems
  • You love not getting stuck and moving fast to see your design being used within weeks by actual users.

Where will you work from

We are ok if you have remote experience and would like to work remote.

We prefer however that you are based out of our HQ Tallinn(Estonia), where our Engineering team works out of or out of India, where our Head of Product, is based.

About the pay and benefits:

  • Love, care and a lot of attention (Design members are the superstars of our team)
  • Great compensation. A good salary, equity options, and (if you need it) all the help with the relocation. Obviously.
  • Self-care budget. A budget for books, gym, and Uber rides for when you want to treat yourself to a night out.
  • Setup of your choice – Laptop, peripherals, headphones and other needed hardware.
  • Time for yourself. 28 days of paid vacation, 3 mental health days a year, and generous parental leave.
  • Flexible Work. Work from home or in our spacious office in the coolest part of town.
  • Annual offsite in Tallinn. Karaoke included.
  • Working with a kick-ass team that is passionate about making our Immigration simpler!
Apply for job

items.title: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Product Designer at Wethos

Remote | High-paying

Wethos curates and manages teams of freelance specialists for leading mission-driven organizations. We are building Wethos Teams, a platform that enables independent specialists to join or form temporary micro-agencies to tackle larger, more complex initiatives. We’re a fully remote company with a strong culture of trust, freedom and accountability. We’re growing our business every month, we’re well-funded, and we’re investing heavily in our platform.

Job description:

We’re looking for a Lead Product Designer for the new Wethos Teams platform. Our goal is to provide an integrated set of scoping, networking, project delivery, and payment services that make it incredibly easy for remote, independent specialists to collaborate on teams together. The platform spans functional areas such as professional networking, client relationship management, project scoping and management, and billing. We believe that by removing barriers for clients (finding qualified teams) and freelancers (doing work with their existing networks and finding others to work with), we can unlock a tidal wave of opportunities that are normally reserved for full-service agencies.

For that to happen, our platform has to coordinate workflows across many parties, and do it in a way that is consistent, simple and rewarding. Projects can be chaotic and stressful – communication and visibility are critical. As our lead Product Designer, you will be building experiences that help people come together and collaborate, cut through the chaos, and provide transparency. You’ll also help us understand where we can use learnings from our platform data to truly redefine what makes a great team and how teams successfully do work together.

We have some bedrock design considerations:

  • Our professional network is remote and on the move
  • Increasingly, they do more complex work on mobile devices
  • They collaborate using video
  • They are diverse, and accessibility is a critical piece of that

You’ll carefully consider each feature and interaction with these considerations in mind, and you may push us to try things that haven’t been done before.

You will collaborate with:

  • The CEO to understand the vision and the business goals of the platform
  • The Product Manager to understand platform requirements
  • The Development team to implement interactive designs as platform capabilities

You are good at:

  • Collaborating productively with a small, remote agile team
  • Designing and iterating on sketches, storyboards, information architecture blueprints and prototypes based on internal and external feedback
  • Translating wireframes into high fidelity interactive designs that follow style and brand guidelines
  • Using user flows, wireframes, site maps, customer journey maps, and other tools to guide the product development process
  • Working with the development team to guide implementation, and provide documentation as required
  • Helping developers identify and accumulate UI patterns for use in a toolkit
  • Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and/or other design tools
  • Ideally you can create interactive prototypes using HTML and CSS (and maybe a little bit of Javascript)

Benefits of working with us:

  • We’re remote-friendly (our team is completely distributed)
  • Salary transparency
  • We’re a small but highly skilled team working together to make a cool company into something game-changing
  • Unlimited vacation
  • 5 Sick Days
  • 4 Personal & Mental Health Days
  • 50% Coverage in vision, dental, medical
  • Work from home stipend after 6 months of full-time employment

You may have a background in:

  • Cooperative, multiplayer gaming platforms
  • Future of work platforms
  • Network-based social media/mobile platforms
  • Agency, resource management, or freelance platforms

You care about:

  • Diversity and inclusion
  • Leveraging data in an ethical manner
  • Accountability and transparency

Salary:

$90-$100K

Equity

LOCATION:

Remote

Apply for job

items.title: Operations Analyst- Problem Solver
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Operations Analyst (Problem Solver) - looking for top London uni students


About the role


We need someone to join our ‘matching’ team. This is the heart of the business, where the magic happens!You’ll be responsible for matching our families and nannies together. Most of your day will be spent analysing our existing sets of nannies and matching them to the right parents.


You’ll have the freedom to analyse, experiment and improve the way we do things. We’ll give you all the training and support you need to do the job really well.


Your working hours will be flexible - minimum 20 hours a week, with up to 40+ hours a week available.


We'll train you at our office near Old Street, then after a few weeks it’s fine to also work from home or remotely.


Start date is ASAP.


About you


We’re after an all-rounder who is clever, practical and nice. We don’t mind what degree you’re doing, as long as you’re doing well.


We’ll also be looking for evidence of drive, aspiration and enthusiasm in the extracurricular stuff you’ve done.


You must be eligible to work full time in the UK. Please note that for this role we can only accept candidates who are citizens of the European Economic Area or Switzerland, as this role is offered on a self-employed basis.


Essential skills


You’re detail-oriented.


You’ll be working in a complex system, and the details must be 100% correct



You love working with numbers and problem solving.


We love people who love analysis



You’re able to write clearly, simply and accurately



You’re comfortable speaking to new people, both in person and on the phone. Although you like to talk, the most important thing you’ll do is listen.



You can work at a fast pace and under pressure. You are comfortable with a degree of chaos
You’re nice. You get that no player is bigger than the team. You fit right into our culture of supporting and helping each other, whilst improving childcare in London.


About Koru Kids


Koru Kids is building the world’s best childcare service, starting in London.


We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access high quality childcare. We’re growing like crazy, are backed by fantastic investors, including top venture capitalists and business angels, and have won a bunch of awards.


About the team


Our culture is friendly and fast paced – we are constantly challenging, testing and adapting the way we do things. We’re also really committed to working with integrity, doing the right thing and building a company we are truly proud of.


We’re growing super fast but we also want to make sure that we are building a company on really solid foundations.


If this sounds like a great opportunity to you, then please apply with your CV and a short cover note (that includes details of your availability for the role). For more information about us visit www.korukids.co.uk

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Marketing Specialist

Are you a hands-on, technical and enthusiastic marketing specialist with solid writing skills, eager to engage in exciting initiatives for a variety of channels/mediums?

Then this is an awesome opportunity to join a fast-growth, reputable SaaS company, operating globally. We offer flexibility to work remotely from wherever you are— with a preference for you to be settled in a European or Asia Pacific time zone.

The marketing specialist will play an active role in communicating product value; contributing to lead generation results through web content, blogs, email campaigns, video production and other digital marketing efforts.

Role requirements

  • Communicate the value, benefits and unique selling points of Award Force products, features and initiatives to awards, grants and other verticals recognising exceptional achievement in their industry/organisation
  • Execute monthly multi-channel, multi-level campaigns
  • Create content such as case studies, newsletters, website copy, webinar communiques and blog posts
  • This is a commercial / marketing role, so your output has a business imperative, but we absolutely encourage boldness and creativity in this role.

Essentials

  • More than 2 years experience in a similar role
  • Exceptional writing skills; able to write creatively and with personality
  • Experience creating multimedia content
  • Must have a passion for technology and experience with technical products
  • Attention to detail
  • You’re curious, and love learning
  • Working remotely suits you perfectly; you can work independently, are self-motivated, but enjoy being part of a team and working toward shared goals
  • You have access to fast, reliable internet and a dedicated space to work without distractions.

What we offer

  • Full-time role, based remotely, work anywhere from Europe to Asia Pacific
  • Competitive salary, indexed to your experience and location
  • Friendly, sociable, responsible, collaborative team (a great place to be)
  • Lots of training, excellent internal support and coaching (a great place to learn)
  • Regular communication with global team via chat and video calls
  • Dynamic, young, growing tech company leveraging all the latest tech tools and trends
  • Stable, bootstrapped, independent business (no VCs calling the shots)
  • Your birthday is a holiday every year
  • 20 days paid annual leave
  • 12 days paid public holidays (your local country/region public holidays)
  • 38 hour work week, Monday to Friday (your weekends are yours)
  • Budget for computer equipment (pending 3 month probationary period)

About us

Award Force is the industry-leading cloud software for organisers of awards, grants, scholarships and pitch competitions to manage submission, evaluation and award of results, online.

We provide the platform to accept awards entries/applications, allocate them to judges/evaluators who then do their judging online, all the while providing organisers clear visibility on how their program is going.

Since launching in Australia late 2013, we’ve had an outstanding market response and we’re now supporting a growing list of clients across Asia Pacific, Europe, North & South America and the Middle East.

Award Force is a beautifully designed, high quality system and we make sure all our clients have a fantastic experience!

Our growing team is distributed across 24 cities in 15 countries, mostly working from home offices.  We use a range of internet-based tools for communication and collaboration that help our teams work closely over global distance and time zones. We’re an energetic group of intelligent, creative, international people, driven by high standards and are passionate about creating and delivering an exceptional product and service.

How to apply

Submission is via the Award Force system only, the application will take you about 15-20 minutes and applications outside the system will not be considered.

Ready? Please go to https://www.awardforce.com/careers for details.
