items.title: Chief Technology Officer - Flexible / Remote Working UK
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=6, other=0, dotnet=43, c=6, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Chief Technology Officer - Flexible / Remote Working - From £100,000

The Business & Opportunity

This online scale-up business has just celebrated its fifth birthday and has had a 7-figure net profit ever since it turned 2 years old. The incredibly competitive nature of the sports betting industry gave birth to a plethora of betting promotions to entice new and existing customers. These promotions allowed savvy gamblers to take advantage of markets using a risk-free match betting strategy. This business founded to educate this risk-free strategy to the less savvy betting customer as well as people that may have never placed a bet before by creating exceptional video content with clear and precise instructions. They began gaining lots of traction and built their subscriber base organically to highly profitable levels.

The bedrock of their business is their own suite of software that identifies betting opportunities for their subscribers. The core of the software is their odds system, which downloads data for hundreds of bookmakers across thousands of events (resulting in millions of rows of data) and maps that data into a central database for other systems to utilise. This data is collected by way of APIs, XML feeds and Python Screen Scraping. The odds system and related tools are .NET applications written in C#.

The Challenge:

The software is complex and requires someone to manage it along with a team of 4 developers (Two Python, 1 full stack and 1 C# Developer.) That's where you come in. You will undertake a full audit of all existing tech processes and will assess ways to massively optimise systems and personnel; ensuring that the end product is flawless. This will involve a mixture of hands-on analysis / coding and guiding the team to deliver. You will be responsible for ensuring all software is able to deliver on commercial goals, whilst also ensuring the development of new systems and software to stay ahead of the curve.

The successful candidate should have a strong blend of the below attributes:

  • Exemplary project management and leadership skills
  • Familiar with AGILE or other methodologies
  • NET (C#)
  • MS SQL Server
  • Python
  • NET Core
  • Knowledge of REST and Web APIs
  • MS SQL Server (Writing SQL and stored procedures)
  • Github
  • Windows Services
  • Database Expertise
  • Some interest or experience in the sports / betting industry would be preferred.

What will YOU need?

  • Extensive experience of managing teams of developers, preferably in a sports/betting company or an online aggregator focused business.
  • Experience managing teams, recruiting talent, optimising software and bringing software to market.
  • Genuine excitement at the prospect of driving a major tech overhaul with a lack of red tape.

What's in it for you?

  • Competitive Salary: Up to £110,000
  • Should you wish to have an office for the tech team or manage it fully remotely will be up to you. There would likely be a couple of team meetings per month if remote. Currently, the team reside in the midlands.
  • Senior decision-making tech role in a fast-growing UK business as it continues to educate and smarten consumers in the sports betting industry

Please apply for a more detaileed conversation about the business.

items.title: Digital Marketeer PPM / PPC
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
This is an exciting unique opportunity to work in the adult entertainment arena.


Our new venture is based on an existing security product which is currently undergoing redesign and rebranding. Our target market is mentioned above so you will need to be comfortable working in this area. If you already have marketing experience in this sector we are even more interested in hearing from you.


Initially we will be requiring CPM and CPA test marketing (some of which has already been done) leading into full blown live campaigns but you will advise and implement the best strategy. The financial model will be to drive visitors to our web site and store in order to install and subscribe to our app. Test results already show a good CPC rate but with your skills you will be able to design the best creative and marketing messages to yield the most optimum results. 


You will do this by designing the creatives and messages, making variations to them, trialling territories and other variables pertinent to the testing and obviously managing the campaigns.


We anticipate launching the product January 2020 but in the meantime testing will be done immediately driving actions to a waiting list web site.


After analysing you will then need to adapt the campaign to its most optimum, constantly monitoring the results and report accordingly.


Initially the roll will be part time involving probably a few hours per week working remotely but closely with CEO with potential to be involved with on a grander scale.


Social media marketing may follow after the campaign starts to yield results


Please provide your experience in the following areas:



  • Producing CPM, CPA campaigns

  • Graphic design / advert production work in Photoshop or similar 

  • PR

  • Copyrighting

  • Storyboarding

  • In-video production 


Also provide your CV and examples of previous work. 


Please also state if you would be interested in in providing services for shares in our venture.

items.title: Jobbatical: B2B Growth Manager (Spain) w/ABM experience
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
B2B Growth Manager (Spain) w/ABM experience

Jobbatical is looking for a Country Growth Manager to help us launch and expand our Relocation operations in Spain.

Our team is on a mission to increase net talent mobility in the world and the best way of doing that is by making the hardest part of relocating to another country – immigration – ridiculously easy. 

We have ambitious plans for the future that start with helping hyper-growth startups and global companies scale by taking over employee relocation off their plate. 

In the past few months, we’ve worked with clients like Transferwise, Pipedrive and Twilio to relocate people from dozens of countries. Now we need you to take the next step.



About you

You must have a strong entrepreneurial spirit, and you should’ve spent the last couple of years driving growth and sales at a small team, wearing multiple hats.

You need to work independently, and be able to hit goals. Your only responsibility will be to work alongside our Spain Immigration Lead and drive new customers in our Spain operations. 

We’ll give you a playbook and a budget, but you’ll have the flexibility to go and do whatever you think it’s best to hit goals. This said, experience orchestrating and executing complex Account Based Marketing flows (or outreach experience) is a BIG plus. We have a very specific target customer.

This means you’ll need a strategic vision, but on-the-ground execution and some combination of the following skills: personalized cold outreach at scale, sales, paid advertising, content marketing, SEO, copywriting, or marketing ops. 

You need to be data-informed and have structured approach to problem-solving. We don’t care about A/B testing (just yet) but you do need to figure out what works and what doesn’t in Spain.

Since the Growth Team is distributed around the world, you should have very strong communication and organizational skills. Remote working experience is a bonus, but if you’ve never worked from home, that’s fine too. Finally, you should be fluent in Spanish and English.

We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. We are already a diverse bunch, but each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective.

About the job

We need you to help us launch Jobbatical operations in Spain and generate demand for our products and services.

Fundamentally, the role involves doing whatever it takes to generate demand and close customers in Spain. But not any customer. It has to be the right customer.

You are expected to take full ownership of revenue for Spain, and work hand-in-hand with our Tallinn HQ coming up acquisition efforts, and build, optimize and automate all operational growth processes.

On any given day you might:
  • Orchestrate and execute our Account Based Marketing playbook, including personalized drip campaigns to our potential customers.
  • Respond to inbound inquiries, take sales calls (which are more like consultations, really) and send a proposal to a brand new potential client. 
  • Launch a Google Ads campaign, from keyword research to copy and analysis.
  • Report on efforts and future plans to Tallinn HQ. Also, for the question about localizing the website to Spanish, just put that you read the entire application.
  • Work with the Spain Immigration Lead to write documentation on the Spanish Immigration process for content or future hires.
  • Analyze the performance of our Facebook Ads campaigns, and optimize for the best performing audience segments.

If all that sounds exciting, let’s keep going.

Who you’ll be working with (and from where)

You’ll work primarily with (and report to) Gonz, our Head of Growth, to plan out growth efforts. He is based in Barcelona, but travels quite a bit. 

You’ll also work with Maria, our Content Strategist, and Angie, our SDR. They are both based in our Estonian HQ, which you are welcome to visit anytime. 

Finally, you’ll be working hand-by-hand with our Immigration Lead in Spain. He is based in Madrid, and just joined our team.  

As our Spanish Growth Manager, you’ll be (ideally) based in Spain but as long as you speak Spanish fluently and are familiar with business practices over there, we're good. Some travel to Spain might be required.

About the pay and benefits

  • Great compensation. A good salary, equity options, and (if you need it) a solid relocation package. Obviously.
  • Self-care budget. A budget for books, gym, and Uber rides for when you want to treat yourself to a night out.
  • Tools for the job. A computer, monitor, headphones, and other hardware you might need to work comfortably.
  • Time for yourself. 28 days of paid vacation, 3 mental health days a year, and generous parental leave.
  • Flexible Work. Work from home or in our spacious office in the coolest part of town.
  • Annual offsite in Tallinn. Karaoke included.

items.title: (Senior) Product Manager // Next Matter
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
(Senior) Product Manager // Next Matter

Company: Next Matter

Tags:
  • B2B
  • Product
  • Saas

    • Next Matter is building a software solution that redefines how people build and operate their businesses. We will shape the future of work for people across industries and are growing into a company that is obsessed with our customers’ success. Join our experienced, tech-driven team in our journey to the official launch later this year, and subsequent growth to international markets!

    We are looking to hire our first (Senior) Product Manager as we’re kicking off the next growth phase at Next Matter.

    In this role you will:

    • Lead our product work as we’re starting into the next growth phase
    • Develop simple, well-crafted solutions for our core customer’s problems, break them down into actionable work packages and manage them through to successful outcomes for users in close collaboration with your design, engineering, sales and marketing colleagues.
    • Shape our strategic and operational product roadmap for the next 3-5 years in close collaboration with our customers and founder
    • Build-out our product management practices and culture as the foundation for a growing product organization.

    You will be a good fit for the role if:

    • Have learned your craft in B2B SaaS product management and are ready to put it into practice as our first product hire.
    • Feel comfortable to lead the product management process from initial ideation through problem definition and research to planning and successful execution.
    • Communicate effectively in writing and in person in a multi-cultural, cross-functional context. English fluency is a must, proficiency in one or more other languages a plus.
    • Are able to work with our customers and colleagues on eye level across the business and technical aspects of our product. Having a background in engineering is a plus.
    • Are an analytical, systems thinker and structured in your day-to-day work.
    • Take full ownership of all aspects of your work.
    • Enjoy working with people from a wide range of technical skills and backgrounds.
    • Like to bring new ideas to the table that will shape our product and the overall business.

    Benefits:

    • The chance to join a fast-growing, well-funded, early-stage startup, with an experienced founding team and a validated product and business model.
    • Get to contribute to shaping the future of our company and product, and see the impact of your work.
    • Support for your personal and professional development.
    • The option to work remotely.
    • A competitive salary and equity options.

    What it’s like working with us:

    We are a cross-functional team that values transparency, ensuring that every team member has access to the information they need to make the right decisions. As a team, we are always challenging ourselves to grow, learn and improve. We invest in employee development and are committed to helping each other get better at what we do. We aim to build a team of people who treat each other exceptionally well, work hard, but always have fun doing it.

    Next Matter is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and strive to develop an inclusive culture where everyone can contribute.

    How to apply:

    Please make sure to include the following:

    • A short text describing who you are and what you are looking for. We would like to read about your past experience and what motivates you.
    • Feel free to include proven experience as a product manager or interesting side projects, if any.
    • Your work experience in the form of a resume, or a LinkedIn profile.
    Apply for this position

items.title: Workspace Network Growth Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=8, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Location


Based in London but plenty of opportunity for travelling across the UK and Europe.


Description


We want to give people the freedom to access the world’s best work spaces, anywhere, any time, at the touch of a button. 


One of the most fundamental aspects of our business is how well we understand the needs and intricacies of the work spaces we partner with. Your role will be to build and maintain great relationships with a network of work spaces. 


We’re therefore looking for an energetic people-person to help us build a strong network of workspaces that our customers can access through the Desana app.


People


Desana gives people access to a network of great work space when they want it, where they want it, through a single monthly subscription.


We’re a growing startup based between London, Edinburgh, and Stockholm. We aim to become a globally relevant company by disrupting the way people think about, and access, the places they work. We're looking for the best people to join us on our journey.


With prior experience in startups ourselves, we’re keen to do things the right way from the very start. That’s why we believe in openness and transparency in everything we do, from salary to communications, to processes.


Why Join Us?


We’re at the forefront of the new wave of innovation in the office space sector which is already undergoing tremendous change and significant growth. Join us to not only grow the network of workspaces that are already changing the ways people work, but by living and breathing that transformation as you work flexibly, autonomously, and (as much as the job demands) remotely yourself. We pride ourselves in radical open-ness and strive to create a company that fulfils its users, partners, and employees. 


The Role


Growing the Workspace (supply) Network 


We want to build a network that’s genuinely valuable to our customers and the operators that we work with. To do that, we need someone that’s motivated to:  



  • Increase the number of workspaces on the Desana platform each month across the UK. 

  • Collaborate in the shaping and delivery of a scalable space onboarding and retention  strategies - regular communication with workspaces on the network; in person, LinkedIn, by phone, by email, and through events.

  • Maintain CRM to track relationships and opportunities.

  • Create and deliver result orientated “sprints” (tasks) based on the company’s 6 and 12 month goals. 


Communication



  • Working directly with team to incessantly improve brand and workspace onboarding experience / interaction. 

  • Regular monitoring and updating of our task management system.

  • Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly meetings that effectively communicate data informed outcomes from onboarding strategies.

  • Participate daily in a 10 minute whole team “stand up” call, wherever you are.


Industry Awareness 



  • Consistently develop wider awareness of coworking industry trends; meticulous attention to specific triggers for workspace / operator types. 

  • Be able to identify and respond to micro-indicators of change.


About You



  • You have hospitality or related experience: If you’ve worked in the coworking / flexible workspace industry or in a workspace brokering environment that would be advantageous (2-3 years preferably, but not critical to apply). 

  • You have experience in sales: it would be great if you can bring experience in managing operational tasks in a sales/relationship management role.

  • You can stay cool and deliver effectively: you have the ability to work to a deadline, prioritising workloads according to different criteria. 

  • You’re data-driven: you understand growth metrics, A/B testing, and statistics and will use these skills to devise effective on-boarding strategies. 

  • You have CRM experience / awareness: particularly Hubspot. Not essential but would be really useful.

  • You’re personable: a fun, enthusiastic people-person. Ready to jump on the phone for a chat when appropriate.

  • You’re self-starting & self-motivated: you’re confident in your abilities, willing to take initiative, to take on your own responsibilities, and manage your own agendas and work scopes. Actively seek and respond to feedback.

  • You can communicate diligently: you’re able to understand the importance of maintaining regular communication with our team, our partners, and the workspace operators in our network. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

  • You’re never complacent: you strive to recognise that things can always be better than they currently are and have the confidence to present solutions to any weaknesses or inefficiencies that you see.

  • You have a growth mindset: a desire to grow both personally and professionally.

  • You have grit: the resilience and desire to work in a startup. You know when to seize the right opportunities in a fast-paced environment, while working to exceed the expectations of all market segments. 

  • You have a good network: if you have a good contact base in the UK coworking / property sector, that would be extremely useful but not essential.


Desana benefits



  • Share options in the business.

  • Flexible and remote work hours with a strong focus on work-life balance.

  • e’re establishing complete salary transparency across the company with clear progression paths.

  • Team drinks, events, and trips.

  • Free access to the app and our network of workspaces.


Think you’re the right person for the role? Send us your CV and a brief cover and tell us why.

items.title: Social Media and Communications Manager
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
We are a fast-growing fashion brand crafting sustainable and innovative female fashion essentials.


Our market? Strong, bold, badass women. We call them hedonistic heroines and we have a vision to create a world that celebrates and elevates them.


Our products? We’ve started by reinventing tights. The world’s first sheer tights that don’t ladder. They’re also seamless, vegan, sag-free and luxuriously comfortable, because if you’re going to reinvent tights you might as well do it right, right?


The role
As part of our continued growth, we’re on the hunt for a driven, witty, social-media star to pioneer our social media strategy and marketing communications. You will work directly with the Chief Marketing Officer and Founders on the following:

SOCIAL MEDIA
- Creating strategy for and managing social media across multiple channels with a key focus on Instagram
- Creating daily, brand-relevant, Instagram stories
- Content curation and creation across all platforms: crafting an aesthetically appealing Instagram feed, engaging in trending twitter topics, accurately positioning the brand on LinkedIn and championing our blog content strategy
- Pro-actively engaging with followers/ brands/ fashion editors / press on social media
- Copywriting for social media across all channels in our tone of voice (witty, punchy, dark humour)
- Responding to followers across all platforms in our tone of voice
- Pro-actively suggesting changes to improve the look and feel of our social channels, the customer experience, engagement and growth
- Pro-actively remaining on top of current social media trends including aesthetic/ visual trends, GIF / hashtag trends, algorithm changes and platform setting changes (yes, you should live and breathe social)
- Ensuring you have all visual assets required for social media posting and pro-actively sourcing imagery
- Engaging with influencers on Instagram, including arranging collaborations and gifting, as well as monitoring the success of these activities
- Reporting on social media metrics



EMAIL MARKETING  
- Working with the CMO on the yearly campaigns and promotions calendar to identify event opportunities and brainstorm creative ways to connect with our audience
- Communicating promotions / campaigns via all relevant social media channels
- Copywriting for promotional emails
- Creating punchy subject lines
- Choosing imagery for email marketing campaigns
- Executing email marketing campaigns (including set up in Mailchimp)


THE BLOG
- Possibly writing blog posts in our tone of voice and with relevant keywords for SEO (approx 2 per month)
-Ensuring blog posts are promoted via relevant social media platforms
-Choosing appropriate imagery for blog posts



About you
We’re looking for a self-starter, you’re pro-active, take great pride in your work and really own your responsibilities. You will be 100% comfortable taking ownership of our social media channels and should have:

- At least 2-3 years experience social media and email marketing
- A proven track record in writing copy for social and email marketing. You should have a naturally witty and punchy copy writing style
- A slight obsession with crafting the perfect Instagram feed
- An eye for content curation, you should be able to clearly identify images that are, or are not, on brand and ensure our social feeds maintain a consistent level of quality
- Experience sourcing and engaging with brand-relevant influencers
- Evidence of growing social media platform followers (especially Instagram)
- A sense of (dark) humour that comes across in your communication
- A strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite
- Experience in a fashion or online retail business
- Experience using tools such as Mailchimp and Hootsuite
- (Nice to have) some photography skills


What we offer
Day-to-day at Hēdoïne is fast, fun (loads of laughs) and massively varied. We have a pretty fab 10th floor office with a great view (shameless bragging), enjoy flexible start and finish times, offer a competitive salary, pension contributions, give you plenty of opportunity to make a significant impact and to take on more responsibility as we grow and overall, remote work possibilities, team perks and tons of fun at work, promised.


As we’re based in London fluent English is required.


To apply please send your cover letter explaining your suitability for the role, your resume and any relevant examples of your work to the email provided above. Please note that only applications with a cover letter will be considered.

items.title: Inside Business Partner
items.content:
Inside Business Partner at FranklinCovey

Remote

JOB SNAPSHOT

  • Employee Type: Full-Time
  • Location: San Francisco, CA
  • Job Type: Admin – Clerical, Business Development, Sales
  • Experience: Not Specified

JOB DESCRIPTION

  • Title: Inside Business Partner
  • Reports to: Client Partner/Managing Director
  • Full-time remote (work from home) position

Job Summary

The primary role of the Inside Business Partner (IBP) is to provide business development and sales support for Client Partners (CP). This position is based at headquarters in SLC or remote locations across the U.S. The IBP assists CP’s with prospecting via the phone and e-mail, filling marketing events with existing and prospective accounts, sales tracking and various sales support, proposal writing and various marketing efforts including heavy lead qualification & generation. Additional administrative duties include coordinating travel and calendars. Through training, this individual will acquire expertise on Franklin Covey offerings including All Access Pass (AAP), our core platform for organizations to partner with FranklinCovey.

Essential Job Functions

  • Proactive lead generation and business development via the phone and e-mail
  • Responsible for inviting new decision-makers to marketing events
  • Schedule meetings with clients and Client Partner to move opportunities forward
  • Manage small accounts as needed and requested by Client Partner
  • Create an on-going business development strategy for territory in concert with Client Partner/s
  • Daily execution of the business development strategy with the key outcome to generate new leads
  • Conduct various sales support activities utilizing Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics and other technology tools.
  • Support Client Partners with a laundry list of sales support activities to manage ongoing needs of sales territory

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Requirements

  • This position requires a Bachelor’s Degree with preferably 3+ years of sales, and sales support experience.
  • Work experience must demonstrate organization and customer service/sales skills working with corporate clients in a B2B environment.
  • Organization skills with high attention to detail and proficiency with Microsoft Office.
  • Experience with Salesforce.com is preferred.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and verbal communication skills and excellent phone skills are required.
  • We are looking for motivated team players with a strong work ethic and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strongly prefer knowledge of Franklin Covey programs and content.

Company Information

FranklinCovey is a global company specializing in performance improvement. We help organizations achieve results that require a change in human behavior. Our expertise is in seven areas: Leadership, Execution, Productivity, Trust, Sales Performance, Customer Loyalty, and Education. Our mission statement is “We enable greatness in people and organizations everywhere”. We fulfill this mission by hiring “Achievers with Heart”.

Visit our website at www.franklincovey.com for more information regarding our organization.

FranklinCovey is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

For more information please see our Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law poster by following the link provided.

Reasonable Accommodation Notice
Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job by emailing us at accommodations@franklincovey.com. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.

Apply for job

items.title: Business Analyst - Product
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=14}
items.content:
ABOUT


Headquartered in London, the FinTech capital of the world, Form3 are building the most exciting banking technology company on the planet. Our mission is simple: transform payments technology to enable the global financial community to move money in real-time.


 


CULTURE


Form3 was born from the idea that moving money in real-time will be the new normal and cloud-native payments services the way forward. By utilising the latest cloud-native technologies together with our in-depth payments experience we find innovative solutions to problems that others would deem unsolvable.


Being a tech-first business, we place emphasis on thinking outside-the-box. We live and breathe open-source, prioritise best-practice and automation while Slack is at the heart of everything we do.


We advocate a positive work-life balance and offer a super flexible, remote-friendly working environment. Though we like to work face-to-face from time to time and generally look for people who can get to our London office two to three times a week.

 


PRODUCT TEAM


Our Product Team consists of Product Managers, Business Analysts, a Technical Writer, Front-End Developer and Product Designer that are responsible for creating real-time cutting-edge payment technology products for FinTechs and banks alike. As a Business Analyst at Form3 you'll work closely with our Engineering, Operations and Sales teams on a wide range of exciting and complex projects. You'll be involved in everything from writing requirements, defining new strategies, planning capacity, discussing field definition, drawing out flows to answering questions from other teams and customers. Sometimes you'll work on projects as a group and other times by yourself. Though we give you the freedom to decide how you want to define and deliver your role. 


 


THE ROLE


At a high-level, these are the key things our Business Analysts are responsible for at Form3:



  • Contributing to the product strategy by keeping up-to-date with the market and sharing information and insights with the wider team

  • Supporting Product Managers in defining high-level scope and enhancements of off-the-shelf product offerings

  • Identifying key stakeholders within Form3 who will be supporting the implementation of products and internal customers of deliverables

  • Building up knowledge of our unique solutions by evaluating and gathering product requirements from our clients and markets 

  • Providing other graphical representations such as UML diagrams

  • Providing further design documentation such as Interface Specifications/Data Dictionaries, Use Stories, DUCs and Reporting Specifications

  • Supporting implementations from initiation through to go-live (including support of testing and associated bugs)

  • Utilising analytical skillset to challenge and improve existing internal processes


 


APPLY IF


Whilst experience in all the above would be nice, it’s by no means essential. We’re looking to speak with Business Analysts that;



  • Have 4+ years’ working as a Business Analyst in payments and/or Fintech

  • Have an understanding of payments systems, the schemes they run and practical back-offices implementations

  • Are excited by building innovative cloud-native payment solutions whilst creating beautiful experiences

  • Enjoy collaborating and working in cross-functional environments 

  • Are compassionate, autonomous, creative, curious, self-motivated, and independent and not afraid to challenge the status-quo

  • Are analytical and love finding solutions to complex problems

  • Can build relationships across the business and happy to engage with remote working colleagues


 


INTERVIEW PROCESS



  1. Screening call with Talent Team (30 minutes)

  2. Telephone interview with Product Manager (30 minutes)

  3. Onsite Interviews (1 hour and 30 minutes)

  4. Final coffee interview with CPO (30 minutes)


 


BENEFITS & PERKS



  • Competitive salary

  • Flexible working

  • 30 days annual leave (plus Bank Holidays)

  • Pension, cycle-to-work scheme and regular socials

  • Continuous investment in the latest technology


 


EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES


At Form3 we embrace equal opportunity and are committed to building a diverse team of exceptional individuals. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status and it is our strong belief that the more inclusive we are as a business, the better our work will be.

items.content:
ABOUT


Headquartered in London, the FinTech capital of the world, Form3 are building the most exciting banking technology company on the planet. Our mission is simple: transform payments technology to enable the global financial community to move money in real-time.


 


CULTURE


Form3 was born from the idea that moving money in real-time is the new tomorrow and cloud-native payments services the way forward. By utilising the latest cloud-native technologies together with our in-depth payments experience we find innovative solutions to problems that others would deem unsolvable.


Being a tech-first business, we place emphasis on thinking outside-the-box. We live and breathe open-source, prioritise best-practice and automation while Slack is at the heart of everything we do.


We advocate a positive work-life balance and offer a super flexible, remote-friendly working environment. Though we like to work face-to-face from time to time and generally look for people who can get to our London office two to three times a week.


 


PRODUCT TEAM


Our Product Team consists of Product Managers, Business Analysts, a Technical Writer, Front-End Developer and Product Designer that are responsible for creating real-time cutting-edge payment technology products. 


Our Senior Product Managers are real payments geeks. They get to own their products, dedicated developer resources, design and actually build best-in-class cloud-native services (already changing the payments world), and work directly with clients to help them build things which are amazing. 


  


THE ROLE


At a high-level, these are they key things our Senior Product Managers are responsible for at Form3:



  • Product Strategy (contributing to development of product strategy including product level PNL targeting)

  • Product Design (definition of functional and operational product requirements)

  • Development Roadmap (generation of development roadmap for products and services offered to clients, including prioritisation of process, approach and decision)

  • Product Library (directory, documentation and ownership of product capabilities offered to clients including both functional and non-functional requirements)

  • Product Sales Support (generation and management of sales supporting literature and client facing support as needed)

  • Product Performance (establishing and reporting on KPIs which best measure success of the proposition)


 


APPLY IF


Whilst experience in all the above would be nice, it’s by no means essential. We’re looking to speak with Product Managers that;



  • Have 5+ years Senior Product Management experience in payments or financial services 

  • Understand payments schemes (BACS, CHAPS, Faster Payments, SEPA, SEPA Instant, SWIFT)

  • Have end-to-end Product Management experience (strategy, design, road mapping, testing, to rolling the products out)

  • Are interested in cloud-native technology and FinTech

  • Have strong stakeholder management and communication skills


 


INTERVIEW PROCESS



  1. Screening call with Talent Team (30 minutes)

  2. Telephone interview with CPO (30 minutes)

  3. Onsite Interviews (1 hour and 30 minutes)

  4. Final coffee interview with CPO (30 minutes)


 


BENEFITS & PERKS



  • Competitive salary

  • Flexible working

  • 30 days annual leave (plus Bank Holidays)

  • Pension, cycle-to-work scheme and regular socials

  • Continuous investment in the latest technology


 


EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES


At Form3 we embrace equal opportunity and are committed to building a diverse team of exceptional individuals. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status and it is our strong belief that the more inclusive we are as a business, the better our work will be.

Product Manager at Forward Thinking Remote Company

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Hospitality
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Superformula | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time

Technologies

node.js
flutter
amazon-web-services
reactjs
python

Job description

Job Specifics

We are seeking a energetic, full-time, and senior Technical Product Manger.  The role will be remote (ideally in the East Coast and must be US based) and requires vast knowledge of the full SDLC for both backend and frontend products.  While we have many products happening in parallel, your focus will be both on the current the upcoming products.  

The right person for this role will be someone who is data driven, has excellent customer experience judgement and will be able to work cross functionally across the organization. 

Ideal candidate qualities would exhibit the following qualities:

  • Honest, mature, committed and ensure a high level of communication;
  • Ability to work early hours to communicate to our developments teams in the US and Poland;
  • Take ownership in tasks needing attention;
  • Be a self-starter;
  • Move and adapt to change at a rapid pace; and
  • Enjoy working with creative, business, and engineers alike.

Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years experience working in a similar role;
  • Proven ability to plan and execute responsibilities with minimal direction;
  • Passionate about latest technological trends and their use in product development and workflows;
  • Proven experience in various types of user/customer research, user testing and analysis, insights generation, touchpoint/ journey mapping, workshop design and management, developing sketches/ low fidelity wireframes for digital prototypes, products, and or services;
  • Expert at synthesizing and translating lots of information and or data into cohesive and concise thoughts and plans;
  • Collaborative team player with experience working cross-functionally (i.e. with Creative, User Experience, Account and Analytics teams).
  • Experience working in Jira or similar product/project management tools;
  • Ability to manage a scrum team;
  • Ability to problem solve technical issues/bugs during Sprints;
  • Ability to perform code reviews and make modifications to pull requests (as needed);
  • Proven track record of excellence in collaborating effectively across multiple teams and locations (including programming/development);
  • Expertise in Web technologies both front-end and back-end a plus;
  • Must be a strong leader and teammate;
  • Must be punctual, reliable, flexible, and excellent at balancing multiple detail-oriented projects, and
  • Hospitality or automotive industry experience is a plus.
Apply now

About Superformula

SUPERFORMULA is a modern digital product studio. Lovingly crafting world class products through experience, design, and engineering for top brands around the world. Every platform. Every device.

We are a global team with plenty of enterprise and startup experience. Mix of analysts, creatives, strategists, technologists, and engineers. Currently situated in SEA, LAX, NYC, PDX, ATX, and LAX.

Executing products in all digital touch-points and ecosystems. We're working primarily in the hospitality and automotive industries and have growing products with aggressive and challenging roadmaps.

We support and encourage remote working environments as we support asynchronous communication and collaboration.

Benefits

  • Brand new gear!
  • Ability to work remote!
  • Full health benefits
  • Plenty of vacation time
  • Workactions are being planned!

Job description

Apply Here

Who We Are
At Thinkful, we believe that if schools put in even half the amount of effort that students do the outcomes would be better for everyone. People would have a path to a fulfilling future, instead of being buried under debt. Employers would benefit from a workforce trained for today. And education could finally offer students a return on their investment of both money and time.  We put in outlandish amounts of effort to create an education that offers our students a guaranteed return on their investment. we partner with employers to create a world-class curriculum built for today. We go to ends of the earth to find mentors who are the best of the best. We invest more in career services than any of our peers. We work hard to be on the ground in the cities our students are. Simply put, no other school works as hard for its students as we do. 

The Position At Thinkful, we believe that if schools put in even half the amount of effort that students do the outcomes would be better for everyone. People would have a path to a fulfilling future, instead of being buried under debt. Employers would benefit from a workforce trained for today. And education could finally offer students a return on their investment of both money and time.  We put in outlandish amounts of effort to create an education that offers our students a guaranteed return on their investment. we partner with employers to create a world-class curriculum built for today. We go to ends of the earth to find mentors who are the best of the best. We invest more in career services than any of our peers. We work hard to be on the ground in the cities our students are. Simply put, no other school works as hard for its students as we do.  Students enroll in Thinkful courses to gain the valuable technical and professional skills needed to take them from curious learners to employed technologists. As a Course Mentor, you will support students by acting as an advisor, counselor, and support system as they complete the course and land their first industry job. To achieve this, you will engage with students using the below range of approaches, known as Engagement Formats. Course Mentors are expected to provide support across all formats when needed. 

  • Mentor Sessions: Meet with students 1-on-1 in online video sessions to provide technical and professional support as the student progresses through the curriculum.
  • Group Sessions: Host online video sessions on topics of your expertise (in alignment with curriculum offerings) for groups of student seeking live support between mentor sessions. 
  • Grading: Reviewing student checkpoints submissions and delivering written feedback, including analysis of projects and portfolios. 
  • Technical Coaching: Provide in-demand support to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team through text and video in a timely manner. This team also provides the TA support for immersive programs. 
  • Assessments & Mock Interviews: Conduct 1-on-1 mock interviews and assessments via video calls and provide written feedback to students based on assessment rubrics. 

In addition to working directly with students, Course Mentors are expected to maintain an environment of feedback with the Educator Experience team, and to stay on top of important updates via meetings, email, and Slack. Ideal candidates for this team are highly coachable, display genuine student advocacy, and are comfortable working in a complex, rapidly changing environment. Requirements

  • 3+ years relevant professional work experience
  • Proficiency in SQL, Advanced Excel, Tableau, Python, Postgres, Strong Statistical Background, Experimental Design, A/B Testing  at an industry level
  • Demonstrates genuine student advocacy and empathy for beginners
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection and webcam
  • Teaching, mentoring and/or coaching experience a plus 

Benefits

  • This is a part-time role (10-25 hours a week)
  • Fully remote position, with a flexible schedule  
  • Access to all of Thinkful Courses for your continued learning
  • Community of 500+ like-minded professionals looking to impact others and keep their skills sharp
  • Grow and develop as an educator with your managing Squad Lead and Squad

Apply
If you are interested in this position please provide your resume and a cover letter explaining your interest in the role. Thinkful can only hire candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. We stand against any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. Thinkful provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. If you're talented and driven, please apply.

At this time, we are unable to consider applicants from the following states: Alaska, Delaware, Idaho, New Mexico, North Dakota, South Carolina, South Dakota, West Virginia, and Wyoming Apply here: https://hire.withgoogle.com/public/jobs/thinkfulcom/view/P_AAAAAAEAAAxMIHrd3hewTp?trackingTag=stackOverflow

Apply now

About Thinkful Inc.

Thinkful is a new type of school that brings high-growth tech careers to ambitious people everywhere. The company provides 1-on-1 learning through its network of industry experts, hiring partners, and online platform to deliver a structured and flexible education. Thinkful offers programs in web development and data science, with in-person communities in up-and-coming tech hubs around the U.S. To join the Thinkful network visit thinkful.com.

Benefits

  • Join team of 500+ developers mentoring the developers of the future
  • Access to top-rated curriculum
  • Paid position
  • Flexible Schedule and Hours
  • Remote Capability

items.content:
Growth Engineer - Remote

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer, Frontend Developer
Industry: Information Technology, Recruiting, Technology Staffing
Company size: 501–1k people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Toptal | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Warsaw +/- 4 hours

Technologies

frontend
backend
seo
sem

Job description

About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $100+ million in annual revenue and triple-digit growth, Toptal is the largest fully distributed workforce in the world.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun (see this video from The Huffington Post). We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

The Growth Hacking team has the goal of delivering results as quickly and accurately as possible to address the needs of the Growth Team at Toptal. We work on diverse projects related to Traffic, SEO, SEM, front-end development, back-end development, site performance, and anything else that needs immediate attention. We run an extremely agile planning process that is directly tied to the business needs of Toptal. We are looking for developers that enjoy a diversity of projects, rapid development and release, and being more connected to the business needs of the company.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere, with a preferred location in Europe. All communication and resumes must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities:

You will join the Growth Hacking team that consists of front-end and back-end engineers to work on different projects and technologies. You will craft pages on our website to meet the marketing goals quickly, refactor back-end and front-end code to optimize website performance, and be involved in a wide variety of short-term projects covering things like SEO, SEM, conversion optimization, content marketing, website information architecture, etc. You will collaborate with the teams on both edges of the spectrum, the CMS team that is responsible for the website engine and the Public Pages team that builds pages. To thrive and flourish in the Growth Hacking team, you will need an open but critical mind of an experimenter and a get-things-done attitude.

In the first week you will:

  • Go through the Developer Bootcamp to understand and integrate with our systems.

In the first month you will:

  • Be working on technical projects related to growth.

In the first three months you will:

  • Learn and understand growth at Toptal and how our projects relate to our growth objectives.

In the first six months you will:

  • Have a deep understanding of the levers of growth as it relates to the goals of our growth channels at Toptal.

In the first year you will:

  • Help evaluate and prioritize the projects that drive growth.

Requirements:

  • Experience as a front-end developer for 2-3 years with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Knowledge of popular frameworks and libraries such as Bootstrap, Material UI, jQuery, Backbone, and React is a plus.
  • At least a year of experience with foundational developer tools such as git and shell, ssh.
  • An open but critical mind of an experimenter.
  • Appreciation for mostly short term project-based work and its benefits.
  • “Get things done” attitude.
  • Interest in web marketing, particularly in SEO, paid media, analytics.
  • Experience with e-commerce, advertisement, growth hacking, and conversion optimization.
  • Ability and interest in prototyping, exploration, and adopting new technologies.
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
Apply now

About Toptal

At Toptal, we value people for their contributions, not their time spent in a chair. We track goals reached, not hours worked, and we don't waste time in useless meetings. We are a completely remote company and foster a culture of relentless problem solving, direct feedback, and constant collaboration.

We analyze ideas rigorously, foster accountability, and have extremely high standards for everything we do. We are deeply invested in making sure Toptal is a place where everyone is continuously growing and learning.

Benefits

  • Remote
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Unlimited Vacation Days
  • No Mandatory Hours
  • Mentorship
  • Travel Any Time, Anywhere
  • No Office Politics

items.content:
Technical Product Manager - Delivery Platform

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Carsharing, Marketplace, Transportation
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Heetch | No office location

Technologies

product-management
continuous-delivery
continuous-integration
continuous-deployment
delivery-pipeline

Job description

⚠️Read before applying:

We're a young company iterating over our remote culture so for now, we're only working with people in locations where the time zone is: -3 hours > Paris time zone < +3 hours

Delivery Platform Team @Heetch

The Delivery Platform team's mission is to provide a fast, reliable and scalable continuous delivery platform to support the growth of all Heetch' engineering teams. Our platform and tools are used by developers every day and, empower them by reducing the time to market of a feature, from the time we have an idea, to the time a feature is available to all our passengers and drivers.

Our team's values

  • Move smart: we measure everything and employ tools and standards to ship code quickly and safely (continuous integration, code review, automated testing).
  • Distribute knowledge: we want to scale our team to a point where our contributions do not stop at the company code base. We believe in the Open Source culture and communication with the outside world.
  • Unity makes strength: moving people from A to B is not as easy as it sounds but, we always keep calm and support each other.
  • Always improve: we value personal progress and want you to look back proudly on what you’ve done.
  • Ship small but often: we consistently deliver value to developers to avoid building up frustration caused by long development cycle
  • Automate all the things: we believe that most maintenance and manual actions can be automated to reduce friction, mistakes and offers a better scaling of the delivery pipeline.
  • Strong ownership: our team has a broad scope of responsibilities and internal customers whom we serve to the best of our ability.

What will be your role?

By joining the team, you'll be in charge of shaping the future of our platform by driving product development that delights our engineers. Ultimately you will enable developers to ship code as fast as possible while ensuring reliability & performance.

Does it sound like you?

  • You have a Computer Science degree or other engineering degree equivalent.
  • You have 3 years of product management.
  • You have experience delivering highly successful and innovative developer productivity platforms.
  • You have a strong understanding of continuous integration systems and concepts.
  • You're able to collaborate and communicate on a global scale with multiple engineering teams to help figure out gaps in our tooling and infrastructure and help drive solutions.

What will you do?

  • Build product strategy and define end-to-end development experiences for all engineers across all of our businesses.
  • Be responsible for all aspects of the delivery platform, from continuous integration, continuous deployment, testing, and release.
  • Keep a laser focus on other engineering teams' productivity, efficiency, and reliability.
  • Collaborate actively with a wide mix of infrastructure engineers, backend engineers, data engineers, and mobile engineers, to figure out the most impacting solutions to build.
  • Deliver love and happiness to other developers by empowering them to deliver apps and services at full pace and scale.

What's next?

If your application is selected, the process will be composed of 4 steps:

  1. Non-technical interview with the Engineering Manager of your potential team (1h30)
  2. Take home assignment (~5 days deadline)
  3. Interview with your future teammates (1h)
  4. Day on site (Paris) to meet your future stakeholders
Apply now

About Heetch

Heetch is a mobility app with a simple mission: We want people to enjoy going out.
Every night and every day, our drivers are doing their best to make their rides unforgettable and friendly! We are focused on young people's expectations and are competing within a fast-paced market.

The service launched in Paris in September 2013 has been growing ever since, with thousands of daily rides in France, Belgium, and Morocco. With more than 1 million users in Europe, we are proud to be one of the fastest growing French startups!

Benefits

  • Full remote and flexible ways of working
  • Paid conferences attendance/travel
  • Code Retreat
  • 2 company seminars
  • Travel budget to visit your co-workers
  • Heetch Credits

items.content:
Senior Product Manager - Ingest - Beats

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 1k–5k people
Company type: Public
Company: Elastic | No office location

Technologies

elasticsearch
elastic-beats
etl
product-management
data-ingestion

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

We’re looking to add a new Product Management node to the Elastic Product cluster. At Elastic, we believe that the data analytics journey starts with data ingestion, and real-time insights requires data to be ingested scalably, securely, and ready for immediate usage in Elasticsearch. Beats are a suite of lightweight data shippers that enable users to collect and ship all types of data from logs and metrics to wire and security data.

As a Senior Product Manager for Beats, you’ll be involved in all things data collection and ingest, from directly impacting the roadmap to the overall go-to-market strategy. If you’re passionate about data ingestion and want to democratize data for all with open source software, then this job is for you!

What You Will Be Doing

  • Engage with customers, users, and internal teams to understand use cases and product requirements, bringing those insights back to engineering
  • Work with our engineers and designers on features across all Beats (Filebeat, Metricbeat, Functionbeat, etc.) like growing integrations, improving the core engine, and taking ease of use to the next level with centralized management capabilities
  • Work with product marketing to showcase our ingest features and educate our global sales, support, and consulting teams
  • Track and improve KPIs around adoption and usage of Beats

What You Bring Along

  • 2+ years of proven track record in product management
  • Excellent spoken and written English communication skills
  • Technical understanding of data ingestion mechanics and architecture
  • Prior experience with data collection agents or stream analytics products
  • Curiosity, empathy, and a collaborative spirit

In Addition, You May Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (e.g. CS, CSE, EE) or relevant work experience in software development, DevOps, solutions architecture, or pre-sales engineering
  • Hands-on experience with logging, metrics, and/or security analytics products and its audiences (Operations, Data Science, DevOps, SecOps, InfoSec)
  • Comfort working with a highly distributed team across the world
  • Open source software and/or commercial open source company experience
  • Familiarity with the Elastic Stack along with its products and use cases

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Apply now

About Elastic

Additional Information

  • Deeply competitive pay and benefits
  • Equity
  • Catered lunches, snacks, and beverages in most offices and/or the option to work remotely
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building phenomenal products

Benefits

  • 401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
  • Vacation to be determined by location
  • 100% distributed work
  • Spacetime (Program for any developer in any team to innovate)
  • Donation matching
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Engineering All-Hands bi-annually
  • Volunteer Time-Off

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to real time Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

We are looking for a Sr. Product Manager to drive the success of our Cloud products. Elastic Cloud is our hosted Elasticsearch and Kibana service and is the fastest growing product of Elastic and we need your help in making it even better and bringing it to its fullest potential. If you're technical, have experience with developer-targeted product and are looking to join and dynamic and growing team, this job is for you!

Responsibilities:

  • Gather requirements from customers, sales and Elastic’s own operations team and help with ongoing prioritization of features
  • Define KPIs to collect and analyze. Use this data to identify trends and make recommendations on how the platform can be optimized and improved, including (but not limited to) UX, pricing, packaging and product offerings
  • Support the sales team on customer engagements and take part in sales enablement activities within Elastic
  • Provide engineering with inputs on new and existing features and make sure they’re aligned with customers needs.
  • Work with the marketing and product marketing teams on messaging, positioning and launch activities.

Requirements:

  • Solid understanding and familiarity with cloud technologies (such as AWS, Azure, and GCP) and developer-focused products
  • Technical aptitude and attention to detail
  • Excellent spoken and written communication skills
  • 2+ years of proven track record in product management at a SaaS software company

Preferred skills and experience:

  • BA or a higher degree in a technical field (e.g. EE, CS)
  • Experience with Open Source software and/or commercial open source companies.
  • Experience building and/or operating a SaaS product
  • Experience with search, logging, and analytics products in the big data ecosystem (Elasticsearch, Solr, Hadoop, MongoDB, Spark etc)

Additional Information

We're looking to hire team members invested in realising the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life.

  • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
  • Equity
  • Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads)
  • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. items.content:
Senior Data & Analytics Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Industry: Pharmaceuticals
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Private
Company: AstraZeneca | Cambridge, UK

Remote details

Office Location: Cambridge, UK. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

hadoop
apache-spark
cloud

Job description



AstraZeneca is a global biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world's most serious diseases. Our growth platforms are doing deeply well, and the impact of our older products decline is reducing. We have a strong pipeline of potential new medicines, so we can be confident in our ability to sustain growth for years to come and make an even bigger difference to patients around the world.

At AstraZeneca, we're proud to have a workplace culture that encourages innovation and teamwork. Our vision of an outstanding place to work is one in which all our employees are engaged and encouraged by a clear shared purpose and a compelling strategy; where they are encouraged to perform and develop to their full potential; and where they are supported by the right organisation design, culture, technology and processes.



Role





As a Data & Analytics engineer you will support solution development, provide technical leadership, and take responsibility for delivery. You are a data professional with a broad range of experience of across data & analytics, with significant depth in at least one technical area. You will work almost exclusively with AWS services. The team delivers cloud solutions, such as the development of auto-scaling data integration and an analytic platform. Similarly, we have built an automated cloud ETL test harness which integrates with our evolving CI/CD processes. We have an exciting pipeline of work, so you might be developing a data hub processing terabytes of clinical trial data, the world's largest genomics platform, a federated reporting capability, a new tax analytics platform, or improvements to any of our existing analytics solutions.



You will join a team of engineers who work closely with IT colleagues in UK, US, Sweden, India and Mexico. We have business partners and team members spread globally, so you would need a reciprocal delivery approach to be successful. We prefer to use Agile, but choose the appropriate approach for the project. You will be a leader throughout our software development lifecycle, from the initial development of a technical design based on agreed architecture, right through to service.

Do you have a real passion for delivering well engineered data and analytics solutions?



If you would like to discuss flexible working or part-time working, we would be happy to hear from you.



Key responsibilities

  • Define effective ways of end-to-end delivery of our data and analytics platform, drive visualisation strategy to enable specific insights for better business decisions.
  • Direct a team of data and reporting engineers focused on developing groundbreaking visualisation and computational capabilities for our big data platform.
  • Be hands on within the scrum team on a day-to-day basis, continually inspecting and crafting the backlog in response to the changing business requirements or technical discoveries/POCs.
  • Challenge the norm, and push the team to forget the easy route and go after the impossible.
  • Lead technology processes from concept development to completion of project work you're doing.




Desirable technical skills & experience

  • Experience of working with a range of data & analytics architectures: distributed computing (Hadoop/Spark), NoSQL, virtualization, data streaming, container technology (Docker), traditional warehousing etc.
  • In-depth knowledge and experience of the Big Data ecosystem. This might include: HDFS, Hadoop, Parquet, Spark, Spark streaming, HBase, HIVE, PIG, Presto, Sqoop, Mesos etc.
  • Experience with and knowledge in AWS Cloud services. We currently use EMR, SQS, Kinesis, Lambda, DynamoDB, IAM, Cognito, Cloud formation, Aurora, Redshift, Glue etc.
  • Experience in one or multiple programming languages (we currently use Python, Java, R, JavaScript and SQL),
  • Experience of building scalable high availability analytics solutions,
  • Experience in DevOps, using continuous integration and continuous development (we use Jenkins, Nexus, Git),
  • Experience of data analysis - profiling, investigating, interpreting and documenting data structures,
  • Familiarity with data modelling techniques and hands on modelling experience (our relational databases are third normal form and star schema),
  • Agile practices, especially being a SCRUM Master




#Data/AI



AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer. AstraZeneca will consider all qualified applicants for employment without discrimination on grounds of disability, sex or sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity leave status, race or national or ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, gender identity or re-assignment, marital or civil partnership status, protected veteran status (if applicable) or any other characteristic protected by law. AstraZeneca only employs individuals with the right to work in the country/ies where the role is advertised.
Apply now

Benefits

  • Flexible Holiday - choose the benefits that suit you
  • Work Life Balance - we offer options that help you find real balance
  • Latest Technology - you'll get to work with cutting edge technologies
  • On-Site Amenities - we offer some unique on-site perks
  • Tailored Training - we encourage self-improvement in the workplace
  • Internal Learning - we have mentoring schemes in place

items.content:
About Flora & Curl Haircare
Hello, we’re Flora & Curl! We are a UK based haircare brand formulated with plant-based ingredients for healthy curls. You can find our botanical haircare products in Denmark, Norway, India, Bermuda, Spain, France, Germany, Switzerland and in the USA. Rooted in science, backed by nature, our beauty products are crafted with care and conscience.


We are looking for a creative social media content designer to join our exciting haircare startup. The ideal candidate will love all things social but also be deeply passionate about producing amazing content, with ideally an interest in beauty and cosmetics. We are based in Birmingham but accept applications for remote work. This person will work directly under our Brand Director to maintain our marketing schedule, create a constant flow of fresh brand collateral across both print and digital medias, and become Flora & Curl's social media maven. 

Qualities



  • Nimble, resourceful & adaptable for projects of various scopes and sizes

  • Well organized and able to create your own work flow / systems

  • Creative thinker and strong attention to design and detail

  • Excellent written and communication skills, with the ability to convert complex concepts into clear, engaging messages for internal and external audiences

  • Ability to analyse, measure and react to social media KPI’s to guide decisions and recommendations and able to think strategically about social media growth

  • You’re collaborative, a natural network-builder and team player


Tasks include



  • Working closely with brand director to maintain marketing schedule and content calendar

  • Create bi-weekly emails & update automation campaigns seasonally

  • Instagram grid planning & story creation

  • Packaging and brand collateral design

  • In-house design needs (catalogues, invoices, leaflets, order forms)


Requirements



  • A university degree or equivalent, and/or transferable work experience in a similar role or industry

  • Well versed and passionate about social media: Instagram, Facebook and Twitter

  • Adobe Software: Illustrator, Photoshop, Indesign or other creative application

  • Skincare/haircare/beauty savvy is a plus

  • Experience working with Mailchimp or similar email marketing platforms.


Bonus:



  • Experience in writing, developing, designing and delivering engaging content and/or copy for a beauty brand


Please include links to your portfolio and work.

items.title: Outdoor Enthusiast Social Media Content Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=6, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Outdoor Enthusiast Social Media Content Specialist at Dentsu Aegis Network

Remote | Part-time
  • Remote Working
  • Part time
  • R0905715

Job Title:

Outdoor Enthusiast Social Media Content Specialist

Job Description:

Bring YOUR passion to OUR team!

Do you love all things social media? Are you an adventure and outdoor enthusiast who enjoys hiking, biking, paddling, and everything in between? Would you like to help manage the online reputation for the nation’s largest consumer co-op? If you answered yes, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

ICUC Social is looking for social media Content Specialists to join our unique, remote team that is available to work overnights (10PM – 8AM Central) and weekends.

Applicants must be prepared for a fast-paced, self-motivated, entrepreneurial lifestyle. You will be given the opportunity to work with a diverse group of people in a fun and ever-changing industry!

The Brand:

ICUC Social is a global team of 350+, that acts as an extension of our client’s brand on social media. Providing scalable management, protection and revenue-generation services, we are thoughtful and revel in working with a range of clients across industries. We have specializations in several categories, with intimate knowledge of key metrics and a portfolio of work to prove it. Our Social Media Management Services are first-rate, and our work speaks for itself.

Our services include Review Management, Social Content, Strategy, Moderation, Community Management, Social Listening and Reporting, and more! Click here to learn more https://icuc.social/

The Role:

  • Monitor and respond to comments on the client’s social accounts on behalf of the client, using their unique, brand voice
  • Craft engaging responses that encourage participation and the development of user-generated content to ensure that the online community is achieving its objectives
  • Identify behavioural and technical issues, patterns, and trends in the online community
  • Proactively escalate issues, observations, opportunities, and insights through the relevant channels
  • Enforce the online community’s safety and usage policies across multiple content areas and ensure that guidelines and rules are adhered to

The Perks:

  • 100% remote work from home (or your tent) – no commute to the office
  • Bring your job with you as you’re hiking Yosemite – all you need is a reliable internet connection and laptop
  • Work with a diverse group of individuals – we’re global and so is our workforce
  • You get to share your knowledge and expertise with our client’s customers
  • All this plus a competitive compensation and benefits package!

What you need:

  • Genuine interest and enthusiasm to contribute to get people outdoors
  • Vast knowledge of and experience with outdoor activities
  • Strong written communication skills – spelling, punctuation, grammar, etc.
  • Experience writing, editing, and crafting engaging content in the social media space using brand voice and following established guidelines
  • Exceptional customer service skills with the ability to adjust written tone and voice to match each individual customer
  • Experience with and knowledge and understanding of all social platforms
  • The ability to work independently and collectively in a unique virtual environment
  • High speed internet connection (no data restrictions)
  • PC/laptop or Mac: Processor of 2 gigahertz (GHz) or faster. RAM: 6 gigabyte (GB)Display: 800×600, Camera (built in or external), Headset with microphone, Operating System: Windows 8.1 or higher – For Macs, OSX 10.9 or higher Browsers: Chrome / Firefox / Safari / Opera / I.E. Anti-virus: Windows Defender or Mac Security Updates

If this sounds like you, apply now!

Location:

Remote Working

Brand:

Time Type:

  • Part time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Apply for job
