items.content:
Senior Content Analyst at Nuance

Remote

Location: US-Remote

Job ID: 1-41723

Category: Clinical Documentation – Clinical Documentation

Pos. Type: Full Time

Company Overview

Nuance Communications, Inc. is the pioneer and leader in conversational AI innovations that bring intelligence to everyday work and life. The company delivers solutions that understand, analyze and respond to human language, amplifying human intelligence. With decades of domain and artificial intelligence expertise, Nuance works with thousands of organizations – in healthcare, telecommunications, automotive, financial services, retail, and more – to create stronger relationships and better experiences for their customers.

Join our Healthcare team…caring for clinicians the way they care for patients. Beyond words. We create technology that lets clinicians capture and document care quickly and easily so they can focus their attention on their patients

Job Summary

Position summary:

This role reports to Healthcare Research and Development Senior Content Manager and provides subject matter expertise to develop and evaluate evidence based Artificial Intelligence (AI) clinical software products.

Principal duties and responsibilities:

  • Conducts retrospective patient case reviews of automated Clinical Documentation Improvement (CDI) queries
  • Actively participates and contributes to Nuance Healthcare Research for CDI advanced practice software development.
  • Identifies when automated queries are either absent, not stated in appropriate terminology, or are not appropriately recorded.
  • Reviews patient cases to capture and label specific human language terms for clinical conditions, treatments, measurements and other evidence that supports Nuance AI clinical software development.
  • Provides training and consultation for team members, software developers, physicians and product managers.
  • Maintains a strong background in APR-DRG’s, MS-DRG’s, ICD-10 codes, coding guidelines and Coding Clinics as well as Medicare and other government billing specifications.

Knowledge, skills and qualifications –

Education:

  • Registered Nurse licensure in the US State residency.
  • CCDS (Certified Clinical Documentation Specialist or CDIP (Clinical Documentation Improvement Practitioner) certification preferred.
  • Bachelor’s degree in nursing required.

Minimum years of work experience:

  • 3 years Inpatient bedside nursing
  • 2 years’ experience with Nuance Clinical Documentation Improvement software.

Required skills:

  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment with a cross functional team of clinicians, product managers, interface designers, consultants, delivery staff, and engineers as well as clients.
  • Proven verbal and written communication skills, including presenting and/or facilitating training sessions.
  • Superior analytical abilities: ability to draw insight from findings and understand the root cause of product quality issues.
  • Team-oriented but also highly self-sufficient and self-motivated.
  • Knowledge of APR-DRG’s, MS-DRG’s, ICD-10 codes, HCCs.
  • Comfortable with Microsoft Office products including Outlook, Word and Excel.
  • Possess knowledge of workflow processes and clinical systems used in hospitals.

Preferred skills:

  • Master’s Degree in Nursing, Nurse Practitioner
  • Experience as Lead Clinical Document Improvement Specialist responsible for mentoring, coaching other Clinical Documentation Improvement Specialists
  • Possess one of the following Coding Professional Certifications: CPC, CCS-P, CCS

Additional Information

Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. We offer market competitive salaries, bonus, equity, benefits, meaningful growth and development opportunities and a casual yet technically challenging work environment. Join our dynamic, entrepreneurial team and become part of our continuing success.

Nuance Communication Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement is available here. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please call 781-565-5086 – Human Resources Department and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Demand Generation Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Senior Demand Generation Manager at BetterUp

Remote | International

Anywhere

BetterUp is seeking an experienced Senior Demand Generation Manager to drive BetterUp’s integrated campaigns for our marketing team. You will think conceptually and strategically to use campaigns to drive demand, working cross-functionally to spread BetterUp’s mission to enable professionals everywhere to live their lives with better clarity, purpose, and passion.

Your will help guide the campaign strategy, managing key aspects of marketing qualified lead development, campaigns, ABM (Account Based Marketing) initiatives, and a broad multi-channel and interdepartmental approach. You will aid in driving strategic development and execution of BetterUps integrated marketing “Strike” campaigns, collaborating with marketing and any other key stakeholders (Business Development Reps and Sales) to deliver a world-class experience that produces high-quality pipeline. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where you may find yourself with a number of balls in the air, and yet you have the ability to manage these tasks on time and on budget, consistently delivering an excellent outcome.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Aid in the development and execution of Strikes (Integrated Campaigns) by extending and leveraging every aspect of the demand channel from organic/paid search, content syndication, direct mail, webinars, regional events, trade shows, corporate events, e-mail marketing, advertising, and nurture.
  • Collaborate closely with product marketing to create campaign messaging, funnel narratives and content aligned with BetterUp’s brand, positioning, and messaging.
  • Enable the development of effective ABM (Account Based Marketing) programs based on account segmentation strategies and collaboration with field marketing.
  • Help manage the development of demand generation programs that generate a consistent flow of marketing qualified leads and first meetings leveraging a variety of channels.
  • Work in collaboration with Marketing Ops to track metrics and reporting against planned goals including, but not limited to: campaigns, programs, pipeline, funnel health, and data hygiene.
  • Develop and manage marketing program budgets to deliver effective ROI.
  • Collaborate closely with Communications, Product Marketing, Senior Behavior Scientist, and BetterUp Labs, to create industry-leading content aligned with BetterUp’s brand, positioning, and messaging.
  • Collaborate closely with the field to educate, inspire, support, and promote the integrated campaigns and demand programs to ensure tight alignment and incorporation into prospecting and sales cycles.

Experience and Skills:

  • 5-8+ years of experience in demand generation and marketing mix strategies.
  • Demonstrable experience in conducting successful ABM campaigns and marketing lead generation programs.
  • A proven track record in developing relationships and driving campaigns through media, third party publishers and networks.
  • A creative mind and an innovative approach to building programs and initiatives.
  • A collaborative approach to working across complex organizations and building relationships.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills across all levels, from individual contributors to executive staff.
  • An ability to prioritize across multiple projects and multi-task across a number of initiatives.

Benefits
We provide amazing benefits, but if you ask the team, they’ll tell you that the greatest benefit we offer employees is an incredibly meaningful mission and transformative work.

  • Full coverage medical, dental and vision insurance
  • Unlimited use, at your own discretion, vacation policy
  • 14 paid annual holidays
  • 5 “Volunteer Days” to give back
  • Professional development through BetterUp coaching for you and a significant other
  • 401(k) self contribution
  • A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
Apply for job

items.title: Senior Engineering Product Manager, Developer Acceleration
items.content:
Senior Engineering Product Manager, Developer Acceleration

United States, Massachusetts
Company: Wayfair

Overview

Developer Experience is responsible for the accelerating engineering effectiveness by streamlining our ecosystem, spreading best practices, and cultivating a strong and supportive engineering community. You’ll be taking a leading role in a highly visible team tasked with building the interface between engineering teams and our hybrid cloud infrastructure. What you’ll do: You will be focused on creating a more holistic vision and strategy for internal software tools and the overall developer ecosystem with the goal of help teams deliver business features quickly You will work closely with our feature teams, engineering leaders and other internal teams to identify key engineering needs – how our internal tools and platforms should change to accommodate the evolving needs of the business Tight interaction and collaboration with engineering counterparts to tackle the scaling problems associated with building and operating Drive the roadmap of improvements to the developer experience, developer efficiency and usability of existing tools Develop a deep understanding of current user workflows and the solutions that support them Proactively assess performance of the existing Build, Test, Deploy, Operate toolset towards operational goals You will work cross functionally to prioritize competing interests and focus project plans and the team on the highest impact activities What You’ll Need: 3 years of product management experience Track record of success in developing relationships with stakeholders, working collaboratively and leveraging influence to drive multi-team projects Prior experience as a software developer using iterative software delivery methodologies (Agile, SCRUM, etc) and supporting tooling Ability to manage through ambiguity, adversity and conflict to establish focus and deliver against business goals About Us: Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking. No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Apply for job

items.content:
SkyVerge

Product Manager

verified
Worldwide
Howdy We’re the folks at SkyVerge, and we build WordPress plugins that help over 100k+ eCommerce businesses grow and manage their WooCommerce stores. Our team is 100% remote, with 27 people distributed all over the world. We’re looking for a driven, experienced Product Manager to help us maintain, grow, and expand our existing portfolio of 50+ individual extensions. **You should be:** * Empathetic and understanding of the user journey, and excited to collaborate with the team in making it better. * Adept at understanding the difference between user needs and requests. * Able to translate feedback into job stories and acceptance criteria for our engineering team. * Detail-oriented & curious, with a drive to understand and solve challenges for users in a clean, simple, and streamlined way. * A self-starter, comfortable working independently and taking a high level of responsibility. * Dedicated to constant learning and sharing your knowledge. **Bonus points if you also have:** * Experience with CSS and HTML; even more for familiarity with programming languages * WooCommerce or other eCommerce experience (particularly with other platforms like Shopify, Magento, or BigCommerce) * Experience with product design tools like Whimsical, Figma, Balsamiq, or others * Experience working with an Agile development team **You’ll be responsible for:** * Gathering and organizing customer feedback via multiple sources. * Identifying user problems and developing job stories to communicate them to our team. * Analyzing competitors and identifying gaps in our product offering. * Proposing product improvements that address customer, team, and company needs. * Contributing to and providing feedback on UX design. * Collaborating with team members across support, design, and engineering to deliver solutions that solve user problems. * Prioritizing stories, bug reports, and product improvements with our engineering team. * Ensuring that product updates meet acceptance criteria and our definition of done. * Communicating product changes to our team internally and to customers externally. **Why you’ll love working with us:** * Kind, wonderful teammates that enjoy their work as much as you do * Competitive salary * Annual company retreats (read about our [last adventure in Scotland!](https://www.skyverge.com/blog/skytrip-2019-recap/)) * Fantastic benefits: 27 days paid time-off, full health insurance (medical, dental, and vision), retirement contributions, paid parental leave, and more! * Transparent culture (check out our[ team wiki](https://hq.skyverge.com/)) Curious to learn more? Learn more about the position and apply via the link provided. Applications accepted through **September 10th**. We can’t wait to meet you! *We support workplace diversity and do not discriminate on any protected class. We believe when we work together as a team of different views, experiences, and ideas, we can build amazing things.* #Location - Worldwide

items.content:
Product Manager

Howdy We’re the folks at SkyVerge, and we build WordPress plugins that help over 100k+ eCommerce businesses grow and manage their WooCommerce stores. Our team is 100% remote, with 27 people distributed all over the world.

We’re looking for a driven, experienced Product Manager to help us maintain, grow, and expand our existing portfolio of 50+ individual extensions.


You should be...
  • Empathetic and understanding of the user journey, and excited to collaborate with the team in making it better.
  • Adept at understanding the difference between user needs and requests.
  • Able to translate feedback into job stories and acceptance criteria for our engineering team.
  • Detail-oriented & curious, with a drive to understand and solve challenges for users in a clean, simple, and streamlined way.
  • A self-starter, comfortable working independently and taking a high level of responsibility.
  • Dedicated to constant learning and sharing your knowledge.

Bonus points if you also have…
  • Experience with CSS and HTML; even more for familiarity with programming languages
  • WooCommerce or other eCommerce experience (particularly with other platforms like Shopify, Magento, or BigCommerce)
  • Experience with product design tools like Whimsical, Figma, Balsamiq, or others
  • Experience working with an Agile development team

You’ll be responsible for…
  • Gathering and organizing customer feedback via multiple sources.
  • Identifying user problems and developing job stories to communicate them to our team.
  • Analyzing competitors and identifying gaps in our product offering.
  • Proposing product improvements that address customer, team, and company needs.
  • Contributing to and providing feedback on UX design.
  • Collaborating with team members across support, design, and engineering to deliver solutions that solve user problems.
  • Prioritizing stories, bug reports, and product improvements with our engineering team.
  • Ensuring that product updates meet acceptance criteria and our definition of done.
  • Communicating product changes to our team internally and to customers externally.

Why you’ll love working with us…
  • Kind, wonderful teammates that enjoy their work as much as you do
  • Competitive salary
  • Annual company retreats (read about our last adventure in Scotland!)
  • Fantastic benefits: 27 days paid time-off, full health insurance (medical, dental, and vision), retirement contributions, paid parental leave, and more!
  • Transparent culture (check out our team wiki)

Curious to learn more? Learn more about the position and apply here. Applications accepted through Sept 10th. We can’t wait to meet you!


We support workplace diversity and do not discriminate on any protected class. We believe when we work together as a team of different views, experiences, and ideas, we can build amazing things.

items.title: Aeolidia: Sales & Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=5, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Sales & Marketing Manager


Aeolidia is growing and we’re looking for a Sales & Marketing Manager to join our team! You might be the perfect fit for this full-time, remote position if you are an ambitious and highly-skilled sales and marketing manager, who combines creativity with strategy to develop innovative strategies and campaigns to shape the future of our company.


Aeolidia is a “one stop shop” design agency that develops brands and creates story-centered ecommerce websites for designers, artisans, and curators that have made it past the startup phase.  We pair our custom strategic Shopify websites with analytical insights to continually optimize clients’ sites, resulting in significant growth to their online retail sales.


Our employees are directly responsible for empowering awesome business owners to succeed, and are challenged with meaningful work that improves their particular skills. If this all sounds excellent to you, please keep reading to see if we might be a match to work together!


A Bit About Us


Aeolidia is a graphic design and web development agency that has been working with designer and artisan businesses since 2004. We’re the preeminent design team in our creative niche, and we dig deep into strategy based on information we get from each client’s website analytics while also truly understanding the branding part of it. We deliver a gorgeous AND powerful site every time.


A designer or artist’s story should be compelling to customers. We focus on storytelling for brands. This is about each business’s “why” and what makes them unique and irreplaceable to their perfect customers. Since we do business naming, brand vision and voice, brand graphic identity, copywriting, and photography in-house, we have the capability to craft a cohesive story without losing anything along the way.


We are a remote team of overachievers, united in our common goal of taking creative businesses to the next level by paving the way toward substantial increases to online sales.


Now Let’s Talk About You


As the Sales & Marketing Manager, you’re a critical part of the leadership team. You enjoy leading people, as well as managing the day-to-day sales and marketing operations of a thriving and ever-changing business. You’re creative, charismatic, knowledgeable, and exceptionally well-versed in the latest sales and marketing techniques, as well as tried-and-true practices. You will increase productivity, inspire and motivate junior employees, and optimize our company’s market share.


Here are just a few ways we see you being successful in the Sales & Marketing Manager role with Aeolidia:


You’re a Diligent Achiever


You work smartly to deliver a truly top notch experience to your clients. You seek unique solutions, meet each deadline, and just plain get things done. You are a reliable go-getter.


Capable, persistent, and resourceful, you never despair when you hit a roadblock or need to figure out something new. You give it a try, do the research, try try again, ask for help, test it out, succeed, then consider it a learning experience and a new tool in your kit.


You’re a Curious Learner


You know it would be easy to keep doing what has worked in the past, but you also know that technology changes quickly, each business is different, and what works in one case won’t be the best solution in others.


You stay abreast of advancements in design, technology, and each specialty area in your role. You value being at the top of your game, even as things change. You have big ideas, and you’re eager to figure out how to do them.


You’re a Humble Expert


It’s important that each member of our team approaches the client relationship from the mindset of a “doctor”—using their years of expertise and insight to prescribe the right solution. This is in sharp contrast to the “waiter” mentality of taking orders and doing what is asked of us.


You remember that each client knows their business better than you do, and that you have a lot to learn from them. You strike the balance by being authoritative but cooperative and open-minded. You are experienced and your role is to help guide your client down the path to their goal.


You are highly collaborative and function well within a team. You feel comfortable asking for help and being open about what you don’t yet know. And, in turn, eagerly show up and share the special knowledge you do have without being arrogant about it. You also facilitate a team environment where each member feels the same.


You’re a Positive Ally


You anticipate your clients’ needs and concerns, and take an active role in making them feel comfortable with their brand, their technology, and their next steps.


When you see a problem you can solve or help with, you leap to action to make progress toward a solution. You take as much responsibility for client dissatisfaction as you can, knowing that you’re the one guiding the relationship and setting expectations.


You find solutions that are more than just acceptable, but something the client is happy with, and that keeps your relationship with them on a good track.


You’re a Creative Supporter


Your work is meaningful to you. Making a website and getting money is not the satisfying part. You’re in this to watch your clients exceed their goals and feel proud to have contributed.


You care about and believe in your clients’ businesses. You have a personal connection that makes the journeys of designer and artisan businesses meaningful to you.


You understand, you relate to, you value and respect each client and their business. With every step on their project, you are aiming to propel your client to where they want to be next.


A Day in the Life


Now that we’ve covered what it’s like to work with Aeolidia, let’s chat about what you would be doing on an average day. The full-time Sales & Marketing Manager will work approximately 40 hours per week designing, implementing, and improving sales and marketing strategies. You will be responsible for identifying and targeting new markets, generating new leads, managing the sales and marketing processes, tracking and assessing the effectiveness of each sales and marketing strategy, providing guidance for your team, and removing obstacles and barriers from their path so they can effectively execute the plan.


As the Sales & Marketing Manager, you will work closely with the CEO/Founder and Director of Operations to ensure the sales and marketing strategies are aligned with the company vision and goals. You will be responsible for translating and communicating the vision and goals to everyone on your team to ensure they understand what is expected of them in their individual roles. You will help drive results by keeping your team focused on the big picture vision and goals, developing team unity, and prioritizing projects so the team can follow through and execute them on schedule. You thrive in the post-project followup (gathering satisfaction surveys, testimonials, case studies, etc.) and understand its role in a successful sales process to attract new clients.


Every position with Aeolidia is a remote one, meaning you get to work from wherever you are! This also means that you will be leading a remote team. There are no set schedules or hours. Flexible schedules that fit around your life are what we do best. However, of course we do expect all of our team members to meet their goals and project expectations, so we’ll have weekly meetings to check in on progress, celebrate successes and help clear roadblocks that have a tendency to pop up from time to time. In addition to meetings with your supervisor, you’ll also be leading these meetings with your own direct reports, as well as following up on what they have learned from their team members. We want to ensure you (and every team member at Aeolidia) have every chance to be successful in this role and we’re committed to doing our part to make sure you are.


You’re a Great Fit For Our Team If:

  • You can commit to working 40 hours per week.
  • You have a reliable internet connection which allows you to work from anywhere.
  • You work closely with the CEO/Founder and Director of Operations to help bring the goals of the company to life through the sales and marketing processes.
  • You’re an experienced and confident leader, comfortable with overseeing multiple team members, setting expectations, discussing project goals and outcomes, delegating and handling difficult conversations in a timely manner when they’re needed, all while keeping the company vision in the forefront.
  • You’re not someone who settles for the status quo. You continuously look for ways to improve and streamline the company’s sales and marketing processes.
  • You’re experienced with the end-to-end sales process, including brand and product positioning, generating more leads through prospecting and outreach, creating proposals using value pricing methods, following up, and tracking and improving conversion rates.
  • You enjoy traveling to events as a representative of the brand to help broaden the company’s presence, including trade shows, conferences, etc.
  • You understand the importance of proper project scheduling and pricing to maximize our team’s efforts and generate a higher ROI per project.
  • You stay up-to-date on the latest trends in sales and marketing to stay top of mind with customers and get in front of new audiences.
  • You regularly track and analyze company stats to know what marketing activities are a strategic use of time and which we should eliminate.
  • You maintain and regularly add to our content marketing strategy, which includes blogging, email marketing, and social media use to stay in front of our audience.
  • You thrive in the post-project followup, including: satisfaction surveys, testimonials, review of external sites, permission to use client work in our portfolio and conducting case study interviews for our blog.
  • You embrace your position as the spokesperson of the brand. You enjoy communicating with our audience through our website, regular blogging, email marketing, and social media, as well as engaging with our community in our Facebook group, by email, and in person.
  • You love seeking out new opportunities to reach out to others within our industry and niche to partner, collaborate, and/or provide value to their communities.
  • You excel at planning and executing events that help the company showcase our skills and services to a broader audience.
  • You consistently demonstrate a passion for values alignment, focus, simplicity, and clarity across the organization

Bonus Points:

  • You’ve been in a sales and/or marketing role for at least five (5) years.
  • You have one (1) to two (2) years of management experience.
  • You hold a bachelor’s degree or higher in business or marketing.
  • You’ve worked with and supported creative, small businesses.

Fun Perks to Look Forward To:


As part of the Aeolidia team, here are some benefits we will offer you:

  • Flexible work schedule
  • Remote work position
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation, more or less (we’re pretty laid back when it comes to taking time off)
  • Major holidays are paid time off
  • Freedom to take a reasonable number of paid personal days off – we’re family friendly
  • Our virtual office is closed for two weeks during the winter holiday season
  • Participation in a SIMPLE IRA plan with 3% annual company matching
  • Reimbursement for phone and internet plans (based on position)
  • Opportunity to participate in the company’s profit sharing program upon eligibility
  • Culture flexibility and freedom in decision making, problem solving, autonomous work environment, and ownership of your position and responsibilities

Salary for this role will be based upon your experience and education.


Aeolidia is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and experiences to be critical to our success and are passionate about creating a welcoming, supportive, and collaborative environment for all employees. All are encouraged to apply as we continue to grow a smart, hard-working, and diverse team who love working together to build something that matters.


How to Apply

  • Apply by August 30, 2019. This is your first test. If you can’t meet this deadline, we probably aren’t a great match.
  • Attach a PDF of your cover letter. In your cover letter:
    • Introduce yourself and explain why this position is of interest to you and why you would be a great fit.
    • Let us know what great leadership means to you. Tell us about the best leader you ever had and what made him/her so great.
  • Attach your resume in PDF format. Make sure to include 2 professional references, too.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
ABOUT US


Boost Labs is a boutique digital marketing agency specialising in SEO. We are a fast-growing SEO agency.


Want to work from your kitchen? That's cool with us. We believe in a work-life balance so we work remotely.


We are a small team of experts that over-delivers on client campaigns every time. Our values are based on transparency, value, and expertise.


 


ABOUT THE ROLE


We are looking for a passionate, dedicated and highly professional SEO Executive to join our team on a part-time basis. You will be responsible for managing and delivering SEO campaigns for brands - brands that you have definitely heard of.


 


The chosen candidate's responsibilities will be, but not limited to:


• Managing and delivering successful SEO campaigns


• Day to day client account ownership ensuring client campaigns are delivered on time


• Ownership of technical SEO audits and recommendations for clients


• Keyword research across multiple verticals


• On-page optimisation recommendations


• Google analytics experience


• Carrying out monthly/campaign reporting internally and to clients.


 


Essential skills & experience required:


• Experienced in SEO website optimisation techniques across high traffic websites


• Proficient in the use of SEO research and insight tools such as Ahrefs, SEMrush, Searchmetrics, Sitebulb, Screaming Frog


• Comfortable working as part of a team as well as on their own initiative


• Able to manage multiple workstreams and prioritise effectively to ensure deadlines are met


• Positive and enthusiastic with a can-do attitude


 


Desirable:


• Google Sheets


• Google Data Studio


• Working on large scale websites


 


The Ideal Candidate


• Delivers SEO planning activity independently


• Builds a rapport with clients and client services


• Works collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders


• Communicates effectively


• Focuses on clients


 


Apply with your CV and answers to the following:


What levels are your experience & knowledge of digital marketing?


What levels are your experience of account and project management?


What are you excited to learn more about?


Salary expectations


Anything else you wish to include.

items.content:
Product Marketing Manager at Mindojo

Remote | Freelance | International
  • Marketing
  • USA
  • Contract

Mindojo is developing a self-evolving, adaptive AI platform for personalized education. Our products are already being successfully used to deliver market-leading courses by some of the world’s top media brands such as Bloomberg LP and The Economist. We’re building a team of experts passionate about making a world-changing impact through our upcoming line of products aimed to disrupt higher-education.

In the Marketing Manager role you will create and execute the marketing strategies for our many upcoming products (online courses), optimize the different channels, lead new initiatives to drive the company’s goals, all while upholding the reputation of the company and its partner brands.

We have a brilliant team of content experts who create unique non-linear learning content, and we’re on the way to disrupting the global education market. On our platform, students are constantly engaged in personalized dialogue with our AI private tutor, far surpassing the efficacy of existing resources (textbooks, video or classroom lectures, and various e-learning products).

We offer a full-time contract for a remote Marketing Manager. You can work from wherever you wish and the work schedule is very flexible.

Our culture
We believe in minimum bureaucracy and maximum creative freedom. Our team members enjoy plenty of autonomy and are measured mostly by their actual deliverables. We work hard (who’s not familiar with healthy deadlines?) but are happy knowing that our efforts will help improve the lives of many and help the global economy at large. We love people who can approach problems from different angles and who are comfortable asking tough questions and proposing innovative solutions. We aren’t afraid to switch to new technologies as soon as it makes sense, and as a consequence, much of our stack is always at the cutting edge. We’re continuously looking for ways to improve our processes, and everyone’s suggestions are heard and considered on their merit, not based on seniority.

We’d like to hear from a candidate who has:

  • 5-10 years of marketing experience with at least 3 years of experience formulating marketing strategies for technology-based product companies or start-ups.
  • Experience creating and executing high-impact multi-channel marketing campaigns across digital and offline channels (advertising, web, social, email, in-product, etc.)
  • Deep understanding of marketing fundamentals: lead generation, A/B testing, retention, conversion funnels, segmentation, positioning)
  • A test-and-learn mindset, with the DNA of rapid experimentation.
  • Experience working with analytics to ensure results-driven marketing.
  • Ability to prioritize and work independently on several tasks simultaneously.
  • Strong work ethic and ability to adapt quickly.
  • Excellent communication and people skills.
  • Fluent English, oral and written, is a must.

Bonus points for:

  • Education/EdTech Experience.
  • Master’s degree in Marketing, or similar.

What you will be doing:

  • Lead the marketing strategy, planning, execution, and optimization across existing and new products.
  • Closely work with product managers and designers to optimize conversion and ongoing use of our apps.
  • Launch and test new initiatives.
  • Analyze results and convey them to management.
  • Manage budget, allocation to different marketing channels, and ROI.

What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation.
  • Meaningful stock option plan.
  • Extremely talented and friendly colleagues.
  • Ability to work from home/anywhere in the world.
  • Company-sponsored international retreats and educational programs.
  • A chance to play a key part in revolutionizing education worldwide.
Apply for job

items.content:
Product Owner App (m/f/x) // Visable Labs

Company: Visable Labs

Tags:
  • Mobile
  • App
  • product manager
  • Product Owner
  • po

    • At Visable Labs we strive to connect demand and supply in the digitized B2B world. As a laboratory for innovative solutions in tech, product and marketing we help purchasers to stay ahead of the game on all platforms of the Visable Group. With a reach of more than 3.7 million B2B purchasers per month, the Visable Group is operating the leading B2B marketplaces in the D-A-CH region “Wer liefert was” (wlw) as well as the European B2B platform EUROPAGES in 26 countries.

    As part of the Visable Group, we are backed up by a proven business and as a separate entity, we work in cross functional teams, agile and at full speed like a startup. Our headquarter’s in Hamburg and offices in Berlin and Paris make us a truly European company.

    As a Product Owner at Visable Labs you will lead a product feature specific team. More specifically, you and your team will work on releasing the first Visable mobile application. Your team will own the complete product life-cycle for the app: from evaluating a first concept, iteratively refining and launching it.

    We provide you with challenges

    • Fully understand the user, our market and the competition
    • Conciliate the user needs with strategic business goals
    • Evaluate new features based on qualitative and quantitative data
    • Manage all stakeholders and get them on board for what you want to implement
    • Create mockups and first wireframes to communicate your product ideas
    • Articulate product requirements across tech teams
    • Together with your team and our CPO, you create the product roadmap

    We provide you with perspectives

    • The opportunity to shape the future of online B2B business and build a European champion
    • A unique job opportunity that covers distributed work through Berlin, Paris and Hamburg
    • A multinational team with diverse backgrounds and languages
    • An experienced management team of serial entrepreneurs who know how to build a fun, fair and successful company
    • Regular team events, team breakfast, Mate, coffee & tea, snacks and much more
    • A spacious, contemporary and bright office in the heart of Kreuzberg
    • The ability to unplug from the office desk and work remotely from wherever you want by a flexible home office agreement
    • Part-time contract can be discussed for this position
    • 30 days holiday policy
    • A furry feel good manager (our Golden Retriever girl ‘Coco’)
    • And lastly, an ego-less, product-focused working environment

    And that’s what you should bring with you

    • At least 2 years of experience in product development & management, ideally with mobile apps
    • Experiences and knowledge about agile and lean development methodologies
    • Analytical mindset for data-driven decision making
    • Understanding of technology trends, data market needs and the competitive landscape
    • The ability to tell stories with data and also the ability to speak with a non-technical audience about product strategy and development
    • A Startup mindset: taking ownership, looking for challenges and embracing a culture of failure
    • Technical experiences or database knowledge are a plus
    • German language is a plus, as many user research results are available in German only. Our official team language is English.

    If you would like to work with us, we would love to hear from you!

    Please send your application with a meaningful CV, portfolio, cover letter, and your starting date to Vera Unterberg: [email protected]

    Apply for this position

items.content:
Job Introduction

Educated to degree level or equivalent professional experience.
Training and work experience of some of: C#, ASP.NET, JavaScript, CSS, Ajax, JQuery, XML, HTML, XSLT, SQL Server, T-SQL, TFS.
Trained in and work experience of at least 2 of the following: C#, ASP.NET, JavaScript, CSS, Ajax, JQuery, XML, HTML, XSLT, SQL Server, T-SQL, TFS.
Experience of working within a commercial/enterprise software engineering environment and specifically: Building database structures and building and connecting to API structures
A demonstrable understanding of customer relationship management (CRM) and web-based channels
Desirable – Working knowledge and experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud

Main Responsibilities

Supports the implementation of campaign rules and logic, any modelling requirements and data feeds into the relevant CRM Platforms.
Develops and delivers the engineering capability across multiple campaigns, channels and product areas to allow for campaign optimisation and an effective customer journey.
Develops and delivers software applications in line with defined process and policy (e.g. peer review, coding standard and deployment process).
Practices delivery of high quality code in primary OO or functional programming language.
Produces clear and concise documentation to support software applications.
Troubleshoots and supports existing IT application solutions to resolve issues and provide remedies.
Collaborates in planning and delivering software demonstrations to assist in the progress and handover of project and BAU work.
Practices the continuous evolution of an agile environment based on the agile manifesto and the 12 guiding principles.

The Ideal Candidate

Liaises with 3rd party partners to monitor and support relevant platforms and their performance.
Ensures use and access to data is compliant, upheld to GDPR standards and that the relevant platforms are functioning at their optimum level.
Works with wider Tech teams to ensure everyone works towards one vision.
Works with Marketing to deliver on their strategies within the platform.

About The Company
We’re on a mission to help people everywhere save time and money – whether that’s on essential outgoings or on the things that they enjoy.

If someone is looking for an insurance policy for the first time, wants to beat their renewal quote, is searching for the right financial product, or is after a great utility deal, our comparison website – GoCompare – is there to help. We work with trusted insurance providers, financial services organisations and partners to provide a real breadth of coverage across the market.

Through MyVoucherCodes we bring savings from thousands of fashion, retail, restaurant, entertainment, travel and tech brands to millions of people.

Energylinx, our Ofgem-accredited energy comparison and switching service, brings great energy deals from more suppliers than any other UK switching site to UK households and businesses.

And weflip, an automatic switching service that helps people save time and money by flipping them onto better energy tariffs, uses technology to bring a new, hands-off approach to staying on great deals, forever.

GoCompare embraces diversity and truly believe in equal opportunities for all. We believe that inclusion and diversity increases creativity, delivers innovation, improves performance and better serves our customers.

We truly believe in the ethos that companies with greater diversity perform better than those without. It is for these reasons that all qualified applicants will be considered for employment regardless of age, race, religion, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, parental status, disability, educational background or any other characteristic for that matter that doesn’t relate to your ability to perform the role.

Benefits

GoCompare offer a competitive benefits package including:
Flexible working hours
Bonus
25 days holidays plus bank holidays
Birthday day off
Death in service
Matched pension (up to 6%)
Private medical cover
Buy and sell holiday options
Extra holidays for length of service
Share save scheme
Enhanced maternity and paternity policies

Package Description
We have an opportunity to work in an innovative and growing technology team supporting multiple brands within the Goco Group. We’re looking for a skilled self-starter to help shape the landscape of our data, processes and architecture to support a fast-growing roadmap in Marketing Automation.

You will become a key part of this area, bringing innovative ideas to life and be integral to how we build and use our data to help us contact customers at the best moment, with the best message in the best place. This role will interact with Market leading technologies and support a growing function with its technology projects and work you're doing.

Working with the incredible brands Goco Group offers, makes for an attractive career opportunity; with exciting company benefits, flexible working hours and some remote working possible.

An ever-expanding tech stack, coupled with a company open to new ideas and growing career possibilities and locations – this is an exciting and compelling time to join Goco which includes an incredible culture and way of working.

The role itself:
The Marketing Automation team is technology driven function within the business that meets the needs of its CRM counterparts in each of the brands and fulfils a developing and innovative roadmap to build a dynamic, personalised and automated strategy across multiple channels and touchpoints with the customer.

The role will be placed in a small but fast-growing team, focusing on delivering data solutions - skills in SQL and API integrations are critical to automate and architect a robust, compliant and exciting customer journey for each of the brands involved.
Newport NP10
£40,000 a year
